Reviews.Title: “Think before you Book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nita1268
Reviews.Content: The Room smelled very MUSTY.....no light working upon entering the room.....then we had to call 3 times for towels as well as coffee cups. The Service was very lacking no one seemed to know what was what. We called and asked for the room to be done in the morning that way we could go back to change etc. again we had to call. Their advertising said they had shuttles to ALL Theme parks and the outlet mall. WHen we asked the front desk where we get the shuttle for the outlet mall they said that is only through the TIME SHARE group. So we would have to sit through their speel. Well needless to say we did not. The pool was dirty and COLD it was NOT heated. The shuttle they did have was late and then only went to Universal @ 7:45 am then back @ 7:30 at night. Only one going and coming back....the only park it wen to more often was EPCOT and I think only because it was the closest theme park to the hotel. Radisson it is time to up date and CLEAN. I have always stayed at Radissons in other areas and this is the most I have ever been disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “This place is basic if you want to stay in a room with a clean bed that is near the theme parks.”
Reviews.Author: lee746
Reviews.Content: This place is basic if you want to stay in a room with a clean bed that is near the theme parks. The free shuttles to WDW are a bit annoying as they leave and pick up only at certain times. The earliest one from EPCOT was 6.00pm which is annoying considering EVERYONE races to catch that bus and it can only fit 20 or so people. The bus itself was old and unrelaible, one time the driver had to turn the engine off so it would not overheat, another time our bus didnt show up at all!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: Ocean00
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first week of April, and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is a bit older, but the rooms were clean, and a nice size and the room also had a fridge which was really handy. The pool area is amazing, the tropical flowers and landscaping are beautiful. There are a couple of pools, the one pool is heated, and then there is one with the waterfalls and waterslide, which is really fun, and there is also a little kiddies pool as well. There is lots to do for the kids, a games room and basket ball net, ping pong, outdoor chess board and also the pool that has the water slide there were activities there everyday, hula hoop contests, poolside bingo etc. also some days they have free ice cream at the pool which was a nice treat, and also in the evening in the lobby they had movies for the kids. The poolside bar was good , but was a little pricey, like one of the other reviewers mentioned a frozen daquiri is 11.50, and the 18% tip is included in your total. The food was good at the poolside bar and reasonably priced. In the main lobby of the hotel there is also a starbucks and deli, which had breakfast items as well as lunch, and there is also a pizza hut, and there is a gift shop. The hotel also has a restaurant. Close by there is a little plaza you can walk to which has a gift shop, a couple of restaurants and a grocery store, also within about a 5min drive there is a Publix grocery store with good selection. The staff at this hotel were great, very helpful and attentive. I had problems with the printer in the computer room and the lady there was very helpful and printed up what I needed. I also had to call down and ask to have someone fix our room safe and they sent someone up within 5 minutes and the called shortly after to be sure everthing was fixed. When we first arrived, we checked in early, which was quick and easy and they had a room available right away, someone called up within 10 minutes of being in the room to be sure we were happy with everything in the room. All and all I just can't complain about anything at this hotel I would defintely return and recommend it to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Dissatisfied”
Reviews.Author: Mishy108
Reviews.Content: This was so disappointing for a Radisson hotel. The room had a damp smell,and a strong bleach smell. The smell was very strong and unpleasant. The rooms do not have wiindows that can open so no fresh air could circulate through the room. Every day room service would forget to put towels for us, so when we got back in the evening we had to call for towels. We found a few cockroaches in the room. The carpet by the bathroom door was always wet, not sure where the leak was. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent amenities, lovely grounds, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: smile_u_nut
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay here, the Hotel is a bit older and the hallways and carpets do show there age, there are some minor cosmetic issues, but the rooms were very clean, beds were comfy, the rooms were large and bathroom was decent size as well. The pool area's are fantastic so beautiful all around each pool, the heated smaller pool was my favorite, lots of activiities around the poolside which there should be for the $12.50 resort fee, I didn't mind the charge with everything they offer but I was disappointed that they have a rental station for raft's and things like that, I think they should be included in the extra charge as well. The food court was really nice my daughter got sereval pizza's from the pizza hut resturaunt and loved them. I will return I really did enjoy the resort. we had a nice size fridge in the room as well

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would return!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyGeekMarietta
Reviews.Content: We were there for Spring break week: May 31, 2012 through April 7, 2012. I was worried when I had read the previous reviews but was pleasantly surprised. I booked the hotel through priceline--bid your own $. Our room was clean and spacious. The pool area was clean and well-maintained. There were many activities for the kids. When we slept in, I requested that housekeeping clean the room and they always did without fail. We needed extra towels and got them. Our bed was really comfortable. We were close to the Disney resort and enjoyed being able to leave the parks and hang out at the pools. Both pools were clean and well-maintained. One was heated, the other not. The jacuzzis were both enjoyable and not crowded. Well worth the money and time. I would definitely stay there again. We did not eat at the hotel so I cannot comment as to the restaurants. They did give the kids ice cream at the pool and they gave a generous amount and the kids loved it. The furinture is old, but it did not matter. What mattered was that the rooms were clean and well-maintained and that we were well taken care of by the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Really Just Average”
Reviews.Author: EmmieMK
Reviews.Content: We purchased this hotel stay on Hotwire. I was concerned after reading the reviews. Here is what I found to be true. The pool is amazing! We spent an afternoon lounging after a busy day at the parks. There are activities for the kids and good places to get food and drinks. Very relaxing. We stayed in building 5000- this must have been a renovated building because the halls/carpet were clean and nice- so was the room. My only complaint for the room are the beds, they were hard as a rock. The people that work there were also very nice. This hotel is in an excellent location if you are going to Disney, it's right at the entrance. As far as the negative, my problem was with housekeeping. They were pretty slack while we were there- they didn't replenish the toilet paper, cups, stuff like that- they even missed a day completely. We were pretty upset when we got back to the room at midnight to find they hadn't come at all. We were out of toilet paper, kleenex, clean towels, soap and cups. When we called they told us they were sorry and someone from housekeeping would be up when they got back from their break. The next day while my kids were down for a nap I guess they were doing some work on the hotel and started drilling on the wall next to our room. This scared my kids to death! I asked them if they could please stop, which they did- but it would have been nice for them to call to let us know they were going to be doing this. I don't think we would be back as I plan to stay on Disney property next time to take advantage of extended hours. But if you are looking for somewhere clean and cheap this might be the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Musky/Moldy smell in room - Dissappointing”
Reviews.Author: receptor
Reviews.Content: Before I get to the bad, this property does have some pros, which are: - very close drive to the Disney parks and Downtown Disney - very nice pool area with kids activities That said, the actual units are very old and in need of renovation. Many sites have this listed as a 3.5 star resort, I would strongly disagree. The main issue we had with the hotel is that the room smelled musky and moldy. The first thing my 8 year old said when we opened the door was 'what's that smell?'. A moldy smell in the room is unacceptable -period, let alone for a resort. When I told the staff at the front desk about this, she said she would have housekeeping look at it and I said I'm sure that they have already smelled it- its not like it was a new smell and was impossible to miss. Additionally, the shower pressure was terrible and the sink/shower drains were both clogged leading to rising water in both. Again, this is unacceptable for this standard. I would be unable to recommend this hotel based on the issues noted, primarily the smell. It would be one thing if it was an isolated incident, but more reviewers than not have mentioned the same thing- very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “I'm coming back”
Reviews.Author: squelliott
Reviews.Content: I'm a regular traveller to Florida from the UK and a lot of the time I travel alone and quitely make observations. Most people can find fault with anything if they look hard enough. I could not fault this hotel at all. I was especially impressed with the young lad in charge of the pool who kept complete order and earned respect from both the children and adults. I was there last June and I am coming back this May and have recommended this hotel to many friends and families.

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: FranR_Chile
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really close to the disney parks, it has a big pool and an inside pool. I booked the hotel in booking.com and they charged me and extra fee, the breakfast was expensive but the thing that i didn't like the most was the room. it was really old, not very clean, smelled weird in the hallway and didnt like the decoration at all.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: westgatedirector
Reviews.Content: We booke this hotel through Hotwire, so we did not know that we were going to stay at the Radisson until after we confirmed our reservation. We were extremely pleased with our room and the resort. The resort is quite large, so getting to the room can be a chore, especially if you get in late at night and parking is harder to find. However, the walk to the room is worth it. Both the room and the bathroom were very clean and furnished nicely. The room was fairly large for a standard size room. We had a crib in the room, yet it still didn't feel crowded. My only complaint is that the bed was extremely hard. I am not very picky about beds, but it felt like I was sleeping on a board. There were a lot of activities for kids and families at the hotel. Although we didn't get to do any of the activities, it was nice to know that they were there. The pool was very large and had a fun-looking water slide. We would definitely stay again. It was the perfect location for our Disney trip. The only thing that would make me think twice are the beds. If you are particular about the softness of your bed, you may need to think twice.

Reviews.Title: “Will return on my next trip to Orlando!!”
Reviews.Author: argnal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson for a few days of R&R. The room was nice and the staff was very professional and extremely friendly. The only minor disappointment was the miscommunication regarding airport pick up.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice if you have any food allergies.”
Reviews.Author: Scarr540
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel b/c we have the Carlson Club points at Radisson's. Only stayed two days and the first day was to be spent at the pool. The pump was broken so slide and waterfalls didn't work. My kids were very bummed out as was I. They said it would be fixed next day. It took them two days. So the day we left we let the kids swim for an hour to try it out. I would have thought it would be important enough to have it fixed right away. We are talking about an Orlando hotel, lots of kids etc... They didn't seem at all concerned. Second problem, the restaurant didn't have much for a selection, didn't know what a gluten free menu was, and there isn't one thing on the menu that doesn't have wheat flour or dairy in it. I can almost always find a few things to eat on the buffet but it was a small buffet. The restaurant was empty we were told after a big crowd, but it was filthy. They didn't even change the table linens before seating us and my husbands glass was filthy. For the price restaurant left much to be desired. I also didn't appreciate being hit up to buy special sunscreen like I was an idiot or told that the Disney park Hollywood studios was not an all day park so we could make time for the free breakfast across the street so they could sell us on their vacation clubs.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Enjoyment !”
Reviews.Author: deps
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a staycation and it was awesome...All the staff...from the super friendly, very personal check in girl to the room service guy ..all were happy, smiling and seemed to enjoy their jobs. There are 2 adult pools, a kiddie pool and 2 spas...the grounds are lovely, very well kept, the rooms clean and beds comfortable. We will certainly be returning for another get away and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for sight-seeing and park visiting!”
Reviews.Author: Holly Y
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. the rooms are spacious, clean and pleasant. the pool and facilities were also clean. we used the shuttle for our first few park visits before hiring a car from reception. we did this because the shuttle times can be very difficult, (early mornings and late pick-ups). staff were very polite. all in all a very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. God Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flip654
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week in March 2012. Check ion fast and efficiant. Staff were friendly and helpful. Hotel is five minutes drive from Disney property. Directions to room were clear. Although it is a large hotel with multiple buildings, it is quite eay to find your way around. Room was spacious and clean. The only issue qwas with the sleep number bed that had no instructions and seemingly a mind of it's own! Luckily it did not affect my sleep at all. Free wifi is a great bonus. This is also available in most of the outside areas. Great for browsing by the pool or in the bars. All the staff I met were friendly and courteous from the onsite shop to the bars and the diner. The one let down was probably the large amount of teenagers there for a cheerleading competition, that appeared, at late nigh,t to be allowed to sit around the corridoors making noise as they were unsupervised. A minor gripe though

Reviews.Title: “not bad if you get a deal”
Reviews.Author: fletchfam
Reviews.Content: Property is very lush and pretty, pool area nice and large and the slide was a hit for the kids. Rooms were moderate, not fancy and needing some updating. The staff is friendly and helpful. (skip the time share desk, that was a big waste of time and way over 2 hours at the presentation, not matter what they offer just keep walking by) Our biggest complaint was the cleaning of the rooms (or lack of) we were there for 8 days, and when we arrived after the parks, the rooms were not cleaned, only the beds made. We had dirty dirty glasses on our fridge that had the "cleaning" covers on them. The hallways and common areas of the buildings could also use a good cleaning. Don't even bother going to the washer/dryer, cost over $8 for one load and the clothes still weren't dry. The bathroom was half updated (new flooring and counter, but tub/shower was old and dingy) We weren't too upset since we only paid $50 a night (priceline) but wouldn't not have paid full price for this hotel. They do charge a $12 day resort fee, which isn't bad if you are using the ammenities (they give you coupons at check in for on property activities) and they do have kids activities daily the shuttle service had poor times and was crowded, so we still ended up driving to the parks. The location isn't bad (close to Disney) if you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Leigh R
Reviews.Content: The beds were as hard as a rock, and the pool water was not heated at all. Also, there were a ton of leaves in the hot tub...literally a TON! The grounds were really pretty. The walk from our building to the pool was really plesant. But for me, the beds are the most important thing.

Reviews.Title: “If You Can Get An Inexpenseve Rate.... It's good”
Reviews.Author: kidritalin
Reviews.Content: The name "Radisson" sounds pretty classy in itself. This hotel isn't really "classy" if you are accustomed to 5-star accommodations. We stayed there because our friends had an event planned on the compound. Kids should have no complaints staying there as the pool area is quite kid friendly with daily games like bingo, ping pong, portable putting greens, mini-basketball and foos ball around the pool. The games change daily which is a smart call by management and keeps things interesting for the children day to day. Because of the vast campus size, it can be cumbersome to walk if you are visiting friends in other buildings, but I suppose a bit of exercise never hurts, right? We were in bldg 6000 and we found it to be a nice location, but it is at the end of the complex, but close to the pool. Our room was pretty clean all in all. Water in the shower worked well. Kid size toilet in the small / cramped bathroom could disappear should a very large adult should attempt to use it. Television is a newer LCD or LED (whatever), and would be a much better use of space had it been wall mounted. The Wi-Fi internet was slow at times to log-on, but not slow enough to warrant a complaint. What DOES warrant a complaint is the card key system this Radisson Resort uses. In the many number of hotels we have stayed at, never has a "too close" cell phone erased the coding. I for one did not even think this was possible, but I had already lost a bet thinking a magnet in my wallet would not erase my room code. It did also, and it cost me a $6 draft beer at the pool to pay up. We had to have six key cards re-coded in three days time. I was told they offer no "smoking permitted" rooms. No problem for us because we don't smoke. But all of the people we visited smoked up a storm in their rooms anyhow. Something I would have definitely complained about had we checked in behind them, so apparently there is no penalty for stinking up a room with cigarette smoke. If you plan to stay here at the Radisson, or at many other Orlando/Kissimmee resorts ALWAYS CHECK YOUR BILLS PRIOR TO PAYING as they will add 18% gratuity without pointing it out. Typical Americans will add additional tips simply because they feel guilty putting a zero in the tip line before signing the check. I take pride in the zero (LoL). The check-in staff was kind, courteous, and efficient and spoke perfect English. Very few of the housekeeping staff we tried to speak to spoke English (if any). It's not unique to Radisson, but it is sad with the current unemployment rate for Americans being around 10% or more. In house breakfast was about $10+ and was not so good but it's better than the Waffle House up the street. All in all, this Radisson is about a 3-star hotel on a 3-star budget price. Great for a family stay. Probably not the best choice for a quiet romantic getaway because of all the kids on vacation being kids on vacation. Within walking distance.... not allot. A small grocery store with good beer prices. Foods and amenities are about 30% over Wal-mart retail, but worth the extra money for the convenience factor. For any camera supplies, the Digital Plus store is not recommended as a $10 item will cost about $89 so beware. Charlie's steak house is also in the plaza out front. Famous around Florida for having prime meats, but we did not have time to check the prices. About 5 miles to a Wal-mart. HaVe FuN !!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean rooms, nice grounds, no problems”
Reviews.Author: eli_lilly
Reviews.Content: My experience here over the weekend was very pleasant. The grounds were full of lush tropical foliage and there are streams and waterfalls throughout. The room size was as large as I'd expect for this price point, I was pleased with it. I'm guessing that the complaints about resort fees are from people who haven't booked a hotel in Florida in the last 15 years, nearly every hotel charges a resort fee. Unlike many hotels that charge that fee, this hotel did have a surprising amount of amenities. The workout equipment was clean and up to date, the pool is gigantic and has a water slide, there's 2 hot tubs, there was a huge chess and checkers board with 2' high pieces, there was basketball, table tennis, and foosball all available for free. Yes, the carpet around the elevator is worn, as it is in every hotel with high pool traffic. I don't know what some of the reviewers are expecting in the sub-$150/night rate class in Orlando. After reading the reviews here II was prepared to be horriified upon opening the door to the room. Instead I was very pleased and plan on returning again.

Reviews.Title: “great visit”
Reviews.Author: zachc21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week and the hotel was very nice. The housekeeping staff went above and beyond by washing our son and daughter's bottles and sippy cups. The only issues we had were with the sleep number beds. They were not that great of quality and made my back hurt.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty!”
Reviews.Author: Bcast17
Reviews.Content: Although the lobby and pool area are very nice, once you arrive in the hallway it's a different story. The hall carpet is dirty and the elevators are filthy! The rooms are small with grimy carpet. The bathroom is tiny and smells musty. We arrived back at our ro at 4:30 after along day at the theme parks to find the room still unmade. The representative at the front desk was so nice and offered us an upgrade. ( we were unable to use the king bed because we were traveling with children). Ended up in another room... A little cleaner but still smelly.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: thekups
Reviews.Content: The hotel is cheap and very close to Disney as well as Sea World. The pool area and lobby had a 4 star feel, but the room was 2.5-3 star. The room was ok for us since we basically just slept there, but it was definitely older (especially the bathroom). Everyone was nice and helpful. As everyone says, be aware of the resort fee before booking. Overall it was perfect for our young family because it was very cheap for the location and as long as it's clean I'm ok. If you're looking for a luxury room then I would advise going elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Looks Great on Outside, Not So Great In Room”
Reviews.Author: majmcd
Reviews.Content: The property and lobby look amazing! When I arrived, I was looking forward to my stay. When I got in the room, it all changed. The carpet was stained, which I understand is somewhat costly to replace. The sheets and blankets were also stained on both beds, which to me is completely unacceptable. I found hair in one of the beds, so I slept in the other. The air conditioner was very loud. My room faced the pool area, so that was loud at first as well. If this hotel would improve the rooms to feel more like the lobby area, it would actually be a nice place, but I would not stay again in its current condition. If it were just outdated, it would be one thing, but my room was dirty. I find this completely unacceptable. The bed was also loud and uncomfortable. It squeaked every time I moved slightly.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little spot to get away”
Reviews.Author: Fullerjan
Reviews.Content: The staff at the front desk were helpful and friendly. This was my first time at the Radisson. I found the rooms to rather cozy. The bathroom plumbing needed major work. We had to switch rooms a couple times, which they upgraded us at no extra cost. I was disappointed that there was not enough parking. I think the paying guest should have designated parking nearer to the building that they are staying. Visitors should have their own designated parking.

Reviews.Title: “Am I at the same hotel that gets such poor reviews? I love it!”
Reviews.Author: Theresa K
Reviews.Content: We got the Radisson Resort on Hotwire. Honestly, after reading some of the reviews I was scared and thinking that we would stay for a night and if it was that bad we would just lose the money and go somewhere else. What a surprise! I was expecting a dingy , dirty place and got to one of the nicest hotels I've been at in Florida. Honestly, I couldn't care less if the decor is outdated. When you vacation in Central Florida how much time will you actually spend in your room? Ours was spotless clean ( this to me is way more important than decor) , the carpet was not dirty like so many people complain about.No musty smell, the room had a pleasant smell of cleanliness to it. Our AC unit was a little bit loud, but that actually helped silence the noise from the hallway, so it didn't bother us at all. We stayed in building 3000, right next to the parking lot. It was a very comfortable room , with very nice and comfy beds. Housekeeping did an amazing job! I am sorry for not knowing the name of the person in charge of our room, but she was really wonderful. ( Management, kudos to housekeeping for room 2307) The grounds of the resort are very well kept. Pools are great. All of the staff is pleasant and helpful. I am really sorry we didn't have time yet to experience the Tiki Bar, it gets such great reviews. Honestly, if you expect a 5* hotel , then pay for one. This is not the Ritz Carlton.I think the people who put such bad reviews here were not realistic in terms of their expectations. This hotel is great! I just wish they had microwaves in the rooms too. That would make it even better. We are at the Radisson as I write this review, and couldn't be more satisfied. We will definitely consider this resort for future Disney visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay For The Money We Paid!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nailah2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is indeed dated and worn from use, but after staying at other properties in Orlando unless you're paying $200.00 - $400.00 a night most of them are!!!!. This was a great place to stay it was close to everything, it had a courteous, friendly and VERY, VERY helpful staff in every area of the hotel. I never encountered a hotel employee who didn't speak to us when we either approached them or passed them in the hallway. We were in town for a soccer tournament, the team stayed at an overpriced, inconvenient property elsewhere and we chose to stay at this hotel because it was convenient to The ESPN Disney Sports Center and other attractions. We spent our days on the soccer fields and our evenings lounging in and around the hotel. We even had the opportunity to experience the "Snow" in Celebration!!!!. We understand that extensive renovations are on the way which will make our return visit that much more pleasant.Taking into account the price we paid and the value we received, we will not hesitate to return to the Radisson Resort Orlando-Celebration on our next vacation to Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location for Disney”
Reviews.Author: Mooney6461
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. It is old and dated but our room was spotless. We had room 1224 that overlooked the hot tub. It was a bit noisy up until 10:30 and then it was quiet. We had sleep number beds but the controls didn't work properly or are old. When we tried to adjust them they didn't work properly. Full beds don't have dual control but that's not the hotel's fault. Next time we'll just ask for a room with regular beds. The pool ares is fun with a heated pool and a cold pool. Kids (and husband) had fun playing on a giant chest set. The hot tubs could use a good cleaning tho. One hot tub was covered in tree seeds and the other had a dirt ring around it and wasn't hot enough. Plenty of lounge chairs and pool towels. Miriam's Tiki Bar is awesome. She's funny, happy, makes great drinks and I'm thinking of going back for a girls' weekend only to sit by the pools and have a great time in the little tiki bar. Miriam should be cloned and transplanted in several resorts. Keep it up girl!

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: wgt_esg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Radisson on a Friday night because I was in town for a wedding. The hotel was near many attractions but the lot behind the hotel looked abandoned and not appealing. There was a severe shortage of parking when I arrived. I and several other guests had to park our cars outside of the hotel lot. While the grounds of the hotel look nice, the interior appears old and outdated as well as my guest room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Karen M
Reviews.Content: we had our wedding here, in feb. and it was great, the staff was helpful. Our rooms were great, the gazebo area was set up for our ceremony. the food was great especially the tilapia. thank you so much. we cant wait to go again

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good price!”
Reviews.Author: sheila m
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is dated and worn from years of use, it's a great place to stay. Close to everything, courteous, friendly and helpful staff in every area of the hotel. It was very hot during our stay and we spent the afternoons at the pool. Miriam's Tiki Bar was great. The pool food and drinks were excellent and served by a smiling Puerto Rican lady who handled the whole place with such efficiency and friendliness it just kept you coming back for more. We also understand extensive renovations are on the way which will make our return visit that much more pleasant. Taking into account the price we paid and the value we received, we will not hesitate to return on our next vacation to Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Large property close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: LincolnDiamond
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the 6000 building overlooking the jacuzzi and pool area. The room was clean, however it just had a smell of being musty. Seemed like the A/C just couldn't keep up and this was February. Would hate to see how it would be in the summer months. The bed was comfortable and the room service attendants did a nice job. The tiki bar seemed to be hopping well past midnight every night that I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck!”
Reviews.Author: Itchyfeet042
Reviews.Content: The only reason this hotel gets Poor and not Terrible is the location. Only 10 mins from Seaworld and Universal. The daily 'resort' fee is a joke - I didn't use any of the facilities as all I wanted to do was stay away from this place. In fact, I'd prepaid for 5 nights but could only bear 4 but frankly nothing could have made me stay another night. No offer of compensation was offered however for the lost night, when I listed the reasons I wanted to leave. Having read the previous reviews, I gave the Radisson the benefit of the doubt being a Club Carlson member, and having some fantastic previous stays around the world. I noted however the comments on the damp smell in the lower floors, so I emailed ahead of my visit to request a high floor. I was assured on the email that this would be no problem. However, on arrival I was given a second floor room which sure enough stank of damp. It was hideous. There was a leak in the laundry room near our bedroom, but instead of someone actually mopping up the spill, a very loud dehumidifier was being used for 2 days. The room was dark and dingy, and again, did not have the most pleasant smell. The bathroom was filthy, long black hairs all over the floor and shower, and rubbish left in a corner of the room all week. There was a smiley face on the mirror from the previous occupants the whole time we were there, so that was obviously never cleaned. I'm just glad I took my own slippers as the carpet was gross. The hotel info book was filthy and falling apart. We had a connecting door to the next room which I hate as the noise tends to be worse from neighbours and sure enough we were woken by their TV. When this was still going on at 1am I called reception asking for their intervention as I had been banging on the wall with no luck, and to get a different room for the next day with no interconnecting door. They promised to call the room to speak to them but no other rooms were available at all. The noise didn't stop, so we drowned it out with the ridiculously loud air con, so we finally got some sleep. The next night, the tv was on ALL night - I later found out this room was for a baby, and the tv was comforting it. Not very comforting for me! No follow up was given to ensure I was satisfied. I had paid for the breakfast but lived only on cereal as the rest was less than appeitising. I didn't use any of the other facilities, eating out each night was much more preferable than spending any time here. This place needs a serious upgrade for the rooms - or even just a decent deep clean! Not one person asked during my stay if I was satisfied. Only plus points - location, free wifi and free parking. Otherwise, avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Black_Thunder307
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this fantastic hotel purely for Disney World. We didn't use much of the facilities but we did do a walk about and they had a lot of things to do there for all ages. It was better to stay here then one of those Disney hotels cause the prices are so much better for a room probably the same. The Drive to Disney wasn't long at all 15-25mins depending on traffic. Great Restaurants close by. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent property for short term stay”
Reviews.Author: raymaynotsay
Reviews.Content: No surprises here that this property is old and dated. It could be termed as a very large motel. However, for people like me who have just come to enjoy the attractions nearby and just use the hotel to sleep, this place is quite a deal. I booked it through Priceline and found everything in order. Had no problems at check-in. Beware though, that they charge an $11 resort fee. Terrible if you had no prior knowledge, but I knew that from before and since I had gotten the room at base rates, the extra payment didn't hurt. Room service was adequate and parking is available. If you get in late, you will have to walk a long distance.Overall, more than a decent place for a night's sleep or two.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience from check in to check out”
Reviews.Author: Eileen O
Reviews.Content: I have frequented this resort on more than one occasion over the past 3-years and can highly recommend it to you and your family. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. You become a part of the Radisson family upon arrival and are made to feel that way throughout your stay. The rates are reasonable and it is located in a great location. Very close to the Disney parks and many local attractions for the entertainment of your family. Also, if you get in late they have an onsite restaurant and Pizza Hut is located in the lobby. For those of you on a budget, you can visit a Disney park on one day of your vacation and then save a day to enjoy the many amenities this resort has to offer, including the large pool with slide that will keep your children entertained for hours!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Celebration!”
Reviews.Author: onedum
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel through Priceline for 2 nights taking our 10 yr old grandson to Disney & Universal. They call the place a Resort and they're right! 2 pools, kiddie pool, 2 spas and a recreation director around the pool (free ice cream @ 2pm, bingo for everyone, and many pool toys for sharing!) Hotel has a full restaurant, a pool bar & snack menu and a deli inside the lobby. The staff was helpful and efficient. 1/4 mile to Rte, 4 ramp that takes you to Disney (next exit) and Universal (10 minutes). Comparatively inexpensive using Priceline!!! ($49)

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Julia B
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for one night, and this place looked okay. However, the front staff were not very friendly at all. The hotel smelt awful from all the must. The air conditioner system in our room did not work and started to sizzle and smoke. The lamps did not work. They had replaced the carpet but I could see cement from the gap between the wall and carpet. There was a complimentary breakfast that was pretty good. They do have an area in the lobby were you can order from Pizza Hut and Starbucks which was great for a late night snack. If we ever go back to Disney we will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Orlandograndparents
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous resort with loads to do, great breakfast buffet. Amazing landscaping, heated pool, jacuzzi, gym, game room, pool bar, sports lounge, nightly movies on big screen. We ordered room service for dinner Jeremy was our server for Roon service for 2 nights. We had made special requests for dinner and it was no problem for him to assist us, we are a elderly couple he assisted us , got ice for us in our bucket . A real asset in a gorgeous property. We live in Florida and come to Orlando area to visit the grand kids and we stay at different properties we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: diederika
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night here as it was a hotwire 'win' and we weren't sure about the neighbourhood. Well, nothing wrong with it really, good location for quick park access, but nothing exceptional nice either.

Reviews.Title: “Lots to choose from at this property”
Reviews.Author: Nancy421390
Reviews.Content: We never stay at Radisson's but found a good price on Hotwire.com and are glad we did. The rooms are nice, staff friendly.and amenities good. Our first room in building 5000 had a tub drainage issue which we reported after our first night. Our room was changed immediately without problem and we got a room with a king sleepnumber bed. The rooms are very nice with comfortable beds, pillows, nice towels. I do wish there were more electrical outlets as I was unable to sit in bed with my laptop. There are 2 pools, one which is only slightly heated. The whirlpool is NOT very warm and my husband reported that the exercise room didn't have a lot of equipment either. I did not check out the exercise room myself though. When we moved rooms we walked on the 8th floor through a smoking section, which was not fun. I worried that I would be able to smell smoke in our room since we were on the 8th floor not far from the smoking section. That was not the case at all, however, and I was grateful since I'm very smoke sensitive. Dinner at the resort's Mandolin Restaurant is not recommended, however. Staffing was low on a Wednesday night and the buffet left something to be desired. All in all, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, service, location, every need was met with a smile!”
Reviews.Author: toothsleuth
Reviews.Content: Our soccer team was fortunate to get to spend a weekend at this hotel. Being a large group of parents and kids (approx 40 people), it is hard to please everyone. In this case, the response was overwhelmingly positive. The kids loved the breakfast buffet, felt very safe letting them go on their own throughout the hotel. Loved playing bingo by the pool, beds super comfy, in fact as I type this I wish I was back there now! You feel as if you are in a tropical resort, very reasonably priced, staff exceeded our expectations on every level. Movies in the lobby on a big screen were a hit. Location perfect for any Orlando destination and you don't get the over crowded Orlando feel. Hoping to stay again and get to actually sit by the pool one day and enjoy a margarita! Thanks Charles for taking such good care of all of us!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: jmmarty72
Reviews.Content: About the only good thing I can say for this hotel is the fact it was in a great location and the staff at the front desk were exceptional. However, when you stay at a hotel, it's for the room itself. We ended up with beds that were like slabs of concrete. I was never so happy as the first night back in my own bed. The room hadn't been vacuum given the trash on the floor. The furniture hadn't been moved in years as evidenced by the dust and debris behind it. I felt the urge to go find a can of Lysol. The bathroom was much smaller than ones in other hotels I had stayed in recently. And, to top it off, I had to pay a "Resort Fee". I definitely didn't have a "Resort" experience. That fee is nothing short of a scam.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired but great location”
Reviews.Author: Fleur98
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location being close to Disney.The hotel has good pools, helpful staff and even Pizza Hut! The downside is it feels a bit tired with noisy aircon!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT TIME @ THE RADISSON!!!”
Reviews.Author: OVIKLC
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed @ the Radisson for 8 days & 7 nights (2 rooms) our stay was wonderful! We have stayed all over the US and this is one of the best hotels we have stayed at. Our housekeeper ORALEE was great our rooms were always clean and smelled fresh. HELEN at the front desk was great also very friendly. The pools were super. Your rates are good! You made our stay very relaxing with everything you need right on the premises. Close to everything... Thank you Radisson Resort Orlando-Celebration for a fantastic time.. See you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't wait to review !!”
Reviews.Author: travelmom009
Reviews.Content: Booked 5 nights here. Great pool- super kid friendly...I am writing this from my room right now! Rooms are nice- certainly above standard and comfortable, and unlike some people are reviewing...- the 6000 building is clean and the rooms are very nice (I have been everywhere). We are Club Carlson members, and visit Radissons regularly. The staff is great, the hotel is lively and fun. Dont be afraid...book your stay here- great value for a family vacation . And I am not easy to please!!

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities, great Service”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: Great location easily accessible from the airports and surrounding attractions. Clean pool and great tiki and sportsbar anchored by Amy! If your looking for the best in service and cocktails Amy and her fellow bartenders will take excellent care of you. Sleep number beds and clean bathrooms make for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Candice O
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in January, and felt so comfortable near the hotel that I hardly left. I really enjoyed being by the pool. I am a student, and found this great courtyard filled with beautiful trees, cafe tables and gazebo. It was so relaxing, tranquil, private, serene. I would grab a starbucks coffee at the hotel restaurant, find a quiet place to bask in the sunlight and study away. The hotel staff is very friendly. Brian, a pool attendant, was super helpful and lively. On the property there is a restaurant, Mandolin's, which has great food at affordable prices and also a friendly staff. In fact, in the morning some of the Mandolin staff was singing and dancing to motown music and it really put us in a great mood. And, being that I do check into school online and did not bring my laptop, I was so grateful that the hotel has a complimentary business lounge. I loved the trip, but I agree with the other reviewers who said that the building is outdated, especially the carpets. However, our room was clean and cute. And drinks at the tiki bar are like 11$ US each, I thought that was remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Kelly18nj
Reviews.Content: The building is very tired. Carpets are disgusting. However, our room was ok. Updated tv, beds and bathroom helped. Then came the housekeeping disaster. Apparently instead of cleaning rooms the housekeepers spend the morning riding the electors with their carts tAking up the entire elevators. It took 15 minutes for us to get an elevator to stop at floor without a cart. Pretty annoying. Over the place looks like it on the decline. Suggest you only brave for a night or two and use the location as the benefit to stay away during all daytime hours. It was only $60 per night. What can you really expect for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing and much needed!!”
Reviews.Author: cherylann910
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Jan 21-28. Loved it. Stayed on the second floor in bldg 6000 poolview. Everyone was so nice, especially the 3 lady bartenders !!! Hi Michelle..... The Tiki Bar is fun and very very relaxing also....great atmosphere :) Played bingo at the Tiki Bar, won some free drinks.. 2 pools,one heated, 2 hot tubs and walkways to stroll along. The pool with the waterfall is breathtaking.... The only downfall of the whole vacation was the oldieds music they played at the pool :( Not the right music at this resort. Need a litte more up beat or island music for relaxing at this beautiful pool... Will definately stay here again, very soon !! Close to everything, and I mean everything... So much to compliment with this hotel.. Very satisfied and the food is much more than we ever expected.. The wings are the best we have ever had !!!! Great cooks at this hotel, they know what they are doing in that kitchen.... Stay here and you WON'T BE DISAPPOINTED !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property but lacking rooms”
Reviews.Author: abdallah7107
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through price line name your own price at 40 bucks a night. The hotel was easy to find & the property is pretty big. We checked in late at night & were disgusted with the room we were given. It smelled horrid & was old & dirty. My party was very upset & so I made the trek back to the lobby. I was upgraded to a much, much better room with a view of the pool & very very clean. The furniture & bedding is old though. Its time for a renovation. The property however is splendid. Beautiful landscaping & gorgeous pools. The onsite restaurant was good but I suggest hopping in your car & going elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average”
Reviews.Author: bondtk
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy writing a good review, but I'm afraid I can't do it this time. Although, I will say that it wasn't super bad, but just not what I was expecting. Yes, this is a resort with some cool features like the two pools and two hot tubs and kiddie pool. There is also a game room and exercise room so plenty of things to enjoy while you're here. It's also close to the Disney attractions which is nice. I stayed in building 6000 so can't speak of the other buildings but this one if definately due for an update! The halls are dreadfully outdated with primary color scheme and the room was very much outdated. The sleep number bed was nice but I read not every room has one. Did appreciate the staff calling once we got to the room to make sure all was ok, but what can you really say? Glad I didn't pay full price to stay here. Also know they do charge a resort fee of $11.00+tax per night once you check in but at least parking is free and so is Internet access! I didn't see any problem with the area this was in at all and felt perfectly safe. Had in room safes too for small valuables. Overall, not a horrible stay, but certainly doesn't even come close to being great. If they update the rooms, I'm sure it would be an awesome property.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise”
Reviews.Author: marieregina
Reviews.Content: Went to the North American Vet Conf in Orlando. This resort was named as one of the cheaper resorts offering rooms for this conference. Since we had to pay our own way we decided on this hotel, also having stayed in some really awesome Radisson's before I knew it had to be good. I was right. The people at the front desk at check in were wonderful. Very polite, courteous, helpful, and darn I missed those yummy cookies they put out for guests waiting in line. (Maybe they will send me some) Our room, a handicapped room for my mom, was great. Very nice, very comfortable, great room for a handicapped person and we finally got to try out those Sleep Number beds! Our room attendent Evangelina was wonderful. She was so nice and wanted to make sure everything was perfect for our stay. On one day she came to clean I told her she didnt have to because we were still there and going to class, she said she would come back before she got off of work to clean our room and check everything. I felt so bad. She made sure my mom and friend, big coffee drinkers, had lots of coffee, creamer, etc. Very nice restaurant on site with an out of this world breakfast buffet at such a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, very good location but don't stay on the ground floor!”
Reviews.Author: anotherpinonthemap
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived here very tired and late at night we were ready to sleep. We opened the door to our room and were overwhelmed by a damp smell. The carpet was very tired and old looking and the pillow cases on one of the beds were damp, cold and smelly. In fact the whole ground floor kind of had that damp smell. Our 1 year old was exhausted and I had to put him to sleep in the bed as the staff were taking too long to come to our room and deal with our complaint. We were offered another room in the morning. Our new room was completely different, it was fresh, clean and quite big. No other complaints, the hotel is very well situated and everything we wanted to visit was within a 10- 15minute drive on the 192. This includes Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom, a few of the designer outlet shopping malls e.g Premium Outlet Malls and some shopping areas/centres (The Loop, Mall at Millenia) , Old Town, Down Town, International Drive. We used the outdoor pool which was heated at night, and they have a starbucks in the hotel reception which was handy. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on food, but there was a decent menu and it seemed reasonably priced. Overall, we enjoyed our 11 day stay here. Oh sorry, another complaint- very thin walls! You could hear the people in the next room talking and they had a baby too which we could hear crying every now and then. They left after 2 or 3 days and no one else was there after that but I imagine that scenario could turn very different for some people...

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful”
Reviews.Author: Renee W
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights and needed service on the sink twice. The response to our service calls were very prompt and Mr. David Mann in the Engineering Department was very helpful and friendly. The Radisson needs updating but the staff is great!

Reviews.Title: “Great christmas an new year stay”
Reviews.Author: MsWorldExplorer
Reviews.Content: My partner an I stayed at this hotel for 13 nights over Christmas snow new year an enjoyed a great stay. After a long flight from the UK the sleep number beds were amazing. Rooms are good sizes. Location great. Good staff. Thanks to Gamy/Gamu an Andrew who always had transport sorted for us. Your own car is not 100% needed. Great resturants in walkind distance. Also Gamy recommend flippers pizza two thumbs up it was great we had utter twice. Loved the hot tubes, tennis and bball. Free WiFi which was useful. Only let down is housekeeping which is not of the best standards. Hope I got the names right. Thanks for a great holiday to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: nicolk1630
Reviews.Content: We booked hotel for New year getaway. Staff were great. But hotel roooms very tired and desperate need of updating. We had to move rooms once and my parents had to move twice in a 6 night stay. Electrics in our room were of a very poor standard and whole socket came away from wall when pulled plug out. Temperature of large swimming pool far too cold, no-one could go in it or use the water slide much to the disappointment of my young daughter. The towels handed out at the poolside were a joke, would have been better buying dish cloths!! Housekeeeping was the big let down. Waited till about 5pm to have room cleaned, coffee tray not replenished, towlels forgotten etc etc. And then to top it all got chrged $11 a day resort fee - for what?? Despite the friendly and very polite staff definitely would not stay again. Would have complained at check-out but hotel receptionist clearly not interested and asked nothing about our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: scrawford80
Reviews.Content: When placing the reservation, I requested a non- smoking room with sleep number beds due to medical reasons. The front desk clerk guaranteed that is what he was putting us in. When we found our room, it was with the door wide open and a pile of wet towels in the middle of the doorway. The maid down the hall kept saying she couldn't believe they were putting someone in that room. We walked in to unmade beds ( which were not sleep number beds). The comforters were not clean. I called the front desk only to be put on an extended hold and have the new front desk clerk come back and tell me that " she had talked to her manager ad they were unable to move us because they had a big party coming in tomorrow, but they would make sure we got a VIP cleaning the next day".we cleaned our own room that day. We decided to try to go to the pool, only to find it dirty and the water slide closed so we gave up and decided to spend a majority of our time out of the hotel. The next day we left at 7 am and came back at 11pm only to find that we still had dirty comforters, towels, etc. we gave up and went to bed. The next day we left at 7 am and returned at 11 pm again, only to find that one of their staff had used our restroom and left feces down the toilet and all over the toilet seat. They also had not left us any wash rags and the bed linens were still dirty. We called housecleaning only to have to wait 45 minutes for them to come up and clean their mess. We could not wait to get out of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms but could use a facelift here and there”
Reviews.Author: Niels W
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for the third time this year. The hotel is located close to the attractions of Orlando but a car is a must to get around. Staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are large and the beds are excellent. Interior is a bit old fashioned and the hotel could use a facelift. Prices are fair and the establisment offer good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort and good location”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort many years ago so things may have changed. Great resort for families. Lots to do. Great location as it was close to everything. Beware of timeshare salesmen. They will try to get you to go view a timeshare for tickets to the parks. Rooms should of been thoroughly checked before others were checking in. Very dangerous things were left behind from others that were staying there. The management took very good care of the situation and didn't charge us for our stay. Thank god we didn't have small kids. But things like this can happen anywhere. They took great care of it without issue. Rooms were not perfect but they were nice. Very nice grounds and pools. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Maurice Rivers”
Reviews.Author: Susan R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Celebration last year for the North American Veterinary Conference and loved the beds and hotel. So I booked 5 rooms this year for our entire staff for the span of 5 days of the conference. However, it turns out our mattresses appear to have been replaced and were extra firm. I have 2 herniated discs in my lower back and after 1 night was in terrible pain. I called guest services and they sent up Maurice Rivers to assist. He kept assuring me that the hotel/himself were "going to get it comfortable for me" and that he was there to "take care of it, no problem". The customer service and understanding is unparalleled in most of todays society. He didnt make me feel like a pain or like I was being picky. I really appreciated that as I have a true medical issue and 5 days on that mattress would have been unbearable. Now my mattress is so soft (he brought up TWO foam pads) and even called the cleaning staff to remake my bed for me. I so appreciate the Radisson for employing such a wonderful example of excellent customer service as Maurice Rivers is!! Congratulations on a job very well done.

Reviews.Title: “A Motel that should be erased from memory”
Reviews.Author: Jopin55
Reviews.Content: Where do I start. No one to help with luggage. The room was a mile away. I had to drive to the building which is not well indicated. So at night it's a nightmare. I had to leave the car running and go check the building. Sure she gave me a map. Go follow a map at night when you don't know the area. Not enough lights. Finally I found the place. Now I sleeping my luggage to the 4th floor at the end of the corridor, it's another mile. The rooms are shabby and old. Badly needing remodeling. The towels are old. (I didn't take a shower, I preferred to check in the next one and be stinky, that's me). I can't stand rust and mildew on bathtubs. I think by the look of the people that stayed there in the morning, I can tell you there is a review that probably goes to all trailer parks and they all conglomerate there. It's a great venue for trailer trash park. (mind you, there very nice trailer parks and they are not all created the same) you know what I am talking about.

Reviews.Title: “Pools”
Reviews.Author: Wanda N
Reviews.Content: In our stay in this hotel we use the swimming pool area, which we loved! not just for cleaning of the area but also by the excellent treatment of Hemir Garcia, who was on the lookout for us while we were in that area. I honestly should have more employees with the charisma and friendliness of him. We are gone a come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great check in staff.”
Reviews.Author: marc s
Reviews.Content: Hi, my stay at this hotel was for 1 week & it was a great base for all the parks with 2 great pools & entertainment. I must also compliment front desk staff Smira & Ronak for there great help & friendliness. I couldnt say the same for the old guy hard selling what he called the best ticket deals in orlando only if you went to his 2hr timeshare presentation.Sorry to tell him that i purchased the park tickets for the same price just doors away without going to his talk & wasting half a day of my holidays. Once again thanks to reception staff for there help with everything & i wish them good luck & i will see them in the future i am sure.

Reviews.Title: “True Resort Feel”
Reviews.Author: Denise5067Plymouth
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Radisson twice now,and it is my hotel of choice from now on!!! I was at first hesitant to stay here as I had read some negative coments. What impressed me and swayed my decision to stay,is that the manager, Jeff Swirsky took the time to address the concerns and complaints past guest had. From the moment you walk in you get the feeling of being at a "resort" Check-in personnel were efficient and very nice. You will also be given a page of coupons to use and I think we used everyone! We stayed in the 6000 building each time,and were extremely happy with our ROOM. It was clean,spacious and the bathroom was huge. Everyone that I came in contact with were friendly and really seemed to enjoy their job and went out of their way to make your stay pleasant. The food was very good,room service breakfast,Awesome! Conveinent location! Small stores right next door. Old Town,right down the street. I don't think you will be disappointed with your stay,and if you have ANY issues,get in touch with Jeff,or other staff. They truly go out of their way to make sure your stay is a wonderful one!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: twistone
Reviews.Content: Great time staying here. Service was top notch in all areas and was natural to all. The kids had plenty to do and made friends while staying there thanks to the staff getting them all involved in games. Freed us up to visit the tiki bar and enjoy the down time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable resort with perks”
Reviews.Author: Suzft
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in January. They had a special deal for twin double bed room with complimentary breakfast. Room was clean, beds comfy, great view of the pool - which is heated in the winter months. Free wifi on the whole resort is great (and should be the norm at all hotels in my opinion). Mandolins resturant offered a delicious breakfast, however healthy options were minimal. The food options within walking distance aren't great, so after a long day you may find yourself choosing from the resorts options. The food is generally good but a little pricey. Service was friendly and helpful. They have self service laundry facilities which is helpful after a few weeks of traveling. They have free shuttles to disneyworld and universal. However the one universal shuttle only ran very early in the morning and one more late at night. Many disney shuttles though. You can also buy your passes for the parks at the resort. Would recommend, but only if there is a reduce price deal with breakfast included in order to get value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson 3 nights in December 2011 because my husband was to have surgery at the Celebration Florida Hospital only a few blocks away. The staff at check in was fantastic and gave us a first floor to make it easier for my husband. We found the premises well maintained and facilities were very nice although we did not use the pool or fitness room. The lobby was decorated for Christmas as was the outside areas which were lovely as we had to be away from family for the holiday. The staff accommodated us with an early check in, emailed us after the surgery with good wishes for my husband, and upgraded us to a room with sleep number bed for his comfort. We would stay again!!! D & S

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Resort Orlando-Celebration --> nothing to rejoice about !”
Reviews.Author: Lata C
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed there in December 2011, in one room. It was nothing like the pretty, sunny room advertised on their website. The building where the room was located was totally run down, with a carpet that needed to be replaced since a long time. The wood panel in the elevator was chipped. In principle, entry into the building required a code but anyone could come in as it was broken. Corridor carpet at the room level was also grim and in the bedroom it was threadbare. Toiletries in the bathroom were insufficient although there were enough towels. When I requested for an extra blanket, I received two and both had holes in it and were frayed at the corners. None of the windows could be opened so our room never had any fresh air!!! At times I had to open the bedroom door so that there was some corridor air refreshing us. I cannot comment on the other facilities of the hotel as I did not want to use anything there after seeing their room... The receptionist at the time of check-out did not even ask how our stay had been and our opinion on the room and facilities! The entire place needs a mega make-over and refurbishing... as what you see on the website is not what you get!!! So I guess this hotel should change its name to reflect grief and mourning as it was a depressing stay. Frankly I could have done better taking my business to a better location to get more bang for my buck! In fact, we stayed out as late as we could as the thought of returning to the room was unbearable! Sad really since I expected more from a Radisson !!!

Reviews.Title: “the worst experience!”
Reviews.Author: lachata3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during new years eve, I gave my bags to the bellman on Sunday morning and on my return my sneakers were missing. The staff was not helpful at all except for the security guy, they were telling me that I gave them 4 bags and I got 4 bags back, yes that is true but my sneakers were still missing!!! I was told I was going to get a call back on Monday after they reviewed the cameras but never got a call. I called today Tuesday to follow up and apparently the manager never got the report!!! My sneakers were brand new and expensive and I am sure somebody stole them. The rooms were not my favorite either, it felt like a $80 room and I paid $150 (including taxes+fees). Never staying at this hotel again.Will let you know in another review if they helped me resolve the problem or not.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we stayed only one night. Ok, but...”
Reviews.Author: pr_littlemermaid
Reviews.Content: I believe you got what you paid for. I prepaid the standard room thru a 3rd party website. Room was small with a small window overlooking the parking lot and I-4. I'm glad we stayed only one night. The room is definitively in need of a makeover. Registration was fast and staff was very nice. On the back of the hotel, there is plenty of free parking. You will find a spot there. When we opened the door of our room (Bldg 4000) the MUSTY smell was awful. We (2 adults/2 kids) were sneezing all night long . In the morning we checked the A/C filter, and it was very dirty. I guess they could rinse it under water once in a while to keep it clean. The dust circulating plus the musty smell, excellent combination to keep you sneezing during your stay. Unfortunately the window is fixed, no way to let fresh air in. Bathroom was spacious, but when I entered it the toilet had pee on the rim, but everything else was cleaned, so I don't understand how housekeeping missed that. I immediately called front desk, and in less than 15 mins the housekeeper took care of it. Plenty of towels. Toiletries were fine. Bathtub is due for tiles to be changed. These had big brown mold spots on the bottom. Apparently the shower had this massaging shower head, but it was broken. TV was fine but the remote control sensor was not working or the remote needed new batteries. Room has a mini refrigerator with a complimentary bottle of water. Glasses, coffee cups, coffee maker. Beds were Ok. No bed bugs and sheets were clean. The best thing was the free wireless internet. No problems and very fast connection. And walls are thick, that's good because you can not hear your neighbors. They provide free shuttle service to Epcot (from there you can transfer to the other parks) and departs at several times per day. We didn't use it, but that's a plus for a hotel. They have several restaurants, gift shop, room service, a nice pool, nice grounds and plenty of daily activities for kids and adults. That is nice. And check out is at 11AM, and they are not pushing you to get out of the hotel. I-4 exit is around the corner and very close to Disney entrance. It is located in the busy Irlo Browson Hwy so there are plenty of restaurants around, grocery stores and pharmacies. Maybe I was very tired but I didn't hear any noise from I-4, and our room was facing that side. I will stay again if they clean those rooms well, remove the musty smell (or place a dehumidifier) and adding a microwave/kitchenette area to rooms will be nice (like other Radissons).

Reviews.Title: “dec 31 new years eve”
Reviews.Author: elijah r
Reviews.Content: one of the best stays at a hotel everyone was very nice and helpful and on new years day they let me have a late check out untill 6 great pools just over all a great stay

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment indeed”
Reviews.Author: IowaRdtripper
Reviews.Content: Normally stay near Downtown Disney but chose this due to advertised amenities, rate package and Radisson name. My initial red flags were raised upon arrival due to the general external conditions visible from the rear and the run-down nature of the zone in general. Then when we checked in we were assessed a 'resort fee' for items we would not utilize and stated that to the desk clerk as well as showed our confirmation for those items to be inclusive. Desk staff were not accomodating and were insistent on the charge. We had booked a double, non-smoking upgrade to sleep number queen sized beds. First room was not clean, was a smoking room, smelled horrible beyond the smoke with non-working lights, air etc. called the front desk and they sent a bellman to assist us change rooms. i talked with the bellman about the condition of the room and even the hallways, carpet etc. and inquired as to whether it was under renovation and was there a particular section we should request to avoid the stated conditions. I was told this is an old hotel that has been there for some time that sees lots of traffic and that is to be expected. We got to the second room with little improvement, sat down and realized right away that they were not sleep number beds. I went to the desk again and had to show the confirmation documents to get reassigned as they did not have a notation on the reservation site. We stayed with this room which was an improvement over the first two. The coupon book that was provided as part of the resort fee were not savings. There was little pride from management as everytime we came through the lobby there were drinks spilled, food littering the common areas etc. The vending machines were few and far between. The housekeeping staff seemed to have challenges in that some days the towels were replenished, some days not, they could not distinguish between regular coffee and decaff coffee packets and like the towels, some days replenished them and some days not. Same with other items like drinking glasses and bath items. The pool area was nice enough, unfortunately flooded with love bugs at the time as the resort did not spray unlike Disney properties. Surrounding restaurants and shopping were sub-par.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: William S
Reviews.Content: Very Nice hotel in a good location. Close to the theme parks and all kinds of dining, Deli in main lobby open until 1:00 am and decent food. We got back late from the Champs bowl and were very starving and the deli was lobby was perfect for a late night snack. Nice bar and two large pools. Would highly recommend. Only complaint and it was from my wife: The bed mattress was too hard. I found it great for my back and slept like a rock. Decent size rooms and nice views from the 8th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to usual Radisson standards, this is a party, convention hotel, needs a make over”
Reviews.Author: Dianewarrenpoint
Reviews.Content: Boy was I disappointed when I checked in here. I am a silver elite card holder, and booked 2 rooms on points. They where unable to accommodate any of my request, adjoining room, or even next door, best was 2 doors away. The decor is tired, and the carpets are worn out, and at times there is obvious dirt in the corridors and lifts. We enjoyed the bar, and the Bar tender Michelle was excellent. Kids enjoyed the Pizza hut, and the snack bar. Our room, 6307, was oveR looking the pool, and it was busy upto midnight, and started at 8:30 am again. We had to ring security at 3:30 one of the nights, as a group of young men where in the hot tub, and where very loud. Security sorted in quickly. When I mentioned this at check out, attendant said ' it happens'. No apology. By view, good location for Disney, if you are in a group, and want to party it is ideal. However do not expect Radisson standards, Lake Buena Vista Radisson is better. Somehow the 100% statisfaction guarantee was missing at both USA hotels I stayed in. Tired, party hotel, that is just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Three Weeks in Celebration”
Reviews.Author: Thom T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the resort for three weeks and had a great stay. Yasmine at checkin was extremely gracious and gave us her undivided attention. She helped us out tremendously and made sure we had an excellent room. Everyone at the resort was attentive and did their jobs well, from housekeeping to engineer. We had a stopped up sink and it was immediately fixed less than 15 minutes after the call. Heidi, at check out was also great. We are staying again in March.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience!!”
Reviews.Author: hellogoodbye2764
Reviews.Content: Well I and my family came to this hotel since it was so close to the parks and also from how nice it looked online. Rooms rates are a little pricey , but other than that we had a wonderful time, Rooms are really spacious and clean . Everyone is very courteous but I will like to give recognition to one of your employees she worked by the pool her name was Mara , she was very nice, respectful and caring I want to thank her for asking if our room was ok and if we needed anything else to just let her know. She made my kids feel comfortable as they were a little shy at first and did not want to participate in the pool activities, also my son was coughing a lot and she went and got him some water. Thank you so much ! We will definitely return !

Reviews.Title: “Back Breaker”
Reviews.Author: 4villas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very run down. Check in was slow. As soon as I got off the elevator I could smell the musty odor of an old Vegas Casino. The rooms however were very clean, but this had the very worst bed I had ever slept on. They were kind enough to bring me a feather bed and put it on top of the mattress, but the damage had been done, I didnt sleep because of my back pain the entire time I was there. We had breakfast buffet and it was good for the price, the location is great if you're going to Disney World. The bathrooms are also very old looking and not updated, but again they were very clean. The location is also near many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “NIGHTMARE AT THE RADDISON”
Reviews.Author: beachboy5417
Reviews.Content: JUST returned from your hotel at the Radisson Resort Orlando Celebration. The time frame ways December 8 to the 10th. There was no celebration here it was unsafe and threatening.You are like a restaurant that goes bad at night. You should close and refurbish your hotel.The rooms are dirty and smell also have mold and mildew in them. We came home feeling sick from these conditions. The only reason we did not leave is do to a Cheerleading compatition. My granddaughters were terrified at night do to the lack of security. There were people yelling and screaming all night long. The front desk said the problem would be taken care of but it never was. There were people coming into the hallways that did not belong on site. These drunken slobs we taken away by police. This hotel is not to stay at for any reason. IF you want to feel safe get lots of rest and relaxation this is not for you. The pools were dirty and the restrooms were full of mold and mildew and a horrible odder. How can you run such a filthy hotel. All we heard that it was do to the humidity in Florida. I LIVE on the coast I know all about heat and humidity. Your hotel needs TLC

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful value and great set up”
Reviews.Author: saholleman
Reviews.Content: We had a "compound" of rooms. One king room, one double room and one suite that all adjoined. It was perfect for our family of five and allowed much faster time in the morning with three bathrooms. Nice pool area, friendly staff. Rooms are clean and comfortable. They are in upgrade process, though our rooms were not yet refurbished. Great beds!

Reviews.Title: “Quality has declined”
Reviews.Author: Brian M
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5-night stay at the Radisson-Celebration (stayed there in July 2007), and I was disappointed to see the hotel quality and upkeep has declined. The location to WDW is good and the staff is friendly, but we had to move rooms twice in 5 days due to a broken mixer valve in the shower and roaches, yes ROACHES that were on our wall and bed one evening. The bell hop told us it was "not a roach and a type of large beetle common to the hotel - so no need to worry", but who wants to see bugs of any kind in their hotel room while on vacation? Also, in each of the three rooms we enjoyed staying in this week and surrounding areas, there were numerous signs of peeling paint that had barely been painted over, drywall repair, rusting hardware in the bathrooms, and dirty carpets. In addition to the mixer valve and bugs each room had a problem that was promptly fixed that day (broken hair dryer, broken shower head, grungy towels, etc.), but it was obvious that the hotel is aging and the management is only "patching" problems instead of replacing things or upgrading. Unfortunately this was not the same level of quality we enjoyed in 2007.

Reviews.Title: “first trip to the radisson”
Reviews.Author: andrew m
Reviews.Content: me and my girlfriend will be staying at this hotel in june of 2012 i have seen this hotel last june where we stayed at an awful hotel im hoping that all these horrible reviews people giving are false and that my stay will be very good due to my last trip to orlando thank you for your time.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Nic-Sweden
Reviews.Content: I went with my family for a three day stay in Orlando. The main reason was to visit Disney and Universal Studios before travelling down to Miami. The staff was very friendly helping out with different of questions. The rooms were clean, big and had comfortable beds. The hotel has a very nice pool area, but since we were not so much in the hotel sadly we didnt use it. We also decided to have breakfast and that was a terrific decision. The breakfast was fresh, a lot of varietes and tasted yummy. One other nice thing is that the hotel works has transfer at no charge to Epcot, Universal at certain times, which we used. There s a lot of parking spaces at no charges, which was a big +++. It was a very nice stay and I can certainly recommend it if you want a nice hotel at a very reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: ecfc2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks in May. A great location, close to the parks and good restaurants. No charge for parking. Rooms were big and the swimming pools were nice, if a little noisey. The rooms certainly need updating though! Also got a little noisey over the weekends due to parties going on in their conference area, etc. No major complaints but i'd look elsewhere the next time i'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Too much drama!”
Reviews.Author: dolphin_lady
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Radisson Resort Orlando/Celebration and I'm so happy to be home!!! The resort was beautiful but because it was football and cheerleading tournament week it was way overloaded with kids.
