They were everywhere, running in the halls until late at night and basically took over the pool and hot tub during the day. Laundry facilities were too limited and trying to get washers and dryers was very difficult especially since the dryers were not working properly. Air quality in the rooms was terrible resulting in a lot of the guests getting sore throats and stuffy noses. One excellent part of the hotel was the staff. Miriam was excellent - always running around organizing activities and always smiling. Our housekeeper (I believe her name was Carol Ann) was wonderful. The drama was one near drowning, another child in distress pulled out of the pool but a fully clothed security guard jumping in after her, another teen taken to the hospital due to swallowing too much water, fights breaking out at different times and never feeling relaxed. What would make this hotel better would be to add lifeguards (there were none) and extra security at times when this hotel has so many kids staying there. Also a plus would be to have an adult only pool and hot tub in a quiet area with no kid access. Would I stay here again? Probably not!

Reviews.Title: “Ugh...just awful!”
Reviews.Author: Julie S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for my son's football tournament. We had a terrible experience. The rooms we not clean, bedding and mattresses were disgusting and very uncomfortable. Food was below par as well. I would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone. A child also drown in the pool while we were here, no lifeguard on duty...ever.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 25th Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: Jeff C
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Resort Orlando-Celebration is a wonderful place to stay. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here for our 25th anniversary trip. This was our third or fourth time staying here, and we love it. The rooms were very clean, the staff was very friendly & helpful, food in the restaurants was good, the pools and outdoor activities were awesome! The prices, especially during the off season, are so affordable! It's a beautiful resort and we'd highly recommend it to families or a couples get-away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....very very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: ianwillishall
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a Honeymoon couple from 22 Nov to 29 Nov 2011 after changing our hotel at the last minute due to terrible reviews. We were anxious to say the least as with being such an important event we wanted it to be perfect. Check in was quick and efficient and our room was easy to find. We were able to park our hire car just outside and enter over one of the bridges over the water. The whole outside of the hotel was to a high standard and the garden areas are beautiful. We had two double beds in our room along with standard furniture and en-suite bathroom. The room was a decent size and really clean. Our ONLY negative comment would be that the room we had 2714 was a little tired looking...i.e. a lick of paint and a new carpet would really spruce it up BUT at the end of the day it was a room to sleep in at the end of a busy day so it didnt particuarly bother us. Again the corridor areas were a little shabby looking but again this is not something that would ruin our holiday!! All staff were friendly and helpful. The pool areas are lovely and really well maintained. Having the onsite starbucks was great at the end of a day and we had a pizza one evening from the pizzahut which was delicious. The location of the hotel was wonderfully close to all the disney attractions which is a plus if youre not too keen on driving long distances on unfamiliar roads. All in all we would most DEFINIATELY stay at this hotel again on a return visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Good resort with great facilities and good location.”
Reviews.Author: Pppancake5
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend in November 2011 for 8 days. The room was quite simple, which is what we liked...king size bed, nicely decorated, good bathroom (although slightly on the small side). They replaced the old TVs in all rooms during our stay and they now boast 40 inch flat screen TVs. The large pool also had a waterfall and slide, which was nice. The pool bar was very nice, as were the ice cold cocktails they serve. The smaller heated pool gets quite busy in the early evenings. We did not visit the Pizza Hut / Starbucks on site, but the room service was nice enough. Being close to the I4 highway was a big plus, allowing us to easily get to all the tourist hotspots. We also arranged a last minute trip to Miami and so checked out 3 days early, the front desk were helpful in giving us the details of who to contact in the third party travel company for a refund. Our air con unit was rattling at times, but that is the only real negative which did not bother us too much.

Reviews.Title: “Best service from frequent travelers”
Reviews.Author: celebrators1985
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice at the Radison near Celebration have been pleasantly surprised by the accommodations and in particular the excellent service. The pool area is very nice, the restaurant is good and the location to Celebration and Disney is excellent. Helen must be the best reservations person as she followed up on our reservation before we arrived and after we departed. In fact everyone we came in contact with was very friendly and accommodating. Looking for a nice hotel near Disney without paying the high prices, the Radison is definitely the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “"Better than you think...."”
Reviews.Author: RALIVA1
Reviews.Content: It was my 5th stay in this hotel and after checking prices and hotels for days non stop I settle (once again) for this one. The big warm pool, jacuzzi and whirlpool all year-round is definitely a plus! Just ask the kids!...plus a team of staff entertaining kids in the pool with games and activities!!! The tropical lush garden as pretty as ever, the slide on the main pool awesome, rooms comfortable-clean, but what I like the most was that, as soon as you check in, by the time you are arriving at your room they call you and ask if " anything else you might need?" and if the room is to my liking...wow, I have been in too many places where not even a "welcome" ever outed. The best for my money, and if you are not satisfy just mention it, I know if they can accommodate your reasonable request they will. 100% satisfied traveler!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT RESORT BUT RESORT FEE SUCKS”
Reviews.Author: happytimesGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson for a few days pre going on a cruise out of Cape Canaveral. We had travelled from Australia to LA to Orlando and arrived at the hotel about 8-00am. We were exhausted and well aware of the check in times but they were very gracious in allowing us to book in for which we were extremely grateful as all we wanted to do was sleep. We couldnt have our king room but were upgraded to a sleep number bed room, the bed was sooooooooooooooooooooo comfy. I had a real problem dealing with their so called Resort Fee. This is charged in addition to your room rates and to me this is an unfair charge as we had our own car, are in our 50's (very early mind you), do not have little people and did not use the pool activities as such that this resort fee is supposed to cover but at the end of the day we just had to suck it up and pay and accept the fee, but if everyone has to pay this fee why not just include it in the room rate to stop any controversy. Doesnt make sense to me. As far as the Resort goes, the room was very clean, the pools, spas and gardens are maintained to the highest of standards and are very pleasant. Staff are extremely proficient and very friendly. This Resort is outstanding and well worth staying at. We never ate at the resort as we had a car but the eateries looked good. Another bonus were the ice machines and also being able to have access to a washing machine. Even though I have trouble comprehending the Resort Fee we have booked to return to the Radisson next June and I have done a lot of research into other hotels in Orlando but feel the Radisson is outstanding as far as quality and value go. There is nothing more that you could want from a resort (apart from a kettle to boil water for a cup of tea instead of a coffee perculator) that the Radisson cannot deliver on I think this is a resort well worth staying at and look forward to returning next year..

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan A
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very average; eventhough the staff was friendly and they did give you a free drink each night at the bar. The rooms were not comfortable, and there was somewhat of a smell (had to go to Target and buy some air fresheners). We would only stay here again if all everything else was booked. I do have to mention something positive: the location is good, and there are plenty of restaurants around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Knani
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Resort Orlando-Celebration in November 2010 during a business trip. The property is located well off the highway, which is nice and probably means that the hotel is quiet most of the time. There are several pools, one with a waterfall, a tiki bar, and recreation areas at the hotel. The hotel is very spread out - there are actually several different buildings, so, depending on where your room is, there may be a pretty long walk to the lobby. My first room was on a high floor near the back of the property. The room was clean and beautifully decorated, and it was very quiet that first night. My only complaint was that my Internet didn't work. I brought my laptop to the lobby (which is beautiful, by the way) and was able to connect to WiFi there with no problem. I called the front desk the next morning and they sent technicians to my room to try and fix the problem. Unfortunately, they could not get the problem resolved, so the techs suggested that I ask to be moved to one of the rooms that had been recently upgraded with WiFi. I called the front desk and they switched my room right away. My new room was located on the first floor, close to the lobby, but it had a really pretty garden view. Just like the first room, it was nicely furnished and clean, and the WiFi worked beautifully. Unfortunately, every time I left my room, my key card wouldn't work when I tried to get back in. Luckily, the lobby was very close, and they reset my key card. Also, there was a large group of teenagers at the hotel the second night (who were in town for a "Battle of the Bands"). They were running around the halls and making noise until around 3 a.m., which was pretty annoying. I didn't call the front desk, so I can't complain that nothing was done about the noise. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay at the Radisson and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant bellhop service”
Reviews.Author: Shell T
Reviews.Content: I will be coming back to this hotel because of Andrew at the front desk. We had a problem with our initial room and he personally escorted us to a new room to make sure it was satisfactory. He went back to our original room and got all our bags all done with a smile. I recently had surgery and needed a motorized scooter...told me where to go and even offered to charge it in the lobby so I didn't have to bring it back to the room. He is a definate asset to the hotel and I will be recommending the Radisson to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “We felt special!”
Reviews.Author: Dico52
Reviews.Content: My recent visit to your hotel was outstanding. The staff, everyone we came in contact with, were there to make our stay the best it could be. The room was beyond our expectations, very clean and the sleep number beds were a treat. The heated pool was a big hit, as it was truly warm and comfortable in the chilly weather. The location is great for the disney parks, we did not even have to get on the expressway. We ate in the restaurants and had yummy frozen coctails at the pool bar. The coupons we were given at check in were a nice surprise and we used them at several areas of the resort. We are planning a return visit to Orlando next month and look forward to another stay at the Radisson Celebration.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah S
Reviews.Content: I could not be a bigger advocate for this resort. The staff was so incredibly helpful and friendly. Miriam (the pool bartender) and Steven (the hotel manager) were more than accommodating and made our trip memorable. There are activities for all ages, and the variety of restaurants, bars, and the cafe on-sight made everything extremely convenient. The location of the resort is close to all major Orlando attractions, and the shuttle to the Disney parks is a great mode of transportation. I highly recommend this resort for any type of vacation! P.S. Mariam deserves more signs for her bar!

Reviews.Title: “Davies Family stay”
Reviews.Author: Steve D
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 14 nights recently using it as a base to visit Disney, Sea World and Universal. Positive comments - The hotel is in a great location just minutes from all Disney locations and the I4 which leads to Universal & Seaworld. There are great facilities for children ie games room, table tennis, football table and films each evening. The coffee shop provides fantastic pizzas and other American style foods, snacks and drinks. Heated pool and jacuzzis are great. Hotel grounds and walkways are very well maintained. Jaynee in the sports bar gives great service with a smile and ensures your glass is always topped up! The standard of room cleaning/tidying is very good by the maids. The free wifi (works all over the hotel - even on floor 7) and use of the 4 PC's is useful Negative comments - the hotel is dated however is kept as well as they possibly could (you have to balance the fact that if they spend millions re-modelling then the prices will go up). The large pool was absolutely freezing - too cold to possibly swim in. The in-room air conditioning was a unit inserted into the window and was too noisy to use whilst we were in the room. We were celebrating my parents' 50th wedding anniversary and my son's 8th birthday during our stay (the hotel was informed twice before arrival) - after having paid for 3 rooms for 14 nights, it was disapointing that this was not acknowledged - some flowers or a small gift would have been well received. We also asked for 3 adjacent rooms and although all were on the same floor were not next to each other. Strange as the hotel only seemed to have low occupancy. In the main I was not dissapointed to have stayed at the Radisson Celebration due to the many positives however I feel that until they re-model, the hotel will fall behind the others in the area.

Reviews.Title: “overcharge !!!”
Reviews.Author: widjaja72
Reviews.Content: they do not known between the resort and the hotel !! because the room is like regular hotel only have tv and the bed , the far as i know the resort have a jacussi or full kichen , but this hotel doesnt have any of them not even a microwave !!! but the charge the resort fee which is very expensive !!! i'll never booked this hotel anymoore !! beware of the scammm !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Deanna D.”
Reviews.Author: Deanna D
Reviews.Content: Great central location, beautiful grounds and excellent service with friendly staff. Loved the Tiki Bar; hated the plastic cups which were necessary since the pool was near by (reusable plastic wine and beer goblets would be a nicer touch). The giant outside chess set was an interesting find. There's a comfy little spots bar off the pool area; our bartender was very professional and witty. Cheers Jaynee!! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good holiday hotel”
Reviews.Author: Calvin H
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of weeks with the family and have to say that the place was a great holiday base. Very near to Disney and close to the I4 junction 64 - so easy to get to the other attractions and back again without getting lost. Staff were very helpful and facilities excellent so would certainly recommend to families and groups.The room could have done with a fresh lick of paint but that can be said about a lot of hotels in busy holiday areas I guess. We had a great stay and I have to say it was excellent value. Thanks to Helen on the front desk!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Jane B
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Location was very central - we had no issues going anywhere. The staff was absolutely fantastic! All were very incredibly polite, helpful and always had a smile. Loved the Tiki Bar by the pool and special kudos to Jaynee, the bartender in the Sports Bar who also helped out in the Tiki Bar. She was fantastic and made our stay even more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Den from UK”
Reviews.Author: denis_schofield
Reviews.Content: First stopped at this hotel in 1988. loved it then, been back over 30 times and still love it now Great value for money.Beautiful setting. Restaurant not too good needs brightening up,but there are lots of great restaurants nearby Logans is our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Price”
Reviews.Author: Mio S
Reviews.Content: Thsi hotel is a great value for it's price and most importantly it's centrally located to get you to Walt Disney World or Universal Studios. It's is also conveniently located to several of the outlet malls in the area.

Reviews.Title: “couldnt get any better!”
Reviews.Author: christine m
Reviews.Content: I came on this trip with a few friends looking to just get away from our everyday lives and me coming to the radisson was the best decision ive made yet...no regrets whatsoever! they had all ammenities near to our convience...the best view by far. the largest pool ive ever been to. this is def a hotel recommended for family trips solo couples..all the above. def looking foward to my next trip next year. they have very welcoming staff esp this man named brian findeson i believe he has great service hes a people person very welcoming and def knows how to keep people entertained and can tend to any needs cant wait to see you guys next year!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent two night stay.”
Reviews.Author: honestashol
Reviews.Content: I arrived late for a business function so I was in a rush to check in and a little frustrated with the parking. While there is tons of parking around the resort, there’s none near the front office. Roberto and Heidi handled everything in stride and by the time she finished giving me directions to my group, she was handing me my room keys. The lobby is impressive and I know I’m the only one who cares, but the hardwood floor is beautiful. As I was checking in I couldn’t help but notice the inflatable movie screen at the back of the lobby. They played Disney movies for the kids each night. Apparently they have activities scheduled throughout the day as well. The pool area is huge, extremely nice and well maintained. I especially liked seeing the ping pong and foosball tables. Plus Jaynee at the pool bar was a lot of fun. I was even able pick up the wireless signal my last day and finish some work by the pool. Julianne did a wonderful and speedy job of straightening my room each day. The room itself was great and in good condition, large enough and decorated to look larger. The windows were bolted for safety but since it was a smoking room, some fresh air would have been nice. Lucy, Michelle and Uncle Steve made sure my friends and I were well fed and fussed over. The food was wonderful as our group had a cook-out next to the pool. The chicken cordon bleu at lunch was a bit heavy though. Still I appreciated the nap that followed… I rented a movie my last night there and my only true complaint is that with microwaves in the rooms, they don’t sell popcorn in the deli. Something to keep in mind on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Average Experience”
Reviews.Author: Private32
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had stayed here about 3 years ago and were delighted with everything so we decided to come back. However, some things had changed. Upon arrival, we were told that the room we had reserved was not available. (We had reserved a King Smoking)The clerk had to go to the manager who told us that we could have a double smoking and come down the following day around 4pm to see if a king was available. He reminded me that the room reservation is just "a request" not a guarantee. The room had a good presentation but after a day we figured out that we couldnt plug anything in to the sockets because the sockets were loose and the plug would just fall out, and there was a delay on the remote. Yep, thats right. Channel down, wait 10 secs, channel down, wait... very aggravating. And the beds were hard. I also had to do laundry. The first washer/dryer took some of my money and stopped working. I called the front desk and they told me to come to the desk and they would refund my money. They sent a maintenance man to my location who told me they dont own the washers/dryers so he could not fix it. I told him to take me to the next closest set and they were out of order as well. On the third try, I found a set that worked! So while my clothes were washing, I got the pleasure of proceeding to the front desk in my PJ's to get my refund. This hotel has a beautiful pool/bar, easy access to I4, lots of restaurants nearby, and there is a Walgreens fairly close. The staff was nice and tried to fix the problems. Housekeeping was good. But we had alot of minor annoyances which could have been prevented in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Visit”
Reviews.Author: Granfair
Reviews.Content: I was just recently at your property for a work training session, and very much enjoyed my stay. I had a great experience from check in to check out. Your staff made me feel very welcome, I always enjoy seeing people smiling when they are at work, means you are doing something right =) I would enjoy a return visit to your hotel, next time for personal reasons. You have a lot of ammentities to offer, and I would enjoy the opportunity to relax and enjoy. Thanks again for a great stay!! Btw my sleep number ranges between 50 and 60...couldn't quite decide! LOL Great beds!!

Reviews.Title: “Good July Stay”
Reviews.Author: Andreas H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Disney Tour this summer, being now in the conceirge status level with Radisson i stay at quite a few. This i would say is in the top 75%, not the best but far from the worst. The rooms were quite OK, typically 90´s. The staff was good no compliants and thefacailities were OK as well. The Hotel is definitly in the family side of things,which is not very common for radisson. If you have kids like myself i would definatly recommend the Hotel, The pool area is top notch, and the life guars are great. Pls give them warm best regards. Just seing the manager reading the reviews is a plus. I would improve the breakfast, becuase it is to much pre-fab. I would go for fresh orange juice ( Hello you are in Florida ) and a chef makeing you eggs would be to bad either. There was an ambundance of waiters so you can re-school one of those fellows. Talk to the Radisson people in Scandinavia to get the breakast ideas ( Radisson in Oslo ) .

Reviews.Title: “awesome time even with all the rain”
Reviews.Author: robinmhewett
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed our stay as we always do it rained the whole weekend and it didnt stop us from enjoying the hot tub and the beautiful views you have there we had the best dinner from your room service that was the best tasting meal ever we had chopped steak that tasted like a real lsteak it had the best flavor we ever tasted and the best price to hats off to the cheif there and thanks to the room manager there jeff he was attending a big wedding and still managed to come welcome us he is the nicest man thank you radisson for a much needed relaxing enjoyable time

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: BP274
Reviews.Content: We lucked out and stayed at the Radisson, we booked into another hotel on the strip and desided NOT to stay there. We went into the Radisson and got a room no problem! Last minute.. The hotel is very clean, staff is friendly and and will help in any way. The pool is inviting and the area is very clean. Rooms are also clean, and beds comfortable. This was a trip with my daughter, so the shuttle to Disney is a great way to get to Disney. We will certainly look for Radisson's worldwide when we travel next Thanks Radisson Celebration!

Reviews.Title: “For a wonderful experience and great staff stay here!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Robert B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a lot of hotels and this was by far the best experience that i have had. Radisson Resort Orlando goes above and beyond meeting the expectations of its customers. From the management staff to the maintenance staff, someone was always asking if everything was ok or if we needed anything.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures are deceiving.”
Reviews.Author: Am8312
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at this hotel and I feel like im compelled to write this review since I feel very strongly about what I'm going to say. I honestly love to read these reviews but never actually have time to write them but just feel like I should to help people thinking about having to stay here in the future. First of all, that smell every one complains about still lingers. It smells like moldly carpet thats been heated up. It goes away after u start the air conditioner but let me tell you it sure is gross when u step into the room. My major complaint that compelled me to write this is the nasty cleanliness that everyone writes about. The second night we were here I noticed that my comforter had gross looking stains on it (like women period stains that the hotel couldn't get out with stain remover) so I took it off the bed and placed it on the floor for housekeeping. The next day after coming back the room had been cleaned up nice and well but low and behold that same comforter is now on the other bed! WTF! This makes me feel so beyond gross having to sleep in this place. Im going to post a pic of this comforter that I'm talking about and hope that pic sums up what I'm trying to say. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOLIDAY”
Reviews.Author: Jackson1974
Reviews.Content: What can I say..... Well are holiday here 16Sept thru 30thSept was amazing... From start to end all of the staff at the resort made us feel very special & looked after us for our entire stay. We would like to thank Stephen, Miriam ,Michelle ,Josef & Jaynee also Gammy for helping us to enjoy our holiday & we will be sure to return. Thanks for the great memories. Ian & Deborah Jackson

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time or money”
Reviews.Author: Savanny V
Reviews.Content: It was not what I had expected at all from looking at it online. I decided to give it a chance, but by the fourth night I was awaken by a huge cockroach/beetle bug crawling on me. They moved us to another room and had my husband check around and found another one in that room. Needless to say, I checked out early.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't call it a resort.”
Reviews.Author: MelisRL
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks nice from check in. The lobby is very well set up and the exterior is well maintained. We were in building 2000. The room was facing the interior of the hotel. Our room was quite humid/moist. We were surprised to see a mini fridge, which is a plus, but shocked once we sat on the beds and realized they were most certianly not sleep number beds (as advertised). Beds were very uncomfortable and stiff. The pool area was kid friendly but I would be weary of opening your eyes underwater... It looked very murky by 3 pm. All in all great value for families, but if you're looking for an adult weekend get away, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “best time ever”
Reviews.Author: Tom B
Reviews.Content: this hotel hosted our group and we had the best time-- everyone working there went above and beyond the call of duty form the managers down to the maids--- i highly recommend this hotel if you are in the area. tom brimer

Reviews.Title: “Compliments to Radisson”
Reviews.Author: Meli D
Reviews.Content: My name is ______ ________ and I had the pleasure at staying at your resort August 18th through August 20th. I was there with my husband celebrating our one year anniversary and we were very satisfied with the service. We checked in with Helen who had such a positive attitude and gave us a very welcoming feeling to be there. Then, we asked her if there was a way we could have a vase for the 18 roses I had and she quickly made a call to have it sent to the room. On our way to the room, we were waiting to go up on the elevator and another staff member was holding a vase and asked if we were going to that room and we told him yes. He smiled and commented that the roses were beautiful and asked if the vase was going to be big enough for them. We had a laugh with him and thanked him for the vase and he congratulated us on our anniversary and told us to enjoy our special weekend there. Once we made it to the room, we were happy to see the king size bed, all the available space and the cleanliness of it. We felt comfortable being there and the following day once the room was turned over, it was like walking into a brand new room again. Inside the hotel, we really enjoyed the dinning at night and the gift shop for late night munchies. One of the best things that we enjoyed was the Pizza Hut Express because it saved us a trip from having to leave the resort to get some lunch while we were by the pool side. We spend most of our time by the pool which was wonderful with the slide and waterfall combination and the ping pong table was a favorite of ours. Overall, we had an amazing anniversary spent at your beautiful resort and I wanted to take a moment to inform you that we appreciated that service from all your staff from check in to check out. Hope we can visit you soon again.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson celebration treats their guests like royalty”
Reviews.Author: mchughbet
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Radisson Celebration in Orlando, 9/2011. Their staff made me feel welcome right from checking in to checking out. The staff was genuinely concerned with my accomadations and my comfort. The Hotel room was clean as well as the rest of the facilities and grounds as well. I also had the pleasure of dining in Mandolins' restaurant as well as the parkway deli, both experiences were pleasurabel as well, I will definitely stay at the Radisson Celebration on my next visit to Orlando Fl.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Friendly Staff, Clean Rooms, and so much more...”
Reviews.Author: Kyle0123
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for an event. The staff were amazing and attentive to every detail. Rooms were clean and beds were very comfortable. The bartenders at the pool bars were just amazing and friendly to our group. We love this hotel and hope the group returns there next year. Could not have been a better hotel and event.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worthy of the Radisson Name,”
Reviews.Author: T F
Reviews.Content: Radisson Orlando Resort | 2900 Parkway Boulevard, Kissimmee, FL 34747 Not Worthy of the Radisson Name, This hotel should have had its rights to the corporate name revolked long ago. The outside and public entrance are kept up but the rest is discusting. Dirty, moldy rooms and not kept up to decent standards. The elevators look like service elevators and were less than pleasing. Guest room service trays sat in hallways for way to many hours. All they could do was put us in a less nasty room, meaning this one did not reek of mold and it was only visable in the shower grout. I was told all the rooms were the same throughout the hotel and the last time it was updated was 20 years ago. I should contact the company the reservations were made through as they could do nothing other than change rooms. At least they were more than happy to do this. There was a nice gentleman who was sent to show us another room and he was very helpful, this was his first day on the job and his second similar complaint by 10:30 am. Nice pool but tepid hottub.

Reviews.Title: “I will only stay here when I visit Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Beatri88
Reviews.Content: I am quite pleased with all the staff they were friendly and efficient, in paticular Hemir who went out of his way make sure I was satisfied with the cleanliness and temperature of the jacuzzi and returned to make sure I was satisfied very friendly. I was also impressed with Elvia who went out of her way to get me paper and tape to wrap my carry on items. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: stb501
Reviews.Content: I saw the Radisson from my balcony at Mona Lisa Suites during a previous stay. I drove around it and it looked very nice, but it was busy so I didn't go in. I decided to stay there on my next visit. I was surprised at the difference in price between the Radisson, Mona Lisa and Celebration Bohemian. Although the address is Kissimmee, and it is on 192, which is the tourist stretch, it is right outside of Celebration. After making my reservations, I read the reviews here and was concerned. However, I was pleasantly surprised. The room was very nice and clean. The bed was comfortable. I actually got a room with a sleep number mattress. The lobby is nice. They have a large gift shop that is open late. There is also a convenience store with a Pizza Hut Express. I believe that is open until 1am. The bar and restaurant both looked nice. The courtyard had pools and hot tubs. Rock walls and trees adorned the paths. They also had large chess and checker boards as well as other games. The only negative thing that I had to say about my stay was that only half of the buildings had wi-fi. The remainder had wired internet. As someone who has traded in his laptop for a tablet, that was not very useful. The Radisson will continue to be my hotel of choice on my visits to Celebration.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the price. Very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: melkos
Reviews.Content: visited 3 nights on Labor Day weekend, two separate rooms. We were initially given rooms on the 2nd floor with no view. We asked if it was possible to switch to pool view rooms and we were very quickly accommodated which was greatly appreciated. Room 1 had no issues for all 3 nights. Room 2 the A/C didn't work the first night and the 2 day we were moved again, but it was done very quickly again. The pool was tons of fun for the kids! Not perfect and needs some updating, but clean and a lot of fun. Deli/pizza was great and not over priced. Rooms were clean. Again need some updating, but this is Orlando with tourists all year round and the affordable rate makes up for it. We will definitely keep it in mind for future trips as we visit Orlando a couple times a year.

Reviews.Title: “We are going back asap! Thank you!”
Reviews.Author: Brittney I
Reviews.Content: I visited the resort over the labor day week end with my family. We got 3 different rooms between all of us because there were so many of us gathering together. The children had a absolute ball in the pool! The adults adults enjoyed not having to worry about a thing for 3 whole days!!! Even though the hotel offers a shuttle to DW we chose to just hang out at the hotel. There were 2 movies played every evening for the kids and family, there are activities all day, and there is a resturant on property and a tiki bar by the pool!!! REALLY? What else could you ask for? We also were sooooooo... impressed by the wonderful staff! Samira was so helpful at the front desk, Jeff and Dustin were managment that went above and beyond for us! Everything that we encountered we were blessed that much more! What a wonderfully surprisingly great weekend we had!!! We will all go back again. Thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Nice Pool”
Reviews.Author: poupa1414
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a trip to DisneyWorld this is a great hotel to stay at. Five Minutes from the park entrances. Tons of places to eat on the 192 (not highend places but more family oriented). The hotel has 3 pools (1 heated, 1 kid's pool & 1 huge free-form pool with waterfall & waterslide). We spent a lot of time at the free form pool - was great and the staff there was fantastic. The rooms are very dated at this hotel, but clean, and there are no balconies. Had a large fridge, laundry facilities down the hall and free shuttle to the parks. I would recommend this hotel to families that want to spend time by the pool or time at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the cost even if free to stay there”
Reviews.Author: Smoore1883
Reviews.Content: My family decided to go to Disney for Christmas in 2010, and we wanted to try staying off-site for a change. When driving up to this hotel, the view looks great! It looks really good from the road. That's where "pleasant" ends and "unpleasant" begins. The experience started with rude staff at check-in. It's as if everyone hates working there. So now we are done with the front desk, let's drive around to our room. The hotel itself is large so the parking lot is also large, which is good, but it has a dark, dirty, unsafe feel, which is not so good. You park and start wheeling your luggage through the duck and goose poop. It is EVERYWHERE on the sidewalk. But, no big deal, it will be great inside. There were reviews from people who LOVED this place. The moment you walk inside the hotel, you see damage. There is damage everywhere: on the walls, the doors, inside the elevator. Next comes the smell. Some smells are pleasant. This one is not. You say to yourself, "I hope it's better in my room". Wrong, the smell does not lessen in your room. The smell is difficult to describe, but is similar to a combination of Oldness (if that term makes any sense), BO and mold, and it is omnipresent. The smell is a perfect compliment to the condition of the room: filthy. It was probably clean in 1983, but it is definitely not clean now...especially the floor. The much celebrated plush bed has a decorative, gold-colored sash. I call it a sash because I have no idea what it really is and a sash is useless decoration, which describes this thing...but not completely. In addition to the gold color, there is a red stain (blood?) on this thing. Did housekeeping really put this on the bed and not see a big red stain? This place is unbelievably bad. It is so dirty and smelly that you want to sleep standing up, with your shoes on. I get the creeps even thinking about that place. This is the worst hotel at which I have ever stayed. I have traveled extensively and have stayed in many hotels and this place has become our measure of sub-mediocrity since. On a positive note, there were no bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: jespin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first time it was great, we meet some wonderful great people especially Miriam the bartender she was awesome, loving, friendly and so much fun, the pool area was the best!! Would definently come back :)

Reviews.Title: “Fun time and very memorable holiday."”
Reviews.Author: LondonDivas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in July with my partner and her 15year old daughter and am writing this review as i was shocked at the many negative reports. After a nightmare journey from Sanford Intl, which was more down to my map reading skills than anything else, we arrived at the Radisson at 2230. Check in was very smooth and was completed by a very friendly girl who was ecstatic at seeing the shuttle launch earlier that day. She was incredibly happy and upbeat, despite sporting some of the reddest sunburn i have EVER seen. We stayed in room 1204 which overlooked the pool area. The room contained two large beds, a decent sized bathroom and enough storage to put cases and clothing etc. Upon arrival there was not enough pillows so we called housekeeping who arrived withing minutes with pillows and extra towels etc. This speedy and efficient service was evident throughout our stay and the staff whom we had contact with were always pleasant and eager to please. The pool area is very pleasant, although at times can get very crowded. This is expected though when holidaying in the high season. We found breakfast in Mandolins slightly overpriced for a buffet, but this isnt really a moan. We chose to eat at the IHOP further down the 192 and the pancakes and bacon kept us going well into the afternoon at the themeparks. The hotel is well placed for Disney and is only a 10 minute drive at most. Universal is a little further, however, a quick journey on the I4 and you are there in no time at all. I particularly liked the closeness to Old Town which is one of my Orlando faves. Celebration, the Disney built village over the road, is also worth visiting. If only for wishing you could afford to live there yourself. I genuinely would find it hard to moan about our holiday at the Radisson as we all had 10 nights of pure Orlando sun and fun. If i had to find one thing, i was slightly disappointed to have to pay the $12 per day resort fee and to get very little in return. I appreciate that it includes the shuttle service, but the route and times are not the most conveinient and many people drive to the theme parks. The times also do not give the opportunity to stay on at Universal in the evenings and make the most of City Walk and its entertainment. This, however, is only a small down. Lastly i would give a warning re the cheap tickets offered by guest services. This is run by Vacation Village, and so i am NOT casting a moan towards Radisson OR the hotel. You are offered discounted tickets to Disney and / or Universal in return for taking 2 hours on a Timeshare tour. Well 2 hours eventually turned into FIVE hours. Despite the fact that we did receive a very lovely free breakfast and met Lance who is the most hysterical Disney creation himself, i would not recommend doing this. We ended up saving a few $$ but im sure you could do deals elsewhere without the timeshare shenanigans. All in all though we had a truly fab time at the hotel and would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “VERY DARK AND SCARY!”
Reviews.Author: love2gals
Reviews.Content: This place is terrible!! It was VERY dark everywhere, in the parking lot, the hallways, etc. It was absolutley deserted the night I was there. The elevator was very old and creaky and took forever to come back to my floor (so I could escape!) Since I was travelling alone, I felt very unsafe! I felt so uneasy that I left and found a room somewhere else. I would not recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Worst resort in Florida!”
Reviews.Author: Kalamariverrat
Reviews.Content: Musty, dusty, dirty rooms; terrible housekeeping service (or lack thereof); rude, discourteous front desk staff. All-in-all a completely unpleasant and unrestful stay. I'll go to the Holiday Inn next time.

Reviews.Title: “Moldy, musty rooms”
Reviews.Author: Koovi
Reviews.Content: Time to tear up carpeting and powerwash these filthy mold infested rooms... Lobby and rest of hotel looks great until you enter room...

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price ....”
Reviews.Author: FLgrl772
Reviews.Content: The nicest part about this hotel was the pool area ... That alone was pretty worth the price ... Was not happy with our old musky smelling hotel rooms with hard beds... Or the disgusting breakfast that we tried to eat the following morning ...

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Patty K
Reviews.Content: From the time we checked in until we checked out, the staff at the front desk to housekeeping was superb! We were greeted wonderfully, our room was comfortable, my kids loved the pool and my 7 yr old son now wants a 40 ft water slide in our back yard! It was hard for me to get him to come in at night! The hotel is centrally located to all parks and easy to get in and out of. It is also situated on a main street with lots of restaurants, stores, gift shops, gas stations, everything you could possibly need!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: rhainman
Reviews.Content: Great staff only issues I had were that the wifi was hit and miss the pool was clean free beer was great hotel looked and felt top class but not stuck up and was easy to relax in. Tv didnt have many channels Hotel rooms were very clean. Breakfast was good but evening buffet isnt recommended

Reviews.Title: “we loved the resort and we had a great time”
Reviews.Author: tamara r
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to your resort the front desk employee his name Tariq, he was so nice with us and he made the check in professional way and friendly, he gave us every information we need it in the resort, and he was so friendly so respectful and smart and he gave to my daughter a tokens to the game in your resort , and every time I came in the front desk i saw him I go to take with him. and I asked him why every employee has a different country? he told me because we are intern from different country and that was good I like that . Really I appreciate his help he was so amazing any time I take to him he was smiling help us immediately because some time we need more towels for our room and other staf to my room. Thank you Tariq very much for everything you are amazing person. And the pool was nice , restaurant and food it's good and the staff also. And thanks for Steve the F&B manager he was so friendly and nice with guest he take to everybody during the stay if we had a problems in the resort. Thanks for the great time we spend it in your resort and see you next year.

Reviews.Title: “the best time ever”
Reviews.Author: carmen n
Reviews.Content: i stay thnere for three day and had a great time . the bartenter miriam was very nice and friendly .dont every lose her ,because i will be back again just because of her great services

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time and would return”
Reviews.Author: Skee72
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great for the family. We had fun at the pool. My daughter loved going down the water slide. Poolside entertainment was great. So close to Disney. The staff were friendly and always helpful. It was well worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “once again....very pleased with our stay”
Reviews.Author: ptskee
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel now on multiple occasions and it continues to be part of making our trip exceptional. And now there has been added things for the kids to enjoy from more things at the pool during the day to the free movies shown in the evening/night. Located minutes from the disney/universal attractions makes this hotel ideal!! The staff here are very friendly and go out of their way to greet and help you. I will continue to stay here for my vacation's to the disney area!!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy D
Reviews.Content: The pictures on their website look good, I don't think those are pictures of this hotel. Pool is old and dirty, chairs around pool - old and dirty, carpet in room and in hallways dirty and stained, stains on the sheets, stairwells dirty, air conditioner in room was LOUD and shook like it was going to come out of the wall. Hotel is misrepresented on website, looks good and they indicate "Celebration" which led me to believe the hotel was in Celebration when in fact it's across the street. Thumbs down on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Valeri J
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed for 3 nights, everything was perfect, the hotel , the staff. It is very near the parks and all other places. My son enjoyed the pool and the activities. Our room was OK, with plenty space for my baby back n play , I have 2 children so we really plan to come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"We totally enjoyed our visit and will returen!"”
Reviews.Author: Ilene R
Reviews.Content: The resort was clean and easy to find your way around. The rooms were clean, big and comfortable. The staff and service was excellent throughout the hotel. The hotel is very family oriented. Pool area was well kept and the activities aplenty.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST for fun and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Linda B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a terrific place to relax and have fun, especially if you have kids. We spent an entire day swirling down the cool pool slide and enjoying the contests and games in the afternoon. Each night is movie night in the lobby, where you can eat pizza and other goodies from the in-house casual restaurant that serves up Pizza Hut fare and more. The buffet is nice, too; and even though the added gratuity and tax boost the bill, kids eating free is a bonus. The rooms are clean and spacious and the refrigerator made it easy to buy fresh fruit and sodas, etc. and not have to always order out. I will definitely stay here again when we go to Disney... Animal Kingdom is only one exit away!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay - great place - will return”
Reviews.Author: whs787
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel within 2 years. The staff from the front desk to the maids and maintenance staff were always pleasant, addressing you with a Good Morning, Afternoon or Evening or asking if there was something they could help you with. The hotel grounds, pool and visitor areas where well maintained and clean. I had a choice of another hotel but since my previous visit was so enjoyable, I decided to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for a conference at the Gaylord Palms(too expensive and no microwave to use!”
Reviews.Author: Dianne T
Reviews.Content: I appreciated the friendly staff and the small diner with a microwave for the use of the guests. The two scrambled eggs the cook fixed were delcious--she needs a raise or a chef's toque perhaps!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Shivani S
Reviews.Content: We first changed roms because we were not happy with our view and the size of the room but after that it was very good. We had a great time at your very own Mandolin's restaurant where we enjoyed our meals and the service was very good and we were especially pleased with the sevice from Meryem Mrichcha who was very kind and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay & will return in the future”
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: Hotel & rooms were very clean, friendly staff, nice grounds & enjoyed our stay. My wife & I have always had a pleasant experience when staying at this location.

Reviews.Title: “I truly enjoyed by birthday ...”
Reviews.Author: JennyNFalcon
Reviews.Content: I loved the resort from the moment I arrived until departure. The lady that checked my husband and I in, from England, was extremely friendly and very knowledgeable of the area. She made us feel like at home right from the start with movie night at the lobby, even had my husband looking at me impressed by the great service. I was able to relax at the Hot Tub and chill at the Tiki Bar next to the pool area with a lovely waterfall and fun slide. My husband enjoyed the game room like a little boy. The lounge at the lobby and pizza until late were a great idea. My extra clean room with a very comfortable king size bed had a beautiful pool view at night that I was tempted to sleep with the curtains open all night, in which we slept like babies after going out for dinner and a drive around the area until late for my birthday. Absolutely nothing interrumpted my sleep that night and I appreciated it very, very much because I do not get to rest too much at home. The room was well stocked with towels, soap, coffee (very important for me), creamer, sugar and other supplies. Loved the fact that all Housekeeping Staff says hello to you and smile when you pass by them. I went as a couple for my birthday and I loved it, so I will definately return as a family soon. Thank you so much to everyone that was part of my great experience !!!

Reviews.Title: “I'm a return guest and will continue to be!”
Reviews.Author: beachteach80
Reviews.Content: As always, the Radisson was the perfect backdrop to have our family reunion. With many people getting together from across the country, you don't want to have to worry about anything, and we never had to. We spent the entire day in one of the large pools and there were lots of games/activities to keep everyone engaged. I've said it before and I'll say it again, the bed is one of the MOST COMFORTABLE beds I've slept in. The entire room was clean, as well as the hallways and grounds in general. Turn-down service at night is a nice touch. Breakfast buffet leaves you stuffed for the remainder of the day, great value. Life-size chess board is fun for children and adults alike. My husband stuffed the toilet (sorry honey) and maintenance responded quickly and resolved the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Reefteacher
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this location before and it never disappoints. There is so much to do at the resort for families- great pools, daily entertainment, and great places to grab a bite to eat (check out Mandolin's breakfast buffet!). The staff was very accommodating and friendly. The housekeeping staff even turned down our bed and left chocolates. The room was clean and comfortable. We will definitely stay at the Radisson again when we come back to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “third visit and loved it every time”
Reviews.Author: DISEN100665
Reviews.Content: third visit and would come back again. excellent time had by all the family High room given as requested. Lovely pool area and entertainment No Problems whatsoever and would return again. Rooms cleaned every day without fail. Ideal location for theme parks. Just far enough away

Reviews.Title: “Great staff..Dated property.”
Reviews.Author: tripguy0974
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Radisson went out of their way to make guests feel comfortable. The nightly reception featuring FREE BEER and appetizers for an hour or so gave this property the bump from 3 to 4 stars. Cellphone reception is poor to none in some areas of the resort and the television programming options are extremely limited in the rooms. Nice pool area...horrible fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T RUIN YOUR VACATION”
Reviews.Author: jenthe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights on July 29, 2011, and would not recommend this “RESORT” to anyone. Upon check in, we wanted to check out immediately. The room had a horrible smell, and the rug was dirty. No internet access and no safe in the room. The TV seemed like it was from the 80’s with fuzzy pictures and limited channels. The room needs help from HGTV. We would advise you to bring ears plugs, the walls are very thin, you will hear sounds. We chose this resort based on the pool on the internet, and location of the hotel perfect for visiting Disney, and the malls.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Holyoke_Herm
Reviews.Content: The price for this hotel looked like a great deal for a Radisson. After the $12 resort fee to use the pool and access to the on site parking, it wasn't as great a deal. Paid extra for Sleep Comfort beds that were only single setting (big air mattress). The rooms were clean and quiet. They had a barely working tube TV like the ones that are given away for free on Craigslist. This is a big complex that has a lot of people from around the world. This made it a little difficult to get around. The location is close to Disney, but the main road (hwy 192?) has a lot of traffic. A quick trip for fast food is not possible. One night was all I planned to stay and that was enough. Nothing was technically wrong with the hotel, location or my stay. I won't be coming back to this hotel. There are better hotel options in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax”
Reviews.Author: Wdkneram
Reviews.Content: I read some bad reviews but after staying here over 10 times I honestly do not know who could have written them. This place is clean, the staff is friendly, the sleep number beds and pillows are awesome, the pools are great, and the Tiki bar is a fun place to relax. You could park and never move or you could enjoy the many activities in the area. I encourage you to give it a try...you will not be disappointed!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not so much to celebrate here!”
Reviews.Author: daisy20071960
Reviews.Content: This property is what it is...a cheap place to stay close to disney. It is outdated and in desperate need of new EVERYTHING. The staff work very hard to impress, but I could not wait to check out! One can do much better in the Orlando area....

Reviews.Title: “Great plae. excellent service”
Reviews.Author: shrink0855
Reviews.Content: Was at the hotel for a business trip. Staff were polite and cooperative. Room was clean and quiet. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unable to open a window so musty smell in the room”
Reviews.Author: lindeva
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was perfect for visiting Disney. Unfortunately that is the only plus. Rooms are air-conditioned by a noisy machine which must be turned off if you wish to get some sleep. It is not possible to open a window so the room smells awful.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time here and coming back again”
Reviews.Author: RickSchaumburg
Reviews.Content: My two teenage boys and I stayed at the Celebration Radisson. We had a nice room with comfortable sleep number beds. The main pool was just steps away and we enjoyed our afternoons in the sun and pool. The hotel is in a good location with shopping and nice restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting hotel”
Reviews.Author: heidigray
Reviews.Content: the hotel stinks and is filthy. would not stay here and warn others about this.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth your time and money”
Reviews.Author: momabc1234
Reviews.Content: Hidden fee of $12.50 charged besides the hotels.com rate. Interior filthy, rug dirty, strange smells. No internet access (wires broken). No lock on bathroom door. Poor front desk service. Site was convenient, but would not stay there again. You can find nicer accommodations for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for family”
Reviews.Author: hrtbrk7186
Reviews.Content: Me and my daughter stayed here in March and again in July. This hotel in close to everything. Walt Disney World, Seaworld and Universal Studios. Also close to the Outlet Mall. Pool area very nice with lots of activities for kids. Water slide in the pool also. I would recommend to anyone. Sleep number beds, very comfortable. All personell very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jackson_nate
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked our vacation stay here last week. The hotel is close to both Disney and Universal Studios. It is also less than an hour away from Cocoa Beach. It took less than 15 minutes to check in. All of the employees from check in/out, pool side, as well as the cleaning staff were friendly and professional. The room was clean and the pool had a waterfall and water slide.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time and would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: snan2011
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was very enjoyable. The Staff was very nice and couldn't do enough to please the guests. My kids enjoyed the pool and activities thru-out the day. This is a nice family resort. The Restaurant on premises has good food and the service is quick. The shuttle service to the parks was good. Always on time and free. The Room was clean...and the housekeeping services are wonderful. They are very efficient in making up the room each day. All in all we were very pleased and would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible housekeeping and maintenance”
Reviews.Author: mike34667
Reviews.Content: the worst housekeeping ever. rooms not made up at 5PM. Impossible to get towels at room or pool. Sheets just put on top of mattress pad too small to cover king bed. Using double bed sheets for king bed. Had to bribe maid $5.00 to get us bath towels because she said it was not her room and had no extra towels. Waited 4 hours for housekeeping to finally bring up towels.

Reviews.Title: “Too big and hidden charges. Very un clean”
Reviews.Author: Claireguirvan
Reviews.Content: When booking we were told high speed internet but only certain parts of the hotel have internet. Plus on checking out you are charged an extra $11 dollars a night for Internet and parking. We were disgusted especially as we did not have internet in our room.Plus we were not told of these charges. The rooms had loose wires which was dangerous as we have a nine month old baby. Cleaning standards very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Disney/Universal”
Reviews.Author: jedi42
Reviews.Content: Just back from a few days at the Radisson, check in was fine we got a room on the 2nd floor looking into the pool just at the entrance to the slide, we asked to change and we were given another room in the floor above, my partner likes light airy rooms that let in natural daylight, unfortunately these rooms are dark due to the decoration. The Tv had limited channels and some of the channels were fuzzy. we got our room cleaned most days (at various times), on the last day we came back to our room about 10.00pm to find our room had not been cleaned, the cleaner had dropped clean towels but had not taken our dirty towels or emptied our bin, made the bed etc. The next morning we were wakened at 9.00am to ask if we required clean towel- which was annoying. we asked at reception the previous day and they allowed us to keep our room until 1.00pm as we had an early evening flight. The Pool was great for kids as again like so many we picked this hotel because of the pool, but agree with other reviews that the pool could do with a clean. They had a big scren in the reception area every night had films for kids, there is a wifi room adjacent to this where you can surf while your children watch the film. The games room was okay - every day someone kept jamming a coin in the 25c thus you end up putting a dollar in to get tokens. The entertainment at the pool was basic and most of the kids tended to stay in the pool and wait until it was time to dive for tokens. We also booked a room with the sleep easy beds as previous reviews said they were great, we obviously missed something as the beds were uncomfortable and spent most of our time trying to adjust the bed before sleep, if one of moved or got out of bed the bed became uneven. The plus point is it is ideal to go to Disney or Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family hotel”
Reviews.Author: dwille
Reviews.Content: OK rooms. We had problems with the toilet. The staff said they would fix it, but it never really worked :-( Nice beds were you can decide how soft/hard you want your bed. Great poolarea.

Reviews.Title: “1 night was enough...”
Reviews.Author: sweetandujar407
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for only one night and thank goodness I did. I checked in and out with no problems. I drove to the room passing half of a gate because it had been driven through. Walking through the hall you feel like you're suffocating no a/c, the rug was filthy and there was a strong odor. Once in the room I was very careful to not let my sandals come off my feet. The tv was not working so we called someone to fix it and bottom line was we had to choose between internet or cable, we couldn't have both. The a/c was working good. Bathroom was clean and I will say the bed was comfortable. To finalize, it's somewhere you stop for one night if that and nothing more. It's an old hotel. I definitely would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Has potential, but needs some cleaning up.”
Reviews.Author: AGorthy
Reviews.Content: Although I didn't hate our stay, there were some things that really needed help. We Chose this resort based on the pool. The pool was ok and good for kids. There is a fun waterslide and a waterfall as well as some nice landscaping, but the pool area was very dirty. The concrete was in desperate need of a good scrub down or power wash. Also there was a smell, we kept getting wafts of what smelled like mouse/rat urine. The pool bathrooms were filthy; besides having way too slick tiles for an area that is constantly wet due to dripping swimmers, the grout was black and disgusting with mildew. The pool bathroom was not well constructed for its use by a pool. Our first day by the pool, there was a lifeguard/pool attendant who was not usually visible. Kids (and adults) were doing dangerous things off the watersllide that could have seriously injured someone, and there was no one around to monitor this. Our 2nd day however, a lifeguard was stationed at the top of the slide. Other concrete walkways to the hotel were also fairly dirty. Painting the walkways brown does not exempt you from cleaning them. A power washer would probably do this property wonders. Our room was comfortable, the bedding was clean, the AC worked well and the beds were comfortable. The room was not as clean though as it could have been. The grout in the bathtub was mildewed, not badly, but this just isn't something guests like to see in a hotel bathroom that is presumably cleaned frequently. The furniture seemed clean but worn and a little bit dated. Also, our wifi, what was supposed to be covered in the resort fee, did not work. We were told the router that was supposed to have been in our room seemed to be missing. we could occasionally get a signal, and fortunately I could conduct most of the business I needed to, but other times we wanted to make reservations or get directions, we were unable to. The rooms were very very noisy. Thankfully most of the guests were fairly quiet, but we could lay in our room and be woken the softest of noises in the hall, like someone opening a soda can or someone's flip flops. The one very positive thing I can say about this hotel, is every staff member we encountered, was wonderful. Our check in was great, the person who was sent to check out our wifi issue (although he couldn't fix it during our stay) was friendly and the pool bartender who we ordered lunch from was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and we have already booked another trip!!”
Reviews.Author: mackay14_11
Reviews.Content: my daughter and her young children ( 3 & 5) and i stayed here for a quick get out of town trip and we didn't leave the resort...the room was perfect...clean, comfortable and perfectly located to the pool...the pool is Faboulous...the kids used the 40 foot water slide all day...they played in the kiddie pool, ate ice cream (free) entered a dive contest which my grandson won!!! And after a delicious dinner, they fell fast asleep in our wonderful sleep number bed and didn't wake til we did! I have already booked another getaway trip with another daughter and grandaughter and i can't wait...

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service at its best”
Reviews.Author: Troymd
Reviews.Content: This resort specializes in customer service and is the best that I have come upon in a long time. I would reccomend this resort to all business and leisure travelers. The General Manager Ron greets all patrons and is a first class GM in the industry.

Reviews.Title: “Best 30th Birthday”
Reviews.Author: nattee2355
Reviews.Content: I had Carlson points that I wanted to use up and I found this hotel with a great offer with points. My best friend of 31 years is now married and we have moved away from Orlando. We meet often and this was my first time there. I had problems with my reservation, but Jeff the manager there EXCEEDED my wished. My best friends husband told me it was the best birthday he has ever had in is life! We went to Sea World, not Disney, since it is really close also and pictures do not do this hotel justice. It is beautiful and huge!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: KristiMDT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a company trip and the place is disgusting. The rooms are filthy and are in need of some TLC. We got 4 rooms all in 4 different areas and everyone's room was equally nasty. One room even had to be changed due to some nasty wet stains on the chair and tv. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Prols
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this Radisson for three nights and four days and we had a great time. The accommodations were clean and spacious. We had adjoining rooms so we had plenty of space. The kids loved the pool area that had planned activities, a slide & pool bar / restaurant. The breakfast buffet was well worth the price. It included everything you could ever want for breakfast. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Got Chance to Stay but had great experience with hotel front desk”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth615
Reviews.Content: We were suppossed to travel to Florida and stay at the Radisson for an AAU boys basketball tournament from July 20th through July 30th. The team had a total of 10 rooms reserved for the trip. Due to circumstances beyond our control the team did not compete in the tournament at the last minute. Roberto at the front desk went above and beyond in helping us to cancel the reservation and not be charged. I cannot say enough about his professionalism and concern in taking care of this matter for us! My family is planning a trip to Florida in Septemember and you can be sure we will be staying at the Radisson! M

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but showing its age...”
Reviews.Author: LonestarNFlorida
Reviews.Content: I was visiting a friend in Orlando and found a very attractive rate for two nights at this hotel. The hassle free check in by courteous front desk staff was marred only by having to wait an hour beyond the published 4:00pm check in time. Check out was problem free. The room was clean, though the bathroom had a bit of a mildewy smell. To call the bed "firm" would be a huge understatement. In fact, it may have just been the hardest bed I've ever slept on. The A/C unit was pretty loud, but in fairness, that's pretty typical of hotel rooms. The TV looked like something from the 80's with limited channels and fuzzy picture. Not a big deal unless you spend a lot of time in the room. I guess I've been spoiled by recent stays in more updated hotels with newer flat screen TV's. My only real complaint was that the WIFI internet connection was down for most of the second day and night of my stay. When I called guest services, the woman kept offering to send someone to the room, even though she said they were experiencing problems with the internet... so sending someone to the room would have accomplished nothing. Other than that, she had no idea what the problem was or when it would be fixed. Not that big a deal... but it added a small irritant to the stay. Parking was ample. This is a high volume property that appears to cater to middle class guests... there is of course, nothing wrong with that at all but the property really shows its age and it doesn't seem much attention is given to appearance. The wood floors in the lobby are scarred and dull, the carpet in the hallways (and room) is in need of cleaning, the elevators are dirty with fraying carpet, etc. Overall, I was not dissatisfied with my stay, largely in party due to the modest $69 per night I paid. I would not however had been happy if I'd paid much more than that. In summary, an okay choice if you can get a good rate and aren't accustomed to staying in higher end hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and excellent attention”
Reviews.Author: vblacud
Reviews.Content: My vacation in this hotel was great, especially with the personnel that took care of everything and made us feel great in our time in the hotel. I am really happy that I picked this hotel and I will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “An old dated hotel that needs cleaned”
Reviews.Author: vacation22
Reviews.Content: I usually research my hotels prior to trips but since we were traveling with a large basketball group, I booked this hotel with the rest of the team. We stayed for 1 week and had about 20 rooms. This review is the general opinion of the group. PROS- very close to disney, I-4. Nice pool, bars, deli, laundry, games, movies, staff. We got a 79 rate, no resort fee and breakfast included. CONS-rooms and hallways are old and musty. Carpets wet around A/C. Bathrooms moldy, showers drip. Exhaust fans filthy and loud. AC filthy. Doors/locks to rooms difficult to operate, sleep number beds worked in very few of the rooms, wireless and cable for computers was very spotty, stairwells both interior and exterior were disgusting. Never been cleaned. LInens and trash piled in the hallways all day long. Breakfast buffet was not good. Even with it being free, most of us skipped out after the first 2 days. Parking was limited and impossible at night to find a spot. Finally, several of the families felt that there were bed bugs, both from bites and in their luggage when they got home.

Reviews.Title: “terrible park shuttle experience”
Reviews.Author: klc143
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at this resort (I am 20) for a mother-daughter trip to Harry Potter World at Universal and the Disney parks. I am sad to say that the shuttle service was extremely disappointing given the fact that it is included in the $12.50 per night resort fee. The hotel shares its shuttle with the Days Inn and the Howard Johnson, both pretty cheap hotels, which causes them to fill up fast. My mom had called the night before we checked in to see if we had to place reservations for the shuttle, but we were assured by the woman on the phone that they NEVER fill up so that is not necessary. Boy was that wrong. The Universal shuttle was fine the first day, but it only had one departure time and one pick-up time, which was frustrating because it greatly limited our options. The Disney shuttle could BARELY fit everyone on the way there both mornings, and would only drop off at Epcot, so we had to take a monorail and a bus to get to the parks we wanted to go to every day. The worst part was that they provide 5 shuttles TO the Disney parks and only 3 shuttles BACK. When we tried to get on the 8:45 shuttle there were twice as many people waiting at the stop as there were available seats causing all-out chaos when the bus pulled up. Elbows were thrown, kids were pushed around, families were separated, and about 25 people were left to wait another hour to be take back to their hotels. We asked the driver of the shuttle if this was a regular occurrence and he told us there had been a fist fight the week before and he had also had objects thrown at him in the past by angry patrons. When we got back to the Radisson, we asked to speak to a manager to inform her of what had happened. We didn't expect a change to be made during the last day we were there, of course, but we wanted to encourage them to change this for future guests because it felt genuinely UNSAFE. We didn't feel like our comments were heard and we got a free breakfast card that could only be used after 7AM at the sit-down restaurant, which we didn't have time to use because we were out of the hotel every morning by 7:15 in order to wait for the shuttle which might not have enough space for us if we showed up last minute. Oh, the irony. As far as the rest of the hotel, it was great. If you are not planning on going to the parks, I would recommend the hotel. The beds were very comfortable (our room had a sleep number), everything was clean, and the grounds/pool were beautiful. A better to-go breakfast selection would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “ROACHES. RUN the other way!”
Reviews.Author: Couple_Connoisseurs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Orlando on the second leg of a business trip, paired with the opportunity to view the final NASA shuttle launch. Arriving at the Radisson around 11pm after a late evening flight, we were greeted by dingy lighting and multiple roaches - some crawling on a wall and others curled up dead on the floor. That really should have been our first clue. We trudged along, trying to ignore the mini roach hotel and graveyard section we'd just seen and checked into the hotel, where the staff was moderately friendly. We were charged a resort fee on top of our hotel fee, so that is something to keep in mind if you decide to try to brave what is presently known as the worst hotel I have ever seen. Once given our key cards, we made our way through the maze of hallways, greeted by broken doors hanging half off their hinges, filthy dirty carpet that obviously had not been vacuumed in months, cracked and broken light fixtures and carpet completely ripped up in sections as long as approximately 5x8 pieces. Our room was no better. Upon opening the door, we were greeted by a broken sleep number bed, more filthy carpet, permanently yellowed bedding, cracked fixtures and a generous layer of dust. We were so mortified we called the front desk and asked for a change of room, were informed they were all to this standard, but were nonetheless immediately shifted to another building. Room two was no better, minus the fact that the sleep number bed did work in this room. The entire space just felt disgusting, and neither of us would even sit in the chairs, let alone lay in the bed. About the time I turned the bathroom light on and received an electric shock, I was done. We called our booking agent and left immediately. I will give the staff credit for giving us zero hassles during this process. They were mildly irritated, but otherwise professional and friendly. We have stayed in various hotels around the world and can say with confidence this is the worst. And, I say that not as an every day five star visitor, but as someone who merely wants a nicely appointed hotel room that is clean and comfortable. Roaches, dirty carpet, ripped carpet, broken doors, broken fixtures, a broken bed, a light switch that shocks you and dirty linens...Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “More cons than pros for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: legalease
Reviews.Content: We just returned today from a 7 night stay at the Radisson Resort - Celebration. I personnaly would never stay at this hotel again and would not recommend it to friends or family. We were very excited about this hotel after reading the prior reviews. As many have stated the lobby is nice and check-in was very quick. Walking to the room we noticed that the hotel itself was in great need of repair. The carpets in the elevator, hallways, rooms are disgusting. Stains are everywhere! It smelled musty but I expected that in a humid climate. After unpacking we noticed that our safe did not work. After calling the front desk and a repairman coming up it was determined that we would have to switch rooms to get a safe that worked (we really use a safe since most of our purchases are with cash on vacation). After speaking with the front desk (not helpful) the manager got on the telephone and said that he would remove the resort fee for our trouble and explained that we could not move rooms since the hotel was full. I appreciated his honesty and decided that we would make do by locking our money in our car. The shuttles to the parks were only to EPCOT and were early in the morning with pickup later in the evening (Nothing in between). We have small children and we could not take the chance of having to stay at the parks until 7:00-8:00 p.m. if one of them didn't feel well or someone got tired.
