I thought that the shuttles were not at all convenient and we never used them. We swam in the pool a couple of times and found plastic, wrappers, etc... floating. It could have been from that day but it just did not feel clean. The waterfalls and fountains are very nice and the kids loved them as they loved the slide. Bottom of the pool is peeling. I had a massage by the pool and it was very nice. The price was in line with massages here at home so I thought that they did not try to gouge visitors. After reading a prior review I now know where my husband and sons got the flea bites all over their legs!! We do not have animals and they have them (flea bites) everywhere on their legs. Housekeeping was not good at all. Most days our room was not cleaned until 4:30 -5:30 p.m. One day we returned from the parks at 11:00 p.m. to find out that our room was never cleaned. After calling the front desk they asked if they could send someone up to clean it. Since it was 11:oo p.m. we declined and ask for new towels (which were sent w/in 15 minutes). One day we were leaving for the parks at 10:30 a.m. and was told by the housekeeping supervisor that they had no towels and that we would have to wait if we wanted them. We always tip daily the housekeeping staff and we decided that we were not receiving the service to constitute a daily tip. We have always stayed onsite at Disney and will do so from this point. on.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location.”
Reviews.Author: Tiffterry
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Has everything you need at one location. Close to Disney and other attractions. You can even see fireworks from the top floor. Rooms are very clean. Hotel needs a little updating. Staff is super friendly and hotel food taste great. Pool activities are fun and great for kids. We love to stay at this location when we want to just get away.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff but needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: hkw46
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, the computer system was down so we were offered free drinks at the bar. The hotel looks dated but the staff were all very friendly and accommodating which compensated for the tired decor. Our room was perfectly acceptable, plenty of room and space for our things. The sheets and bathroom were clean. Because of the age of this hotel, and the fact that it does need some serious updating, it is difficult for the cleaning staff to make it 'shine'. The bed was comfortable but we would advise you to bring ear plugs because the walls are very thin. We felt we got value for money. It is a perfect location for airport and theme parks with local shops and restaurants. The pool area looked popular with the kids. If you want 'fancy' you'll have to be prepared to pay more! This is the heart of the theme park area so hotels come at a premium.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL & AFFORDABLE!!”
Reviews.Author: cardiokungfu
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and affordable!!! Clean rooms. Elegant Service. Close to EVERYTHING!! Lots of activities for all ages. Our new favorite place to stay in Orlando! LOVED IT!!! Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL STAY EVER! NOT WORTH THE MONEY! DONT BE FOOLED BY "RESORT" IN THE NAME!!”
Reviews.Author: KC_111210
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived to this "resort" on June 23,2011. We were here on a personal trip that was a gift from my dad..they had previously visited the same city and stayed at star island resort which is on the same street is this crappy place. My husband and I checked in, upon check in the front desk agent IMMEDIATELY ran my husbands card and placed the charge for the room on the card, Ive never seen this done before I thought you usually wait until you check out but we were still thinking no big deal. The lobby was gorgeous! So when you walk in and see the resort you think yeah im a great place---NOT!! Once we got to our room I felt like we had stepped into a time machine and traveled back to the 80s. calling the room HORRIBLE is an understatment! There is awful wicker furniture, a BOX( in 2011 unbelievable) TV that had very fuzzy cable and few channels not to mention the in room movies that were offered were WAY overpriced (between 14.99-35.99 THATS RIDICULOUS). We had a small refrigerator in the corner with no microwave, and no wi-fi (which is also unheard of in a hotel in this day and age)..My husband and I couldnt believe it! Not to mention that once we checked out and received our final bill there was tax after tax after tax and believe me this place is definately NOT WORTH THE MONEY!! Resort fee, resort tax, county tax, city tax, etc. if you are being charged all those taxes on a daily basis it can be pretty costly if it was a nice place to visit then I wouldnt have minded the cost..to sum it all up please please please STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!! DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE YOU WILL NOT BE IMPRESSED!! ITS NOT WORTH THE MONEY! DONT RUIN YOUR VACATION!!

Reviews.Title: “Is worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: Aiv02
Reviews.Content: I'm very satisfied... An excellent customer service. Definitely is a good place to stay on my next trip to the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle times a no go an fleas”
Reviews.Author: Hmmm090
Reviews.Content: Prior to booking our stay for 5 nights, I called to ask on the shuttle service an they advised all day ... Not even close they change their schedule from week to week an this week they only go to MK late morning around ten a.m. An other parks are a no go this week an I specifically asked how far from DTD an they saud oh walking distance about one mile. The aleep # bed did not work! We get here to check in an you can't even see DTD an I'm shocked at the useless shuttle service that should be non existenent. DTD is about 8 miles away an the only time the shuttle will take you there is at 6 in the evening. I canceled immediately an said we would only be staying one night since we arrived at midnight. We get to our room which is directly outside the entrance, an their walls might as well be paper because that's how thin they where , so if you want to sleep in , goodluck! Maintenance decided it would ne nice to drill an hammer on the floor above us at 6:30 a.m. As well. Next we go to the internet room to search out a new hotel( lake buena vista palace) stayed here before an loved it! An my husband an I had bites an where itching every where from the fleas we had to keep smacking off of us. Get back to our room an more fleas. Over all the grounds are nice an pool is great, but convience to Disney is horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Resort Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Alphredo
Reviews.Content: I had surgery scheduled at Celebration Hospital and my wife and I needed a place to stay without breaking the bank. This is actually a resort hotel. The rooms were nicely appointed. The pool area is gorgeous and can compete with any Disney resort pool. The hotel restaurant, "Mandolins," was sparsely attended, however the food was fabulous and the service was great. Our waiter was Josef and he was very attentive. An excellent center cut New York Strip steak with wine reduction and homemade mashed potatoes was an extraordinarily reasonable $17.99. Convenient to all things Disney and downtown Celebration, Iwe would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it and will definately be back!!”
Reviews.Author: SunShine7704
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel!! My kids especially enjoyed the water slide, waterfall @ the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: arielle2287
Reviews.Content: We had a large group of high school students and adults. I found the staff efficient and friendly in accommodating our requests and while completing their everyday jobs. While the rooms were clean and could maybe use a little work, the pool, grounds, restaurants and activities made the stay wonderful. The location is great, too. Just a minute away from Disney and I-4 that connects you to the rest of area. Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Probably Not”
Reviews.Author: ruthiec052
Reviews.Content: Where should I start with my review. Nice hotel beautiful ambiance and landscaping. Let's start. I stood here with my son for five days. It was nice to get a hot meal and kids dont pay. The only problem the meal wasnt hot. It was buffet style and always cold. Thank god the coffee was good. If you include the breakfast meal in the price of the hotel, it would be so much better. When I stay at a hotel I prefer the breakfast be included this way its something less I have to worry about. If you pay for breakfast, more people will eat there that means they will continue to have to refill the bins which means the food will be HOT! It just makes more sense. There were kids teams staying there. I believe softball and volleyball. They were loud and obnoxious at night. They were very discourteous about whom else was staying there. It was ridiculous how loud they were. The slide at pool is a great feature. My son loved it! For two out of three days we were there, they were servicing it or something cause it was not able to be used. I broke up the times my son and I would go to the pool because I really didnt want him to be out in the sun as he is a cancer survior and Im just paranoid really. I think they should have serviced the pool earlier in the day so we were able to enjoy it. I asked staff for a few ways to get around cause I didn't want the hassle of a car and everyone gave me a different answer. Not one person agreed on how I could get around town without sacrificing to pay for a cab. Luckily im from New York and I figured it out on my own. I made it for 5 days without paying for a cab to go anywhere I wanted. You can do it too. It was really sad that we had to go through this, but we made the best of it! I read the reviews and that's why I chose the hotel. Im really disappointed. Other than that it was, like I said a really nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lake_George_John
Reviews.Content: Very nice room, hotel grounds and very attentive staff. We had some issues with our room and they were immediately taken care of. This is a great hotel for families!! We had sleep number beds and although they are outdated, they still were very comfortable. The wireless internet is only wireless in some buildings; you have to hard connect in others

Reviews.Title: “THEY MADE ME FEEL LIKE ROYALTY!”
Reviews.Author: truesay65
Reviews.Content: Recently my daughter and I stayed at the Radisson Celebration for 5 days and can honestly say that in my 46 years, I have NEVER had such a wonderful experience at a hotel. The grounds were immaculate, the lobby clean and inviting and the rooms were absolutely wonderful. The staff were the most amazing people I have ever met in this type of industry. They always had time to smile and say "hello", and were very helpful and knowledgeable. As we did not have a vehicle at our disposal, we used the shuttle service provided by the hotel to visit both Universal Parks, Seaworld and the Factory Outlets. We were very pleased with this service and their punctuality. It also afforded us the chance to see some of the other hotels we researched. We are very thankful we chose the Celebration! Set off on it's own, we were grateful for the seclusion as the other hotels seemed to be within spitting distance of each other surrounded by heavy traffic areas. And, after a long day in the heat, we opted to cool off in one of their 3 swimming pools (mostly the one with the waterfall.... gorgeous!!) And when our bones were aching from all the walking, we soothed ourselves in one of the outdoor hottubs (again, with waterfall.... love it!!). Then, as the dinner hour approached, we grabbed our dinner from the wonderful diner on the premises, and went to the lobby to enjoy family-friendly movies (even though my daughter is over 20), where we enjoyed a relaxing evening and visited with one of our favorite staff.... "Uncle Steve" Komives (that is, when he wasn't rushing around to take care of business or taking a moment to visit with other visitors... he's such a social butterfly!). He especially went above and beyond in his care of my daughter and myself. A true gentleman who ensured our visit was pleasurable. We shed some tears when saying our good-byes, as we had become so close. That has NEVER happened in my 46 years! We had a late departure flight, and check-out time is 11:00 a.m. I talked to Steve to see if he had any ideas as to what would be the best way to fill in the time. Within minutes, he returned with Jeff, who told us he would be extending our check-out time so that we could enjoy the hotel commodities until our shuttle came that afternoon so that we did not have to worry about what to do in the meantime! Then, as we checked out the next day, Jeff came to say good-bye to us and check that we enjoyed our stay! Of course, we said farewell to "Uncle Steve" about 5 times before we finally left..... My daughter and I BOTH decided without a doubt that the next time we visit Florida, we won't even bother looking for other hotels..... the seclusion, the beauty, the friendliness of the Radisson Celebration is where we'll be staying!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT room and service but ...”
Reviews.Author: SMarie_20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a trip to DW and even though the check-in time says 3 or 4 .. you might be waiting an extra 2 hours for your room to get done being cleaned. We arrived at 330 hoping to be able to check in to my room when i was told at the desk that the room wasn't ready yet and I would be called on my cell phone when it was ready. Well two hours passed we went to the desk and they told us that the room had been ready for about an hour. Of course, I hadn't received any phone call informing me that the room was ready. I can't complain about the service, condition of the room, or anything of that sort. I would just make sure that if you're checking in on a Friday or and weekend day that you make sure that your room is ready before you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: pandg1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old and in need of some serious upgrading. The lobby gives a good initial impression but the rest of the hotel is a huge let down. The rooms are shabby, humid, dusty and damp. Our shower was falling off of the bathroom wall, some of the towels contained holes and stains, the carpets were filthy, room service trays were left by lifts and there weren't many staff on hand. The complimentary internet access is accessed by a lead and not WIFI. The pictures on the Radisson website show a polished and elegant hotel. When you arrive, it's a different story. We'd recommend booking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful...”
Reviews.Author: shewett5
Reviews.Content: one of the prettiest hotels i have ever been to for the price. the pools and jacuzzis are very nice. the front desk man named jeff was very helpful and made us feel very welcome at the same time as being professional. i would definitely go back again...

Reviews.Title: “we love it we are coming back as much as possible”
Reviews.Author: robinmhewett
Reviews.Content: we love your hotel we have never had any problems we are spoiled now and have been since our first stay with you back in 96 we have come there ever since and now that we are only hours away we come there every chance as a nice relaxing getaway for us and at times even bring the kids and grandkids to enjoy your pools and hot tubs and you have the nicest employees and the best rooms manager Jeff he has always been so helpful and friendly he goes above and beyond to make our stay pleasnt one our thanks to you and your resort for helping us relax and making great family memories threw the years we will see you soon the hewett family

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: LovinTheFunInTheSun
Reviews.Content: We were impressed from the moment we walked into the lobby. Jeff at the front desk was friendly and helpful as were all other employees we had contact with. The pool areas and grounds are beautiful, very tropical setting. There are several waterfalls located throughout the property and one in the lobby. There are several places to eat on site that have everything from snacks to full meals. Maid service cleaned our room every day, always replenished towels, soap, coffee, toilet paper and tissues without our asking. This hotel has many great perks that the resort at Disney does not provide. There are also many free daily activities that children and adults can partake in. Pool-side bingo was one of our favorites, my husband and I each won free drinks from the poolside bar and our son won free ice cream. Aside from the gameroom, there are several games outside free of charge... ping-pong, life size checkers and chess and "carnival type" basketball to name a few. We have absolutely no complaints with this hotel, only two suggestions... tropical music would add to the atmosphere and ashtrays were in short supply in pool area. We will definitely stay again, we really enjoyed our four days there!

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough about the amenities and staff”
Reviews.Author: Sharif_M
Reviews.Content: I was at this Radisson with my kids while my wife was at a dental convenion at the Gaylord hotel. The room was nice and clean for the price ($99). What really made the stay memorable were the amenities and incredibly pleasant, helpful staff. Each day, the front desk gave us 2 coupons good for 2 draft beers each, which I consumed myself :-) The food was cheap and good for casual hotel cafe's/bars, and the sports bar gave us 2 free kids meals for my kids with one adult purchase. They gave away free ice cream, had a great pool with waterfall and slide, played bingo, had basketball/foosball/pingpong, and much more than I can cover here. My kids made a new best friend in Irfann, who worked at the pool. He more than entertained them, got them ice cream, sunscreen, etc. He was one of the many wonderful employees there. I really can't say enough about this hotel. I truly never left the grounds until I went home, and hope to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Clean”
Reviews.Author: JCJ445
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, check in was fast and friendly, I did plenty of research about the different resorts before I booked anything, so the "resort fee" wasn't a surprise to me. The first night we were tired from our drive to Kissimmee, and just ordered pizza for dinner, was told it would be 45 minutes, but it was less than 30 :) We called and asked for extra towels and they showed up within minutes. Staff was friendly, I don't remember his name, but one of the pool attendants was joking with me that the pool towels were $1 each, and seemed to be enjoying his job. Other than that we only seen staff in the hallways, and they always greeted us with a smile. The pool area was great, we enjoyed it both nights we were there, our 6 year old son loved the slide, and swimming under the waterfall. We also ate at the breakfast buffett @ Mandolin's, was reasonably priced as our child ate for free, food was average, nothing spectacular, but was comparable to any other breakfast restaurant (like Denny's, IHop) Our waiter was very attentive, and made sure we took a box of cereal with us, if our son wanted a snack later since he was more interested in coloring at the time. Our second night there we wanted a late night snack, since we had an early dinner, and tried calling room service, got no answer, so my husband went to the diner in the lobby, and ordered and was back with food in about 20 minutes, and it cost a few dollars less than room service. Our only complaint would be the beds, they were too hard for us, but can't blame the hotel for that as maybe the next guest would love it. We will definitely stay here again, but I will get the sleep number bed room :)

Reviews.Title: “Nothing But The Best”
Reviews.Author: Dodge52
Reviews.Content: The hotel is like staying with neighbors. I know there are many choices in the area but we always choose the Radisson Celebration. We have been coming for many years and everyone is like family. From the moment you walk in your greeted with enthusiasm and you feel like your with family and that you are home or (home away from home).

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place I stay when in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: TJnSheryl
Reviews.Content: My wife & I only stay at this Hotel! From the Pools, the Sports Bar and of course the Tiki Bar with Amy & Mimi! The front desk staff is always happy & helpful, The internationals employees seem to be the happiest. While it may not be the best/newest resort in the Orlando Area my wife & I have found it to be like home... That point was driven "home" by my nephew. He thinks it's my house and whenever I'm in town he wants to his uncle's house with the pools!!!

Reviews.Title: “It gets better and better every year!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: zahir71
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to this wonderful resort in the last 2 years. Our experience at this resort last year was a memorable one and that made us come back this year also. Once again the level of friendliness, hospitality and high quality service makes this resort the best one for us and i strongly recommend staying at this place if you are looking for a great family vacation. Once again there is one person at this beautiful resort who makes the difference and this is Jeff Swirsky who is part of the resort management. He always goes out of his way to make you feel comfortable and take care of all the problems. Guess what???? We have again started making plans to visit this magical resort next year also!!!!!!!! Whenever you are visiting this resort, dont forget to give a shout to Jeff - u will not regret it!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable!”
Reviews.Author: darlahall71
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Resort Orlando-Celebration went overboard to ensure that we had enough space for our large family. The front desk staff greeted us with a smile, the restaurant managers were great, the pool staff was swift and the housekeepers were excellent. Everyone was extremely friendly. We'll visit again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Super Staff, older rooms”
Reviews.Author: BikerBob31522
Reviews.Content: Front Desk staff were superb !!!! The overall appearance was very well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “First Family Vacation - Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Budgetmom8
Reviews.Content: Though the staff had no idea that this was our first family vacation - ever, we were treated as though they knew our secret. Upon arrival, we were immediately greeted and checked in. Our room was spacious and clean - it even smelled fresh and clean. Our hotel package included breakfast. The Mandoline's staff was warm and efficient - the food was quite good. When we had difficulty with the room safe, we called the front desk and within minutes someone was in the room and fixed the problem. We traveled with our eight year old son and found the pools to be clean and in great working order. The hotel was quiet and family friendly. Check out was a breeze. Thanks you for your attention to details and for making our first vacation so memorable. We hope to return to Orlando in the future and will definitely stay at the Radisson Resort Orlando- Celebration. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Would consider staying again”
Reviews.Author: FredTM
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay at an affordable price. Staff were very helpful and welcoming. Very close to theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “We Had A Great Time and Staff Was outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: golfnut85
Reviews.Content: We Loved the Resort ..great deal on price..Kid's had a ball ... Staff was outstanding from the time we walked in to when we left. We will be back for sure. Rooms were Clean and pool was great. Yes the resort is older but and a big but..it is well maintained. you can't beat this deal!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for service charge fees”
Reviews.Author: Perry16
Reviews.Content: I booked a week at his hotel in Febuary to get a "special" rate. The rate shows an additional $12.50 a night fee, which having stayed here a couple of years ago, I thought was the resort fee. It isn't, it is a service charge per night. So the special rate with tax and everything will be over $100.00 a night for a $73.10 room. At that price point you have alot of other options for hotels in this area. The rooms are ok, and the hall decor is dated. The carpet in the room wasn't clean, and candy wrappers and dust under the beds look like its been there for some time.

Reviews.Title: “I need to implement a employee recruitment process like the Radisson in my company:))”
Reviews.Author: carlos2011_11
Reviews.Content: Without your employees you have a building, your team made my stay with my grand child and wife one of the best experiences I have ever had at a resort. Like to mention Miriam (pool side) GREAT, Mariangelee Otero front desk (never needed a map and/or event calandare) and not to mention house keeping I forgot to get her name (just fantastic lady) I was in room 6302. Thank you and we are booking for next year with grand kid again. Moving from Gay-lord Carlos F. Quinones

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, we were happy”
Reviews.Author: williebaseball
Reviews.Content: I wound up paying $85/per night (After taxes and "resort fee") and I'd say that was about right. If i'd've payed any more, I would have been disapointed. The bathroom was showing its age with loose fixtures and cracked flooor tiles, but other than that, the room was fine. The hallway noise was a little loud because people let the doors slam, but that happens just about everywhere. The pool was great, and breakfast at the resturant was adequate and convenient. It is one of the closest hotels to Disney and proved to be very convenient. We used their free bus service one day and it was great. and free parking was nice. I will stay here again....if the price is right . For another $40/night I could've stayed at a Disney Economy Resort.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic holiday hotel in Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: MizzMegan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Radisson Hotel in Kissimmee last month from 4th May til 21st May in a party of four, two adults and two kids and I am fussy, with high standards and I found this hotel met all of them. We seem to have clean bedding every day, we were very messy in our room (shame!) and bless the housekeeping, they cleared it up every day! The room was lovely with a view over the pool and they've got Pizza Hut and Starbucks, which I loved. But the best thing about this hotel by far is the staff. I must mention Steve in particular, he was awesome, very attentive and a really nice guy. We all felt looked after, cared for and it was this that made our Florida trip very, very special. Thanks to everyone at Radisson, Kissimmee, best wishes June Marsh

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, expecting to reurn for the 3rd time..”
Reviews.Author: dgrand1
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd time staying at this resort..We have 2 kids and we all enjoyed it very much.. The pools were great, the activities they had for the kids were very good they had a ball.. the restaurant was great ans the cafe also was delicious. Cant wait to stay again..... Even housekeeping was nice

Reviews.Title: “Another Stay”
Reviews.Author: rad1269
Reviews.Content: This past weekend i return to the Radisson Orlando Celebration, and again was very happy with my stay. The staff are great and the rooms are very clean and comfortable. You should try this hotel if your in Orlando or Kissimmee area, you will be very pleased!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the money”
Reviews.Author: jamaicalover14
Reviews.Content: We only payed $40 on price line plus the $12 resort fee so I feel it was very nice for that price, pretty close to disney, and pretty clean overall our stay was just fine the beds were small though we only stayed one night so we didn't use bar pool ect.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_jef
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from may 16th - may 22 with my sister and two nephews. Our stay at this resort was a lot better then we had originally expected. The front desk was very friendly and polite and there was no wait to book our room. Management is always walking around to make sure everything was ok. I was waiting at the outside pizza hut for the attendant and the manager went to get her right away. My nephew is the type that doest follow directions to well, he was running at the pool area and slipped and hurt his knee. The life guard rushed over and bandaged his injury. Thee free bus shuttle to all the theme park was a great addition. I have to mention that even the maintenance crew where amazing. Our safe stopped working and some had come to fix it within 10 minutes. On other days, the maintenance guys would always greet us as we passed. The maids were also doing a good job at cleaning our room. Me and my sister are the messy type and we noticed that the maid had neatly organized our stuff around the bathroom sink. She gave us better then expected service. We are use to them just making the beds and doing a little sleep, but this maid did more which was great. This resort has everything you can ask for and I will tell all my friends about it. One quick note, this hotels location is in the best part of Kissimmee will all attractions within minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall, backstabbed with resort fees.”
Reviews.Author: GraysMom
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through Priceline and got a great deal! We thought it was too good to be true. And it was. When we checked in we were also told we had to pay an additional $12.50 in resort fees. We checked in, and had to leave to meet family, by the time we got back it was 1am. Had to wake up, feed my children and leave again. I didn't even know there was a restaurant. I didn't recall it on the site. Overall the visit was average. I've stayed at other Radisson hotels and I've seen top of the line, and I've seen worse. This was right in the middle somewhere. We stayed in building 2000, when we got to the elevator the carpet was less than to be desired. But to make up for it the Housekeeping manager "Howard" met us and was so nice. He sat and talked with us an easy 15 minutes. Very nice man. The rooms were so small, but clean and I loved the beds and pillows. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Barbmc2929
Reviews.Content: The Radisson at Orlando-Celebration was not only beautiful, clean and comfortable but has one of the friendliest staff I have ever experienced. My husband and I were only there for one night but they treated us like we had booked the entire hotel for a month. My only regret is that we were only there for one night. I would have loved to experience the inviting pool, well equiped fitness room and restaurant. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: Soozie49
Reviews.Content: We have been staying here every year since 2004 and just love it. The hotel is situated in an ideal location just off the US-192, and within easy access to Walt Disney World and the I-4. The hotel's daily shuttle bus service to and from the theme parks is a definite bonus! Bedrooms are comfortable and clean, and include a fridge and a safe. The best things about this hotel have to be it's location, amenities, the superb pools and poolside area, as well as the friendliness of the managers and staff who always take the time to speak to guests. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend a stay here, and we will definitely be heading back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time!!”
Reviews.Author: Maryann5252
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during spring break week and really had a great time. Travel to the Disney parks was very easy but to Universal a little more difficult. Only because the bus runs once a day and we had to take a town car back from the park because we wanted to stay late. Still not a bad move at all!!! The travel to disney parks were great. I would stay here again. It was clean, no bugs, the staff was the best. The breakfast at the hotel was also very good and prices not bad at all. Thank you for making our trip wonderful. Maryann from Broomall Pennsylvania.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: jbarnes4601
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Radisson Resort while on a Make-A-Wish trip for my 11 yr old son. My family members that stayed at the hotel were my husband, myself, my son, his three sisters ages 12, 14, 16, and my mother -in-law. The hotel room was cleaned daily but there was some food found under the bed the first day. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The pool area was great, the staff working at the pool made the day fun for the kids and adults. They were very personable, and looked out for the safety of the patrons.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation Time at Disneyworld and R & R”
Reviews.Author: hondo63
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked our room several months in advance for a good rate. We arrived later than we planned, but we were checked in efficiently, and soon we were in our room. The hotel ran a very efficient shuttle service to take us back and forth to Disney's Magic Kingdom, et al. The parking was very secure and we left our car basically unused for 4 days and nights. We did most of our eating on site, and found the service and the food quite good. We ate each morning at the in house deli where the chef was very friendly and cooked up a mean breakfast. The food was always hot and presented quite nicely from all the vendors in the hotel. We ate twice at the restaurant, Mandolins. where the food and the service was superior. Our server, Marrian, from Morocco, was both efficient and friendly. We spent a good deal of time at the pool which was nice and well maintained. The Activitiy Director, Irafan was remarkable with his activities that kept both my teenaged kids busy and happy. He was very personable and was just great with our kids. We did meet one manager, Steve. Everyone he'd met earlier referred to him as "uncle" Steve as they walked by. It was obvious he cared about the guests. He sat at our table a few moments, took our picture, and chatted awhile. He asked about our stay, talked to us like he'd known us for years, and was really interested in what we thought and asked for our input as to his hotel. While the place could use some updates - modernization for example, our stay was pleasant. Our room smelled good, and our sheets, towels, and all else was clean and fresh. This is a family friendly place, lots to do to keep kids busy, and an overall excellent experience. We're already talking about coming back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: Saladhater
Reviews.Content: I can understand some people liking this place and others hating it. It basically does what it says on the tin. It's very good room rate value but they rake some of that back with highish bar prices. Staff are all very friendly and your kids will love it if you don't.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay, will definatley being going back, made our holiday very special”
Reviews.Author: louiseGnegative
Reviews.Content: I have just returned for a 17 day stay at the Radisson resort celebration, which was booked through virgin holidays. Had the most amazing time there, brilliant location although I had a car, but had a shuttle service to all the parks. The room was clean, tidy and serviced everyday, and was lucky to stay in the 6000 building with great views of the pool and the most amazing comfy beds. Went with two 12 year old energetic girls who loved the pools, one heated one cold with a water slide, and enjoyed all games and pool staff who were so friendly. The deli dinner has a starbucks which was always great, and the most amazing pizza from the pizza hut. Thoroughly enjoyed breakfast and dinner at mandolins main restaurant, and the pool bar has the best cocktails and warm friendly bar staff. Extras I was not expecting was free use of the internet (virgin holiday customers do not have to pay the resort fee) free hersheys ice creams by the pool side most afternoons and tokens given to kids for the games rooms for winning swimming games. I cant wait to book to go back, this hotel really did make our holiday very special, many thanks to Steve, stan and crazybill.

Reviews.Title: “Resort fee is robbery”
Reviews.Author: Coaster1
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews are a little harsh. Clean accommodations from what we saw. Room was very quiet also. This location could be helped if the resort fee was invested back into the property though. The negative...Carpet and furnishings are way past it's prime. Carpet is worn from the elevators to your room. Furnishings are just plain 'beat up' along with the outdated TVs. Mattress was hard like previous reviews. I slept well, but could understand why others would complain. We did not use pools as we arrived late and felt the resort fee was a ripoff for those like us who don't use the pools and drive to Disney on our own. The free ice cream by the pool does not apply to those like us staying one night either. It is around 2pm which is before checkin and after checkout. Hopefully the $12.50 phony 'resort' fee will be set aside and be used for new carpet, furniture and TVs in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A little treasure!”
Reviews.Author: banana77771
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and really can't find anything negative to say! The hotel is one of the best, if not the best around the Kissimmee area. I have stayed here every year and just love coming back as it feels like home. With plush surroundings to huge comfy sleeper beds... could you ask for anything more!!! The Deli is such a plus as well as there is nothing more welcoming to kick start your day with a hot cup of coffee and extremely tasty doughnuts. The location is ideal as it less than five minutes away from Disney also you can happily walk to the local restaurants and old town just down the road. This will be our eighth consecutive year and will be back this coming September... Let’s hope I can win on the mini bingo this time round =) Outstanding!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place, tremendous value for price!”
Reviews.Author: Sheilah01
Reviews.Content: Great resort hotel. We have stayed here 4 times now and it was great. I did not find it to be worn as per other opinions. The rooms were clean and large. Bathrooms modern and clean! The staff at the pool bar, restaurant were so friendly. One afternoon they had make your own sundaes by the pool. The pools are great, one heated and one the perfect temp for us northerners. You can always find a lounge chair by the pool (unlike some of the far more expensive hotels we have stayed in in the Disney area). We had our car so I cannot comment on the shuttle to the park. Get the breakfast with your room great value for the money, great host from Boston! Go yanks!

Reviews.Title: “It's disney area, so expect a lot of kids.”
Reviews.Author: esoteric24
Reviews.Content: Booked through priceline. The was a resort fee on top of the priceline bid. Hotel was nothing spectacular. Room was pretty big. Hallway reeked of smoke though. The pool area was pretty big, but outdated. This is disney, so a lot of kids, teens are running around. Didn't bother me at bed time though. Would I choose this hotel again? Probably not. Internet was free, but painfully slow.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: 186338Alexandra1987
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I stayed at the Rad in Kissimmee in March of this year. We booked our holiday 6 months in advance through the Expedia website, excited and content with our choice (good location and reasonably priced room). However after reading a lot of negative reviews on Trip Advisor, we became quite alarmed and worried as to what to expect of the hotel. It seemed that most travellers were concerned with the state of the room+bathroom. It didn't leave much to desire. We emailed the reservation team to request a non-smoking/king size room in Building 6000 (as recommended by fellow travellers on TA).The response wasn't quite what we expected; it didn't confirm our hotel reservation and was instead offering us a "romance package". As lovely as it sounded, for an $127 per night not including taxes (haha), it was not what we asked for. So we emailed them again stating we had already booked a room at their hotel and just wanted to check if it was possible to have a room in Building 6000. We got another couple of emails, which ignored the content of our emails and offered us other packages. We had to finally call the hotel for the reservation manager, Garnedy, to take over. She assured us we would have a refurbished room in the desired building. We asked for a confirmation in writing just to be sure; which we got. We are never fussy when on holidays but our good sense and their lack of communication skills, left us quite wary and thought it was a good idea to take certain measure of precaution. We emailed them 10 days before our departure, just to check that everything was in order. When we finally got to the hotel after travelling for 24 hours, we had to wait another 45mins before being able to check in. We were given a room in Building 4000 and didn't bother putting up with a fight. I just mentioned the emails and the front desk staff told me " M'am all the rooms are the same". Well the room was lovely, spacious and clean, to our greatest relief. The sheets and towels were changed every day and the cleaning staff was engaging and polite. Our only complaint is that we were next to the elevator and the ice room. So there was quite a bit of noise during the night. Not to mention we went there during Spring Break, so there were quite a few randy students running and screaming in the corridors in the evenings. We ate once at the hotel restaurant. The food wasn't the nicest and we found ourselves, after the first evening, wandering around the area for better restaurants and dinners. There was a bar by the pool which served great cocktails. We ordered food from the bar, which always took a while to come, but that's probably due to the fact there was only one lady (lovely by the way!) working behind the bar, taking all the order and running back and forth to the next door restaurant to get the food. There are two swimming pools in the hotel: a big one (water is cold) and a small one which is heated. We used the big one as it was most of the time empty. The hotel was packed, but we weren't at the hotel during the day, so didn't really mind or care.Overall we were pleased and had a great time! Most definitely a trip we will remember!

Reviews.Title: “In need of an update”
Reviews.Author: tball01
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly located hotel if you are going to visit Disney World. I reserved this hotel on priceline, so I cannot complain about the price of the hotel. However, if I were paying the standard rate, I would be sorely disappointed. The first thing I noticed when we entered the hotel was the shabby condition of the entryway and the elevator. Carpet in the elevator was dirty and fraying at the edges--not what I'd expect from a Radisson. Additionally, there were large school groups staying in the hotel and much noise. The service staff at the hotel were nice and helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable and fine for a stay where we were normally only in the hotel to sleep. Internet is also included in the resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: thegreatone99
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel hotel for the price.We stayed here for a week or so and had a great stay.The large pool is great and the kids really enjoyed it.The other pool was alright but a bit too hot for this time of year.More like a large hot tub then a pool.The hotel offer great food from a onsite restaurant and pizza hut.There was also entertainment for the kids like poolside games and movies in the lobby.The rooms were clean and had lots of room.The hotel has a great layout for the size of it,not a long walk to go anywhere on the grounds for the amenities.Only beef I had was the internet,had trouble getting it in my room and when I did it was very slow.Would stay again and recommend this hotel to anyone.Tip,try booking through travel sites,you might save the resort fee like I did($11-$12 per night)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, especially for the price!”
Reviews.Author: BlueMoc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a one night stay in the area and chose to stay at the Radisson. While the hotel is a bit older and the rooms are nothing spectacular, we thoroughly enjoyed our day and night here. Everything was clean, the location is great, service was very good, and the price was beyond reasonable. The courtyard of the hotel is great, with two pools and a couple spas. We spent some time in the evening and the following morning down in the heated pool, which we really enjoyed. The biggest compliment I can give is that we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, though next time we'll bring the kids. They'd love the pool and slide!

Reviews.Title: “Good option for resonable price”
Reviews.Author: rarvelo
Reviews.Content: I reserved 6 rooms for my family group vacations in April 2011. Hotel is convenient located 10 minutes from Disne main entry. Hotel is old but kept in good condition, staff is very courteous, rooms are spacious, comfortable and in good condition for a not new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WILL STAY HERE AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: johnkell
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and 3 year old daughter in late April. I am already looking to go back. Here are the negatives: Pool towels were a little small, but hey they were complimentary. I can't say the same for the float rentals at the pool, which were priced a little high at $5/hour. The dude at the pool was cool and let you hang onto it for extra time though. The vending machines don't accept bills. I went to a few different floors to get a diet coke, but none of the machines would take any dollars. No Filet Mignon at room service. My wife tried to order it twice and they were out both times. The positives: Price! , Say no more. Service. We arrived at the hotel at 11:30 am, hoping to be able to use the pool and facilities, as check in is not unitl 4:00 pm. We were very pleasantly surprised to learn that our room was already ready and we could check in immediately at no extra charge. We received fresh towels and the beds were made every day. The shuttle to Universal is great. It saves you $14 in parking and the hassles associated with big parking lots. The Pools are great, plenty of space and sun. Two hot tubs (that I know of) and a cool waterslide. Pool Bar and Pizza Hut on premises! Two Disney movies every night in the lobby on a nice big screen and cozy chairs. We even had dinner there one night, while my daughter watched Finding Nemo. It was great! Also, there were huge turtles and carp in the pond over the entrance bridge. They would fight over cheerios. We ate and drank most of our meals at the hotel. The price was not too high for the most part, and the food was tasty, plus there were alot of choices (Pizza Hut, The Deli and the Restaurant and Room Service and a Convenience Store) and we could bill to the room to pay at the end of the trip. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to relax by the pool a little, be close to the theme parks and not have to go to far away for anything.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay”
Reviews.Author: Fatboy2000_9
Reviews.Content: Had a Great stay at the Radisson Orlando Celebration over the weekend. The room was great and very clean. Had the chance to eat on property and was impressed. Staff was great! Very pleased!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dont listen to negatives!!”
Reviews.Author: marloubor
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived for a 2 week holiday i could not have anything but good things to say, and after reading other comments on here was very pleasantly surprised. The staff throughout were ALL so friendly and offerered a superb hospitality service with excellent customer service. The kids loved the swimming pool area, and the surrounding grounds were kept lovely, the Tiki bar was great and so friendly..breakfast at Mandolins was good value with the kids eating free and of course they loved the fact that the resident character Rock the Parrot used to visit to say hi. Our bellmen Michael and Raul were so friendly and helpful giving advice on how to get to different places. The hotel offers a great atmoshphere in which to stay and close distance to Disney parks. On the day of leaving it was my daughters birthday and the staff made it really special with treats to the games room and even a cuddly miniture Rock to bring home. The hotel is exteremely child friendly..Thankyou to all of you for making our place of stay so enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “The Best.”
Reviews.Author: msholmes
Reviews.Content: Great location,beautiful pool,indoor/outdoor bar I will book more vacations with this resort when I'm in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for families, everything you could want and more, close to Disney.”
Reviews.Author: 42hdes
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel. The value was excellent. They have a beautiful location, pool, great breakfast buffet which you can include in the price of your room. There are several restaurants, a snack shop which came in handy, gift store with anything you might have forgotten, convenient to Disney - easy to get there and back. Clean rooms and good service throughout. (Reminder there is a conference center fee in addition to your room and taxes).

Reviews.Title: “Good Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: KMire
Reviews.Content: We found our King room ("Select Comfort" bed) very accommodating. We were in building 6. We heard comments from others regarding a musty or damp smell in some part of the same building, but our room was very comfortable. Our son was with a student group in another building with rooms that appeared to be older or possibly not recently updated. The housekeeping staff was prompt, courteous and effective in building 6. The check-in and check-out process was fine - no issues. We utilized the business center and found the computers, printers and online connections in good working order. The breakfast buffet at the Mandolin restaurant was exceptionally good for a hotel buffet, and not really a bad value either, considering the variety of food choices. Overall, we had a good stay, found our room to be in good working order. The Select Comfort bed was very comfortable. Linens were high quality, crisp and in perfect conditions. No complaints ... I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the games around pool area and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Woodcut
Reviews.Content: Super clean room, spotless. All lights and remotes worked well. Very large pool area and 2 hot tubs under trees and out of the way. Very nice to have ping pong, lifesize chess and checkers and other games around 2 pool decks. Very nice slide and waterfall area. Full service pizza hut on pool deck as well as other restaurants. Minutes from Old Town and many restaurants. Beautiful, lush grounds. Free ice cream sundaes on the pool deck Saturday was a hit! Only negative was needed to vaccum main pool and pressure wash lounge chairs. We had a great weekend getaway. My husband and I got to play ping pong while the girls played chess. Staff was very friendly while not intrusive.

Reviews.Title: “dump”
Reviews.Author: ilovelost
Reviews.Content: the whole room smelled like bong water, i wouldnt know but my husband told me, i just knew it smelled real bad. it was cheap 79 a night and it was close to disney but i would never stay here again or bring kids here. my husband did mention he went down the the pool area and it was really nice if that matters to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Fun”
Reviews.Author: gailmlmom
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful weekend. This hotel is quite nice. they have so many family friendly things that people actually use: ping pong, folsball, basketball shots, big chess and checkers, tennis courts. Having the poolside covered walkway is nice too. People can walk in the shade and sit in the shade.

Reviews.Title: “This is a quality hotel and property for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: RandyDNewYork
Reviews.Content: I have stayed the this property a total of seven times and each time was better than the last if that is even possible. I think this hotel is a five star resort at a very affforable price. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and very quiet during the nightime hours, we were well rested every morning. The property was very clean and very well kept, all the staff is personable and very helpful, and make you feel right at home. The pool areas and hot tubs were always clean and staff is constantly walking the area and picking up and cleaning throughout the day. Can not say enough great things about the management and staff, everyone had a smile on their face, all were friendly and helpful throughout our stay. I have recommended this hotel to many friends and family in the past who may be visiting this area and will continue to recommend in the future. If your looking for a comfortable place to stay that is close to everything in Orlando area, this is it, book this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ptskee
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on several occasions and highly recommend it! It is very clean, plenty of things to keep the kids occupied, love the pool area and the food and service is great! You cant beat the location as all the orlando attractions are minutes away!

Reviews.Title: “A Must Stay”
Reviews.Author: Scoobdoo49
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Raddison. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff was exceptional from the room attendants to the front desk. Way better than any Disney hotel i have ever stayed at!.

Reviews.Title: “DONT BELIEVE THE NEGATIVES”
Reviews.Author: adamsfamily518
Reviews.Content: We have stayed on the resort before and when we booked this hotel due to location we were concerned due to the negative comments we read online. We are checking out this morning after being here 6 days and our stay was FANTASTIC. rooms were extremely clean, the food at the Medallion restaurant in the hotel was great. We were buisy with all of the attractions most of the week but the last two days we spent most of the time around the hotel, One example there was a lifeguard from Jamaica that took time out of his off time to play poolside bingo with our 9 and 7 year old kids. I know that may sound trvial for some but it was just one example of all of the staff going beyond the call of duty to improve our family vacation experience......

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nowaskee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and three kids stayed here during our February break. What a great hotel, the activities that the hotel had were so family friendly. Our kids had a great time in the pool. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We had a great breakfast at the restaurant everyday and the distance to the parks made it a great place to stay at. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “No major complaints”
Reviews.Author: mom023kids
Reviews.Content: This is our families second stay at the Radisson. Our room was clean. The staff was very courteous. We enjoyed the buffet every morning at Mandolins. Everything there seemed to be clean. Best part is kids under the age of 10, eat free!! The heated pool does have a very strong chlorine smell, and yes the pool with the slide is cold. But most pools are. And they don't claim say that the water slide pool is heated. There are plenty of pool toys also. Not boring at all. There are giant checkers and chess boards to play with too. They DO have many different times for the shuttle pick up. Another person on here said they only had one time, that was for Sea World. Disney has several times. The location is great. Only 15 minutes or so to ALL ot the parks, (including Sea World). So if the shuttle doesn't work for you, driving is quick. One small complaint is the room did not accomidate 2 adults and 3 small kids (ages 9,6 and 3). We wound uphaving to get a cot at $10 a night. BUT it was still cheaper than having to book 2 adjoining rooms. We will stay here again when we go on our next vacation to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be decieving! Choose another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: missdebbie1211
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel from Priceline.com. Checked into our room only to find spiders, dirty linens, lights and a phone that didn't work. Carpeting was nasty and room smelled. Tried to call the front desk for another room, but phone didn't work. Have to drive around building to front office and was given a "pool" room. After finding our room, which was no where near the pool, it was in the same condition. No toilet paper in the bathroom, black long hair in the toilet, in the towels and on the floor. Had to leave a note for the cleaning crew to leave toilet paper after the 2nd day. The outside security door was broke and couldn't get it to close behind us after entering. Water bottles and trash were under the beds from previous stays. Not many stations to watch on TV. The carpeting and curtains were nasty and I had a torn bedspread on my bed which the maid "flipped" everyday to look like new bedding was placed on the bed. Spoke to several other people who had rooms also and they commented on the same things - that the hotel was NASTY! The pools were nice although the hot tubs had tons of leaf clutter in them. Had I not won this hotel through Priceline, I would have demanded a refund and moved on.

Reviews.Title: “Wish the recent negative reviews were written before I stayed!”
Reviews.Author: lilly2093
Reviews.Content: Not terrible but certainly not great. I didn't want to pay to stay in Disney since half of our trip wasn't going to be going to the parks. I should have spent the extra money. The staff over all was friendly, except when I called down one night and was disconnected after giving my room number and wasn't called back! Room: Our first room smelled musty even though it was an updated room. The air conditioner sounded like it was going to explode and I didn't sleep. The walls are apparently thin and we heard everything around us, including the people moving furniture around upstairs. Our neighbors must get up early because around 4:00am the hallway door slammed which made our door shake loudly. Helen very happily changed our room. She was great. I've never complained before and I didn't think it was a big deal, but after everything kept piling up, I had to write a review. We were moved from the second floor to the eighth where it smelled like cigarette smoke in the hallway. Our second room had not been updated. There was no fitted sheet on the bed, just a top sheet so at your toes you could feel the bare mattress. That drove me crazy. They changed the duvet cover on our comforter and I think they put a queen size cover on the king size comforter. It didn't even cover the bed. That's when I called down and was disconnected. We were tired so I figured the sheets would be changed the next day. If you want new sheets, you have to put a card from the bathroom on your bed or they will only change them every other day, which is fine if the comforter fit the bed. I put the card on the bed and that night, same thing. Comforter was squeezed into a cover that was too small. The sleep number beds were terrible. Whether you blew it up or not, if felt like you were sleeping on a rock. There was only one "complimentary water" in the fridge and was never restocked during the stay. We had some pretty bad wind while we were there, which didn't effect our stay except all night the door was rattling and I had to stuff a towel underneath it so it would stop. Bathroom: I didn't find the bathroom to be too bad. It was pretty clean but when we asked for more towels, they must have given us the old worn out ones because they were nothing like the nice fluffy ones when you first get in the room. The water pressure in the shower was terrible. On one of the settings, the water just trickled out of the shower head. We asked about it a couple of times but they didn't let us know if they had looked at it. It took a while to get the soap off! Pools: There were 2 pools, 1 heated, 1 not, and a couple of hot tubs. We didn't use any but there was also a small bar outside. Restaurant: Our first night we had dinner at the hotel. I ordered the "fall off the bone" ribs which would have fallen off the bone if they stopped cooking an hour before. The food took forever to come out but the waiter was very nice. Without saying anything to him, he brought us some salads on the house. I ordered a half rack and got a full which was fine, but it was pretty much the ones you get already cooked in the grocery store...which I like, but at home! The bill was a bit pricey for a mediocre meal. The breakfast buffet was pretty good. Try the make-your-own waffles. That was very good! They had fresh fruit and just about everything a normal breakfast buffet has for $10 each. Not bad. The restaurant charges 18% gratuity automatically. There is the cafe by the front desk as well which has starbucks coffee and excellent egg sandwiches. We went there a couple of days too, but with coffee and juice, its just about the same price as the buffet or more depending on what kind of coffee you get. The shuttle only goes once each way per day to each park so you have to look up the times. We didn't think the times were convenient so we paid the $14 to park each day. One of the reasons I picked this hotel was because of the shuttle. Its a nice service if you don't mind being on a time schedule which, in Disney, is hard sometimes! I probably wouldn't stay again, it was just okay.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER EVER AGAIN.PERIOD.”
Reviews.Author: MARIATERESA23
Reviews.Content: I am a traveler on this earth.I've been to world's 5-star-hotels,4-stars,3-stars to no-star-at-all! that's why I am a cheap-traveler.My stay at Radisson was a so-so,I'm not picky in the first place. But I had a very bad experience that I said to myself , I will NEVER EVER set my foot on the doorstep of that hotel again.I had an early morning check-out, was in a hurry, left my phone in the room;I made a series of follow-up when I reached Arizona but to no avail. Abracadabra!!..... my phone became history. TRUST is an ultimate compliment which Radisson doesn't have.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck.”
Reviews.Author: avaric
Reviews.Content: I usually do LOTS of research on hotels before I chose one....this time I did none. My daughter's high school band was to march in a Disney parade and the hotel was booked for the entire band --I just went ahead and booked our room here too. Mistake. First of all when I think of a "resort" I think about relaxation and recreation. The definition of "resort" at this hotel means "pools" (one too hot, one too cold). What's so special about a pool in Orlando...you can get that from 5 star hotels to $29.99 a night motels in Orlando. More importantly the room was not good. There were crumbs in the corner of the room on the carpeting when we checked in...when we checked out 5 days later the same crumbs were there. The hotel put top sheets on the matteressand tucked them under (now this I have not seen done in many,many years) so that after you layed down and got "comfortable" the bottom sheet was pulled up from the mattrress --thus affording you a view of a mattress that would look more appropriate on your front lawn on trash day than in a hotel...picture...old floral patterned...etc. The bathroom was so small and the elongated toilet jutted into the "room"so much that you had only a small square space on which to stand to towel off or dress...there were literally about 3 feet between the door and the toilet. The interior of the bathroom door was battered and rusted...there was a huge rust stain on the wall in the bathroom...the toiletries were made by Sysco. Our first night we arrived tired, hungry and late....too tired to go out for food....I ordered room service. I did not however order the hair sitting on the rim of my plate...No dinner for me that night. They have a shuttle to Disney which I thought would be great...however there was only one departure at 9am. When inquired about return times they told me that had one return at 5pm--later another parent told me that had been informed the return shuttle was at 9pm...no matter...I did not want to wake my son early every morning nor did I want to have to come back at 9, especially because the Magic Kingdom was open later than that...so I ended up paying for parking all four days at the parks. The furniture is worn. The room did not have wireless internet (what kind of place does not---I passed cheaped dives on 192 every night that advertised wireless. If you want a happy, clean, enjoyable stay in Orlando there is not shortage of hotels to choose from ....do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Awful stay”
Reviews.Author: runningdiva31
Reviews.Content: Your front desk staff was exceptionally nice, BUT the (mildew) smelling halls left me discouraged even to walk into my room. Room had a funny smell to it, then in the bathroom a constant and ANNOYING drip from the shower head. How can a constant drip not be addressed by your cleaning staff, a blind and deaf person could of seen this. VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!! 11%, resort fee, really for what?!??!?

Reviews.Title: “What the ?!?!?”
Reviews.Author: mscc40
Reviews.Content: Okay . where do I start. The front lobby, grounds, and shops are appealing;however, as we took the dreaded walk through the long dirty mildy smelling hallway to go to our room, it reminded me as a roachtel 6. We are here right now. We are staying two days until we cruise on Thursday. OMG! I rented 3 rooms on Priveline. One of the rooms had to be changed twice. 3311 and 3315 smell like mold , mildew and roach spray covered up by bleach. Do not stay here!!! Have you ever been somewher where it feeeeels dirty. OMG! I am too disappointed. They ought to be ashamed. They have put all of this money on the grounds and have totally disregarded the rooms. Help!! Maybe we can camp out in the lobby. And the 12.43 per night charge is ridiculous. Stay away please- they are so wrong for this!

Reviews.Title: “are you serious?”
Reviews.Author: poppingupdaisies
Reviews.Content: By far one of the worst resorts I have stayed at in the Disney area. Bid using priceline, was known as a 3.5 out of 5 star resort with 90% approval. Let me list the issues cleanliness: on our second night, the towels in the shower were found to have not one but several black hairs in the towels. The towels were rolled up, and you could see the hairs poking out. Our household is made up of redheads and brunettes. The room looked as if it were over 20 years old. Wear and tear was evident throughout. Chips in the furniture, including the mirrors, counter surfaces and tears in the carpet... all were evident. The door to the room should have clued us in since all doors in the hallway were severly damaged. The resort owners should be embarrassed. Service: I have to say that the service we received from the custodial crew was good. WE had a clogged shower and sleep number bed issues. Both were addressed quickly. Location: was good Value: We paid $60 per night, this was with priceline. Upon check in we were told of a $12 usage fee for the resort. I think it is ridiculous that resorts add these on when you are paying already above what they are worth. I was embarrassed to be staying there. Rooms: I think I have addressed this. Sleep Quality: Linens were nice, pillows were of good quality. The issue was with the sleep number. Even after assistance, they did not work, and we were left with very hard beds. I called the front desk manager who refunded us the resort fees.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading photos, please read before booking”
Reviews.Author: mylovingkids
Reviews.Content: I want to begin by saying I am not a person that ussually complaints but I feel as I have been done wrong! We usually visit Orlando frequently and this time decided to check out the Radissont Resort, our idea was to stay all day enjoying the beautiful facilities displayed on the website- WRONG ADVERTISEMENT! the pool with the waterfall and slide is freezing and unless you are a Polar Bear is kind of hard to go in, my kids and I couldnt cause it was too cold. Also they have 1 heated pool which is boring and dirty so do yourselves a favor do not intend to use the pool facilities unless is May to October. Also in the pictures shows a double inflatable donut- well they dont even have them, they have a company that RENTs them for $10 dollars (they dont have a double donut available) and they are small. Other important thing that was my #1 dissapoinment in this hotel was the room I was in for 2 days had very little water pressure coming from the shower head, had to shower from the bottom faucet and by the 2nd day couldnt take it any longer since the shower head had 0 water coming out, they sent someone immediately but couldnt fix it until next day. after they fixed it still there was no water pressure. They comped my breakfast but I didnt feel they did enough, I had no real shower. A horrible experience, I don't feel that giving me FREE breakfast is enough given the fact that mostly all guest have free breakfast with the rates anyways. I don't think they understand how affected we were given the fact that we traveled with little children. The one night we came back from water park they offered to open the room in front of ours to shower but it was 9:00 pm and thatt was not easy. Also please I hope they change the carpets in the elevators, I stayed in building 4 and the feel of the elevator was worst than a motel, it made me disgusting for our room carpet so it made me uncomfortable through my stay. The elevator carpet is embarrasing and it gives guest the impression that they are in a motel rather than a hotel. Oh I hate to complaint but also our AC broke the 1st day our trip but by the time we got back from the park they had already fixed it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Wallstreethyena
Reviews.Content: Wow... I really enjoyed my stay at the radisson celebration resort great beds, hot tub was amazing and the pool is great! But over all my favorite thing was the location, is nearby everything and they offer shuttle services everyday around 9:00am Only thing I did not like was the price of food for room service, 27 buck per person for breakfast seems a lol bit much

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Enjoyable Stay....”
Reviews.Author: dilello
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days ath this hotel, the staff were wonderful, we loved the pools...the room was beautiful ...housekeeping was great to us ...highly recommend the Mandolin Restaurant had breakfast there 4 mornings, and plenty neaby if you want to leave the hotel...will go back again for sure.....

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel - Not Perfect - Good Value - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rcneal
Reviews.Content: **There is a $12 per day RESORT fee that you MUST pay no matter how you book the room or pay for the room!!!!! Stayed with my family when we went to Disney. Cleanliness - Surface clean but definitely could use a DEEP cleaning - Beds, bathroom, furniture was all ok - not a NASTY roach motel but not a 4 star either - if fine details of cleanliness bother you then DO NOT stay here (for instance the fire sprinkler in the room had not been cleaned in several months and was coated with dust/cob webs and the wall paper in the hallways was peeling in spots). The grounds - the grounds were well kept and very pretty - the pool looked very nice and there was a play ground and tennis court/basketball court. Transportation - the free shuttle to disney was nice, very crowded but FREE and dropped you right at the front gate...the schedule for the bus was confusing though and we missed the last one out of disney - SO PAY CLOSE ATTENTION to the schedule, it is written in a confusing manner. Staff - the staff were ok, they seemed friendly but definitely not overly friendly - they seemed very busy. They did allow us to check in early and that was nice. Overall, I would stay again but only because the room was cheap and close to Disney with free transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Bleck! Dirty Hotel, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: Iliketotravel018
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very dirty. In need of a serious cleaning and make over. Pools were dirty and not cleaned daily. The daily events for kids they advertise are a joke. One of the staff memebers who hosted the daily event didn't even know how to play bingo and had to ask the kids how to play! If you just want to sleep somewhere and be gone all day, you'll be ok. Just don't expect an upscale hotel. Very surprised this is rated a 3 1/2 - 4 start hotel. We'd give it a 2. On the plus side: The staff was very nice. I took photos of the dirty bed skirt (and it was filthy with stains) and showed the manager . . . he gave us a refund for a portion of our stay. Both of my parents had food poisoning from the deli at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay outide of Disney”
Reviews.Author: mulley0464
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay. Nice big clean rooms. Nice size bathrooms. Pleanty of free parking, quick bit to eat (oizza, burgers and ice cream) great bufffet everyday. 2 Pools. One is fabulous and has a great chillness, refreshing to every dip. Other is warmer to the liking !. Kiddie pool and 2 jacuzzies. There is outsideping pong, huge chess and checkers game and an fun game room. The gounds are spectacular and there is always someone or crew that is around for maintence and cleaning up. Housekeeping is quick and delightful. Clean, spotless rooms everyday. If you like a larger scale hotel this would be perfect for you and your family ! I can't say enough great things about this hotel. although there is a !12 resort fee for what I don't know, but pay it.. its well worth it. Booked my room through JetBlue $75 /night I would have paid alot more for this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go”
Reviews.Author: tsf1014
Reviews.Content: I stayed March 24-March 28, 2011. I planned and attended my son's wedding here. The list of what went wrong goes on and on. First....the resort needs a good cleaning. The ponds are scum and trash filed. The pools are filthy and need some serious tending. The maid service was extremely poor. Day 1 left us with no shampoo/conditioners. Day 2 was ok. Day 3, she forgot to leave clean glasses. Day 4 had no towels (we used the handtowels). The resort charges you a hold on your account for an extra $80.00 for incidentals. They forget to tell you this. At the wedding....flowers were stolen immediately following the ceremony. The plated dinner arrived (was good) but had no tea, coffee. Guests were served water. The catering/wedding planner never attended the reception as promised to announce/coordinate the cake cutting, champaign toast, 1st dance. I, as the mother of the groom, was left to run around like a wild woman trying to coordinate. I realized later that there was a 2nd wedding going on so I think the coordinator was busy with them. My wedding (the smaller one) got put to the side. As I am writing this, the resort manager has phoned me (Jeff) to discuss my complaints. He stated all resorts charge extra for incidentals. (I have never had this happen before). And for all my complaints he has refunded one of my nights stay. I still will never stay at this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “late check in”
Reviews.Author: ColBuckshot
Reviews.Content: Hotel was good enough, they did add $12 extra as a resort fee when we checked in. The check in was the problem, no one got in until 4:00 and not a minute sooner.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful.”
Reviews.Author: ahqiu
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights in Radission hotel. Only the first night I don't have to call the guest service. There is always missing items every day. Either missing face towels, hair towels, ice bags, tiolet paper, coffee cups, glasses, etc. The carpet is dirty and not cleaned two days in the roll. There is one time they even gave us the dirty un-washed glasses. On the 5th night that we stayed, my stuff in my bags are trashed and emptyed out when I came back at night time. There are food, unopened pastries, candy, coffee and hot chocolates package in the bag. There are stuff I don't even remeber that are in the bags. The housekeeping advised the bag was next to the trash can, which is not. I put the bag against the wall next to my luggage, and its not even close to the trash can. The mandatory resort fee is even worse. They claimed this is for the use of the service in the resort which I never use or don't have time to use. They even claimed the parking and fridge is within the resort fee. I wondered which hotels charge extra for parking and fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Place Ever”
Reviews.Author: Jmtm1122
Reviews.Content: I checked in on March 15 at 10:30 pm and we went straight to bed because we were so tired. Thought the hotel was ok by what we could see. The next morning I woke up having a hard problem breathing, my eyes were swollen, and I could not stop sneezing. When going to take a shower I realized black mold everywhere. I contacted front desk and asked to speak to manager and they told me they were unavailable. I left message and have yet received call. I had to go to doctor and he said I had severe reaction to mold. I knew I was highly allergic to mold and carry an epipen for mold reactions. This is the first time I have had it and my family vacation has been ruined because of it. Will try to contact manager again in the morning but also will be contacting attorney. I have never in my life seen something as disgusting as what is growing in the bathrooms of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “i would stay again, and again...nothing wrong with this place.”
Reviews.Author: JPearl44
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in about 12-15 different hotels a year over the last 3 years with my daughter. Priceline is the only way I can afford the numerous trips every year to see her. After my bid was confrmed and I read the reviews I was terrified to say the least. I thought about just getting another hotel and taking the hit financially. I decided to call the hotel and speak with the manager on duty about my concerns. Sherri took the call and within 5 minutes my fears were put to rest. When I arrived Sherri was actually the one who checked me in and once again reassured me that my daughter and I would be satisfied. Sherri was right, my daughter and I had a wonderful time in a comfortable and clean room over the course of 5 days. Yes the hotel has some cosmetic imperfections and it has been there for many years but I did not see or experience anything I read in the horrible reviews. Room service was prompt, pools were great, breakfast buffet was a steal seeing as kids eat free, shuttle was on time, the "diner" in the lobby was great, and it was quiet and safe at night. During my stay I noticed the GM and his team walking the property numerous times obviously inspecting things. On my final day I was at the pool and Jeff Swirsky the rooms manager was walking by and I stopped him to let him know about my experience at the hotel.
