We had a wonderful conversation and I could tell that he truly cares about the guest experience which shows in how I was treated by all staff that I encountered. If you are nervous....don't be. You and your family are in good hands at this place. I look forward to staying there again when my daughter and I go back to Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Very COLD pool!”
Reviews.Author: RaeK1218
Reviews.Content: If your planning to come because of the fancy waterfall pool and waterslide...think again! The pool is NOT HEATED- EVER!!! And when I asked why the pool is so cold, I was told by the pool faculty, that "they do not heat the pool because it is too expensive to heat" and then I was told about the smaller pool, that is heated. My children enjoyed this pool, since it was warmer, but thought it was a saltwater pool since it was very salty...blaah! Very disappointed we couldn't enjoy the pool we expected to enjoy. Wish they had noted that the large pool in their photos, was an UNHEATED and very cold pool, before luring people in to staying there. So, my question is...what is the resort fees for? Shouldn't you invest some of it into turning the heat on? Would the management swim in that pool? Or the other "saltwater" tasting pool? Never again! What a waste of my hard earned money.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN ROOMS, FRIENDLY HELPFUL STAFF, GREAT HOTEL FOR THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: LisaM26
Reviews.Content: I am from Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, Canada, and recently went to Orlando with my sister. She pricelined our room at the Radisson and got it for 40 dollars a night (plus the resort fee so about 60 a night with taxes) and we were there for 6 days. The staff were very friendly and helpful, didn't encounter one rude person working there during my stay. We were in the 6000 building, the room was a little musty smelling, but it was very clean and our room was cleaned nicely everyday. I'd read some of the negative reviews and was a little worried but when I got there was pleasantly surprised, the pools are nice and the hot tubs were great. There were no bugs of any sort in our room! I think this is a great hotel, the sleep number beds were amazing! We also met a lady there who told us she had been in a room that was not to her satisfaction and told the front desk so they moved her to a better room right away. They guarantee you will enjoy your stay or you contact them to fix whatever it is you are not happy with and if they can't fix it you don't pay.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, avg hotel”
Reviews.Author: Raquel3183
Reviews.Content: Let me just say-the grounds are absolutely beautiful. Breakfast buffet with our rate-fantastic. The Deli in the lobby was great and included pizza hut.However, we were on the ground floor and it was probably the loudest hotel I've ever stayed in. People slamming doors, housekeeping starting early, etc. Non-smoking room, but could smell cigarrette smoke from other areas of hotel. The bathrooms in the king standard room are tiny and the shower had horrible pressure. One side of the bed, the electrical outlets didn't work, and that was the side of the "sleep number" control, so we were unable to try that out. I can't get over the fact of how loud our floor was. It was nice that they provided shuttles to the parks. OK hotel-rooms need updating and it would be a great hotel. At this time, would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, but too pricey for what it is”
Reviews.Author: phowebemish
Reviews.Content: if you are travelling with no children fine. we booked 2 weeks in a 4 star hotel. on arrival it was brilliant! pool views, all the family in rooms next to each other. we had young children with us and was upset when "security" were called to tell us we had to keep to them quiet at 9am!! its advertised as a family hotel, come on people expect to hear excited children!! we didnt complain when there were teenagers running around shouting and carrying on in the pool at 11pm with it being spring break!! overall though a really nice hotel, not worth the 4 stars though. and $30 for a childs breakfast?? get real!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed on many levels”
Reviews.Author: divot316
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms for 2 nights while traveling with family before a cruise. Since we were arriving late and had plans the following day, all I wanted was a clean hotel in a convenient location. I booked through Hotwire which listed this hotel as 4 star. It is a 2-3 at best. I don't want to sound like a snob but the clientele at this hotel reminded me of a Wal Mart. Not what you would expect at a 4-star hotel. In fact, one night we went to the pool and met several other guests who were not staying at the hotel, They were there with coolers packed with beer using the hotel pool. On a positive note, the hotel is very close to I-4 and all area attractions, restraints and other entertainment. The rooms were relatively clean but were a bit worn. Now the negatives. -The hotel charges a $12.50 per room, per night "resort fee" This is to cover internet access, transportation between parks and what they claim are "many daily activities." What they don't tell you is the internet is very slow, transportation is exceptionally limited and there was no mention or postings outlining the "many daily activities.' This hotel was full and at 718 rooms, Radisson collected just under $9,000 per night for these services. -We had requested one room to be a king but was denied as the hotel was full. -We got our kids settled in their rooms and headed to the next room where we could not gain access. Long story short, the lock was broken, we had to wait over an hour (after midnight) to get into our room. The front desk staff did not want to be bothered with this issue but the security guard dispatched to help us did everything possible to get maintenance. -I was assured this issue would be corrected first thing in the morning. I even called the front desk at 9:00 am to confirm maintenance would fix the door. When we arrived after dinner, the door was still not fixed. I did not bother calling the front desk again. The next guest will certainly have to deal with this issue. -The common areas of the hotel smell of cigarette smoke as people congregate at the side entrances smoking with the doors propped open. There are far too many quality hotels in the Orlando area to have to settle with a sub-par resort. Therefore, I would not recommend this property to the Trip Advisor community.

Reviews.Title: “Listen to the other negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: grjtoo1972
Reviews.Content: Old, run down hotel. I'm sure in the 80's this was a nice hotel. Since that was 30 years ago, this hotel is in desperate need for a hardcore renovation or a demolition for a do over. We got this hotel through priceline. That's a whole different can of worms. Priceline's bait and switch had us stranded here. This is not a 3 1/2 star hotel. A 2 star would be generous. We just used this place as a place to sleep, so the $14 a day "resort" fee was ludicrous. Look elsewhere for a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dholton1
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review on a resort before but if I can keep anyone from making the same mistake I did by purchasing nights here something good will come out of this. We checked in and I just wanted to turn around and go home. It smells so bad. All the way through the halls and the room. The smell doesn't go away. We got in our car to get something to eat and we all smelled like the room. The paint and wall paper are coming off the wall. The carpet has stains and is filthy. I have never been so unhappy with a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Phew, what a relief!”
Reviews.Author: jayner15
Reviews.Content: I received a room at Raddison through Priceline. I read the reviews on Trip Advisor afterwards and was frightened because they were so negative. However, to my great relief, we had a very positive experience at the Radisson. The room we were in appeared to be recently renovated, fresh paint & carpet. The bathrooms had tile floors & granite countertops. The linens were fabulous and bed & pillows were comfortable. Yes, the hallways & elevators were a bit dingy & worn, but I didn't stay in them long! Although we did not use the pool area, it appeared that many families were having a great time there. The grounds were quite pretty. There were several restuarants right across the street, as well as a small grocery store. Accessibility to Disney World was great. Parking was free. Only surprise was that the restaurant was not open for dinner. We did have to pay $12.50 for resort fee. We did not use the shuttle service or internet. I'd stay again...we paid $65 for a room close to Disney. Not bad in my book!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Staying Here”
Reviews.Author: Lindy34
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a weeks stay at this hotel and we could not have been happier. The staff went out of their way to help us and were very friendly. Our room was clean and the beds were very comfortable. The location was very convenient to shops, theme parks and there is every type of restauarant nearby. The pool area was very nice. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it if you can - too many other places to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jkdal75
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two evenings at a very good rate. Realized why shortly after I arrived. The property is much in need of real renovation, multiple coats of paint start to look worse than a remodel after so many. The decor is stuck in the 80's. Most of the entrances smell badly of ashtray's that are placed right by the entrances for smokers. The elevator is falling apart and has messages scrapped into the doors like a mall restroom stall and many are missing numbers of the floors. Old 25inch TVs that don't tune in well, Old noisy AC Units and sheets and bedding that don't quite fit the size of beds they were intended to ! The water pressure in the bathroom showers in poor and my shower had a lot of visible lime and calcium stains/deposits. The lobby area is deceiving because it looks like it has had some effort put into it. Best thing going for this property is its pool area with waterfall and slides and plenty of seating. However, if it were my money again, Id stay elsewhere - There are too many good properties at similar or close enough rates that have more attention paid t them and you don't feel like you need to shower after spending anytime in the room or property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: djvyrus69
Reviews.Content: Like all Radisson resorts throughout the country, one thing you can always expect is the wonderful sleep number beds. From my travels, this chain is the only one with these beds and oooooh are they comfy. Now when it comes to the hotel itself. I went in the early part of November for the Food and Wine festival in Epcot, It was a bit chilly so we were unable to enjoy the pool and onsite facilities, but the first thing that struck me was that they gave you an actual itinerary of things happenning at the resort throughout the day, and I literally have never seen this before and thought it was pretty cool, and that is why they do charge you that small hotel fee. Most hotels in Orlando charge this now, so for everyone who is writing negative reviews about a hotel fee, guess what, EVERY hotel is doing it. I live in Miami, and I have annual passes to both Disney and Universal, and I can tell you that even the cheapie MOTELS are charging it. Now, I alaways Priceline my hotel stays in Orlando, so for me to be paying $41 a night, when the regular rate is normally $100 and a $10 resort fee, I'll take that anyday versus having to find what a hotel is at $41 a night, I'm looking at you Days Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off and run down”
Reviews.Author: MamaJojo123
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel on Priceline and thought that the price was ok - not great. What a rude surprise when we had to pay the additional resort fee of $12.73 for the night! We didn't use anything they had to offer for this extra fee, and had no idea the fee was coming, so we felt cheated. The rooms were ok enough, but more like a Motel 8 rather than a Radisson "Resort". Everything was run down and shabby looking, scuffed up doors, walls, elevators, torn carpeting in the room. Beds looked clean enough, but the floors were dirty looking. When we arrived there was a police car in the front - not sure what was going on, but the police officer was talking to 2 young men in front. Not a good impression at all. Don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: dperuski
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline.com and thought the price was all inclusive. It is not. The rooms are okay hotel rooms but there are better places to stay with better quality and at a cheaper price than at this Radisson. Additionally, even though I booked through priceline.com I was stuck with a $12.43/day resort fee charge that I had to pay in addition to my room. So in the end this was a high price hotel with low to moderate standards and definitely was not worth the price paid. Heed all of the other entries on this site. They are accurate. Stay elsewhere if at all possible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surpise”
Reviews.Author: mauriciopichardo
Reviews.Content: Low price, very clean and nice rooms. Didn't spend that much time at the resort but it was really nice. The even returned a pair of jeans my girlfriend left behind.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: rad1269
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff are very friendly, rooms have great beds. Sports bar on the property, Good prices on all food and drinks. Would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing like it appears online”
Reviews.Author: nik1108
Reviews.Content: We booked this room for Walt Disney world, we figured we were getting a deal by staying off the actual resort, and they offered shuttles to the ticketing and transportation center so we were expecting a nice place. The lobby and pool are the only nice things about the hotel, the rooms are small and smell like mold. As soon as we got to the room we wanted to leave and get another room but there were too many complications. Its not in a very nice part of town either. Through all this, I would have to say that the biggest dissapointment would be the fact that they literally only have the shuttles run 4 times a day to the parks. With big gaps in between times, so if you miss it or the bus is full(which tends to happen, with 5 or 6 too many families) you're pretty much out of luck unless you get a taxi or have your own car. Neither of us make a whole lot of money, but we both feel like we make too much money to stay at a place like this. I would have rathered stayed at a motel 8 closer to the parks. Oh, and not to mention the shuttle stops at another hotel down the street where they also pack about 12 families on the bus that is already overfilled. Please try to stay somewhere else when booking a room for your vacation! I wish we would have read reviews before making our decision.

Reviews.Title: “They treat you like Royalty!”
Reviews.Author: VidalKeywest
Reviews.Content: This resort by far is the BEST! not only for price but for quality....the staff is ALL incredible and nice! You feel like you are checking into your home away from home....anything you need can be found on the property...the pool area is terrific and the gym is basic and good! I have done numerous photo shoots on the property being a Photographer/Model! I find the everyone from the front desk to housekeeping is knowledgeable and helpful! If anything at all goes wrong, because it is ;Life on ,life's terms "engineering" will handle it and promptly....I have stayed there over 15 times and will continue to do so....from the coffee in the lobby to the complimentary computer room....oh did I mention how fabulous the food from room service is? Vidal Keywest P.S. I also get massages on property...this is a one-stop resort!!!!!! No kidding

Reviews.Title: “Not nearly as nice as the website makes it look”
Reviews.Author: SunshineSeeker71
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is the pool area. They have 2 pools, one small heated one and one large cold one. They also have 2 decent size hot tubs, one very nice with a waterfall. On Saturday night, there was a movie by the heated pool which really was relaxing. Thank you Maryanne (staff by the pool) for telling us about it and directing us to the area. I don't usally ask staff their names, but she really went out of her way to be nice and to make sure everyone was having a great time. She was excellent with the kids too. Finding our room was an absolute nightmare. It took us 30 minutes to find our room. There are multiple buildings, and it's very confusing. Also the lady wrote down room 443 on our card, and there is no room 443. Our room was actualliy 4413. Called and complained, and they appologized but did not offer us anything for our inconvience. Most hotels will offer a free breakfast or will waive their resort fee if something like this happens. We did not run into even one single staff member who could help us find our room, even though it was only about 5pm. The rooms were small, but the sleep number bed was nice. The rooms are very outdated and old carpet. There were about 500 college kids who had booked rooms. They were running around, smoking in the hallways, and blocking the doorways. The hotel didn't do anything to stop them and they were running around late into the night. The is also a 12.95 per night resort fee. I despise resort fees. Why not just put the resort fee into the price of the hotel, then you know exaclty what you are paying for a room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: staugustinefl
Reviews.Content: Paid $69 plus $12.50 resort fee. Out the door taxes etc... paid $90. Our room in the 6000 bldg. Smelled like mildew. Once you get past the smell the was simply average. The lobby area was nice and appeared updated. The pool with the waterfall and slide was FREEZING. Not a soul was in it. They do have a heated pool which had a very comfortable temp. There are many things to do around the heated pool. Foosball, table tennis, chess etc... they also have a nice arcade. Check out is at 11am but you can be extended till 1pm for no additional fee.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: clinebrats
Reviews.Content: I realized over this past weekend why I do not stay at the Radisson Hotels. On an average, my family and I stay 3-4 nights a month and sometimes more in a variety of Hotels / Resorts in the Orlando area. I understand the age of some hotels especially in the Orlando / Disney area are a factor; however the lack of maintenance, cleanliness and degradation is unacceptable. When first arriving to the hotel my first impression was pleasant. The lobby was updated and modern with a contemporary feel. Unfortunately the same did not continue throughout the rest of the hotel. The carpets were disgusting; the walls in the hallways reminded me of section 8 housing. When entering our room the same continued within. I discussed my concern with the front desk and was moved to another room. The new room was a small step up from the original and unfortunately I did not have the time to deal with it. There are so many other hotels / resorts to choose from and I recommend you choose another one. From my experience, I have found allot more for the money in the Orlando area. Don’t waist yours!

Reviews.Title: “A bit overpriced for the area”
Reviews.Author: jonkar154
Reviews.Content: I booked this 2 night stay through Priceline for a fair rate. Upon arrival, we were advised it is an additional $12+ per night for a "Resort Fee". The list of benefits of the "Resort Fee" had nothing of which we were going to partake of (other then parking); no matter, every room is assesed this fee. It would be much easier to just adjust the room rate to include the fee, even my initial receipt from Priceline indicated inclusive of taxes and fees. There are other Radisson properties close by to Disney that are cleaner, and just as well located that do not add the "Resort Fees" Be sure to ask before you book. The room we had was ok, but not in comparison to the photos on the website. It showed age, and had minimal ammenities. Facilty was fairly clean and the lobby had a nice appearance. Suggest you think twice. . . .

Reviews.Title: “Stayed four years in a row and loved it”
Reviews.Author: jraedy
Reviews.Content: This will be the fifth year there, and our kids absolutely love the place. The big pool is "kid cold", and the other one is usually busy. We have gone easter week the last three times (very busy week everywhere) and have loved this place for the relative location. We can drive to each park faster than any bus, and we stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge one year - this is much faster and easier to get in and out of. Would recommend this place to anyone just for the ability to leave the parks and return to your hotel in 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “A great resort for the small budgeted traveler looking to get the most bang for your buck.”
Reviews.Author: smileddog
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd time staying at this resort. It never let's me down. The price is always great for what you get. I stay here whenever I visit Universal Studios because the hotel provides a shuttle to and from the park. I like the pool area and landscaping here. They have 3 pools. One huge pool with a small water slide and a water fall. 2 smaller pools I would consider kids pools. And 2 hot tubs. One is on the main walkway and another is tucked away in the greenery. The grounds are very well kept here and they always have been even in previous years visits. They have started doing daily activities which was cool. Things from poolside bingo, to table tennis tournaments, and so much more. They give away kids prizes and free drinks to the bar for the adults. There is a big bar outside and a tiki hut by the pool that serves as a towel stand/music stand. The lobby looks really nice. There is plenty of parking and some cool resteraunts in walking distance, as well as a grocery store. Although the prices looked like they were waiting for the tourists. Let's just say I paid $10 for a case of water. I'm use to paying $5 in NY. oh well. There is plenty to do here if you don't plan to swim in the pools. They have plenty of lounge chairs. Some show wear and tear but then again most lounge chairs sitting out In the florida sun do. They have table tennis, fooz ball (sp?), basketball, tennis courts, an arcade with a variety of about 10-15 games, a fitness center, a gift shop, a deli/convenience store, a resteraunt/sports bar. Now for the downsides of the resort. They do add an extra $12.50 per day as a resort fee. This covers the shuttles to Disney, Universal, Seaworld, Ect... It covers the pool side activities, and probably the poolside service for towels and the poolside games like table tennis and fooz ball. It's worth it though. I like to go to one place that will keep us entertained without dropping a ton of cash. You can't get a taxi to and from a park and they can shuttle you and do all the other stuff for $12.50. People have mentioned the wear and tear. I do see this as well. For example the elevators look like Someone took a key and scratched the stainless steel doors. Some of the wooden decor on the walls of the elavators are chipped. Some dings and dents in the walls where a door might have opened and hit the wall or a suitcase has scratched it here and there. The tile in the bathroom shows some age and coloring. The decor in the rooms feel very 90's. But it's nice and clean. Ya it's not a flat screen tv, but instead you get a sleep number bed. I'm actually laying in it right now as I type this and I must say it's like laying in a cloud. So your not getting the ritz or Hilton for the price of a super 8 here. But I think you are paying for a 3 star hotel/resort and that's exactly what your getting. The staff has always been friendly. They don't seem to go out or their way for you, but they also have never been rude to us either. I'm sure as time goes on things will keep improving here and I will keep coming back. But if your like me and want to get the most of your $. Then give this resort a try. Your kids will enjoy it no doubt. You will save a ton of $ that you will have to turn around and spend in a park anyways. And in the end you will have a really nice vacation. Just don't sweat the chip in paint here or th ding in the wall there. It is what it is. It's clean, it's safe, and affordable and so close to everything. Enjoy!!! Now for the downsides of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “O.k. for a night or two”
Reviews.Author: ke1con
Reviews.Content: Radisson is typical big 3* resort. It is convenient and confortable, but do have not a soul. Star-like building is very convenient to move to the business center or parking. Rooms have only acceptable design. They are spacious and rather confortable. We have problem with strange smell in our room during second day. One call and they changed room for us. For budget oriented traveller this hotel is o.k.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Okay, Customer Service and Attitude sorely lacking”
Reviews.Author: mkextra
Reviews.Content: As far as a hotel, this was okay. As far as being called a resort? That was only reflected in the extra resort fee (which offered no more than other hotels in the area within their standard rates) and the pricing in the restaurant and bars. We made reservations 3 weeks prior to our stay for a specific room selection for 2 nights. Called the morning of our arrival to confirm that we would be arriving late. When we checked in, there were no more rooms of our reserved type available. There was no "sorry" or "let me see what I can work out" but rather a belligerant attitude of "well, you booked that on line through someone other than Radisson" and we don't guarantee your room request. When asked for a lower price to accompany the lesser room all we got was "'your room was pre-paid, no refunds". Only after we contacted our travel site about getting a refund and then asked the hotel the question "will our requested room type be available tomorrow night", did they work to "make things right". I don't understand the policy of taking pre-paid, no refunds, and not guaranting you a room. I also don't understand many hotel's negative attitudes toward travel booking sites. They may get a slightly lower rate but they get more of their rooms filled. Wonder if there are any survey stats on what percentage of a hotel's rooms are filled via travel booking sites? Better deals can be found elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not all it was touted to be..”
Reviews.Author: Pugs4ever
Reviews.Content: On a good note- the bed was comfortable. We had the sleep number and it was fine. The bedding was also nice, it was down comforter and pillows, decent thread count on both. The grounds were also nice, they have 3 pools and two jacuzzi's. Grab a towel early as they are often unavailable in the evening. The room itself was .. "tired" in both decor and wear. Unless it is part of your package DO NOT eat at the breakfast buffet. I have had better continental breakfast at other hotels for free and cost us over $35.00/2 people. The 50's dinner has sutiable breakfast food. We had a decent dinner in the sports bar one night. Beware of the trams to the various parks- they are very limited ( one a day to and from universal) and they stop at various hotels- we were third stop, so standing room only on bus most of time( and this was off season). Cab ride is approx $20 to Disney ( we took the city bus home one day a bit of a walk from the stop but ok)and $35 to Universal. This hotel was $140/night rate- we did get a discount, but still- it wasn't what we expected. Oh becareful of the guy/gal in the lobby they are selling time shares and can be a bit aggressive.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out Hidden Resort Fee Charges”
Reviews.Author: SarasotaSlim
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very average, check in was easy, staff very nice, beautiful pool. I was very angry about the fact that undisclosed to me was an addition $15.00 a day resort fee added to my room. I could have stayed in a nicer hotel in a better location with that money. It is for the games and activities they play around the pool during the day they said, and the "free" transportation to Disney that all other hotels in the area have for free (really free) as well. I am here for the mouse not to dive for a spoon in the pool or play bingo. Beware of the hidden undisclosed fees to make more money off the unsuspecting tourists. We were also promised sleep number beds but did not have them. Better yet, stay at a more honest hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible. Don't risk staying at this...”
Reviews.Author: Mappie
Reviews.Content: Horrible. Don't risk staying at this resort regardless of the rate you get. We got a rate of $64 per night. For that price we weren't expecting much aside from a clean, comfortable place to sleep. The room decor has not been updated since the 70's. The furniture, carpet, curtains, etc are dirty from age. The first morning we woke up there was a huge bug crawling across our floor. We flushed that one. Five minutes later another one fell to the floor from our hand towel. We called the front desk to be moved. The customer service agent & bellboy who came to help move us were friendly & efficient. Before they would do anything for us though, a security guard showed up wanting me to write an incident report. We were packing up to move and late leaving by this point for disney so I asked if he could write it. It had to be in our handwriting. Not a very customer friendly policy. They moved us to a room that was just as dated and smelled even more musty than the first room. Plus, the in-room safe did not work & they couldn't repair it. We had to bring our valuables to the front desk to be locked away. Which they later could not unlock - delaying us another 15 minutes later in the day. Also, the roll away cot they sent to us had springs sticking out of it everywhere. For all of this inconvenience, wasted time & sleepless nights in dirty, stinky, bug-infested rooms, they generously did not charge us for the roll away cot. One of the worse hotels I've ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that!”
Reviews.Author: anmol0458
Reviews.Content: Had 2 rooms next to each other, was traveling with 3 kids, the rooms smelled really bad, the AC was noisy. The decor was really boring and old, the TV's were really old as well. A resort fee of $11,00 per room per night plus 13% taxes were a real dissapointment, paid $48.00 per room on top of the room price of about $65.00. The pools were not clean. The staff was friendly. The remote in the kids bedroom was not working i called the front desk and they said someone would come the next day, we stayed 4 nights but the remote was nto fixed and no one followed up. There were several better deals and i picked the wrong one, thanks to prceline.com would not recommed unless you can get for less than $50.00 and no additional fees. the plus was it was close to some fast food places and walgreens.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Quality-Rooms - Staff - Grounds - Breakfast- Pools”
Reviews.Author: Trixylee53
Reviews.Content: Came over from Daytona to get away, was totally impressed by everything from the lobby to the staff, the room was spectacular, a sleep number bed and huge garden tub. Very nice. Just minutes away from everything, Disney, City Walk. Tons of resturants.

Reviews.Title: “4 stays and happy”
Reviews.Author: maxi_p
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Radisson Celebration for the 4th time recenty. We stayed for 8 nights and were happy with all. We paid in advance with no resort fee payable. It was the 1st time we didn't use the pool etc but used the diner and it was fine. Only problem was that the lifts were old and slow. Room was fine but no wireless, but there was a ethernet cable in the room for our mac to connect to which was fine and we used our iphone's in the lobby etc. Location is perfect for parks and restaurants and the price we paid we feel we got great value. Overall happy with 2 little problems that could happen in any hotel. We played golf almost every day and there was a course just a mile away. If i went with just my mate i'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...20 years ago.”
Reviews.Author: GeniusJoe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is reviewed frequently on this site. I read the reviews and was not sure what to expect. The reviews seem to be at extremes of people that liked it or hated it. I found this resort hotel to be extremely average. I paid a group rate of $59/night. They add a resort fee of $12/night to that rate. The hotel would have been better priced in the $40-$50 range. Check in was quick at the desk. Then to get the parking card for the dashboard they sent me to the concierge desk. I was given a quick time share offer for a future visit. It wasn't pushy but I still felt it to be inappropriate after my journey. I had a broken hand and it would have been nice had anyone offered to help me out. The facilities were generally clean. The carpets were a little worn. They do a good surface cleaning but the place could use a thorough going over. Only one elevator worked. No sign or notice. Just one elevator. I was on the second floor so I stuck to the steps. The pools and hot-tubs looked clean. The bars were resort priced. Two virgin daqueries $15. The room was small and not well appointed. The bathroom was very small. The fan went on with the light and was noisey which was inconvenient. Overall this is a good place on a budget. Fight for a rate under $50. And remember the resort fee !

Reviews.Title: “A solid 3-star resort.”
Reviews.Author: vtmathteacher
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel exactly as advertised. Let me start with the "resort fee" that has been much discussed on this site. I have stayed in a Radisson and a Radisson resort; you get your $12.43/day out of the resort fee: 4 pools, tennis, basketball, life-sized chess and checkers, fooz-ball, and on and on. However, if you are just needing a hotel for a bed (i.e. checking in at midnight, out at 6am), then the Motel 6 (which quite excellent too!) would be your choice. Since I had read several negative reviews prior to checking in, I tried to find things wrong with this hotel; I haven't found any. I had a minor issue with my room (the safe did not work) and was immediately offered to either change rooms or use the front-desk safe--I consider that resolved. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I Love this place and can't wait to return !”
Reviews.Author: bkvanness
Reviews.Content: We have been to this resort about 4 times now within the last year and we now find ourselves trying to figure out when we can plan on coming back !! The staff was friendly, the managers attentive and came by to make sure there were no problems and you were happy with your stay. The resort has beautiful landscaping and relaxing by the fountain is awesome !! We find ourselves not doing any attractions, shopping in Orlando.. just hanging at the resort.. The Tiki bar was a great place to hang and meet new people, or sit and relax as well.. Nothing was better though then watching the ducks, kittens roam around and play. If you stay at a resort that is more than a parking lot with a brick building you are bound to have nature and with that comes the critters and you have to love it.. or you should stay at a resort with a concrete parking lot !! Thank you Amy(tiki bar), Stephanie(activities), Michele(inside bar), Steve and Magic man(managers),housekeepers, and Myrna(reservations) for a wonderful relaxing stay at you're resort !! See you a.s.a.p !!

Reviews.Title: “unreasonable additional charge”
Reviews.Author: anthony00
Reviews.Content: when i booked the hotel , the hotel representative said it is Free parking and free internet , I made bouble check when I check in , but when I checked out they told me about I have to pay for my internet fee , parking fee also they charge me the shuttle fee which I never took their shuttle to the desney!!!! and they told me I have to pay for the refrigerator in my room which I never open it!!!!!!!!!! they charged me additional $250 for 8 night!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: appletree4
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the hotel's website make it look a lot nicer that it actually is. The sleep number beds that were advertised were not comfortable at all and the sheets didn't stay on because they were too small. The size of our room was quite small for three adults. The cleanliness of the hallways and rooms were not up to our standards. We were told we'd have to use our key card to get into the rear entrance of the hotel each night, but the doors were never locked which didn't make us feel real safe. The location of the hotel was very good; near restaurants, shopping and the parks. Overall, for what we paid, it wasn't a bad value. We were just expecting what they were advertising.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Packerbully
Reviews.Content: A great location, nice from the outside, our room was fine. Hallway and lifts need a tidy up. Shuttle buses worked well and there is the little town of celebration 2 minutes away which has a great cheap diner for breakfast. Went there most days. Five minutes down the road is TGI Fridays. Staff were friendly I reported a broken safe when I arrived - 2 weeks later it was still broken! Room cleaning was good. Never ate in hotel Pool was nice, no problems there. Would not stay at hotel again. Want a 4 star next time that is a 4 star. Free wi-fi in room.

Reviews.Title: “Child was attacked by deranaged woman in pool, hotel turns the other way”
Reviews.Author: rrkky
Reviews.Content: A woman, who was obviously impared was in the hotel pool, she groped several children, the hotel staff was notified, and the staff tried to gently coax this woman out of the pool for 45 minutes, the staff was laughing and joking about the situation. My 13 year old daughter was trying to exit the pool when this woman grabbed her breast, her face, and slammed her underwater attempting to drown her. Finally hotel guest grabbed the woman and carried her out of the pool and restrained her until an ambulance arrived. The hotel staff was willing ZERO responsibility for what happened to my daughter. They are willing to pay to co-pay on our medical insurance for her treatment and nothing more. The local police would not take a report unless we are willing to fly back to Orlando to prosecute. This hotel which caters to families had NO IDEA how to handle the situation and therfore put my daughter at risk. They did not even offer so much as a free nights stay for the headache. At this point my daughter is having nightmares about the attack, has a sore neck, and the damn hotel won't even return my phone calls. I would not let my dog stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for visiting Disney”
Reviews.Author: cherryb73
Reviews.Content: Really friendly staff on arrival, nothing was too much trouble. Room was clean but there were bits and pieces that needed redecorating. Maid service was brilliant, couldn't complain even on days when we slept in the maid ensured the room was tidied before we arrived back late at night. Food in hotel was good but expensive but with a fridge in the room you could stock up at the local Walmarts. Felt very safe at night with security entry and often families arriving back from the parks met around the pools for the kids to have a late night swim, very sociable and nice way to end an evening. Pool area needed some tiding up with new slabe veing laid etc but landscaping was brilliant. Would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms, good value”
Reviews.Author: katiecakes20
Reviews.Content: The best bit of this hotel was its location - we were very close to all the major theme parks and there was a complimentary shuttle run by the hotel (first-come, first-served basis, but this was never a problem) to and from the parks - once a day for Universal, SeaWorld and Downtown Disney and a few to Magic Kingdom Transport Centre. The rooms were a bit dark (but this could have just been ours) but the king bed we had was good and it was SleepNumber so you could adjust the firmness on each side independently. There was plenty of space and they were cleaned daily. Television channels were limited, but there were a few good pay-per-view movies. Room service was very good. The restaurant in the hotel now only serves breakfast, not dinner as advertised, and the breakfasts were extortionately expensive - I would recommend going elsewhere. There seemed to be quite a selection at the deli in the hotel, however, which also serves Pizza Hut and multiple grilled items at lunch. The Gift Shop was good. The receptionists were good, but the staff at the Customer Service desk repeatedly kept trying to get us to timeshare seminars for 'cheaper theme park tickets' - beware of this as frequently these will take a full day out of your holiday. Parking was good and plentiful (and free). Grounds of the hotel were nice and well-maintained.

Reviews.Title: “What are people moaning about?”
Reviews.Author: johan001
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Radisson Celebration in Orlando. Before arriving (but after booking -- of course), I got a bit nervous having read some of the reviews on this site. According to some reviewers this hotel was horrible: old, dirty, worn-down, etcetera etcetera. Having arrived, I could find absolutely no fault with this hotel. It's a modern building, beautifully maintained grounds, a stylish lobby, some nice restaurants with reasonable food, two pools (one of which is really big and has a waterfall), two hot tubs, and a (small) water slide. The room had two double beds, a nice decor, a fridge, and a safe large enough to store your laptop. So is there nothing wrong with this resort hotel? Well, the only thing I could find fault with was some of the hallways. At places there was a bit of wear and tear. But nothing extreme. At some point I began doubting myself if I had looked at the right property when consulting TripAdvisor on this hotel prior to my trip. I really don't know why some people so viciously attack it. Yes, it's not a five-star resort, but it's also far from a ratty hotel. So if you are planning to stay here, I wouldn't be too worried about the negative reviews -- at least, that's my experience.

Reviews.Title: “May want to think twice about staying here........”
Reviews.Author: shortyao1
Reviews.Content: After checking out the photos of the hotel and the amenities it offered I thought this looks like the place to stay. The photos on the sites look great -but in person not so much. I know over time hotels are worn down with all the travelers using things as they see fit--however - this place is simply worn down and seems unclean. I won't go into all the details (room smelled, bathroom dirty, etc.). My son loved the pool area and I would have to say that was the highlight of our entire stay at the Radisson in Celebration. Another thing to be leary of is at the registration desk. Our family has been to Disney before and thought we will just get our tickets at the hotel. Be prepared as the ticket desk does a switch and bait to get you to go on a Holiday Inn timeshare tour for discounted tickets. My husband and I did not realize this until we paid for our "tickets" and then we were told we had to be ready by 7:45 am or 10:45 am and we would be given our discounted tickets at the end of the tour. We asked the lady "what tour?" and were told we had to do the tour to get the "deal". The tour was another story and since this is about the hotel - I will leave that part of our trip out of the review. Our family normally plans our Disney trips in advance-- but this year we went on an impromptu trip and thought this hotel would be just right to save us some money since we were not staying as long as usual. Never again will we stay at this location. Usually we stay at a Disney hotel and this impromptu trip just confirmed that we will do that in the future. Normally our family will give a place a chance but this one did not make the grade. If you go by the pictures --the Radisson looks like a wonderful place to stay. I hate to admit we fell for it--but never again.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here - Thieves About”
Reviews.Author: scarrylarry
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in desperate need of upgrade.... nasty carpet, walls need painting, doors replaced, the musty smell is real, etc. THE SECURITY IS TERRIBLE... and therefore local thugs can hang out here and WE HAD OUR BEACH BAG STOLEN right off of our table in the pool area in the middle of the day. The staff admitted to me that the locals know they can come here and hang out!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ripoff resort fee and spiders.”
Reviews.Author: ler713
Reviews.Content: I arrived late at night and had to wait 20 minutes and eventually call the hotel to have someone come out to the front desk and check me in. Finally, Alex, a very unfriendly guy, came out and checked us in, not smiling once. He asked for a credit card as hotels usually do, I handed it to him thinking that it was just to keep on record for incidentals and he charged a $12.50 resort fee on it without even asking me first! When I told him I pre-paid on priceline and was not told about the resort fee he literally, with a sarcastic smirk, told me "that's not my problem I don't deal with priceline but you have to pay this resort fee." The resort fee is apparently for transportation to the parks and for the pool- NEWSFLASH: every hotel on that particular street has transportation to disney, you wouldn't survive as a resort in Orlando without transportation to disney and you wouldn't be able to call yourself a resort without a pool, so how is a 12.50 resort fee justified?! These amenities should be included in the price of the hotel. Needless to say I felt very ripped off considering I was paying $50 for a night and had to pay a $12.50 resort fee in addition- that's a 25% increase in the price of the hotel! To top it all off the room was just plain filthy. There was hair in the tub, the room smelled musky and I found a HUGE spider making it's web hanging from the ceiling. Don't stay here, believe me I've been to Orlando countless times and there are much better options for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if you book early”
Reviews.Author: GermanTraveller2009
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with friendly service. The desk in my room looked not perfectly clean but the rest of the hotel was well maintained -- a very nice pool. Lots of entertaining activities for families and others like bingo by the pool. I stayed there for a conference and extended for the weekend which was nice. Large refrigerator in the room. Internet via LAN cable, wireless only in the lobby. Good rates if you book early and check their website a couple of times.

Reviews.Title: “Required $12.43 service fee/day”
Reviews.Author: Connie280
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night to catch an early flight out of orlando. Got a great deal through priceline's name your own price. But when we got there, we were shocked that they asked us to pay an extra $12.43 service charge per night, which would include wireless, a refrigerator in the room, shuttle service to the parks, live entertainment (DJ and clowns near the pool), fitness center, parking, and such. We didn't use any of those services, besides the internet to write this review. When we asked if we could opt out of the fee since we did not need any of those services, they said no and that it was a required fee. In my opinion, if its a required fee, it should be included into the price for the room. Plus, all the other hotels in the area have free wireless, shuttles, fitness centers, and parking... Although we still got a pretty good deal, we were surprised when we were asked to fork over money for services that we did not need. The room itself is nothing special. Smaller and less extravagant than what you would find at other hotels in the area. But the lobby and the hotel grounds are pretty nice.

Reviews.Title: “Was nicer than expected.”
Reviews.Author: patty4645
Reviews.Content: After booking I found this site, I read the reviews on this site and was terrified to go to the Radisson. I thought "What have I done"? I had always stayed on Disney property hotels but lately have been very unhappy with the dirty conditions of the Disney rooms and the total lack of Disney to care about real complaints. I read some of the Radisson comments and did what they wrote. I asked for a king bed in the 6000 block near the pool and parking. I was VERY happy with the room. It was located on the 7th floor. The room was spotless, the bed was fantastic and the maid service was excellent. The pool was wonderful for my 9 year old. You may need to rent a car if you stay there and pay the $14.00 per day Disney Parking. ( The hotel shuttle buses are very limited and only return once a day). The Time Share booth employees were sarcastic if you told them you were not interested. But all in all, I was pleased with the Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteTravel11
Reviews.Content: The hotel stay was comfortable. excellent customer service and facilities, it had a shuttle to disney parks

Reviews.Title: “It's never good when you find a snake in your hotel room”
Reviews.Author: rosiesmall
Reviews.Content: The room was very musty and smelled awful. It made me sick to my stomach just being in the room. Then there was the snake in the room - yes, a real snake, slithering across the floor. And the man they sent to get rid of the snake was afraid of snakes himself. What a nightmare. I was surprised that the hotel didn't take anything off the price or give us any concessions for the awful smell and the snake. I'll NEVER go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasmic!”
Reviews.Author: bucksfizzle
Reviews.Content: I am a regular visitor to disney world florida and normally stay within the disney complex itself. This time we decided to try a cheaper alternative. The radisson is FANTASTIC! Good pools, hot tubs and amenities. Has a shuttle bus that runs to disney, seaworld and universal etc which is good but sometimes you have to get several buses just to get to where you want to go. The best part of the radisson is the sleep number beds.... never had such a good nights sleep! All the excursions were excellent and i dont think i need to say anymore about disney world and the other parks. As it was september it was quite as people were back at school but still on the high season opening times which was good. If you dont mind walking there is old town down the road but it is quite out of the way. Best holiday i have ever been on :D

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal Around Disney!”
Reviews.Author: TomOutdoor
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned traveler and have stayed at some of the best hotels in the world. I'm also a smart traveler and know a great deal when I find it. The Celebration Radisson is an excellent bargain if you are shopping for price, luxury, cleanliness, service and close proximity to all the Central Florida Attractions, especially Disney! For over eight years I have been staying at this hotel on business (and pleasure) and have had excellent experiences except on a couple of occasions. Even then, the staff was professional in their effort to correct any and all problems. Most helpful has been Rooms Manager, Jeff Swirsky, who not only tries to correct the problem, but follows up to make sure I have been satisfied. During these eight years, I have stayed at this Radisson well over 100 nights, so I would say I know this operation fairly well! If you are looking for a place to conduct business either poolside, at the unique Tiki Bar or in a conference room, this is your hotel. If you want to bring the family for a week of very inexpensive living, around three pools and a waterfalls, while listening to Reggae music and sipping Pina Colada's, this is your hotel! Or, if it's a romantic getaway with your better-half, book your reservation and then find a cozy spot on a lounge chair tucked among the beautiful gardens on this Resort. If I sound like a "promoter" of this property, that's because I am, (unpaid of course). In my business (advertising) when you find something good, you want to tell the world about it. Well...I'm telling you, this is one darn good resort hotel!

Reviews.Title: “dirty dirty dirty”
Reviews.Author: russ5844
Reviews.Content: when we arrived at our room i was shocked at how dirty the room was, dust cob webs hanging from the ceiling, tub was filthy, i called and told them i would like it cleaned. they were not very friendly, after i called the front desk they put me to housekeeping, i left a message, no one ever called me back so i called the front desk and they would not answer my phone, so we called from our cell phones it took 4 hours to get anything done. the grounds were also very dirty. i would not stay in this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: cookies10016
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay. Jeff the manager took care of us and made sure we had rooms we were happy with. Price to value ratio is fantastic. Grounds are nice and very centrally located to all highways, Theme parks and celebration which offers better dinning then the normal strip mal fast food types.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: gutsysean
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in late december early januray although the weather was cold the hotel was great. We stayed in block 6000 on the top floor with a really good view over kissimmee. We used the hotel as a base because we were going to miami and clearwater and doing the parks. It was in the ideal place as it is just off the I4. The hotel itself was very good the beds were good and the room was tidy, the bathroom was small but how long do you spend in there. The pools were great but it was too cold to use them, but the hot tubs were great. As we did not use the gym or some of the other amenities i could not tell you what they were like, although the gym looked a good size. In the hotel lobby there was free internet and some of the hotel rooms had Wi-Fi. As for returning to Florida i would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ferrari01
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel (4) times a year on business travels for multiple days and the service of the staff and especially the manager, Jeff Swirsky, is fantastic. He really makes me feel at home. The location and amenities are great, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “We called this hotel the "Rat"isson”
Reviews.Author: hotelreviewer08
Reviews.Content: Our company had a convention at the Gaylord Palms and some of our staff had to stay at this Radisson Orlando Celebration to allow convention attendees more rooms at the Gaylord. The hotel lobby was okay, but it quickly went downhill from there. There are no rooms attached to the lobby section -- all the rooms are in buildings that you have to walk outside to -- I felt this was a safety problem at night. My room was a LONG way from the lobby and required walking around the pool area and video arcade that anyone from the street could come in to -- the gang of rough-looking teenagers hanging around the walkway to my room was a bit scary. My room was dirty feeling (the carpet was disgusting and "sticky" -- good thing I brought socks I could walk around in) and smelled dank and moldy. The air-conditioner worked well (the best part of the room) but was very loud. The internet service was SO SLOW I thought it was like the old dial-up service. Paint was peeling on the walls and the carpet baseboard was peeling away from the wall. The whole place smelled like the furniture, curtains, etc. had a cigarette smoke smell masked by cleaners. Maybe it was in the airducts, I am not sure....The mattresses on the beds are hard as a rock. To top it off a large group of high-school students were staying there on a school trip to go to Disney so they were running up and down the halls. Not exactly the business travelers...I was lucky on my 3rd day of the conference to be able to check out and move over to the Gaylord Palms (MUCH nicer and cleaner hotel and definitely worth the difference in price!) Now that we are back home we are calling this hotel the "RAT"isson....

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL FOR A HOLIDAY SUPERB LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Rek2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife & daughter for 21 nights from April 25th, now I read the reviews on this hotel after booking so I was a little concerned about stay for this amount of time. However we were totaly suprised yes the rooms are dated but for the price the rooms are more than satisfactory, the location is great the staff are very helpful. We did have to change room because of a problem with the toilet which the staff attended to us immediatly, I would reccomend the block 6000 as the rooms were better and located better to the swimming pool and car park. The location is fantstic right on the 192 and a 5min drive to disney. The hotel got a little busy over weekend which you would really expect, I would reccomend this hotel for any family which are going to florida for a HOLIDAY!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a huge disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: horsta
Reviews.Content: From the smell of mold that overwhelmed you from the moment you openened the hotel door, to the paint peeling off walls, and the elevator door propped open with a chair and emergency tape...my colleagues and I nicknamed it "the getto". I won't even attempt to tell you how slow the computers were in the "business center". The pool, lobby, and outdoor grounds are very nice, but it is what is inside the hotel buildings that is so disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hostel-style hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkMunich
Reviews.Content: Was there for a conference, so I picked the hotel as well for an additional stay to see other clients, so seven nights in total. The guest room areas are worn out and urgently require an overhaul. The room itself is more a "tourist locker" than a hotel room. Blurry armchair etc. The "High speed internet LAN" is ridiculous slow (tested morning, at noon and 9:30pm). Nobody from the conference wanted to eat at the "fabulous" Mandoline restaurant. It would however be difficult since they have two classes of hotel guests. If you don't belong to a (student)group, you won't even get a menu to see.... In the "bar" they serve a snack in the evening - micro wave trash on a cardboard plate with plastic cutlery (!) .... At check-in on Sat 08:30pm nobody could help to get four bags to the 5th floor in an offset building...... The "concierge" were bored housewifes that had no glue (no interest...) how to book tickets for a tour at KSC (Kennedy Space Center); we managed through KSC website within minutes... There were so many other issues, too long to list all of them. If most of us would not have had such a tight schedule, we would have moved to virtually any other place. This is more a hostel for kids than a "Conference Hotel".

Reviews.Title: “beds are hard as concrete”
Reviews.Author: CBGirl088888
Reviews.Content: The beds here were hard as concrete. I had two rooms and both beds were terrible. I even tried to put the comforter on one to sleep on and it was still terrible. The funny thing is, is if you call the hotel directly they have this advertisement that they have sleep number beds. Not a chance. I guess for the rate I got for hotel.com did not include the nice beds. the pools and the people working were very nice. But I would never go back because I could never get any sleep

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.......when there are no conferences on!!”
Reviews.Author: gazbjo
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and myself stayed here and have to say, for the first week it was really nice. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the hotel itself was lovely. The grounds and the pool were really nice. No complaints whatsoever. The second week however, the sheriffs conference came to the hotel for the week and completely took over the hotel. The pool was full every day and night (think this must have been where they were having the conference lol) and they were noisy walking through the hotel when going to their rooms at night. For the purposes of the hotel review though, this hotel is a perfect getaway. Close enough to all the attractions, right on the 192 and only a couple of mins drive to the I4. Might be an idea thought to check if there will be any conferences on before you book. Hope this helps. And please ignore the negative reviews. You cant please all the people all the time and there are people who complain just for the sake of it!!

Reviews.Title: “Give it a try!”
Reviews.Author: roboreo
Reviews.Content: My husband chose this hotel because it is close to Wide World of Sports and we were spending one night in the area. I wasn't sure about it, after reading some of the reviews, but changed my mind when I arrived. First the cons: Yes, it is older. I did see a bit of peeling wallpaper in one area, but it was not a sign to leave. We were on the eighth floor and when we got off the elevator, I was sure they had put us in a smoking room because of the aroma in the hallway. I couldn't manage to get online. But, then, I am used to wireless and the room had broadband, so it was probably my fault. It wasn't important that day anyway. Pros: We arrived early to check out the hotel and they happily checked us right in to our room. The room was just perfect for us. No cigarette smell at all. Everything was clean. The sleep number bed was great for this couple. The bathroom looked like it had recently been redone with a granite vanity top and marble tiled shower. It was a gorgeous day and we decided to go down to the pool, which we had not seen yet. The large pool was not heated (don't know about the "kids" pool), but it was lovely! There are two pools and two hot tubs and plenty of lounge chairs. The landscaping surrounding the pool is hard scape i.e. manufactured rock walls, and waterfalls and lots of foliage where you feel nestled in and pampered. The music they played was perfect and then, a live musician! Of course, he played Buffet, James Taylor and that sort and we spent about three hours lounging and enjoying the first day of vacation. There is a game room, but we didn't go in. Free parking too. Oh, the resort fee is $12.50 per night, which is added to your bill after the fact. Apparently, this is common in FL, but I had already known about it, so it wasn't a shock, like it had been to some reviewers. ( I guess that is a 'con') Would I spend a week there? If the price was right, I might. But, even if we never stay there again. We are glad we stayed on that day. Good choice honey!

Reviews.Title: “Saved our trip”
Reviews.Author: sandyrodge
Reviews.Content: After booking with another hotel and getting grossed out, we check this place out before booking. It was perfect. Price, cleanliness and service, can't get much better without going broke. Felt good to have a clean room and bed to go to everynight.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Celebration - Excellent hotel - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastTraveler1
Reviews.Content: Was unhappy in a nearby Best Western that led patrons to believe it had Hi Speed WiFi in its rooms. Called Radisson blind with no notice and told them my problem. Told them it was paramount to have a room w/Hi Speed internet access. They put me on hold to verify they had exactly what I was requesting. They returned to tell me they were placing a hold on the room I wanted and allowed me to check in the following AM at 8 AM prior to going to the local theme parks. Normal check in is early afternoon after 3 PM. They allowed this early check in at no extra cost. Every thing was as promised and the WiFi was lightening FAST. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. By the way....they were $20 per night cheaper than the place I left!

Reviews.Title: “OK for the budget conscious”
Reviews.Author: carlton858
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel for three days while coming to Orlando for a convention. As a business traveler, this resort was acceptable. The rooms are not extravagant and the on-site restaurant food is pretty uninspiring. I have no idea what the grounds are like since I left in the morning and came back at night. I can see this hotel would be good for family traveling to visit the theme parks on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Work & Play in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: MelonyE
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds with pool, jacuzzi's, water falls and slides. Food and drinks right at poolside. Beautiful flowers and landscaping throughout. Rooms were great. We loved our "sleep number" beds!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay here”
Reviews.Author: grammy0710
Reviews.Content: The location is close to Disney attractions and easy to find. Our room was quiet, clean and the beds were comfortable. The staff was pleasant. The pool area looked clean and well cared for, but it was too cold to swim. But I think the hallways, stairways, and elevators should be updated soon. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who wants a good, clean, basic room at a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: farley11
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous as I had read so many horrible reviews on this hotel after booking many months ago. What a pleasant surprise to see this is a beautiful hotel at a terrific price. We loved that the drive to Disney was only 5 minutes and it was in such a central location. Room was clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. Pools were beautiful with fun activities for the kids. The food was also very good at the hotel restaurant, yet a little pricey. We will stay here again on our next trip to Orlando. I am one who is picky, yet there really was nothing I could pick apart at this Radisson. I do not understand how others could have rated so poorly.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the moaners, this is a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tishywishy
Reviews.Content: we were so worried about our proposed stay at this hotel because of the reviews, but we found it to be clean, comfortable rooms, staff were really friendly, pools were great and the breakfasts were more than adequate. Lots of parking and well placed for the attractions. Free internet, good gym, lovely gift shop nice bar and deli for all day snacks. Lots of hot water and powerfull shower. Yes the halls could do with some new decoration. would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: canadarose1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson for 5 nights in Feb.Thought that the staff were friendly and efficient. Our Building was the 4000. Could have used up-dating, especially the carpet, which was stained. The bathroom also needed some work, the fan was almost blocked with dust. Other than that, the bedlinens and beds were first-rate, very clean and good quality. Liked having a fridge in-room. The pool area was nice, and staffed with a games supervisor if you have kids that might get bored. The buffet breakfast at the on-site restaurant was the biggest disappointment- very poor quality. Thought the location was really good- near restaurants, close to Disney and the Highways. The resort fee seemed a bit over the top for what you get- but if I got this hotel at a good rate, wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Damning Reviews Are Unfair”
Reviews.Author: beaubrummie51
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 14 night Stay at Radisson Orlando Celebration. A family of 5 Adults and 1 Child using the Hotel as a base for the Disney/Universal Parks. The reviews we read before leaving the UK. really spooked us out, to the point of it spoiling the build up to our outbound journey, even though we always travel with an open mind regards different standards, having travelled around Europe/Caribbean/Cuba, the reviews really stunk!!!! We need not have worried so much! The Hotel Staff on Check In were Polite & very helpful. No nasty people loitering in the lobby as previously reported. Our first rooms in Block 3000 were adequate, the decor is tired as are the corridors & lifts, however the room was clean, and beds were comfy. Our Safe couldn`t be fixed so we were offered new rooms in Block 6000, at no extra charge. These rooms had been newly decorated and were clean, quiet and comfortable. The WiFi is fee providing you use your own lap top, and not the key board in the room. The Pool Areas were clean and Bird Poo free!!! and the pools were warm. Other than needing a coat of paint and some new soft furnishings, carpets etc. This hotel is fine. We left gaming consoles on charge with no problem, whilst out during the day, and when we left notes for the maid asking for extra coffee, coat hangers etc. we got them the same day. Considering the scathing reports being posted, it is also very busy, so obviously other guests aren`t being detered. We were happy with our stay and would return again. if you want a Posh Hotel then pay more $ or £`s, but if like us you are going to be out all day what is the point? Special thanks to Janice on reception. What a lovely lady.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price...just needed to sleep as days were spent elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: Sandyfeets
Reviews.Content: The rooms were decent for the price paid. Sleep number beds were nice, although the 2 doubles were rather close together. Bath was clean and room a/c system was quiet and efficient. If I had a complaint it was the process of the check in desk clerk sending me over to the guest service desk to get a parking pass, but first being told that I could get 2-for-1 Disney tickets. After my interest was peaked, I waited 15 long min. for the clerk to complete another guests transaction. It turned out the only way to get a 2-for-1 deal was to attend a 2 hour timeshare presentation at 7:30am. I did not appreciate the wait, nor the method of delivery. I didn't appreciate the sales pitch after I've just paid over $200 for accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Lynn S
Reviews.Content: I don't understand what people are complaining about so wholeheartedly. This certainly isn't the hotel for a wedding or a honeymoon but myself and my partner stayed here for 5 nights and we had a wonderful time. Ok the halls in the hotel are outdated and need redecorating but other than that we found our experience to be an overwhelmingly good one. We paid only $73 per night for a king room with breakfast included and for that we got a really nice hotel room (nothing like the halls), a very comfortable bed (best sleep in a long time), two swimming pools (one heated, one not-so-heated), two jacuzzis, waterslide, ping pong table, etc. I really can't fault it for the price, by far the best value of our whole trip (we stayed in 5 different hotels). We spent most of our days out and about but we did take the time to spend a relaxing afternoon or two at the pool, which was very pleasant. The location is also a plus, just off the interstate which takes you up to the parks and there was a great collection of restaurants just across the road (I'd recommend the italian one). I'm not saying this is a 5-star hotel, maybe between 3 and 4, but people are slating it as if they expected 5-star standard. When you book a hotel you do have to take the price into consideration and we were 100% happy with what we got for our money and would definitely recommend to our friends. I do agree that the resort fee should not exist but from what I could see (after searching through many hotels before booking this one, almost all hotels in Orlando charge a similar resort fee)

Reviews.Title: “"Well worn to be generous" -- But then, I don't want to smell my hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: jimkellster
Reviews.Content: Web site impression -- good. Outside appearance -- Ok. Staff on check in -- Ok . . plus. Feeling pretty good, in fact, a wait and see the room neutral or positive impression so far. One step into the room corridors, things change, bells ring, red flags fly, and my nose twitches. It's either dank, musty, damp or dirty, I can't decide which. Into the elevator, where the veneer is peeling off the faux wood paneled walls, and onto the 8th floor where my first and only impression is yet another foul odor, stale cigarette smoke laced with some form of antiseptic. I don't care if this has been a no smoking hotel or floor for whatever period of time, to a non-smoker, it is overwhelming. The rooms did not have the same characteristics, but can only be described as average but with very old, oft-cleaned carpets. Thankfully, the bed linens were a highlight and were sans bedspread. This became the positive experience of the stay. This is a hotel in need of updating. And what's with a $12.43 Daily resort fee? As a business traveler, I had no children, no time to swim, no need for planned activities, and I was not willing to traverse the hallways (see above) to find the fitness center. Always ready to find a positive note, the room service food, while not first class or gourmet, was good and presented in a polite and timely manner But, it would be not be hard to do better. Keep looking

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT EVER EVER EVER STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: mrspetty09
Reviews.Content: I was on my honeymoon to orlando my poor husband thought he would surprise me with a stay at this four star resort. More like half star resort. WHen we got there the front desk were rude and thought we were a waste of there time. We were told that a tweleve doller charge would be added to our room daily for things that most all hotels don't charge for. They said the main reason we have to pay it is for parking we don't have a car. It was aweful the rooms were filthy the beds were not made and our room was never cleaned. We asked to leave the next day but were told that we would not get our money back. BUt it was so aweful we had to go. THe otel manager and is star were the meanest people I have ever met. DO yourself a favor and don't stay at this hotel of any radisson for that matter.

Reviews.Title: “This is no way a four star hotel. Poor setting for our wedding!”
Reviews.Author: lbcbOrlando
Reviews.Content: The hotel is exremely tired looking with wallpaper hanging off walls, lifts dirty and service poor. Restaurant was not open in evenings and services advertised are simply not available. We were married here and service provided was extremely poor, little decoration and very poor service. Not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Stay At Home.”
Reviews.Author: crazycaitlin5499
Reviews.Content: This hotel was old dirty and disgusting! My husband and i checked in to a gross lobby with digusting people. while riding up to our room in the elevator, ignoring the lobby, we were aproached by a man with dirty old cloths and a long beard. we looked down and saw that he was carrying a diper in a trash bag that smelled like a dead skunk.We literaly ran out of the elevator with watering eyes!! we were lead to our room by a bellhop with a nasty atitude who said to us as we aproached our room," here take it or leave" and handed us a scum covered key. We walked into our room and were greeted by a pigon swarming the room looking for food. To make a long story short, hair in our food and wine. rabid cats swiming in the pool. pool deck was covered with duck and Bird poop. Nasty people loitering in the lobby. And to make things even better, this was where we stayed for our honey moon. tip to the world- never stay at a hotel when you see a man carrying a giant diaper.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average hotel”
Reviews.Author: blange606
Reviews.Content: As far a price goes, it is affordable. Not sure what the "resort fee" covers, this to me is just a hotel, not a resort. The pool chairs are very uncomfortable and the pool bathrooms are disgusting!! No toilet paper for 2 days!! The diner food was pretty good for a reasonable price and the bartender at the pool bar was very friendly. the drink prices are outrageous especially since for every drink an 18% tip is automatically added. My husband and I got 2 mixed drinks (very small) for 19 dollars. The rooms are average.

Reviews.Title: “orlando”
Reviews.Author: brat464
Reviews.Content: this hotel was gorgeous. the heated outdoor pool was my favorite. we had already done the disney thing so just hit disney village and city walk at universal. this place was close enough, but another world.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: charlie2324
Reviews.Content: We checked in at 12:00pm on 12/31/09 to a beautiful lobby. We were told that our room was all set .Walking to our room, we saw trash in the hallways. We entered our room and were hit with a god awful smell. My wife walked back down to ask for a different room and she was told"we can put a fan in the room". She insisted on a new room minus the smell. She was told the new room would be ready at 4pm! Great we'll go to the great looking heated pool(not) The big pool not heated had birds(fowl) swimming, all the pools and jacuzzi were dirty(not to mention one lady was eating a sub in one) also stray cats all over the premises(looking for food no doubt). At this point we decided that we would stay one night and try to get out of our additional two nights. We talked to a Manager who told us "you can leave, but you will be charged for all three nights". We then asked if we could just be charged the one night and would check out the next day. The price for the first night was $199.00 per night and the two additional nights were $115 a night. We were told again "you can leave, but you will be charged for three nights". We never committed to a 3 night minimum stay and at this point asked to speak to the highest ranking Manager available and were told that he was not on the premises, but would call us later. My wife received a call from the manager by the name of Jeff Swirsky approximately one hour later and was rudely told before she could explain our situation, that we were paying for three nights no matter what, "too bad!". My wife then asked again if we could stay one night and check out the next day with no charge due to the fact that the hotel was unsanitary, unsafe and was she had been completely disrespected by himself and his employees and she was told that if she wanted no charge she would have to leave within 30 minutes. We were staying here on New Year's Eve with our 8 and 10 year old daughters and were told that we would have to leave within in 30 minutes or we would be charged for three nights. This took place at 8:30pm. We were greeted by a bellman at our room 25 minutes later to walk us out of the hotel. THE TRASH WAS STILL IN THE HALLWAY.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: nrg132
Reviews.Content: We checked in our soccer team into this hotel as the pictures on the web looked nice and the hotel appeared to be presentable. Upon checking in, we were pleasantly surprised at the nice grounds, nice pool area, and nice lobby and food court areas. That is where the good experience stopped. It appears that money was spent on the previously mentioned areas and stopped at the rooms.
