The corridors were dirty and walls were scuffed, the rooms were dirty, old, and not well maintained, there were smoke odors coming from an adjacent area, the room was foul smelling, the elevator, while functional, was old and in need of rejuvenation, and the carpet and curtains were old and stained. Our steel bathroom door was warped and never did close all of the way. The safe was not functional and maintenance never did show up. Even changing rooms from the 3000 building to the 1000 building did not improve the accomodations except for the odors. We did not expect this type of quality issue from Radisson. I had seven other rooms for families who came to the soccer event near this location and all wanted to leave and find other accomodations. We checked out early and found another hotel as we could not see ourselves staying at this property for another week. It is a shame that with such a great location and nice grounds that the rooms are being ignored and turning this property into a low grade hotel. Truely a disappointment and the last time that I will personally stay at or recommend a Radisson property.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson has gone way down”
Reviews.Author: svenskachef
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Radisson before, but this one I should have passed. The staff is accustomed to many foreign travelers and their lack of courtesy is very apparent. The hotel was dirty with many things broken (ie 5 out of 10 pieces in the fitness center were broken and out of order and electrical outlet hanging from the wall). There are a lot better options.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it used to be . . .”
Reviews.Author: kcrom
Reviews.Content: We live about one hour from Orlando, and the Radisson Resort is usually our go to place when we visit for the weekend. It's a beautiful hotel, the service is always good, and my son loves the big pool and waterslide. But I look for cleanliness and comfort, and on our last trip, both were lacking. Our beds and pillows were very uncomfortable, and there was food and food containers under our bed, indicating that the cleaning staff did not do a very good job. I am usually very pleased with their Florida resident rates, but in the future I may be willing to pay a bit more for a nicer, cleaner room elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...if that's all you're looking for”
Reviews.Author: AHabdasRN
Reviews.Content: I (24) traveled with my boyfriend (28) for a quick vacation to Universal Studios for my birthday. We travel a lot and are very easy to please. The location of this hotel is great. We were able to walk to Old Town (which I wouldn't neccessarily recommend walking, it's about 3 miles...) but we're pretty active. We walked to a couple flea-markets which were GREAT!! And a Taxi ride back only cost about $8. Thankfully, we weren't in our room very much, only to sleep. The positive review of this hotel would be the pool and hot tub. Both are very nice. The negatives are a-plenty. We stayed in the 4000 building, which indeed had sleep number beds, but was so outdated I also felt a creepy vibe, like time warp into the 70s. We had to change rooms because our phones didn't work, and the room we moved into was just as creepy but had a better view. I found it very scary that we were able to use our old room key throughout our stay-- they never deactivated the card! Also, we were able to just pull most doors open without cards! The bar/restaurant is so overpriced and adds gratuity, so the service is so-so. Most of the place looked outdated. I wouldn't call it family friendly because of the issues we had. It was a place to sleep. I wouldn't go back. The free shuttle was conveniant, but it would pick us up so early, at 7:50am, and that was the only option. With all that said, I do believe that you would be able to make the best of this place if you're in it for the price and have a rental car. Like I said, the pool was very nice, the waterfall and waterslide were fun. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Dad and 10 year old son”
Reviews.Author: 50DAD
Reviews.Content: First I must say that if your going to stay off of Disney property get a car, I know its money that you don't want to spent but you'll be glad you did. The stay in Florida was nice but the weather didn't quite get as warm as I'd of liked, low 70's to low 60's. Compare it to Chicago though and it was a heat wave. We got our car with Payless and had a reservation got the Camry, car was very nice had no problems at all. The cost for this car was for 6 days with all the insurance was right at $300 and if you don't have to take all the insurance you can save $30 a day. The next thing is get the map that they give you you need it to find your way around. OK now the hotel we book from here and got the room for the two of us for $59.00 a night but it doesn't tell you that they charge for about everything you do, they charge you another $11.50 for there stuff, the amenities, the pool, the water slide, the spa. etc. I had another reservation with the hotel for two days less and the front desk called me in my room to tell me that they were going to have to charge me one night's stay on that reservation, I told the girl at the front desk that I had cancel that reservation when I made the one I was using, Well after I talked to the manger they decided not to charge me. The first night in the hotel I did find a dead Silverfish, about 2 inches long in the bathroom under the sink, I got a tissue and picked it up and I must say did not see any other bugs the whole time. Room itself wasn't bad but it wasn't perfect. The TV cable system was screwed up the whole time,they had a channel that you could buy movies to watch and the whole time it didn't work. They keep saying that the cable company was going to get it fixed but it never happened while we were there. The bed left me sore in my back, now I'm 50 years old and 50 lbs overweight and my son didn't complain so I'm not sure if it was me or not but I never have problems at home. The game room is kind of small its got around 10 or 12 games, nothing new. The restaurant is just like all the other restaurants in Orlando high priced and the sports bar the same $5 Drafts, $6.95 for a draft and hot dog $9.00 for a draft and burger. They do have a pizza hut at the hotel basically $15.00 for a medium peperoni pizza, the pizza was one of the best with a ton of cheese but expensive. If you have to make a phone call and you pick up the phone expect to be charged, I made 2 calls while their and found out they were considered long distance $5.50 each, use your cell phone. Oh there are a limited number of plug ins in the rooms,one beside the coffee pot,one in the bathroom and one on the desk lamp I must tell everyone about 3 things in Florida. First make sure if this is your first time to bring a lot of cash or your credit card everything cost's at least a $20 if not more. It was just me and my son and it's hard to get a meal for less than $20. and Disney World is worse figure at least $10 a head per meal per person and go to Wal-mart to buy your trickets, you'll save a ton. Next go see the Blue Man Group at Universal one of the best buys there and tickets are not cheap $70 for mine and $25 for my son, but a completely outstanding show had us laughing the whole damn time. Last the last night we were their in Orlando we went to Joe's Crab Shack on 192 just Hwy 4. One of the best place's I've ever been too. The food was outstanding,the wait staff was Great and friendly. They sang and danced (with my son) they made it fun, the building provides a perfect atmosphere for them. COMPLETELY enjoyed them and the food. I am going to recomend this hotel because of its location to the parks for the price

Reviews.Title: “its a great place to stay-especially with kids”
Reviews.Author: glassmen007
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights in start of December-the hotel is in a great area for travel around Orlando etc-cant understand why anyone would not have a hire car in Orlando-the shuttles are always inadaquate according to other reviews !!! Hotel grownds well kept and perhaps due to past reviews the duck poo was not so much an issue. Rooms good and well maintained. Staff that we met all good and friendly-did not have any hassle with guest services at all. Does look a little worn in parts but then so do 90+ percent of hotels especially in Orlando and even more especially Kissimmee area. Tip to all brits book on computer use Travel web sites to find the best deals Priceline and Hotwire can give you very good deals-like we got for this hotel through Priceline. At the end of the day dont expect luxery unless you are willing to pay higher prices but do expect reasnable standards for your bucks

Reviews.Title: “Our first "escape" from Miami”
Reviews.Author: RubenDorrego
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and very near to the Disney parks! It's a shame that there is cold in these days but everything was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: SirTravel0ts
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the clincher for my perfect family trip weekend. This hotel if very easy to get to from the I-4 freeway and check-in was a breeze. During the check-in process, one of my party members misplaced their iTouch in the lobby; we were promptly notified by the front desk that it was found and would be waiting for us at the front desk. The rooms were spacious, clean, and up-to-date. The "Sleep Number" bed was an unexpected treat. The beds are made with all washable 'linens'; there was no questionable bed spreads, refreshingly it was a freshly laundered duvet. The next morning was started with a quick breakfast at the Deli-Dinner and then off to the many pools on-site for a day of relaxation. The chairs were plentiful and in great repair. The pool water was clean, clear, and perfect temperature for a day of fun. Food and beverage were allowed poolside, and there were plenty of refreshment options for all members of the family. The fresh pizza from the 'tiki hut" was fresh, delicious, and enjoyed by all.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again, definitely would not recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: Mother6
Reviews.Content: My husband & 6 year old son stayed there for 1 week. My son commented daily on how "smelly it was", & it was. The pillows on the beds that were for "show" with shams were stained yellow. The carpet was dirty( my slippers were black at the end of the week). Guest services(were you go for info on parks etc) were nothing but a pain in the you know what!! They were representatives from a "time share" & let me tell you were pushy & had a hard time accepting no for an answer. It was difficult because we usually needed some kind of info daily on things to do around Disney etc & they had all the info. We had an issue & needed security, they were helpful. All the staff were nice. Heavy smoking noted in all pool areas, which my son has never been exposed to, & I did my best to keep him away from. The loby was OK, the "deli" was OK, but all the walkways could have used some work, cleaning etc! It just felt dirty, definitely not what I'm used to. We usually stay at the Comfort Inn in Canada, & I can tell you that it is MUCH better than this Hotel that requires work for sure!!. It was close to lots of restaurants(we didn't have a REALLY good meal our entire stay), all restaurants we went to were not really the cleanest, it was very close & convenient to Disney which was nice. (we rented a car) Grocery store close by, but be careful taking food back to the room refrigerator, IT WASN T clean!!THE Water was BAD!!!!!!!!!!!! !!!( my 6 year old wrote the last sentence)

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: atdavis
Reviews.Content: Oh, where to begin? I normally do not write reviews, but this place was so bad I feel I need to worn others. We were mistaken to not look at reviews before we left, I hope you do not make the same mistake. My parents-in-law had stayed here before and thought it was nice for the price, so when they decided to go to Disneyworld again and invited us, this is the hotel they booked. When we arrived at the hotel, they were disappointed and stated things had gone downhill since they last visited. We went to our rooms and discovered they were not pool view, which we paid extra for. We were then moved to new rooms which were worse than the first. I will only talk about my wife and I's room, but our entire group had problems and had to be moved three times. Our second room had blood on the shower curtain and mold all over the window curtains. Our next room had exposed wires from one of the outlets. I'm not talking about a little wire showing, I'm talking about frayed ends that are sticking way out from the outlet that had been ripped off the wall! Our last room had hair all over the pillow, and again I dont mean one hair, I mean it looked like a dog had been sleeping on the pillow. There were also cigarette burn marks in the pillow and the sheet. The entire hotel smelt very musty and molding. The elevator is the worst. It literally smells like someone threw up. The floor matches the smell as well; it is heavily stained and "mushy", giving you that nice just puked on feeling. This hotel is not like any Raddison I have ever seen or stayed in. It was very uncomfortable and dirty. I could go on and on. The hallways had holes on the wall, exit signs were hanging from the ceiling. It was like a bad joke. We felt like the place was closed down, but for some reason they were letting people stay there. The only nice parts were the lobby and the pool. Not sure how it compares for transportation purposes, but most parks only had one depart and pick-up time. The only exception was Disneyworld, which had three departure times. They had a restaurant, but it was never open.If you are looking for a cheap place, I would reccomend a Hotel 6 or Holiday Inn. My wife's parents paid for our hotel and I am still complaining, that should give you an idea of how bad this place is.

Reviews.Title: “Old, Smelly and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: yadiperez
Reviews.Content: This is actually the first review I've ever written and let me tell you that I felt the need to warn you before you commit in staying here. This hotel is totally misleading. Do not go by what you see on their website. The room is super tiny for a family of four. The electrical wiring was messed up. Several lamps were not working (lighbulbs were fine). The room smelled horrible. The bathroom was dirty. There were no comlimentary toiletries. Our garbage was not picked up once. The TV was super old and the remote control didn't work.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location but Poor Transportion and NO Free Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: vthiker89
Reviews.Content: It was difficult to decide to say if I'd recommend this hotel to a friend or not. I put yes because of the positive aspects, but I wouldn't recommend without a warning. Positives: *Friendly staff (all but one) *Nice room *Great Location esp. if you rent a car - we didn't but could still walk to restaurants *Heated pool *Nicely landscaped grounds *Activities for the kids (a little lame but my 9 year old liked them) *Gave us two connecting rooms *Great price through priceline $37/night per room *Sleep number bed *When room was cleaned, they did a great job Negatives: *NO Free Breakfast (walk to Golden Corral 1/2 mile down the road, much better) *Typical over priced restaurants (even Pizza Hut) * Forgot to clean room one day (yikes, this has never happened to me before!!) * Transportation to/from Disney was inconvient and often didn't show for pick up at night, had to waste $$ on a cab a few times. * Guest services pushes you to tour a time share for discount tix (don't waste vacation time doing this)

Reviews.Title: “don't judge a book by it's cover”
Reviews.Author: summerleeds
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks lovely on the internet & in the glossy magazine. it also looks impressive from the outside. Don't be fooled, this very large old hotel needs major money spending on it. The first couple of rooms that we were given were dark, smelly & not cleaned properly. After wasting a few hours changing rooms we finally got a half descent ones. We still had to have them come & clean it, the curtains were disgusting, hanginging in tatters & dirty, the long dark corridoors were shabby to say the least. We were not happy and would not return

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfullllllll! enjoyed loacation and facilities”
Reviews.Author: CharmedOnes
Reviews.Content: This Radisson started well and just kept going. Staff addressed concerns about some reviews and ensured we would enjoy it. WE came for three days and Shari noted our requests. Had a pool view in the 6000 building and it was worth it with easy access to shuttle to Disney and Orlando, close to all pools and main lobby. It poured one day and every pathway had canopy cover which made it easy and dry to get around. Shuttle was on time regularly except once we arrived one minute late at Epcot stop #24 and was told by others waiting for next door shuttle he had left about 3-4 minutes early even though he had waited about 5 minutes. My watch was accurate as we checked so that didn't thrill us. However, shuttle driver in #23, turned out to be same one who dropped us off earlier and was now on another route, took his passengers and then took us to the Radisson which was very nice. Note your times and service for 4 people was worth the $11.30 they charge per day per room. Some kids and adult activites were fun and similar to what we have had on cruise ships. Complments to Radisson for adding something extra. We won drinks in one contest. Lobby was exquisite, grounds well kept with 3 pools to choose from (one heated) and two saunas. Would love to stay there for a week and mix the days with the theme parks and some days enjoy the sun and facilities. Did not eat at the Mandolin as we were out and about although had late snack at the little diner inside which was fine. Grocery store close by isn't great but with a car everytihg is close enough. Sleep slumber beds were outstanding. All of us agreed we slept the best we have at a hotel. Book in advance this place will be busy at peak season.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT POOLS”
Reviews.Author: princessnora
Reviews.Content: I love the pools that this hotel has and I also love how they have a pizza hut and a grocery store in the hotel. That completely made my stay. also i liked the rooms there.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Radisson Standard”
Reviews.Author: SDEAOI6
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not up to Radisson standards. Rate was reasonable but I guess you get what you pay for. Hotel has seen better days. Room was worn, a bit dirty, and smelled moldy. Carpet, towels, drapes, bedding all need to be replaced. Poor lighting, older TV, no wireless internet in the room (although there is internet connection). Not impressed with dining facilities on site. On the plus side, disney parks are close by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: HuttonRef
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights. This was our sixth visit to Orlando, so we knew what to expect. The room was standard for the area, twin beds, decent sized bathroom, tv with a limited number of channels (not important if your out at theme parks all day). We were on the second floor in the 1000 building. There was one lift in the 2000 buiding which we were not aware of on arrival and so had to carry everything up the stairs. The rooms were clean and there were lots of facilities in the hotel. The location, just off US 192 and close to I-4 made this a perfect hotel for travelling around. We didn't eat at the hotel but Charley's Steakhouse across the road was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with this hotel overall.”
Reviews.Author: FloridaLadyB
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in early 2006 with my husband, and we were very pleased with it. The rooms were clean and contemporary, the staff was attentive, and we got a great rate. We loved the pool area, and the complimentary shuttle to Walt Disney World was a gerat plus.

Reviews.Title: “It's pretty much what the majority opinion is...”
Reviews.Author: Midwesterner007
Reviews.Content: Like the other recent posters have stated it's was a pretty good experience on the off-season. The lobby is beautiful. The grounds are beautiful. I found the staff to be helpful and friendly. The room was OK and the comments about not staying on the first floor due to the damp smell was right on--even in November. Like others, we got a pretty good deal at a discount website and we found that it was a really good option for those with families who are going to spend most of the day at the parks. Most helpful for economic considerations was the in-room refrigerator which saved a lot of time and money on breakfast and late night dinners. When you have a small child it is a good idea to serve breakfast in the room quickly so that you can spend most of the day at the park. I don't think we would have made the early shuttle if we had to go out anywhere first. The shuttle runs to Disneyworld several times a day and back at times which will allow you to stay until the fireworks close at Magic Kingdom. It was a good value considering parking at Disney is now $14. Best of all, we got to the park so early that we were able to get on the rides in the morning with little or no waiting. (Again, it was also the off-season). Like others have said, the "resort fee" seems a little inappropriate as this is not a "resort" but the tradeoff is that you can take the free shuttle and the extra fee is less than Disney parking. It's also much less hassle than driving and parking yourself. I considered this a definite plus. The room was OK. It was a little dated and seemed a little Vegas-inspired but it was comfortable and the beds were fine. The Internet was spotty. It worked fine the first day but not the next. I didn't try the restaurant but we did get suckered by the deli prices for a canned coffee and a chocolate milk--$6. That's worse than Disney charges! Some prices at the Pizza Hut/ deli looked reasonable--ask before you order. In general, though, it was a pretty good experience and we liked it. The location was fantastic. It was easy to find, close to the park and located very near strip malls with many shops and even a movie theater. My young son was very impressed by the pools and playground in the back of the hotel and would very much like to go back. It would be worth it if we get a similar deal.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Celebration - The Good and the Bad”
Reviews.Author: tfinchler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson Resort Celebration for five nights in November 2009 with my wife and kids - ages 11 and 7. Took a package for $184/night that included two four-day adult Disney passes and breakfasts for all four of us. When you net out the cost of the Disney tickets ($55 per day per adult) and breakfasts, the hotel room was effectively $30-40 per night. If they offer the Magic Your Way package, consider it. Prior to November 2009, we had stayed at the hotel three times, most recently in 2003. Here are some observations: LOCATION: You cannot beat it. The hotel is at the intersection of 192 and 4. If you don't know where that is, it is 1.5 miles from Main Gate. Or, stated differently, it'll be a 10 minute drive or less to any of the Disney parks. No one can reasonably dispute that this hotel is in a prime location to visit any of the Disney parks. ROOM: We were in room 1324 - 1000 Building - 3rd floor - at the end. Room was fine. Think three-star quality. Room size was large. Decor was a bit dated, but not old. Bathroom was large. Water pressure in shower not so great. Not enough hangers in closets - consider bringing some. Drawer storage was woefully inadequate - three small drawers under TV. If you'll be staying for more than 3-4 days, you may not be able to unpack all your stuff. Can hear noise outside of room rather easily. SERVICE: Housekeeping was excellent. They tended to the room promptly and did an excellent job. Five-star quality here. Try to avoid Guest Services desk. Not referring to front desk - they were fine - did a nice job when called upon. Guest Services is run by a tour operator, which tries to sell you stuff. I had to wait 30 minutes to pick up the included Disney tickets - they kept bypassing me when they saw I was just there to pickup the free tickets and was not buying other stuff from them. RESTAURANT: Ate at Mandolin's for breakfast each morning. Buffet on Sat/Sun and a la carte from menu during week. Food was very good. Nice portions. Service was very slow, but I'd blame that on understaffing as opposed to poor wait staff. Tough to serve an entire restaurant with two waiters and one busboy. Menu prices were about $10 for a large-sized breakfast. Believe the buffet was $14, although did not see price. Buffet was also very good - omelete station, fresh waffles, pancakes, french toast, bacon, sausauges, potatoes, fruits, pastries. Definitely a good way to get fuel before heading off to the parks. MISCELLANEOUS: The layout of the hotel complex can be confusing. Picked it up after a few days. Be aware that there is Wi Fi in only portions of the hotel. The 1000 Building does not have Wi Fi - so if this is important to you - make sure you request a spot closer to the main building for reception. Pools were well maintained, but rather empty. Kids loved the heated pool. Parking is iffy. If you arrive back at the hotel after 8pm, you may have to park a bit of a distance from your room. Not a big deal, but others have noted it. Prices at the deli are really high, so consider going to the Publix down the street and stocking the in-room fridge. We did not, but should have! If you're looking for a good meal without getting ripped off, there is a Logan's about 2 miles down the road. Think Outback. You can get a really good meal for about $10-15. Based on the price and proximity to Disney, I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Resort Orlando? Not a resort”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelerAustin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights and though I got a great price, this is not a good choice for business travelers or for families who are looking for a resort feel. Orlando has a lot of hotel options and I think you could do better. However if price is your main factor, the rooms are large and you could fit a family. Pros: Big room, big bathroom, sleep number bed (if you like those - I actually don't), big pool, refrigerators in rooms, nice outdoor landscaping Cons: Sub-par toiletries, poor soundproofing, "odor" from heater, humid feel in rooms, "clingy" shower curtain, small towels, long walk to rooms from lobby (sleeping rooms are in separate buildings and you must walk outside), inconsistent hot water and internet access, small fitness room with worn out equipment and few amenities

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at this clean and friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CornishboyUK
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at the hotel during our honeymoon for two weeks. The hotel was clean and the staff were more than friendly and helpful. The hotels runs a regular shuttle service for those visiting the many theme parks such as Disney in the area. The swimming pools were fine and plenty of sun beds available. Although we don’t have any children there appeared to be many activities to partake in. The rooms were cleaned every day and have all the necessities. Coming from the UK I thought the food at the hotel was a little expensive but there is a food store within walking distance. The only recommendation I would have for any traveller is get a hire car as we found it difficult at night to go far without one. I also recommend during your stay getting cab into Celebration and try the fantastic restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Ref_Librarian
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean room, a nice place to swim, and easy access to attractions for a great price, this is the place. The grounds are beautifully landscaped with waterfalls throughout. Rooms are grouped into 6 buildings. From what I gather from other reviews, there may be some inconsistency with room quality from building to building. We had a room on the top floor of building 2000 and were pleased with the room's quality. While it could use a little polish here and there, overall I was pleased. The room was clean and housekeeping did a fantastic job. On site dining options are scarce; I recommend eating off site. There's plenty of places to dine around the hotel, with Downtown Disney and the Crossroads shopping center just 10 minutes away...there's something for everyone. Parking was ample and gated after dusk. If you are visiting Central Florida on a budget and looking for an affordable place to stay, I highly recommend the Radisson. I booked directly online with the resort and paid $59/night plus the $11.30 resort fee. What a deal!

Reviews.Title: “5 Nights at the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: HelenH4
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 12 y/o son as a base for the theme parks. The service was fantastic, the hotel needs a little maintenance but is good. The pool area is fantastic , the music can get a little loud at times, but fun. The shuttle buses to the theme parks are early in the morning and late in the afternoon which can be a little restricting. There is not a lot of other things surrounding the hotel & it can be hard to eat healthy. Overall this is a good place to stay with very comfortable beds & rooms. (air conditioning is effective if a little loud) I would go back to this hotel without any hesitation. The entire staff are helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price, slightly dated rooms, confusing to get around”
Reviews.Author: ennairam6
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel after a business trip and it was nice for what I needed it for -- to get some sun. They have a small pool with basic lawn chairs and tables (and a cool water slide) and then a kiddie pool with a nearby pool bar. A couple dining choices, though nothing particularly healthy. The diner makes hot Starbucks drinks, which was comforting. The floor plan is so confusing that I tried to go back to my room as little as possible. Probably wouldn't be an issue if you're going to be spending most of your time at a park, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and at a bargin price - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: dominica51
Reviews.Content: We booked two double rooms on the third floor adjacent. My sister who lives in Florida also booked a room for our first night (on the 5th floor - upgraded to the Easy Sleep room). Our rooms were slightly dated, but a good size. Afterwards we meet at reception and I noticed the sign for easy sleep rooms, the receptionist asks if she could help. The following day both our rooms were upgraded free of charge to easy sleep on the seven floor. Slight trouble having to wait for the lifts, but it made no difference from the 3rd to 7th floor. Found the staff to be extremely helpful and politic. Did not have to fight to get a sun chair and plenty of hotel towels by the pool (nice and quite - first week of school holidays). Some inferences going on at the time - but did not interfere with our stay. Did not eat at the hotel, as you have so many places to choose from in the area. Hired a car for the week. Room service every day.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable value for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: amd0576
Reviews.Content: One thing I really liked about this hotel is that five of the six wings are interconnected with one another and adjacent to the lobby, making travel to the room simple. Amenities are abundant, with a large pool and waterslide (could have used a lifeguard on staff), as well as a poolside Tiki bar and Pizza Hut Express. This was my second time at this Radisson and I noticed that some rooms have the SleepNumber beds and some do not. Either way, your back (or stomach) will thank you in the morning. Parking is free of charge and the resort fee is less expensive than most Orlando offerings. Definitely a worthy option to the massive amount of hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobShawyn
Reviews.Content: I do lots of traveling and spend lots of time in hotels, but I have not stayed at a Radisson in a long time. So with this Radisson I got a great price on Priceline of $27. So with the "resort fee" of $11.30/day I still got a good deal. After I checked in the front desk lady showed me a map to my room(yea, it can be confusing finding your room as you have to drive a while). After I parked I had to walk through a flock of ducks on the walkway, It was kinda gross and you have to walk through the ducks droppings. I was on the top floor in building 4, which is the smoking floor. My room was ok, It had a sleep number bed, but the decor was dated and tv was old and had very few channels(several channels had poor reception). Front desk manager was very helpful when I had issues with my wifi in my room. This hotel does cater more to family travelers then people who are on business. The room could of used a better desk and a sofa instead of a single chair that was very uncomfortable. I would recommend this place, just dont pay full price and if your here with kids. But I do hope Radisson would redo its rooms and they looked tired and worn.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value for money !!!”
Reviews.Author: samhayes
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews online we were excited but a little wary of what we may find and when spending such a lot of money on this kind of holiday it is a little worrying. When we arrived we found the hotel to be very pleasant in its surroundings and clean and tidy. We were given our room key and we drove round to our car parking area and found the room pretty easily. We did realise soon that evening that finding a spot close to where you staying is hard especially when you are coming home late after visiting the parks. After saying that tho there is plenty of spaces you may just have to park a little further away. Our room was big enough for myself my husband and 2 boys aged 4 and 11 at the time. We had 2 double beds that are sooo comfy and you can ask for additional pillows if you need them. The room had its own bathroom which was very clean and had bath/shower toilet and sink with plenty of space to move. The room also had a hairdryer which was handy as i forgot to pack mine!!!. We could have done with a little more drawer and wardrobe space as i thought that for a room that sleeps 4 people there was not near enough but didnt ruin our stay at all it just meant i lived mainly out of my suitcase for the stay. The pools were lovely too. One of them is heated which was great for me and my youngest son as we dont like cold water much and the larger pool is lovely and looked almost tropical. Our room overlooked the pool on the ground floor and had patio doors that led out to it but they were permanently locked maybe for security ??. There is eateries in the hotel but we ate out everyday as there is ample restaraunts of every taste to choose from around the area. We hired a car to get around and figured we did need one to get the best out of our holiday although none drivers would still be ok at this hotel. We stayed here for 2 weeks and thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would stay here again. We have visited orlando 7 times now and have stayed in numerous places and would recommend this hotel for anyone to stay for there fantastic holiday of a lifetime. I hope this helps in any way for any concerns you may be having and if i can give any advice it would be this :- If you are going to orlando for your holidays first of all you are very lucky as its a wonderful place but please dont worry too much as if you are anything like us you will only be looking at your room to go to freshen up or goto sleep after a long day in the parks. There is so much to see and do in the day and evenings that keeps you away from your hotel. If your room wherever you may be staying is not up to your liking let the reception know first and if they cant move you ask yourself this....is this problem going to ruin my chances of having the best time of my life and will it put me off orlando in the future if your answer is no then maybe the odd little thing you can live with just using it as a base to store your belongings. I can truly say that i have never been anywhere else in the world that makes our family so happy and i would choose to stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed!”
Reviews.Author: jwinters0219
Reviews.Content: During my business trip in Orlando, I stayed at the Radisson Resort for a couple days. On the surface, the hotel appeared to be slightly dated, but overall nice. As my stay went on, I started disliking the hotel more and more. I did not enjoy the hotel food onsite, as I was in meetings all day and the Convience Store/Deli was the only thing open most of the time. My room was without internet for more than half my stay, even though I complained about it as soon as I walked in the door. They attempted to fix it once, but it was attempt number 2, on my last night, they finally got it working. Shower pressure was terrible! The nearest elevator was out-of-order so I had to continually go out of my way to get to my room. My biggest complaint cost of this so-called "resort." There was a daily $15 resort fee they charged for the use of the internet, exercise facilities, and pool. All-in-all, never again!

Reviews.Title: “location excellent hotel great”
Reviews.Author: j2ules
Reviews.Content: The reviews for this hotel have been quite bad at times. We have just returned and we had a great time. Yes the rooms are a tad worn but they are in constant use and any slight damp smell is down to the fact that it is a hot and humid country. The rooms were very good , just take some spare coat hangers with you. The hotel itself was great. There are competitions and bingo etc. at the pool, if you ever get the chance to go. The pool bar does great cocktails and food. There is a pizza hut service at the pool and in your rooms . There is the deli diner which does eat in or take away, so you can get food or wine etc and take it to your room. They even had a huge blow up screen in reception some nights with movies and the kids went down in their pj's to watch them. All in all we had a fabulous stay and the location to not only disney but seaworld and universal was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Damp rooms but nice setting”
Reviews.Author: Colszy1
Reviews.Content: Was given ground floor room in building 4. Room was damp with musty smell and mould on curtains and in closet wall. There was a general damp smell throughout the ground floor of the building. Complained and was given room on floor above - much better and no damp smell in room or corridors. Other than that hotel was fine. Staff were really helpful. Great location for WDW. If the Hotel Management reads this - you need to damp proof your ground floor rooms - its letting your hotel down!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: cmhou2002
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with my kids after a several day trip to the Space Center. The hotel OK - and I have not big complaints. The room was a little old and the AC made a lot of noise - but for the Hotwire price of $57 plus the $12 resort fee - it was a good deal. You can tell that this hotel is no rolling in profit as they do not appear to be doing a lot of updating - this is very noticeable in the pool area. Had I paid full rate - this review would have been a lot different. If you are looking for a cheap place (or won it on Hotwire) - Your stay should be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Will definitely return !”
Reviews.Author: FloridaMango
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 1 night after spending the day at Disney's Animal Kingdom. Before making our reservation, as I always do, I researched on the internet & read every review possible. I am a Florida resident & have stayed in a lot of hotels in the Orlando area. (and others as well). If you're looking for a 5 star hotel, this is not the place. I would definitely rate this a 3.5-4 star. This hotel was way above average for cleanliness, amenities, restaurant choices, atmosphere, everything! I was impressed. I booked our room at radisson.com, it was actually cheaper than all of the other discount internet sites! Yes, there is a 'resort fee' of $12 on top of the room fee. BUT, the total for our awesome room/stay was $92 TOTAL. This was your basic room with king bed (which was a bit firm/hard), but I slept fine. We were fortunate to have a room in the 6000 building right next to the smaller pool & jacuzzi nearby. Everthing is within walking distance at the resort/hotel. We had dinner in the Sports bar, food was good, service was good, and like any other place...a little more $$, but worth the convenience! I want to write this review for your average family, couple, traveler... who appreciates & understands a good deal! This place is perfect for families. The pool, slide, games, game room, ping pong, etc. Yet, couples who want to get away & not spend a fortune. We escaped for the weekend without our children. I will definitely stay at this hotel every time we go to Orlando now. It is very close to all attractions. The landscaping & atmosphere was very nice, the staff was friendly, the hotel common areas were clean, our room was clean & pretty (no odors whatsoever), the pool area was clean & we always saw employees walking around & keeping things tidy. Don't waste your time/money on the 'discount' hotels, this is the same $$ or maybe $10 more per night.... but well worth it! I hope this review helps others when making their choice. The only thing I can say about the negative reviews?.. maybe their rooms weren't renovated yet? Maybe they just had one of those bum-deals or bad day?.. Oh, & check out the pix included in other reviews... that is what it looks like. I have the same exact photos.

Reviews.Title: “Big On Quality, Low On Prices”
Reviews.Author: blueknight
Reviews.Content: On arrival at this hotel i was not disappointed, with its spacious grounds, modern building and welcoming reception area. We were given a room in block 6 (Probably the best location in the hotel) next to the heated pool and jacuzzis and also convienent for the restaurant and lobby. The room was in good condition, sorry to hear some people unhappy about theirs, but i can assure you having experience of everythinbg from 2 star to 5 star hotels, that the room we had as good as any four star hotel you would find (although we were upgraded to a sleep number bed room, highly recommended). On site you had a deli with a good range of eat in or take away foods and a pizza hut. Just outside the hotel there was a massive selection of restaurants to choose from, you will not starve. The hotel offers a courtesy bus to the theme parks, but we did not use as we had a car. The gym was modern with a good selection machines and weights, the larger pool was great, with plenty of space for everyone. The hotel also had free internet facilities which was great. We paid around $50 (£35) a night for this hotel and it was worth every penny. I would not hesitate to stay here again because the facilities were great, the price was right and its only 5minutes to all the disney parks and to a massive selection of eateries. Don't listen to the people who have found problems with this hotel, because i can assure you, this joint is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel very central great for families”
Reviews.Author: tagtravellers
Reviews.Content: Just home from a trip to the Radisson, great hotel and just lovely for families. Pool has waterfall and slide and the staff had pool games to keep the kids amused, a welcome distraction and rest from the theme parks...my kids wanted to just stay at the hotel !! The hotel (thankfully!) avoids the International Drive hype , and although its states Celetration its a short 5-8 min drive to the centre of Celebration town, this is definitely worth a visit, lovely restaurants, the Cinema is like 'Back the the Future' and you can even sit on a rocking chair by the waters edge and look for the alligators......Walt Disneys town and just so quaint and lovely if you want to avoid the neon strips, and see something different in Orlando go to Celebration for lunch and have a look ...we hired bikes and went to the Cinema to see Harry Potter just lovely. Back to the hotel....great rooms (no balconies), good sizes fridge and safe....main pool area has a pizza hut take out which was really handy at lunchtime, the Tiki bar was great but as you can imagine not cheap ($8.50 for a cocktail). Free parking close to the rooms as the hotel is laid out in blocks, opportunity to buy park tickets in lobby but we warned they do push reduced tickets (which sound wonderful.....but its timeshare related (best be prepared !!) Weather permitting they have Cinema nights twice a week so the kids can watch the big screen outside, we found mid week was quiet and weekend extremely busy as the locals came up for the weekend but there were always plently of sunbeds for all. I would recommend this hotel to families wanting to be close to all the amenities (10-15 min drive to Disney)....we have been to Orlando before and found International Drive and all the commercialism weary after a while...this gave us flexibility to take it easy as well. WE LOVED THIS HOTEL AND WOULD DEF STAY AGAIN WHEN IN ORLANDO

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: freetravel75
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. We were given a 2 beds room, the room was smelly. The overall building condition was not so great. We were tired and did not want to change rooms the first day. Called front desk and was put in building 5000 for the second day's stay. This room was in much good condition, did not smell as the first room. Kids loved the pool. One caution is regarding the slide in pool. THe slide is in the deeper side of the pool (around 4.5 ft deep I think). There are no life guards at the pool. Free internet wifi included. Hotel does charge $11.50 additional fee.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting hotel, smelly, noisey needs total redecoration”
Reviews.Author: review10
Reviews.Content: We had booked for 3 nights and cancelled after one!! Not worth the discounts!!! Room service mopped floor with guest towels (after we had an overflowing toilet) and continued to do so even after i requested them to stop. I was told they do it all the time!!! Pay a little extra and go to Omni Championsgate it was fantastic. The reception staff laughed at me when i complained. The hotel has not been updated for a long time. The corridors and rooms smell musky, carpets are unclean and housekeeping are useless. I would never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family hotel”
Reviews.Author: brian_magee23
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and 2 children in the Radison Hotel in July 2009 for 12 nights and found the service very good, the rooms clean and comfortable. The facilities overall were excellent this was enhanced by the friendliness of the staff who were very helpful and courteous. Best regards to Miriam, Amy, Brenda, Michelle and Steve.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: KeyWestbarbiedoll
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times over the past six years and we always have a great time. For those who say it was not renovated, that is not true. I STAYed THERE WHILE IT WAS BEING RENOVATED. Not a great idea, but we still had a good time. The 2 pools are great. The break fast is really good. They have such a variety of food ( including fruits, yogurt, cottage cheese, etc.). It is centrally located and 3 minutes from International Drive. excellent variety of restaurants in area.WILL BE STAYING AGAIN IN AFEW DAYS!!

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN HOTEL- NICE PRICE- GOOD LOCATION- just complaining about one thing”
Reviews.Author: xxmiamigirlxx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Resort Celebration in June 2009, with my boyfriend and some family members, the hotel was clean, For me it is very important that a hotel has a clean bathroom and bed and the truth is that this hotel had wonderful clean bathrooms and beds. There were NO bed bugs, no stains, we got the sleep number beds which were wonderful. BUT the only complain was the parking, we would get there late and the little amount of parking that the hotel has at the near side of the hotel was all taken and we had to go all the way to the back were there was poor security at that time quite frankly and go through all the duck poop in the bridge and walk for about 10 mins to get to the hotel tower. So in other words missing parking lot, should have more closer to hotel. But other than that the hotel was great, the pool area was clean very nice waterfalls, movie nights by the pool very nice, overall we had a nice stay, I liked it

Reviews.Title: “Cancel reservation before it's too late!!”
Reviews.Author: yk2
Reviews.Content: We booked thru Priceline for $40/night, but had to pay a hidden fee of $11.30/night. We also got slapped a mysterious TV charge of over $16... daylight robbing. From the parking lot to the building, it's hard to avoid all the duck poop (they all seem to have disgusting diarrhea). The pool was slippery and one of my kids fell. Room quality is equivalent to a cheap motel with noisy air conditioner. We even found blood stain on the bed sheet! The shuttle schedule is not aligned to the theme park's activities so it's quite useless. I highly recommend paying $12/day to park at Disney. First time we had to use the shuttle, we got misinformed by the driver and almost took the wrong Disney bus to the theme park. Upon returning, we couldn't take the latest bus from Epcot due to the theme park's activities and had to catch the only one at MK. However, the hotel staff misinformed me on the phone (TWICE in one night) to wait at the wrong place for the bus. It was midnight with three young children exhausted from Disney and nagging. We ended up taking a shuttle for another hotel. When I brought this to the night manager's attention, I was treated with a "sorry, too bad" attitude. Upon checking out, when I brought all the issues to Jeff Swirsky (an inexperienced and rude rooms manager), he offered no help whatsoever. Worse, the same "sorry, too bad we got your money already" attitude. The managers are good at insulting your intelligence and to make you feel bad, so beware the humiliation. How upset am I after 48 hours of cool down? Well, I am drafting a complaint to the Better Business Bureau, the Carlson Group (Radisson) management, and all relevant Travel Bureau responsible for Orlando tourism right now.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A CESSPOOL”
Reviews.Author: sugarer1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely filthy. The claim that it was recently renovated is a bunch of bunk. It was probably renovated 15 years ago. The beds were comfortable and the linens were changed every day but there is no way I would ever stay there again. At the building we stayed at there was a bridge from the parking lot to the hotel and beneath the bridge was a pond with ducks and turtles. Well the ducks would come up on the bridge and do there business all over the walkway. In the 4 days I was there, this was cleaned once. So every time you wanted to leave you had to cross a landmine of duck duty (absolutely disgusting), The shuttle left at 7 am and returned at 6 pm. Once a day that is not as convenient as many of the other resorts that have a shuttle every hour. The rooms stunk as did the hallways like cigarettes. The pool had no service, the restaurant where kids eat free - closed, I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Bad reviews were not accurate”
Reviews.Author: sfri
Reviews.Content: I read the bad reviews but was pleasantly surprised when I arrived and I had a great stay so far (I'm still here for another few days.) Making the reservation: First off, I booked through hotwire. When I called Radisson central reservations to request a non-smoking room they told me I couldnt request anything since I booked through hotwire. "You take whats left. I cant even see your reservation since you booked through hotwire. Youll have to check in and see what they'll give you." I was a bit angry so I called the hotel directly expecting a fight. The receptionist could not have been nicer. She appologized and put in my requests (sleep number bed, non smoking , quiet room away from pool and high speed internet) On arrival: The place is beautifully landscaped with fountains and waterfalls, ducks in several lakes..gorgeous. I needed a couple extra days and I had booked two more days through hotwire to follow the first 5 days I booked through hotwire. The clerk was very nice but a bit confused so she got the manager who was wonderful. She made sure I had everything I asked for and made sure that my stay would all be in the same room. The room: 4000 wing, 6th floor. From the reviews I expected old outdated furnishings. Not so. The room was decorated very contemporary, no stains on the carpet and no rips in the drapes.. The bathroom had granite counters and marble floors.The bed linens were all white with a washable white bedspread. Yes..they do wash them. I saw the housekeepers linen cart. My only complaint..the shower looked well used and had a mildew smell coming from the shower curtain. Not bad but I could tell it was there. Rather than ask for a new one, I washed it with a little bleach in the tub and all was fine. I'm sure they would have replaced it had I asked. The a/c was great and no more noisy than any other hotel I've stayed at. The sleep number bed was amazingly comfortable and the room was quiet enough that I could take a nap mid-day. Ammenities: I did not eat at the restaurants. The pools are excellent and there are hot tubs scattered around also. As mentioned, its beautiful and well maintained. Transportation leaves several times per day but I never used it. Last shuttle picks up at EPCOT at 1045pm. Fireworks are at the Magic Kingdom at 10pm this week lasting about 20 minutes leaving about 20 minutes to get from the MK to Epcot via monorail. I would watch them from the MK exit if you want to make the shuttle on time. Location is great, down the street from lots of eating establisments and I was at the Contemporay Resort every day within 10 minutes. Both hotwire AND the Radission were up from about the $11.00 resort fee. Anyone surprised by that fee never bothered to read the web site including hotwires. No one tried to hide that they charge that fee. Wireless internet was plenty fast. Exercise room with several treadmills and a few universal type weight machines and light freeweights. Overall: NICE, HELPFUL staff..very friendly. Room was not outdated, was clean (including the fridge) Maybe slghtly worn but with this kind of turnover you have to expect that even in a more expensive hotel. For the price I paid on Hotwire, it is unbeatable. I would stay here again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - you decide”
Reviews.Author: lakelandfl
Reviews.Content: I live locally but wanted a weekend getaway. The main goal of this trip was to find a reasonable price hotel with a nice pool/waterslide to spend two days. Accomplished. I would go back only because of the variety of pools and water features on site and the low cost ($96 per night included a very good breakfast buffet). Without breakfast the rate would have been in the $70 range (purchased direct from the hotel). There were three pools; one kiddie, one large with waterslide and waterfall and a heated pool. There were two hot tubs, one of them had a really cool waterfall to stand underneath. We spent most of our time in the heated pool because the large pool seemed a bit cold. It was overcast and not quite as hot outside when we visited but I managed to get a few trips down the waterslide. There was also a fun giant chess/checkerboard. There were lots of ponds, fountains, waterfalls etc. There were families of ducks and turtles that would almost walk up and eat out of your hand. My 18 month old son enjoyed the baby ducks. My son also enjoyed watching the airplanes overhead except for seeing the occasional naked people standing in the room windows with curtains wide open LOL. The room. Hmmmm the room is another story. I have a feeling that there may have been nicer, more newer sections of the hotel. Our main goal was the pool so I didnt request to be moved. Our room was in bad need of refreshing. The carpet was frayed, the picture was missing from the wall exposing three large holes. The furniture was beat up. There was what looked to be 1980's blue tile in the shower with black mildew stains and a really gross rusted/mildew area under the tub spout. There were granite tiles on the floor and a different color granite sink area. The walls looked beat up. The A/C unit in the room appeared to be falling out of the wall. The room was VERY small; no room for a side chair like I normally find in this scale of hotel. There was a small desk/table and computer hookups. The room had the usual fridge, iron, safe and standard TV. Sleep Number beds were available, but this room didnt have them. The duvet was nice and the bed was very hard and cheap feeling. I happen to like hard beds so that didnt bother me but my wife said she has slept on floors that were more comfortable. I think the $11.30 resort fee would be worthwhile if you need shuttle service to the parks, but in my case the $11.30 didnt really offer us anything else. Of course any food/drink at the hotel is very expensive and overpriced. We only at the breakfast included in the room rate. I'd definately not recommend this for honeymooners or romantic getaways. For my purpose it was pretty much what I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money”
Reviews.Author: midteacher8
Reviews.Content: For my $45 per night priceline charge, the room, grounds, amenities, and location were great for what my family and I were looking for. Check in was no problem. The front desk girl and her manager were very accommodating in finding us a "pool view" on the 6th floor (random request from my 10 year old daughter and her friend). This proved to be quite the luxury as the girls were able to swim in the pool while my husband and I were easily able to keep them within eyesight from the confines of our room. The room, although small, was comfortable. We bought cereal, milk, snacks, and sandwich fixins all which easily fit in the room fridge. The beds (sleep number) were ok. Once we figured out a comfortable number, we slept fine. I would NEVER buy one for my house; however, how do you judge the true comfort of this bed when it's probably used and abused on a regular basis. For our purposes (sleep!!), it was fine. The bathroom is REALLYS small, but it's clean and free of "funk." Our tub faucet wouldn't completely shut off - not very environmentally friendly, but it couldn't be heard from in the room. We encountered no elevator noise, little hall noise/traffic, beautifully kept grounds, friendly staff, fun pool activities, good in-lobby store hours, and free internet in the business services area. Some negatives were shortage of parking (only dealt with this on Saturday pm after a night at Downtown Disney), expensive bar drinks, even N/A, shortage of pool chairs unless you get your chairs early and "reserve" with towels, and SLIPPERY pool area. WEAR FLIPS ALWAYS. I watched 3 different people actually FALL down. Not good. We had a great time and would recommend this hotel to anyone. It's not the RITZ folks, but for families on a budget and just seeking a safe, fun, and NICE hotel, you'll not be disappointed with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not a nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sheilagriffiths18
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel on the 24th May for a three night stay. On arrival we were greeted with a token for a drink from the bar. We thought that to be a nice gesture, and proceeded to our room on the second floor. On arrival at the room we immediately noticed the room had been poorly serviced. A powdery substance on the carpet by my bed remained there for the duration of our stay. The in room safe did not work. The bathroom was grubby. The coffee maker was in need of a good clean and the coffee mugs were chipped. There was a hole in the sheet on my bed.The key pad of the telephone was filthy as were many surfaces. Returning to our room the next day, we found the beds had not been made, just pulled over. We made our beds ourselves the following morning. I asked for non chipped mugs, but did not get them. Our room did not get vacuumed during our stay. On the first evening we were told the Restaurant was not open because they didn't want to encourage people with children to eat there. ( we had no children ) We went out to eat. We didn't bother to enquire about the Restaurant after that. The staff didn't have customer care. One evening I asked at reception for a pen and paper as I wanted to jot down a email address I had been given. The lady reluctantly gave me a pen and a Hotel brochure. Having worked in the hospitality trade for more than a quarter of a century, I do not rate this Hotel at all. I have stayed in other Hotels in Orlando and have found them to be welcoming and clean and tidy. I would not stay in this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RichardEssexUK
Reviews.Content: We (Wife and two young children) stayed here for a week whilst we did the Dinsey parks. Its roughly 15 minutes easy drive from the airport and only 10 minutes from the main disney road (which truncates to each park). The hotel does great breakfast and has good swimming pools open all day (till at least 11pm) which you can enjoy on a rest day. The rooms are spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Mathesons
Reviews.Content: First time in Orlando and we all had a fantastic time. The hotel was really just a place to put our head down at the end of busy days out but we found that we did spend quite a lot of time at the pool. Pool was fantastic. Staff were excellent. A/C broke down in room but was repaired within 30 minutes of reporting it - what more can you ask for? The only slight negative was that on one occasion we decided to try Mandolins for our meal and found that it was overpriced for what it was.

Reviews.Title: “Absoulte Bargin!”
Reviews.Author: tgawn
Reviews.Content: Never had i paied so little and been so impressed with a hotel before. I managed to get 2 nights for £70 through alpharooms.com. Paying this i was not expecting much at all but it turned out to be one of the best hotels of our entire holiday. Check in was fast and the staff very polite and giving me lots of information and discounts on local eateries. The room was large, clean and a comfy bed. The hotel had one large pool with a slide, a smalled heated pool, kids pool, and 2 jacuzzi. Alot of pools! All were very clean and great fun. The lobby is great with a little store for drinks and pizza, sports bar, and free internet. The parking is free and the hotel is very close to the Disney parks and the main road into Orlando. To top it all off when i went to check out and pay for breakfast on the last day, the guy at the desk told us we didnt have to pay for breakfast! Bonus! They were very scrummy with lots of healthy options Overall one of the best hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MJX
Reviews.Content: The Location is Close to Disney, but thats it. Located on Route 198, if you have a Car its pretty convenient for visiting Disney. But I think as compared to other places in Orlando - its a bit Overpriced for no great Hotel. Service is a little Slow, probably they have very less number of manpower as compared to the number of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Lisa922
Reviews.Content: After reading most of the reviews on this site-I was a bit skeptical about staying here after I had already booked. I have to honestly say that my husband and I enjoyed our stay immensely. The staff was helpful and pleasant-the rooms were very clean and the sleep number bed was extremely comfortable. I did read a lot about the air conditioner in the room being very noisy and musty/leaking-we did not experience any of these problems. Although we did not get to experience the pools because it rained all the days we were there, they looked really nice. The grounds were beautiful and well manicured. The shuttle service to the parks were great...timely, air conditioned w/ comfy seats and a t.v. to help pass the time although we were only a mere 10 minute drive away :-) We did eat one night at Mandolins and while it was nothing to write home about-we enjoyed what we had. There is an amazing steak restaurant right across the street named "Charlie's"-if you get the chance-treat yourself and go there...you will not be disappointed!!! Coming from NY-we have gone to more than our fair share of great steak houses and this one is at the top of the list. Overall, the stay was great. You have to take the negative reviews with a grain of salt-to each his own I guess-but we were happy with our experience at this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort but service poor”
Reviews.Author: faderman
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and cleaning staff very nice ( iasked for some extra coffee for the room and was given some with a smile) Mandolins restuarant was terrible, there was only me and another guy in there one evening (730) and we were rushed out,they even cleared the table and took my 3/4 full glass of beer away. so I never had another evening meal in there. The breakfast is a choice of Buffet or menu items the waiters are brash so went for the buffet, I object being charged service charge on top for a buffet- what service ?? the waiter smiling ?? I was on Business so liked the idea of the internet access in he business center but this seemed to be full of the same geeks whatever time I visited and I am convinced that none of them were staying at the resort -bloody cheek I stated to visit at midnight and there was only one sad old geek there surfing for a mail bride I expect. none of the drink vending machines worked on any of the floors best place was the sports bar if you can stand boring rounders (sorry base ball) and basket ball,but bar man nice in there and food reasonable. watch the room service very expensive !!! +this charge and that charge etc etc

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with lots to do.”
Reviews.Author: family_man674
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean and nice. The room that we got was in the 2nd floor and had a great view of the spa and the rocks. The room smelled really good too. It was bright and open. The service was great, the people were very nice and helpful. But something that was also interesting was that the employees were from all over the world. There was an employee that was from England. And there was also an employee from South Africa. There was a game room with few games but it was fun. The location of the game room was in a hidden corner near the pool and restaurant, so if you can't find it ask an employee. The pool was great! Even though we didn't get to go in it but from the looks of it, it was great. The beds were amazing! It was a sleep number bed. We set the bed on 20 and I sunk into it. The fitness center was pretty cool. Through the bridge was a pond with fish and lilies. Also in the parking lot, you will find a family of ducks. The overall experience was the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Davejerome
Reviews.Content: Before I review the place I think you should know the conditions that I arrived in to the hotel. I went here as my first holiday without parents and my first time I had travelled to America. I also worked for a large UK travel company at the time (Virgin). The day I was due to travel I realised that I had made a huge error and had booked the flights for March (which it was) and the hotel for February (a month ago). I arrived at the hotel and played innocent (did not mention I worked for Virgin) to which the members of staff instantly said "Ok, we can't find your booking, but you have been traveling a long time as you have come from London. We will put you in a room, come to reception in the morning and we will let you know what is going on". The next day I went down to reception and instantly they remembered who I was and told me that they had sorted the problem, and if I was happy with the room then I could stay there, which I did. The next self inflicted problem I had was that I forgot my tickets to Discovery Cove (left in the UK). My parents faxed them to the hotel (before I knew they were missing) and I had them waiting for me in my room, didn't have to chase the hotel for them. The pool was lovely, the breakfasts were like all hotel breakfasts (expensive) but not over the top! I have been to Orlando twice now and the Coaches from this hotel were great, the only problem is that if you want to see the fireworks at Disney you will miss the last coach how, however a taxi is about $18 so not the end of the world! At the time of staying I was quite young and I remember thinking "its a shame I had booked such a nice hotel, because we were not using it as I was out all day" but having stayed in the best western Lakeside a year later which was ok, but not great I now look back and think it was a good choice. Oh yeah there is also a pizza hut and sandwich shop in the hotel. If you are British don't be fooled by the pizza hut. Not that British Pizza hut is great but American pizza hut is very different and not in a good way. We pretty much ended up having a sandwich for dinner every night!! If you find the time I really advise going to the shops for some healthy food! So yes, not a straight forward review but the one thing that really stands out with this hotel is service. I know its easy to judge that someone who books a hotel for the wrong month and is in his early 20's may not know about it but I am lucky enough to have stayed in many 5 star hotels as a teenager across the world and this 3/4 star is really up there with service quality! Maybe not ideal if you don't have a car but if you do then you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “lovely resort, attractions nearby”
Reviews.Author: DareToLive
Reviews.Content: beautiful pool, watrefalls and ponds, well maintained, pizza hut on site, great choice of restaurants nearby, easy drive to theme parks, family friendly, loads of activities for kids provided

Reviews.Title: “not bad for a one time stay...”
Reviews.Author: broook
Reviews.Content: I would not give a 5 star for radisson bcuz of the cleanliness in the rooms.. they dont refill supplies fully. & they leave dirty towels on floor after cleaning rooms... the customer service at the counter is "very" good. they're very polite & treat you very nicely. although the guest service pple tend to be really nice, they dont have discounts at all!!! we thought were gonna save if we buy the tickets at the guest service & in the end i overpaid 5 bux... wooow!! what a saving! the shuttle service is VERY prrompt... but they're very limited & not even to all parks... the pools we enjoyed immensely... (24 hr..although they say till 11pm) w/scheduled activities...stunning grounds & very clean outside.. all in all its very comfortable besides the area which is pretty far from the main streets.. (only if u dont have a car...)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful on the outside - questionable on the inside”
Reviews.Author: snapperpcfl
Reviews.Content: We arrived around midnight (Friday night, Apr 24th) on the date I thought I had reserved to check in. Original reservation was for Apr 23 -25th, checking out on the 26th. However, due to a change in schedule, I called 72 hours prior to the 23rd and requested for the reservation to be changed. I needed to push everything up by one day, so I cancelled arriving on the 23rd and extended leaving to the 27th. Upon arriving very late on the 24th, or early on the 25th, I was told that I did not have a reservation. I did have my confirmation number but the clerk in the mean time found my reservation but said it was for checking in on the 25th and out on the 27th. And, there were not any rooms available except for something with a pull out sofa bed. I was told that one roll-away bed could be added but that the room would not accomodate two. There were 4 people in my party, and at this point, I'm very tired and pretty much upset . I tried not to take it out on the night clerk, as I know it was not his fault. Before I could decide, I was told that there was a room available in the smoking section of the hotel that had two double beds. I agreed to take that toom as long as I could move the next day. I have stayed in rooms designated for smokers before and hadn't really noticed or had a problem. This, however, was totally horrible for us as the smoke smell hit us as soon as we stepped off the elevator onto the 8th floor. I called room service for some air freshner, which they promptly brought up. But, it did not help very much. We made the best of it and anxiously waited to be moved the next day. A plus on this particular room or floor, the internet at least worked. The next day, I requested to move as soon as possible. The clerk at the front desk was very nice and did call us as soon as there was a room available. We moved into a room on the first floor which intially seemed to be alot better. However, the internet did not work nor could we access wireless. We called the front desk twice on this matter and they sent someone up the 2nd time but he did not know what to do. He changed out the cable but that didn't help. Later on, as one o fus was lounging on the inside of one of the doulbe beds another horrible odor was detected. It smelled like someone had vomitted. The smell seemed to be coming from between the two beds up near the wall. I assume that someone had gotten sick and the smell was lingering in the carpet. We asked housekeeping to clean while we were out and upon our return, it did smell better - or so we thought. Later, this same odor was detected again. It was not something you could smell constantly (thankfully); however, when you did smell it, it was bad. We had some perfumed sprays we kept using as none of us wanted to go through the ordeal of having to move yet again. On the 27th, as we returned to our building from going to our car, we actually smelled the same disgusting scent upon entering the building. Now I don't know if what I smelled was exclusive to the room we were in or if it was something rank in the ventilation system of the building. However, I did tell the clerk when I checked out that I strongly suspected someone had been sick in the room and the carpet needed to be shampooed. Positives of this hotel - everyone (staff and housekeeping) for the most part were very nice, helpful, and prompt. Also, the exterior of this Radisson very pleasant and the pool areas are beautiful. We enjoyed the pools and spas very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Kids But Look Other Places for Food”
Reviews.Author: MEricksen
Reviews.Content: My family stayed one night. The rooms were worn but clean, and the AC system worked well. The pool and recreation area was great with a heated pool, a kiddie pool, and a pool with a waterfall and water slide. There were also two jacuzzi spas. We had the breakfeast buffet at the on-property restaurant, Mandolin. It was not good and expensive. We had a pizza for lunch that we ordered from the pool bar. It was not good and expensive. We would have no problem staying at the property again, but we would eat at restaurants off of the property.

Reviews.Title: “A Great friendly Resort!”
Reviews.Author: bssd
Reviews.Content: My, son and myself stayed at this Resort over his spring vacation. We found this Resort to be of very good quality. The staff was very friendly and helpful at all times. As for the ammenties at this Hotel, they are just outstanding. A huge center pool with a 45 foot water slide, which my son just fell in love with. They have a great little snack shop there which is moderately over priced but has what you need. And also a Gift shop, in which I did not find that expensive. With all this being said, I could not rate this as 5 overall rating, because of the same complaints that have been voiced in previous posts. The Rooms and Hallways need Refurbishment. While I did not find them to be discusting in any way. They do need updating.

Reviews.Title: “FAMILIES KEEP OUT”
Reviews.Author: katmcc
Reviews.Content: We arrived with an 8, 5 +18month old boys in the early hours after travelling almost 24hrs. We opened the door of our room to be met with a musty smell. The toilet wasn't clean + we phoned the lobby to be told there were no other rooms +they would sort us out in the morning. We said ok as we were all tired but the sheets on the beds had been washed but had cup and ash stains on them, it got worse the kids beds had blood stains on them. The carpet had a thick layer of dust it was obvious the place hadn't seen a hoover in a few weeks . We went to reception + they gave us a king room +sent a security guard to help with luggage, even he agreed that the smell wasn't good. We went to the king room and although it did smell a bit better the 5 of bed +when we put the air con on the next morning the smell was revolting. It was obvious the filter hadn't been changed. The fan in the bathroom smelt of urine, the hairdrier had a layer of dust on it, the fridge didn't work, the carpet was filthy with cigarette burns, everything was a nicotine yellow colour including the lampshades and the paint on the walls. The smoke alarm+sprinkler had dust on it the list is endless. We asked for a cot to be sent up and it was something you would have seen from an orphanage during war times. My 18 month old started vomiting and didn't stop, we went out for a walk +could'nt believe the difference, the outside , the gardens, the pool, the lobby area was fantastic until you entered the rooms and coridoors which had bare carpet, peeling wallpaper and that awful smell. My child continued vomiting and had to be taken to hospital. He had vomited so much he was dehydrated+it was nothing to do with the weather as we had only got there the night before and didn't even have a chance to experience the weather well so the doctor said. My son was discharged at 3am and we even contemplated sleeping in the car rather than that stinking hotel. We checked out the following morning and they had the cheek to ask for the $50 check out early fee!!!! My family hired us a villa and we recouperated there. We had to wash all our clothes as everything had that musty smell.. Please take my advice, if you choose to stay here DON'T. otherwise you need to bring some surgical masks and biohazard bags with you. Anyone who writes a review that says this place is good need their head examining. If you have a family and don't want your kids to pick something up STAY AWAY

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Celebration is a Mixed Bag, some +, some -, overall -”
Reviews.Author: djw5737
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Celebration for both business and pleasure. My partner attended a conference, while I stayed at the hotel. Then we spent 2 days a WDW.
