The Radisson was a disappointment overall. It would definitely be the most disappointing Radisson we have ever stayed in, which is probably over a dozen in various US cities. It is obvious this Radisson was a property they acquired and have not spent the money to upgrade it to the standard of the Radisson brand. I would put it overall below almost all business focused hotels and certainly below "resort" status. First the positive things: Room: the pillows and shower were very good, and we usually find the pillows in almost all hotels to be too soft. Having a free mini-fridge (actually quite large) that was not a pre-stocked mini-bar was great. It easily could have held > 24 cans of pop. It was nice to have a free electronic safe (though it was rather beat up). The air conditioning system was easy to use and did a great job. Though the room smelled musty most of the time. Room service was prompt, the food was pretty good, and reasonable in price - just very few options on the menu for any meal. We ate the breakfast buffet once, which is over priced for the variety and quality of food offered. The pools and pool area was nice. If you have kids, they organize a lot of activities around the pool and there is a large arcade. The Exercise room held all fairly new equipment - and all the cardio machines worked and were in good condition. There just wasn't many of them. The "deli" in the main bldg was open probably 20 hours a day and had a lot of options for food, snacks, beverages etc. The free bus transportation to WDW Epcot transfer station was pretty much right on schedule - there just isn't many trips per day. The bad: The room was dirty. Some sort of beverage was all over the bed room mirror. There was mold all around the sink under the counter over-hang. The toilet ran almost continuously. Some days they took the towels and then did not leave enough. Some towels were fairly plush, yet others were very thin and should have been tossed. The TV was an old 27" that had no input for video game/dvd player. The remote did not work to enable you to do anything other than change channels/control the volume. So no Menu options to adjust the picture, go to on-demand movies etc. Radisson advertises their "Sleep Number" beds - which they had, but good luck finding a setting that would stick. We thought we would set it at a number we liked, and the next morning it had either deflated and was too soft, or seemed to stiffen up on it's own. We finally gave up. Through out the property there were damaged walls (broken or missing tiles, ripped wall paper, gouges in the walls. etc). While the pool area is nice, the LOUD music they play from their Tiki Hut is way too much. If you sat near it, it was impossible to have a conversation. For the money, and the hundreds of hotel options in Orlando, you could spend a lot less some where else and have a much better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool area, not so great room”
Reviews.Author: seaandski4us
Reviews.Content: My children and I checked into the hotel after a long day at Disney. The room was very dated and quite dirty looking. I asked to be moved and was moved to another floor but the room was just as dirty looking. However, the bed was very comfortable and clean and that's what matters most to me. My opinion of the hotel changed the next day as I lounged by the pool while my children had a blast participating in all of the fun activities and swimming in the pools. We all had a great day and the staff did an excellent job of keeping everyone happy. We had lunch via the pool bar area and it was quite good. I got the room for about $70 including tax via Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: diggs2002
Reviews.Content: We booked our room on a third party site at a nightly rate of approx. $55. The complimentary shuttle service and on-site eateries were great. We'd definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Was a cat loose in my room?”
Reviews.Author: AndapandaColorado
Reviews.Content: The hem of the curtain liner was out, and frayed, along with what appeared to be scratches in the carpet. It gave such a shabby look to the room, that I was surprised they rented it out! The overall condition of the room could best be described as tired. The carpet had patches, and was substatially beat-up. The furniture was scratched, the beds were HARD, and the decor was interesting, one tiny picture, and a giant mirror. The oddest thing about the hotel was the maids were outside of my door at 4:30, when I returned for a ten minute refresh. The room had not yet been cleaned, and the maid followed me and started cleaning the bathroom. I had to almost push her out the door! Atfer three minutes, they knocked on the door and and wanted to come back in. When I left, they wanted me to insert MY key in the door, to in effect tell the system that they had entered and left once. To top off this great service, they did not leave me any washcloths or hand towels! The hotel and property are meant for two groups of people; travelling teen-age teams and families with young children. There were groups here, and they looked like they were having a fantastic time in the pool.(Also, they were well-behaved, must have had a game the next day...) The pool is very nice, and not too large,perfect for children in the 5 to 12 range. With so many choices in central Florida, they need to step it up.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but watch out for the "hidden" service charges”
Reviews.Author: Jayvad
Reviews.Content: Check in went smoothly and staff were friendly. Rooms were basic but clean. I looked at the breakfast which did look nice but we decided to go across the street where there was a selection of restaurants and much better value for money. The pools and business centre were clean. Only gripe is that I booked (and paid) the hotel through hotels.co.uk which stated that all taxes and service fees were included but upon check out the hotel insisted on charging $11 per day (we stayed 8 days) for service charges so this I found completely misleading. Next time I will stay on International Drive which is much better located and you can get the same quality of hotel for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: michlyn
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews I was slightly nervous about inviting 20 odd friends and family to stay at our hotel, which we were staying in during our Wedding holiday. (The wedding was not held at the hotel). We were greeted by a friendly, but new, Englishman on front desk. He mentioned that we were a honeymooning couple. And since he said this, I assumed we might get some flowers, or fruit display in our room..... Nothing! Maybe I shouldn't have assumed we'd get something, but I dont know any honeymooning couple to go away and not get a single thing. Was quite dissapointed!!!! The receptionist sorted our keys and were shown a map of how to drive to our dessignated car park, and how to find our room. Now, when I say this hotel is confusing, I mean IT'S CONFUSING! After 2 weeks at the hotel, I still got confused which door led us to our car park. etc.... I wasn't the only one. The rooms are a bit easier to find. First its the building number, then the floor you're on, the the room number. IE; 3507, is in the 3000 building, on the fifth floor, room 7. Our room was reasonably sized and equipped. 2 double beds, iron and board, fridge, coffee maker. The only thing that caused me issues was the windows. I didn't like them at all! Floor to ceiling length made me felt uneasy, especially with a child in with us, on the fifth floor. (It could've been worse, there are 8 floors!) The pool area was cool. Although cool to describe the tempreture isnt correct. More like FREEZING! The heated pool never felt heated to me! If you have little ones, the floor by the kids pool is slanted and I see many an accident there! The water slide there is fab, and the heated spa is wonderful. Had many a great time in there! The sports bar is perfect and the people are really friendly. Popcorn machine is free, and they have free picky bits on the bar which I devoured! The Deli, also, is great. Pizza Hut was used often by us, and they also do other hot food, as well as cakes, drinks, crisps etc.... Right, as far as location is concerned, you couldnt get much closer to Disney! We're right by the turn off before the "Disney highway". 10 minutes drive at the most! The road the hotel is on has local amenities; Gift shop, Supermarket, and restaurants. A lot of friends went to Charley's a lot, and loved it. I really liked the Italian. The hotel restaurant was bery enjoyable. Pretty quiet aand a little slow on service but they're friendly and the food was great! Overall, our stay was spot on!

Reviews.Title: “Musty, Loud Rooms”
Reviews.Author: BirdsMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Resort and requested a room in one of the newer towers, we heard there were older rooms. We stayed in a sleep number room ($140 per night) and our expectations were not met. The room smelled MUSTY as soon as the door opened. Our room looked out to the hot tub on the first floor, but it seemed from the Musty smell that it had not been stayed in for a bit. We could hear every bit of activity and think there was a cheerleading group staying on our hall (with maybe the team leader across from us). So through the evening as we tried to sleep, we heard girls running up and down the hall. We put the do not disturb sign up that apparantly attracted some teenagers. They knocked at our door, then banged on it~ waking our baby in a screaming state. The first night was rough. The air only stays on for about 2min at a time and did help to block noise while it was on. The kids pool was FREEZING and the heated pool was very cold too. I've stayed once before and had a pleasant stay, we must have had the wrong building (2 story building).

Reviews.Title: “The worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: shafamu
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I decided to go to Orlando for a few days as a getaway. I decided to book this hotel because of the pictures and also becuase it was a Resort. When we first got there we thought it was nice but when we checked into the room they had an outdated tv with channels that were fuzzy. Yes they have a sleepnumber bed but my side didnt function properly. They also had glass cups instead of paper cups and the cups wee not clean. They looked as if someone just rinsed theme or sprayed them with windex. Also when we decided to lay down the person above us was making noise and we could hear them. We even can hear the people next door to us and people in the hallway. We also put a please do not disturb sign in the front door and the housekeeping ignored it and still came in to clean. The last but most disturbing thing is that the bed was not clean. I have several bed bug bites on my back on stomach. Stay Away from this hotel. The name does not match the ambience at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very Close to Disney ~ Second Stay There”
Reviews.Author: elansing1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raddison for the second time this April; first of all, the weather was great. we checked into the hotel around 6:00 p.m.; the first thing i noticed was a musty smell in the hallways and in the room, but i think we experienced the same thing last time. the room was exactly the same as last time; we stayed in building 2000, 4th floor, room 2411; one of my complaints is that they only changed our sheets once during our stay; we actually left a note on the bed asking them to change the sheets one day, and they did not. we traveled with a 3 year old, who got ketchup on the sheet the first night, and we slept with that for 3 nights (lovely i know). the towels are scratchy, but remember, you are not staying at the Ritz; my second complaint was with room service. the last time we stayed, the room service was excellent; couldnt have asked for better food. COMPLETELY DIFFERENT EXPERIENCE THIS TIME; it took them 1 1/2 hours to bring up 2 salads and a bowl of what they called Minestrone soup; really it was just tomatoe chunk soup; we complained and the whole $45.00 charge was taken off our bill. they do charge $11 resort fee, and they do charge for rollaway beds ($11); they do not charge for cribs; there is a safe in the room; they did not provide much of anything. there was one bar of soap and one small (very small) bottle of shampoo. the maids did a really poor job of cleaning; basically they replaced towels and made the bed. there is a refridgerator. there is also a walmart and a walgreens right down 192 if you need little stuff; there is also a publix supermarket across the way from the walgreens. YOU HAVE TO GO TO THE KOBE STEAK HOUSE; WE WENT TWO TIMES THIS VISIT AND TWICE BEFORE; GREAT; SO WORTH IT!!!!. overall, you get what you pay for; we weren't expecting much; basically its where we slept and hung out, which it was fine for. the pools are really nice; gym was nice; and there were a bunch of mother ducks that just had babies; we fed them daily which was really nice. my daughter loved it; you can feed the fish too. we had to make an unexpected trip to the ER (daughter had fever of 106!!!) and thank goodness the ER is right across the street from the resort; really close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot for families”
Reviews.Author: MomofoneMI
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect on this one. I read mixed reviews on line. Anyway, I brought my 9 year old daughter to this hotel for five days. The lobby is beautiful, the gardens are very nice and the pool area is great for kids! On Friday and Saturday night they showed movies by the pool. The heated pool is great and my daughter met quite a few friends. Kids eat free at one of the restaurants on-site, but I wasn't impressed. The on-site Pizza Hut was better, and always busy. It is located inside a little store/ice cream shop/restaurant that offers just enough to get by (snacks, soda, Starbuck's coffee, etc.). Another plus was the guest laundry facility. A theme park shuttle is included in your room charge. Great if you are going to Epcot, because it makes several runs there and back during the day. However, if you are planning to visit Sea World or Universal, be ready to stay from 8:00 - 6:00, because that is what the bus schedule requires. All in, it worked for us though! As another reviewer said - don't expect the Ritz and you'll be fine! This place is laid back, nice and a good spot for families.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Resort Orlando-Celebration - great place!”
Reviews.Author: dennisj631
Reviews.Content: i booked through priceline and got a great room for what i paid...some other guests on tripadvisor say that the rooms and halls are musty - not my experience. the room is fairly large. 2 queen size beds and a couch, a microwave and fridge...this isnt the ritz or even embassy suites, but youre not staying there for under $50/night. i was impressed with the cleanliness overall, and the pool looked really cool, but the one day we were going to use the pool we had a monsoon. oh well! the slide looked neat, we will try it next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: TampaFLSuperbecky
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms for 3 nights and both rooms were excellent! We payed less than $40 through Priceline and were worried after reading some reviews! But all turned out great with very clean rooms, great pools, clean beds, shiny tiled bathrooms. The shuttle system is not that accommodating for Sea World, but Disney had a few trips to and from. Lots of restaurants within walking distance. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here if you have high expectations for a nice clean room!”
Reviews.Author: cbreinart
Reviews.Content: I was really dissapointed with the room, so if you dont have high expectations of a hotel room, it would be an okay place to stay. The carpet in the room is terrible looking and it is really old, the room had a musty old smell and the walls and windows were not fresh looking at all. I had to call the front desk about the smell and they sent someone to spray the room. We stayed in 6501, it's right by the pool. They told me it was the newest building, but I dont think any building is a new building. If they would do some updating to the hotel rooms this place would be fabulous. I was actually afraid to fall asleep thinking that roaches were going to come out and get me, but I fell asleep anyway. We only had to stay here for 2 days, so I overcame my fear. :) It does look like they updated the bathrooms in the room though, so I was able to take a shower and not have to worry about bugs coming into the shower with me. I never saw any bugs or roaches, but I'm sure they were hiding. haha! The restaurant in the hotel is alright. We did have omelettes for breakfast and they were pretty good. The lunch menu is quite good, too. The bartenders are really nice and the grounds are beautiful. All the little games they played by the pools were enjoyed by my boys. All the hotel staff was very nice, but I would never stay here again, because of the condition of the room. Beware of the pop machines, too. It cost 1.75 for a can of pop. There is a little grocery store in the plaza right by the hotel, but dont go there either, their prices are crazy, too. So, stop somewhere else along the way and bring some drinks with you. The frig in the room looked brand new, so I didn't mind putting our drinks in it. I will definitaly spend more money somewhere else so that I can sleep better!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great Location and Beautfiful”
Reviews.Author: rick_nick1224
Reviews.Content: DO NOT READ ANY MORE REVIEWS OTHER THAN THIS ONE PLEASE!!!!!!!. This is a great hotel in almost every way. For the people who gave bad reviews stay home this is not the Ritz Carleton. I was very concerned about some of the reviews but everything was perfect and the food at the restaurant was absolutely to die, best prime rib I ever ate and I truly mean that. Joseph at the restaurant is the nicest server I have ever met he definitely made dinner a great experience. The food is kinda expensive but there is so many restuarants on the strip so it is not even an issue but trust me if you have the money eat there trust me you will thank me. There are two pools one heated one not but kids love the cold pool and it is nice to get a quick cool down. The waterslide is nice never used it but went to disney a lot so didn't really have time. There is lots to on the resort too for those days you need a break. Some things not mentioned in others are they a ping pong table have paddle and rackets just not very good. They have a mini basketball, arcarde, beach volleyball court and tennis courts are near the parking lot not near the pool and the tennis courts are lit. This is a huge resort but very easy to get around and trust me don't be scared of the size it is big but seems smaller because it keeps everything central. My bed was a king bed sleepnumber was very nice and they were nice enough to change into a non-smoking room (got a deal on expedia look on this for cheaper rates as well one you bid on can't remember the name). There is a pizzahut right next to the pool you can order through the window as well as other food. They have a nice bar by the pool great dacquiris, inside bar is nice bartender is pretty cool huge projection sreen inside and very comfortable chairs trust me. Beer is kinda expensive by draught not by bottle and they put an 18% surcharge on it but it is okay for a couple go buy beer at Walmart if you wanna drink NO GLASS CONTAINERS BUT BRING DOWN YOUR OWN DRINKS I DID AND THEY DIDN'T SAY A WORD. Trust me if you want to a very nice resort go to this one. You will not be dissapointed. Just try and find a deal they are out there just look. Oh ya and one more thing disney is like 5 minutes away and GO GO GO!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fair for the bargain”
Reviews.Author: ponygirlgt1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through priceline for about 40.00 a night. For that price, we really can't complain....... We were in building 4000 on the 4th floor. Most of the complaints on here are valid and honest complaints The halls were hot and musty smelling, but I am sure some kids were probably playing with the A/C controls as they were not under a lock box and were set at 98 degrees, I turned them down and it was fine after that.....musty smells are gonna be somewhat expected in Florida if the A/C is not running It was a in a location that I felt I wasn't going to get mugged or my car broken into, the room was clean (old and in need of updating....but clean). I could sleep in a cool, quiet room, get up rested and head to a day at the theme parks. Worth the money in our opinion. Don't think we could stay at a Motel 6 for the price. Pluses.....A/C controls were an actual themostat, heated pool, fast elevators, close location to Disney, easy to find, staff friendly, they even gave our daughter 10 tokens for the arcade. Buy Disney tickets onsite. Refridgerator in room. Housekeeping nice, left extra supplies in room when asked Minuses.......safe didn't work (they did replace it the next day), pillows to soft (personal opinion), carpet, drapes and bedding in serious need of updating. Rooms only have double beds instead of queens. No microwave in room I wouldn't recommed this hotel to anyone to book on your own especially at the full booking price, but if you get if via priceline like we did, its really not that bad for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice... Definitely worth the $”
Reviews.Author: TomAndNee
Reviews.Content: We were checked into room 6803 (Top floor with a view of the pool). We found the room to be clean. Everything in the room seemed to be in pretty decent shape. I was particularly surprised how noce the bathroom was. The sink, fllor tiles and wall tiles all seemed to be very nice quality. Also pleasantly surprised at the large mini-fridge in the room. It was nice to be able to bring a few 12-packs of beer and soda and fit them all in the fridge. For visiting the Disney parks - the location was great we were a very short drive to the park. On Irlo Bronson Drive - there were plenty of restaurant choices just a short drive away. Next time I return to Disney I plan to stay in the Disney Resorts just because of the extras you get by doing so (Extra Magic Hours). If not - I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not quote sure where some of the reviews are coming from...”
Reviews.Author: tuba1
Reviews.Content: I would never subject any of my friends to the service we recieved. We arrived to the hotel around 9pm and got to our room as soon as we opened the door the smell of nasty old hotel room filled the hallway. The room had appeared to have recieved new surface treatment but underneath it, it was NASTY. Upon setting our luggage down we went to put some water in our mini fridge to discover, that is was fully stocked. But not with food that the Radisson placed there. Old milk, chinese food, chicken wings and more moldy delictble goodies. After discovering the mini fridge, my friend and I decided that it would be a good idea to check the beds, man was that a mistake. In one pee stains and other misc. items, and in the other one what appeared to be food and hair. The bathroom, was suprisingly the only clean part of the room. So after this inspection we ventured to the lobby to get our room cleaned. around 9:45pm the housekeeper showed up with just a towel, and left, leaving the room in the origional condition. We went back to the front desk around 10:15 to ask for a complete cleaning, that was a mistake it took until 11:45pm for them to finish cleaning the room. Then we discovered that the drapes wouldn't close all the way so the hanger with clips from the closet came in handy. Then aroun 1:15 am a employee came to our room to inform us that our room had a broken tub. But our tub was not broken, and did not listen when we tld him our tub was fine. So in five minutes he had taken apart and put back together the tub to tell us that the tub was fine. It ends up our friends room directly above us their tub was broken. So after laying down (on towels) in the bed we discovered that the room appars to have been involved in a fire. The fire sprinkler was rusted and inspection of the rooms walls showed that 2 of the four in the sleeping area had different texture and paint color than the rest. In the morning we left for breakfast at the restaurant to be pleasantly surprised by the quality of the breakfast. That night we discovered we had gotten eight towels that pretty much took up the entire vanity area. As the stay progressed housekeeping got more consistant but failed to change the sheets even after placing the request card for new sheets where specified by the card. Also the smell and mold in the room that has been mentioned in previous requests was present and accounted for. The only plus to the hotel was the large expansive pool, slide and large pool deck with pleanty of charis. All in all I think the Super8 down he road was most likely cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: romantix
Reviews.Content: I stayed in October 2008 during my college homecoming. I got the Bed and Breakfast package and it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Resort better that expected”
Reviews.Author: terryg4766
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel in Orlando over Hotwire with the usual fear and trepidation that comes with not knowing what you are getting until after you pay! After reading some negative reviews once we found out where we were placed we had some concerns. However we found the property to be in good condition for a hotel that receives a large amount of traffic. It is showing it's age a bit but our room was very comfortable and clean and the room service was excellent. The pool and spa areas are very nice. It was not overly busy for the time of year. You are charged a resort fee over and above your room rate. The only caution that I would have is to avoid the on-site restaurant. We paid $35.00 for 2 people for the breakfast buffet after they add the 18% gratuity. You can pick from several good breakfast buffets down the street for less than half that amount.

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney-area hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Aaronius1974
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here, and while the hotel has aged, the experience is still pretty great. I'll get the not-so-great stuff out of the way, right off the bat: 1. This hotel complex was most likely built in the early 1980s, and was last upgraded in the early 2000s. It's beginning to show a little wear from the last "Modern Italian" upgrade. 2. The beds are harder than one would expect, which is bad if you like the pillow-topped experience (but good if you want less material to attract bed bugs and Florida critters.) 3. The $10 a day "resort fee." Just charge me the fee upfront. I hate all the back end charges to maintain the illusion of a lower price. In fact, you might attract a higher caliber of tourist if you just added the $10 a day back into the cost. Here's the good stuff, and why you should stay here: 1. Clean rooms and facilities. In Orlando, this is a great boon. 2. Being on the "right" side of the 192 interchange, nearer to Celebration, in an office park/residential feeling area, rather than the tourist trap that is 192 in Kissimee. 3. Shuttles to Disney. Not too shabby. 4. Full compliment of gift shop, bar and restaurants, with Mandolins serving some great chow. 5. The pool area is stunning. Seriously. Too cold to play, but great to look at. 6. The staff was awesome, friendly and polite. 7. Smoking rooms! Thank goodness for non-fascists! Seriously. Adults like to smoke, Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Decent 3 star hotel....”
Reviews.Author: drolly
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that my lover and I thought this was a decent 3 star hotel. I have a bunch of minor complaints that may sound like this hotel faired poorly... but there was never a point where I disliked the hotel or felt the urge to leave or anything like that. First, the hotel looks really nice from the outside, the lobby area and landscaping is beautiful and, for the most part, the grounds are pretty clean. Room was adequate. We stayed in room 2311 (I think) which had a king size sleep number bed. Complaint #1 was that housekeeping reset the sleep number every single day. Contrary to what the website says, not all the rooms feature Sleep Number beds. I would suggest requesting a sleep number bed, if only because you know the room has been recently renovated/switched over. Bathroom was nice. Toilet flushed slowly, but there was adequate pressure from the shower. Decor wasn't any more or less dated than any other hotel I've stayed at in the DW area. Website also claims a daily resort fee of $10/day which is actually $11.30/day after tax. Ok, so here are my main complaints. First, I really hate to complain about shuttle service... but the shuttle to SeaWorld dropped us off AN HOUR BEFORE THE PARK OPENED. We left the hotel early but I just assumed that we would be stopping at area hotels and get there right about the time the park opened. Standing around for an hour in the parking lot before the park opened was beyond annoying. Second, the resort has 2 pools with 2 extreme temperatures. The main pool featuring the waterfall in the pics is not heated. The second pool is heated to bathwater temps, which, in my opinion, is gross. Now, we were there during a cold snap in Florida so maybe the non-heated pool isn't usually an issue, but the non-heated pool was FREEZING. The news said the ocean temp was 59 degrees and the pool felt colder than when I stepped in the ocean. There is a pond in front of the hotel that is really gross. I felt bad for the wildlife in and around the pond because there was garbage and debris floating in and all around the pond. Like some of the reviews have said, the "guest services and ticket center" is really a timeshare salesman. I really don't have a problem with this except when they give you bad information. I HATE concierge-type services that aren't informed (see my review for the Atlantis). We wanted to see the cirque de soleil (sp?) and asked about ticket prices and showtimes, etc. He gave us ticket prices and we drove to Downtown Disney to see the show where we were promptly informed by the Box Office that the show was on vacation, returning the following Tuesday. They were also no help for anything in the Tampa area. Overall though, we did enjoy the hotel. My gf loved the duck family, especially the baby ducks. Like I said, a bunch of minor complaints, but nothing that dimenished from the overall hotel experience. A nice hotel in a fantastic location that can be had for a really good price through any of the discount websites.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: DiscoveryTraveler
Reviews.Content: Old facilities, but clean. Spacious lobby, and room was fine. First floor had a funny smell - they may have just did some painting. Shuttle service a plus, but there is a "resort fee" of $11.30 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain through Priceline!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaPixie
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay Jan. 23-26 through Priceline, with a rate of $35 per night, which plus tax and the resort fee, ended up at $50 per night. We usually stay onsite at Disney at one of the value hotels (POP is our favorite), but even with our Florida resident discount, this time we were only able to find $82 per night at the Sports. Since we'd stayed at POP for a week in Nov. 2008, we decided off-site would be fine this quick trip. So, we decided to do Priceline to try to save money. We felt that the $50 rate was a good deal for the room we got, and were very happy with our Radisson experience. The resort fee was not a surprise, and I didn't feel like it was that much of an issue since, even with that added on, we still got a good rate. The room at the Radisson was nicer than the Disney value rooms, and it was convenient to have a fridge in the room at no extra charge. Disney charges extra for a fridge. We stayed in the 4000 building on the 4th floor, so we did not experience the moldy smells that other reviewers mentioned. Our room was nicely updated, with new looking furnitureWe enjoyed the free wireless in our room, as well as the king size sleep number bed. We had to request the king upon check-in, and the front desk person was very nice and said he would upgrade me to a king at no charge. We needed the king since our little three-year-old daughter would be sleeping with us--she's too big for a crib. Our little one loved all of the ponds and ducks around the resort, and the pool area was so beautiful, though too cold this trip. We didn't eat at the hotel, especially after reading some of the reviews, but Mandolin's restaurant was just about empty Sunday night around 6 pm when we drove by. There are so many options to eat in the Disney area, why would you want to eat at a hotel restaurant? We would recommend this hotel to anyone we know, and I am very picky about hotels. Is it the Peabody or Disney's Grand Floridian? No. But if you a looking for a clean, comfortable room at a good rate, then check it out. My advice, go through Priceline and hope you get this Radisson. The Radisson/Celebration's online rate was $80, which I would not have wanted to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Tried to stick my in a dump of a room”
Reviews.Author: angienti
Reviews.Content: I got a really good rate for this hotel on 12/26/08 - 12/30/08 of $79/night, plus a $30 meal credit. I arrived at the hotel and check in went OK. Was given room 6101. The door to the room looked like people had just used their feet to push it open. It was very, very dirty! The carpet in the room was filthy and did not even go all the way to the walls. No baseboards. The remote didn't work, they sent a new one. The safe did not work, and could not be fixed. I was told there were no more rooms available and I would have to bring any valuables to the front desk and put them in the safe there. There was no internet connection, I mean no wires at all, in the room. They sent me a cable, but there was nothing to connect it to. After wasting about 2 hours of my time in this room I decided I it was not worth the $79/night rate. I went to the front desk to have the room removed from my card. The manager would not come out and speak to me, the girl who checked me in finally asked if she could assist me. She found me another room which was a much nicer room and more of what I was expecting. It was at this point that the manager finally showed her face, but no apologies from the management at all. I did receive very good service from the young lady who checked me in. I wish I had wrote her name down. The new room was fine except for two days straight I did not get any clean wash cloths. Another day no coffee cups. I didn't complain about this because I figured it would"t do any good. The main door to the building was only locked that 1st night. Anyone from the street had access into our building. I was assured the door would be locked each night at dusk. We never got back to the hotel until 11:00 pm or after at night and it was only locked that one time. I am a grandmother and was traveling with two 11 year old girls, so this was a big concern for me. This is the first time I have ever wrote a review about a hotel. I always use Tripadvisor to check out a hotel before I book and I really thought this one time the hotel was overrated. I felt I had to give a review. On a positive note the pool area and the food we ordered with the meal credit was great. The ladies working the pool area were great. We did however have an extra charge on our bill for food that had been charged to my room by mistake. Was able to get this straightened out during checkout. A combination of all the things above is what made this a terrible stay. I will not stay with them again, nor would I recommend this hotel to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: mutiger97
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just go back for a quick trip to Orlando to visit the Disney parks over MLK weekend. I pricelined our hotel for $40 per night at the Radisson Resort - Celebration. We stayed in room 2115. While it was on the ground floor and near an entrance, the room was nice and we didn't have any problem with any outside noise. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. The lobby of the hotel was updated and the pool looked very nice (too cold for us to try it out though). I thought it was a great location for those visiting Disney parks - it was only a few miles away. Also there were plenty of restaurants close by. FYI - there was also a $11.30 per day resort fee. This fee covered a shuttle to some of the area parks and daily activities at the hotel. The shuttle only ran a few times a day - so I'd still recommend getting a rental car if you don't want to be on the shuttle's schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, no way a 3 star...Motel 6 may be better”
Reviews.Author: Ravens67
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline for Disney's marathon weekend. After reading some of the reviews, I thought it would be hit or miss. When I arrived, the lobby area was great. I thought that it couldn't be that bad. Boy was I wrong. I was in building 1000. When I opened the door to the building from the parking lot side, I realized how old this building was: chipped paint, worn carpets, old doors. I get to my room, open the door and the worst smell of mold and mildew. I could not believe it. I asked if I could get another room and I was told there was nothing else available. The bed was hard as a rock. There were controls to supposely make the beds softer, but they did not work. Even the remote control for the TV didn't work. The chairs were filthy and the telephone was dusty. To top things off, on day two, a roach runs across the floor. It was the only one I saw. Not sure if that's because I decided to keep a light on all the time. If I had to guess, I was in the priceline section of the hotel. That's the only way I can explain why some have a good experience. The resort has several building and maybe some are older and worse shape than others. With the price I paid there priceline for this hotel plus their daily resort fee, I could have gotten something much better on my own.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: tewks
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Celebration is a mediocre property. Altough the grounds are nice, the pools are good and the lay out of the property is well done, there are just too many smaller things wrong to think of this as more than a poor excuse for a Radisson. The lobby area -- including fast food and coffee availability -- is fine. The rooms leave a lot to be desired. For instance, my room in the 2000 building had no tv remote, a very loud air conditioner, a coffeemaker that didn't work properly, they only provided decaf coffee, the newspaper that was supposed to be at the room never was, and the room is outdated and in need of updating. My package included the breakfast buffet (which is $18 otherwise!). It was pretty sad. Was there four mornings, and never did find anything decent to eat. Hard pancakes, tasteless sausage gravy, lukewarm bacon and sausage. It was nice to have it included in my package, but not anything i would have paid for. This is close to the Disney parks, and there is a convenience store within walking distance. But, if you're going to pay more than about $50/night, you'd be best to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: littlebit0863
Reviews.Content: I don't agree with the negative reviews. Check in to check out we were treated with nothing but hospitality. Our room did have the mildew smell that other people complained about, but it was nothing to fuss over. After the first five minutes I didn't even notice it. Our room was very clean. The hotel had an impressive lobby, a BEAUTIFUL pool, as well as a smaller heated pool, and the hot tub was near our room and very nice after a long day at Disney. The hotel did have various daily activities, but it rained every day of our stay, so I don't know if they still went on. I do feel the $12 resort fee was a waste of money, but it wasn't at all hidden. Hotwire mentioned the fee, as did every hotel website I saw, and there was a huge sign in the lobby about the fee. On top of that, you had to sign a paper upon check in about the fee. So I don't know what's going on with the people who said it was a surprise. My one complaint is that we ordered room service and it was TERRIBLE. The worst food I have ever eaten. We ended up having to walk down to a local restaurant and eat, feeling sad about the $60 we just wasted on room service. So I would not recommend eating at the hotel. The hotel buses to the park ran right on schedule, with no problems at all. I felt they were a great deal, but I wish they had a few more running times like the Disney hotels do. All in all, it's a great value, and I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations, and not nearly as bad as other reviews suggested”
Reviews.Author: Bonbonmontreal
Reviews.Content: We got this room via Priceline, after bidding $35/night for a 5 night stay approx 10 days before Christmas. In our opinion (two parents and a young child), it's a legtimate 3 to 3.5 star hotel. When we read the spate of bad reviews on this website and others, we started to panic a little bit. However, when we arrived and got to our room (on the 8th floor of the "6000" building), our concerns were greatly assuaged. The room and carpet were clean and in good shape (e.g. no chips, dents, stains, tears, etc. anywhere) and it was appropriately spacious for a single king-size bed. It did not have any of the musty or unpleasant odors others have described. The bathroom was on the small side, and it was cramped if one person was in the shower while the other was at the sink. The complimentary toiletries were refreshed daily, but weren't especially impressive. The room and bathroom were cleaned appropriately every day. Parking was free and adjacent to the building. There was complimentary high-speed internet service in the room, and there was also an on-site business center where documents could be printed for free. We had little opportunity to interact with the staff aside from during check-in and check-out, when we found them professional and courteous. They were aware of the bad reviews on tripadvisor and asserted that they'd made sincere efforts to improve. Again, we didn't see any of the bad things others have described. We did not visit any of the restaurants or the swimming pools, though they looked just fine. The hotel is less than 15 min. drive from all of the DisneyWorld attractions (our reason for the visit).

Reviews.Title: “Poor 3 star”
Reviews.Author: Oudec
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a conference. First impressions were good with a very nice foyer, beautiful xmas tree and a pleasant receptionist. However, rooms were more like motel rooms and could do with some serious updating. Word of warning to anybody who likes to go to bed early, if your room is anywhere near the pool, stay up! The pool area is open until 11pm and we were kept awake every night by excited children running around the pool area and screaming at the top of their voices. Apparently there was some kind of cheerleaders contest in the area and I think most of them were staying at this hotel. The adults werent much better! We would never stay here again. Its a 2 star hotel at best.

Reviews.Title: “Another Excellent Radisson For The Deal”
Reviews.Author: Bigbroad555
Reviews.Content: I booked my families stay (3 Rooms) for Thanksgiving Week, my deal was 94.00 a night plus the 11.30 resort fee and in return for each night we stood in the hotel we received 25.00 food vouchers for each night to use anywhere on the resort property even for room service which was a wonderful help. The resort has 3 pools the first is not heated and has a slide the second directly behind it on the other side is bath warm water, also a kiddie wadding pool which is not heated and 2 HOT 104 degrees whirl pools which one has a water fall the other does not which both are wonderful. There is also a Tiki Bar and Pool food serice and a game room. Also in the 11.30 extra charge is kids activites by the pool, so grown ups can relaxe and kids can play and win prizes The restuarant is wonderful they also take care of the room service which is quickly delivered. Did I tell you the KIDS EAT FREE PROGRAM ? Kids eat free at any buffett and sit down Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner also included is drink, except if it is a Holiday Special Buffett then you have to pay. We paid 19.99 per adult and 9.99 per child 5 and up for the Thanksgiving Buffett which was wonderful. The restuarant is directly by the heated pool and building 6000. The resort also has a fitness room, computer room, lounge bar which has low cost food, also a store to buy things. Also the resort has a deli in which you can get Star Bucks and PIzza Hut and many more items. On the property is also a tennis court and playground. If you enter the resort buildings after dusk you need to use your key for the room or no entry which is an added security. Ice on each floors, soda machines & laundry as well. Not that hard to check in or check out. The beds are a little hard, the rooms are clean and also cleaned daily. Towels are also replenished daily as well. Roll in beds are a little soft but the rooms have cold air conditioners and also heat. Rooms are wonderful only thing they need to upgrade beds from doubles to queens. When I return I will ask for buildig 6000 it is closer to EVERYTHING.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel....terrible beds”
Reviews.Author: melinda1050
Reviews.Content: Wasn't the best first impression, when we arrived at 2am, hotel had just had a fire and they had NO power. We were not able to check in so had to find another hotel for that evening. Went back later that day, they still were having issues but we were able to check in. Beware of $10 daily resort fee! Room was good, clean, somewhat small, but the beds are horrible. They are hard as a rock. Not what you need when you come in from all day parks. Pools were nice, staff less then friendly but other then that, good for the money, if you use priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Way above what we expected for the price.”
Reviews.Author: jayburtch0922
Reviews.Content: Place was very clean, staff was as nice and polite as anywhere we have ever stayed. It had several pools waterslide and spas with poolside bars and food. You can not beat the location you are with in 5 minutes of everything and there are at least 50 resteraunts with in 5 min. Only complaint is the beds where a little hard but I would give it a 9.5 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Trip4Us
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Radisson Resort Orlando Celebration for a short birthday/anniversary getaway from Oct 31, thru Nov 3, 2008 in bldg 1000 room 1404. I read some reviews prior to our trip on this site and have to say that I enjoyed my stay at this location despite the mixed reviews that I read prior to my departure. The room was clean and neat without stains, dirt or odor and had a nice view over the pool. The beds were comfortable, it had a decent sized refrigerator, a password programmable safe, and plug in internet access was free. The staff was professional, helpful, and assisted us in a timely manner whenever we needed them. There is a small fitness center on site that is available for use but can get pretty crowded if you are a morning workout person. We did not eat on site as there were many options to choose from to and from our daily destinations. There is a little store in the main lobby where you can purchase coffee, snacks, adult beverages and such, but I advise you to purchase your adult refreshments elsewhere because of prices. Overall this was a nice place to stay. I recommend this to travelers who want a quick getaway in a great location close to all the attractions and don't want to spend $$$$$. The Radission Resort Orlando-Celebration is a nice hotel with nice grounds and pretty centered around everything you may want to experience during an Orlando Florida break.

Reviews.Title: “a little dated but perfectly acceptable”
Reviews.Author: TarbyEssex
Reviews.Content: Me, the wife and our three kids (15,11 & 7) have just returned from a ten day stay at the Radisson. We stayed here on our previous visit to the parks 3 years ago and didn't hesitate in returning there again. Yes the hotel is a little dated and could probably do with some refurbishment but it was kept very clean and the service we received was excellent. We asked in advnace for adjoining rooms, which we got. All the bar staff were very amenable and remembered our orders after the first day. The food in the bar was simple but very good. The main pool water was cold, but we didn't get much of a chance to get in there anyway as we were at the parks every day. Overall as a base for doing the parks you can't go wrong with the Radisson. If you are looking for somewhere to spend time relaxing by the pool there are probably other hotels that will be better suited.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy”
Reviews.Author: MSPilot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a room through Priceline at this Radisson on a whim. We really didn't think we'd get anything for the incredibly low price we named, and were pleasantly surprised to learn our bid had been accepted. That would be the last time we experienced anything but regret regarding this hotel. We checked in rather late at night and went straight to our room. It was filthy! There was a used water bottle lying on the floor, in addition to tons of other bits of trash lying around. There were 3 phones, all unplugged, laying on the chair, the nightstand and the desk (???), and the bed was not neatly made. We called down for a new room after getting one of the phones plugged in. The next room was better, but certainly did not meet our standards of basic cleanliness. There was mold and mildew in the bathroom, and you could tell by looking at the faucet that they never cleaned around it. The floor was very clearly not cleaned well. We had read complaints about parking, but after the first night there was always plenty available (but it is the low season). We spent as little time as we could in the room, and we were both pretty grossed out by the place in general. Hotels in Orlando do see a lot of traffic, but if they put a little more into upkeep and basic cleaning, the place wouldn't be in the terrbile shape it's in (let's be honest: how do you miss a water bottle lying on the floor if you're actually cleaning it??). We will never use Priceline again after they sent us to this dump and called it a 3-star, and we will NEVER stay at this hotel again. As a frequent traveler (I'm a pilot and spend 150+ nights per year in hotels), I have come to find that the Radisson brand as a general rule can be counted on to disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hikingmood
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson the week of October 21. We booked via Priceline and were a bit leary of the place given many of the poor reviews. The first room we were given was fairly well-worn and not the cleanest. There was a foil candy wrapper (like on a Hershey's Kiss) on the floor, and the bathroom smelled musty. We also were not pleased about the lack of wireless internet in our room - this is only available in some buildings. We asked to be switched to a building with wireless and the front desk gladly accommodated our request. After switching rooms, it seemed we were in a different hotel. Not five star by any stretch, but comfortable. The room was very clean, and there were no musty smells. With regard to amenities, we did use the wireless internet with no problems. Also, the multiple pools and hot tub were nice. We did not use the Disney shuttles - the times didn't work for us. We wouldn't have a problem staying here again, though next time we visit Orlando we'll probably get a condo.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: clevelandstever
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, and hotel grounds were very nice. However they decided to paint a room across the hall one day during my stay, and my room stank of chemicals that entire day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience for the Price”
Reviews.Author: AmishRob
Reviews.Content: I used Priceline "Name your own price" and got this hotel for $35 per night for 3 nights. The total price including all taxes and resort fees came to $160.90, or $53.63 per night. This was an incredible bargain! Just about every part of our experience was positive. 1) CHECK-IN: Check-in was a breeze with Doris, who I had spoken to the day before to confirm that everything was in order. 2) CLEANLINESS: Our room (3204) was clean and typically appointed for this class of hotel. 3) LANDSCAPING/POOLS: The grounds are nicely landscaped, and the 3 pools and 2 hot-tubs (one with a waterfall) were beautiful. 4) FOOD: We only ate in the deli, but the food was good and the service was fast and friendly. The price for a hot breakfast was not really higher than you would find most other places. 5) SAFETY: Hotel staff seemed to be present all of the time, adding to a sense of safety. On our first night I forgot to unlock the deadbolt when we left, and the door was never fully shut. However, our room was completely undisturbed when we returned 4-5 hours later. 6) STAFF: We were always treated with respect by the staff, who tried their best to answer our questions and accommodate our needs. 7) PROXIMITY: The hotel is very close to a decent selection of restaurants heading south on 192. We did not visit any Disney theme parks, but Downtown Disney was only 10 minutes away (less than 5 miles) and Universal was less than 30 minutes away. Although this was just a getaway for my wife and me, I think our kids would love staying here as well in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Disney, Universal, and SeaWorld trips”
Reviews.Author: marmotsgrl
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Celebration was full of good and some bad things for us. My Husband and I stayed for 10 days this past October 2008. Our main reason for staying here was that it was close to Disney and the other attractions in the Orlando area. We started out in the 1000 building on the first floor. VERY humid in this section. We thought it was because we are from a very dry state and it was something that we just had to deal with. Sheets on bed being moist and clothes always feeling wet. I couldn't take it any more so I called the front desk and asked them if there was a room that was not so humid. We were moved to building 4000 on the 4th floor and it was 100% better. The rooms may have a joining room door for larger families that want to get 2 rooms but the doors are not very sound proof and you can hear what movie your neighbor is watching at 11:00pm! Bring ear plugs. The Sleep Number beds are fantastic. I always have a hard time sleeing at hotels because the beds are too hard but not here. I slept very well. We had to ask for towels 3 times and they seem to be slow on the room cleanings. We came back at around 3:30pm and they still had not finished room. The restaurant is expensive but the food is pretty good. The Deli is also expensive but decent food in a hurry. The concierge desk was helpful by helping us get discount tickets to SeaWorld and free breakfast but it will cost you half a day of listening to time share information. To be fair this seems to be a common thing in the Orlando area. So be prepared when you ask the concierge desk anything! The pools are nice. There is a nice waterfall and you are surrounded by palm trees. There is a water slide for the kids. There is a warmer pool and 2 hot tubs. The buildings are secure at night- you have to have a room key to get into the buildings. There seems to be adequate parking and it is free. That is also a bonus. Overall I would say that we enjoyed our stay and the hotel provided what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “If you can get a deal, stay here”
Reviews.Author: SouthFLmom
Reviews.Content: I would probably stay here again, though there were some problems. Reception was professional, but the counter where you receive your coupons has a hard sell for free breakfast and cash for listening to a sales pitch; we declined. Room #3321 was clean with updated bedding and decor; however, the bath tile desperately needs to be re-grouted, there was no bath mat provided, and the shower curtain is insufficient for keeping in the shower spray. We did not have a Sleep Number bed, and the standard mattresses were way too firm. I did not get a good night's sleep because of the hard mattress. There is a mini-fridge in the room, so we were able to eat cereal and milk for breakfast. Housekeeping took away all our wet towels but did not supply fresh ones, so we called at 11 PM and someone brought them immediately. The pool area with water slide was great fun for our kids. Parking was no problem during our stay (Sep 27–29). We did not eat on-site or use the shuttle; we drove to EPCOT, which was a very quick car ride away. Yes, there is an $11 resort fee per room per day, but this is fairly standard in Orlando. For forty-nine bucks on hotwire, this was a good deal; I probably wouldn't pay full price, though.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average for Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: thehappycamper13
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through a discount with Mousesavers. The deal we got was pretty good for a 3.5 star so we went with it. We've stayed all over Kissimmee and this hotel is really not bad, although I would say no more than a 3 star. We are staying there again through a deal booked at hotwire in a couple weeks. I will say that the first room we were assigned was unfortunately not clean, so my husband complained and they assigned us a different room which was much better and had a great view of the pool as well. Neither room was smelly. My only real complaint about the hotel in general (once we got into our 2nd room) was the parking. Now its highly possible that we were there at a busy time or conventions were going on or something along those lines, but when we would return at the end of the night from Disney, there would be absolutely NO parking left. We'd drive around and find nothing. And the place is huge, there's a few buildings (I think we were in #6) and apparently not enough parking for the number of rooms available. I'm not kidding on this, we don't mind walking in from the end of the row, but there was nothing! We did eventually find a spot in front of a building pretty far from ours, but its no fun at the end of a long day. All in all, I think it is worth the money if you can get a good deal, but not at full price. If you want better than this one, book a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson ok as a base in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Coltonvic
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Wotif.com as it seemed to be the best location outside of Disneyworld but in the vicinity. Because everything is so spread out in Orlando, being nearby doesnt really mean anything. The shuttle services provided are required to get about everywhere and you really dont get a sense of being "nearby". We arrived at midnight, and were keen to get to our room after a long flight. It took 3 attempts to provide us with the room configuratuion that we had booked. This was all done without argument, it just would have been more helpful, at that hour to get the right room first up. There is little assistance available to help with luggage, something we found at many hotels across America. The Radisson factors in additional charges for phone service, whether you use the phone or not and organising activities, something you dont see or use. So you need to factor in these costs when making the booking and comparing various properties at the outset. Our room was clean and comfortable and the beds have the ability for each side to be made softer or firmer by the touch of a button. A bit gimmicky, but very comfortable. The grounds and pool area are attractive and well kept. The staff are friendly and helpful. The restaurant offerings are linited but tasty and fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Watch for hidden costs! Do not Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: mollymacToronto
Reviews.Content: I was expecting something great after seeing the pictures on the website - but looks are definitely deceiving! I got charged $11.32 per night for a roll away cot I requested, but on top of that there was an 11.32 service fee per night for using it! That's $22.64 a day! The kicker was that the room was so small we couldnt even open the cot or we wouldn't have been able to use the bathroom or get out the front door in an emergency so we had 3 people sleeping in one bed! I was told by the front desk that I should have read the sign indicating the service fee, but I had thought that was for the cot, the prices were exactly the same, I think it is done just to confuse the consumer. Will never go back, definitley mars the good name of Radisson, defintely not a "resort", room was musty as stated by others.

Reviews.Title: “An ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: evenoelle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just like a lot of other hotels in very popular areas...a little worn from the constant traffic. We were in the 5000 building and never experienced the musty smell that other reviewers here mentioned. The room we received was fine - needs a little updating and the carpet could sure use some cleaning - but there was really nothing major to complain about as far as the room goes. It seemed to be a very busy hotel and the parking lot was quite crowded. My husband has a disabled placard but all the spaces were occupied. We had to park quite far from our building and in the parking lot, it seems the farther away you get from the buildings, the darker it gets. We parked where there were no light whatsoever. A little spooky to say the least. The layout of the hotel is a little confusing as well. Once you leave the reception area and drive to your building (yes I said drive - it is a HUGE property) - the road you are supposed to go down is not clearly marked and it seems as though you are going down a narrow alley. It certainly could use a sign or two directing guests in the right direction. We also got lost inside the hotel as the buildings don't go straight in a row 2000 - 3000- 4000 - 5000...thankfully there are signs along the way so you can navigate. Finally - I was prepared for the "surprise" added resort fee that many have mentioned here. We were told that the $11 fee covered transportation to the theme parks, the use of the pool, refrigerators in the room, and activities around the resort (and a few other things I can't recall) - NONE of which we were going to use. We were told it didn't matter if we used them or not, that the fee was charged to everyone. Seems to me it would make more sense ro charge $11 more a day for the room than to make people mad by adding an extra charge after-the-fact. It wasn't a horrible experience, however, I am not sure we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Skeetersmum
Reviews.Content: I had read a lot of reviews regarding this particular hotel online and was a little apprehensive before I arrived. I was in Orlando to attend an IT conference and was unable to get a room at the venue for the conference so I "settled" for the Radisson as it was close to that venue. But, guess what? Yes, the room smelled moldy, but this is Florida and those particular type of ac units don't seem to take the humidity out of the air like the "central" units. The room was spotless and every single day the maids made sure it was spotless. Yes, it smelled like mold, but I looked EVERYWHERE and could find none, none at all. The staff was friendly and efficient, the Italian restaurant's food was excellent and there seemed to be a lot of families having a great time. My only complaint would be lack of parking. They really need assigned parking next to the particular building you are booked into. It is a huge complex and women travelling alone for business should be able to park closer to their particular building when they have to come back in the dark. Assigned parking would resolve that issue because the complex is huge and the parking on the other side was just about empty even though there was a huge building on that side. My assumption is that people were parking where they felt like, regardless of the building they were in. Again..ASSIGNED parking. Then they would be just about perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Did the Job”
Reviews.Author: chris120
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed @ the Radisson for 2 weeks whilst visitng Disney / Universal, mainly for the loaction close to Disney. We were a bit worried about some of the reviews but went for it. Entered the room and we could smell a foisty smell as has been well documented in numerous reports. The main problem are the buildings / rooms are totally air conditioned with no natural ventilation. Question : Where is the smell coming from ? ...... Probable answer .... Bathroom - Change the Shower Curtain !! We called and within 5 Minutes the smell had gone and problem resolved. Do not leave damp towells / swimming items lying around as they will not get properly dry. Leave them in the car (as it gets v. hot) to dry and keep going down a couple of times to shake & air and they will be dry in no time. Don't leave in damp / wet items the room. They won't get dry !! Turn left out of the hotel and there are a few restaurants about but we found drinks were a bit expensive but the food was great. Worth a walk over to the Celebration WaterTower area as there was a great Chinese next to an Irish Bar. If you fancy going under the 417, you will find Logans which do a nice well priced steaks and beers as well. There was another one called Brannigans (I think) which did a fantastic Burger and Beer. There are also numerous fast food places if required. We enjoyed the Hotel and surroundings and any issues were dealt with promptly and efficiently. The pool area & bar was fine with a pitcher of beer and Chicken Wings for $12. We really didn't use the Pool as we went to Typhoon / Blizzard but when we did we enjoyed. The staff were very helpful and professional and we would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “was a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: funkyfal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 28th june- 12th july and had no problems whatsoever. When i read the reviews i was really worried as i was getting married here, but none of them were true. The hotel staff were really friendly and were really helpful. The rooms were comfortable and didnt smell of damp or mildrew. I got married in this hotel and i wouldnt change a thing as it was the most prefect day. If you are worried about going here after reading these reviews i wouldnt worry. I would most defintely go back again as the area is nice and there are some really lovely resturants across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Ill-advised on the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: alohagirl62
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the Radisson June 29th - 30th, 2008 through a promotion rate linked through Mousesavers.com that raved this was a good place to stay. What they didn't add was - if you had no standards in your choice of a place to sleep at night. The second we walked into the building 6000 that our room was located in stunk of wet, moldy mildew and of course our room did too. Coming from someone who's family business is in Restoration (fires, water damage), it smelled like there had been severe flooding and the clean up was not as complete as it should have been. It may look cleaned up on the outside but inside where mold and bacteria are unseen is the big worry. Needless to say, it set the tone for what it felt like to be in the room. It felt dirty and unclean. None of us unpacked as we were afraid our clothes would pick up the mildewy smell, not to mention the worry of the cleanliness of the room. The front desk people were pleasant when I requested a new room but were a little confused when I told them the reason why. I suspect they probably have no idea what the rooms are really like past the front desk. She was going to put me in a room directly across from ours and I needed to repeat that the whole building smelled and could we please be put in another buidling. She put us in building 1000 and it was the same problem. The $79.00 rate I stayed at was great but was it because of the condition of the place? I understand that people are on a budget but I also believe they should get an honest heads up on this place so they know what they are getting into. That way their decision is made on knowing all there is to know! I let the hotel know of my dissapointment. And I let the above mentioned website know the results of my stay, with no response and today I get an email from them about a great rate to stay at the Radisson. They still raved about it!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Charges & Kids DON'T eat for free here- WATCH OUT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: koetssm
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after checking out their website and finding what we thought was a good deal thru a travel website. The hotel was nice on the inside. The pools were also nice, even though the hottub wasn't on a few times we tried to go to it. We were extremely disappointed about 2 items. First, we were told that "kids eat free". Well, that was ONLY at Mandolins (the most expensive restaurant there) and would only get a free kid's meal with each adult meal you purchased. Second, we were charged "entertainment charges" for poolside music and games, which were geared toward older kids...ours were only 5 & 3. So they did not partake in any poolside games. Out of the 9 days we were there, we used the pool 1 time for 3 hours. And we were charged about $11 extra a day for something we only used 1 day. Ridiculous!!! We were also NEVER told about these charges ahead of time, even though we called the hotel twice before arrival. We complained when checking out and called again when we got home, asking for this charge to be credited to our card, and they refused. We will never stay at this hotel again!!! Definitely not worth staying off Disney property!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed, noisy late night parties”
Reviews.Author: sstayner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from June 21 - 29. Pros: Comfortable beds Clean Hotel Room Close to Disney - if driving Pool area is nice Cons: Workout room has poorly maintained equipment Disney Shuttle is infrequent, so you really need a car Extra $11/day resort fee - waste of money unless you are really going to use the pools/shuttle Loud guests in the pool late at night I have mixed feelings regarding this hotel. We selected this hotel because all of the "Moderate" Disney resorts were booked when we made our reservations and we thought this would be better than the economy Disney resort hotel. Given the same circumstances, I would choose to book at an economy Disney resort - which would have been less money- simply because we did not spend time at the hotel. Perhaps if the crowd had been a little tamer, we would have spent more time at the hotel pool. Another option would be the Radisson hotel near Downtown Disney. It is newer, costs less money and is closer to Disney transportation with more frequent shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Great price”
Reviews.Author: hammkse
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value! It has beautiful landscaping, a great restaurant with a nice breakfast buffet, 24 hour internet on the computers in their business center, shuttle to theme parks, walking distance to a few restaurants and gift shops, and the room was clean and comfortable. All for under $150/night! Only complaints: Housekeeping left no face towels one day and no hand towels the next day. And there are no shuttles between noon and 5pm.

Reviews.Title: “the best deal”
Reviews.Author: alexia05
Reviews.Content: this hotel was a great deal. for the money we paid it was definitely worth it. nice pool nice work out center, nice room. remember what you pay for must meet expectations. this hotel was not one of those fancy five stars but for what it was we definitely got a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasently Surprised!!”
Reviews.Author: joeski01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson for a nearby training conference. I had no choice in this hotel and was concerned after reading reviews telling of mold and mildew problems. Upon check-in I voiced my concern to management and stated I had allergys and a slight asthma problem. They took my concern seriously and made sure I had a room that I was happy with, (which was the first one they gave me!). I had one problem while there and it was addressed without hesitation. The only little complaint I have is the resort fee they charge, a bottle of water is supposed to be included in the mini fridge each day as part of the fee and it was only provided on the first day. I was up and running early in the morning and too late at night to bother about this item. Overall, I recommend this hotel. Also, it has free parking, many of the hotels in this area are starting to charge for parking, which is a crock!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: XC31
Reviews.Content: Thips place is horrible dont go there. The hotel employes are not professional at all. When we check in they didnt tolled me that they will charge me extra $11.30 for each night i was staying there when i check out thats when they tolled me. One more thing is that they said they have ticktes for Magic Kingdom and they are less than what they chagring at the gate hotel price is $192 and the gate price was $147. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room at Radisson Celebration”
Reviews.Author: fpsunny16
Reviews.Content: Had booked a room on Priceline for the Radisson Worldgate but was informed shortly before my trip to Orlando that the Worldgate was older, outdated and the rooms were a disaster. So, scrambling at last minute, I contacted a friend who know's the Kissimmee area. He suggested, Radisson Celebration.... I was pleasantly surprised with my room. I had the most comfortable sleep number bed and my room was very clean and spacious. I also had a slight view of the pool area. The pool was wonderful and room service was prompt. The only complaint I have is the parking lot... Depending upon what building you are staying in, it can be a bit of a pain to get around the building and then walk quite a ways to get to the elevators... Overall a great experience and would recommend this hotel. I would definitely stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “family fun”
Reviews.Author: CCURN1
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a wonderful time at the Radisson celebration. The hotel staff was exceptionally friendly all through the hotel. The pools were fabulous; we watched Happy Feet movie by the heated pool, and played games at the other. Beautifully landscaped! Our room was cleaned everyday, and we had no problems. I have to admit that there needs to be some updating to the rooms, but the hospitality of the staff was soo good we didn't care. The shuttle bus service is great, and if you do miss one going to the parks, the bellman will get you a town car. We actually rented a town car to Celebration for dinner for 10$. The Mandolins restaurant on site is great as well. The Tiki hut by the pool has great staff, who makes the best drinks. You can order food as well. We had the pork barbecue sandwich, excellent is all I can say. I hope whoever reads this finds this review helpful. Nothing in this world is perfect, but we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for the parks.”
Reviews.Author: spihandwestie2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson 1-8 May 08. We were somewhat apprehensive on arrival after reading some very negative reviews. However the check in went without a hitch and our room was pretty good. We knew that we wouldn't be in the hotel much as we were doing the Disney parks, Seaworld etc, so we were up and out early and back late. However, we experienced none of the problems highlighted in other reviews, i.e. musty smells, dodgy aircon etc. Yes the hotel could do with a face lift from the 70/80's into the 21st century decor wise; but that is all superficial. My one criticism would be the carpet in the room good have done with a good clean. That said, we never walk barefoot in hotels, as you don't know who was there before you; different people have very different standards. The bed (not a sleep number) was very comfortable; again a personal thing. The room was cleaned daily, towels replenished etc and there was no problems. I used the Pizza Hut downstairs once and my pizza was delicious. The hotel is quite large and spread over several buildings. It is set in landscaped grounds, which are very well kept. Some of the ponds have fish and turtles in them, and there are feed dispensers (10cents) so you can feed the fish etc. The inbound car park barrier (not a gate as some discribe) never worked whilst we were there, but it is there to control traffic and not people. The hotel is ideally situated just off the 192 and just down from the I4, so getting around, assuming you have a hire car, is a breeze; once you get your head around navigating amidst a plethora of advertising signs of all shapes and sizes. Sometimes, trying to find the road signs was a challenge - but it was the first time I had driven in the States. Eating out is easy with a huge selection of eateries catering for all tastes a short drive away, whilst some are within easy walking distance. In summary we found the hotel clean and comfortable for our needs. After a day in the parks we were shattered and didn't explore the hotel that much. Maybe not for a relaxing hotel stay, but as a base for the parks it is ideal, and certainly nowhere near as bad as some have made out.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: needsmorevacation
Reviews.Content: I have to say I was really scared about this hotel after reading all the reviews and our stay here (we booked on hotwire and didn’t choose the place only the star level). However our 7 night stay was fine and had no glitches. I agree the room decor could use a little updating and the bathrooms are a little on the small side but I wouldn't say it’s enough to give it a bad review. Here's the main thing, the hotel was clean, the staff was nice and helpful and most importantly minutes to the Disney world!! We had two bookings and unfortunately they couldn't put us in the same room for both reservations. However the bellman took our luggage down and when we came back from a day at the park our luggage was waiting for us in our new room. In other reviews it was stated that the security gate was never down and we too experienced this, during our stay at this hotel but it never concerned me and at no time did we ever feel unsafe. Never used the restaurant or even went to the lobby other than to check in and out so can't comment on the deli/pizza hut place. I didn't go to the pool but my husband did say that the side with slide was cold, but the other one was fine. Here's the biggest part we booked our stay on hotwire and got a great deal at $60 a night. We come from Hollywood CA, and out here you can only get dumps for that price!
