So at that price our stay was fantastic and better than I could have imagined. Now if I paid the $120+ a night my opinion on the Radisson would be a lot different. Like a lot of other people all we really did was sleep there so quiet, clean and comfortable is all that I need and we found all of that here. Not to mention that the hotel is next to a bunch of restaurants and Walgreens (we used for snacks and waters). The resort fee was a little annoying but we had a rental car so at least we used that aspect of it....but I could see why people would be angered with that. Will we stay here again.....no, but not because we didn't like it but more because now that we've been to that area we've seen all the other hotels we are interested in trying out.

Reviews.Title: “OK but”
Reviews.Author: EssexGirl34
Reviews.Content: Having read previous adverse reviews I found the hotel better than I expected. My room was clean, bedding changed every day. The remote for the bed adjustment was laying on the pillow but unfortunately it wasn't plugged in. The hotel generally could do with a good makeover - its not what I expected from a Radisson. The outdoor areas were OK. I used the Mandolin for buffet breakfast one day but by the time I sat down the food was cold no doubt due to the cold plates. I had cause to ask directions from the concierge (female) but she wasn't very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasently Surprised”
Reviews.Author: ClrwtrDisneyMomma
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a one night stay at the Radisson Resort Orlando - Celebration. After reading the reviews on here I was apprehensive but decided to book it anyway. We got a great rate thru Mousesavers and their review of the resort sounded good. I was swayed by the fact that it would only be one night, it was a good deal, the pool with slide and waterfall would be fun for my son and the deal came with a free "Authentic Disney Gift." At check in we forgot to mention the gift and they didn't offer it, but a quick call from our room fixed that. I was expecting a small trinket for my son, they brought up a toy, straight out of the Disney parks, with its $30 price tag still attached. My son was THRILLED with it. That was the first plus. We were given a room in the 6000 building. It did have a strong perfume-y smell but it wasn't terrible. My husband and I are both sensitive to strong smells and cannot take cigarette smoke but we weren't bothered enough by this smell to ask to be moved. The room was clean. We got a sleep number bed, worth every penny of the extra $10 charge. Our only complaints were that the toilet would run if you didn't 'jiggle the handle' and the faucet in the shower dripped. The pool area was VERY nice. My son enjoyed the slide enough to not be bothered by the cold temperature. They played a movie on a large screen by one of the smaller pools the night we were there. And during the day they have a very friendly man doing airbrush tatoos, 2 for $5 ~ a MUCH better deal than you'll find in any of the parks! One other minor complaint is that the pool bar closed at 8pm. Hardly a big deal though. Overall we we very satisfied with our stay and definitely plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Definately Not A 3 Star”
Reviews.Author: Floridacracker17
Reviews.Content: The room was overall ok, except the air conditioner made horrendous noise turning on and off. The hallways and lobby smelled moldy. After asking for non feather pillows once, two hours later they were still not delivered and had to call them 3 times before they were brought up (3 hours later). Empty food cartons, and old food plates were left in hallway for long periods of time. In fact, I watched the housekeeping manager walk by and kick the old pizza carton to the side instead of having the 3 housekeepers in the hall at the time pick it up. Food was terrible and service was brought with a grumpy demeanor. Most of the employees , except at check in , acted as if they really hated their jobs. The only upside I could see was if you had a family of children then they would enjoy the pool and pool games. Otherwise, if you are a couple, or single business person, I say choose another hotel with better food and cheerful servers!

Reviews.Title: “50/50”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous133
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our family holiday to Radisson (10 of us) Like many others - having read the reviews was very concerned about what i would find. This hotel was OK - not as bad as some people say - the lifts are run down - the decor is in need of a face lift - the lobby is well presented and the surrounding gardens and pool are very good. Ate at Mandolins for breakfast first couple of days not bad, good value for money and friendly staff but after a few days the smell from the restaurant (cooking/oil etc) turned your stomach. It is also a hot spot for band camp trips - one day there was hundreds of american kids getting breakfast - not great. I cannot deny for an off resort hotel it is well located and with a bit of a revamp would be a very nice hotel. I won't be returning to Radisson but for all you new visitors it isn't as bad as people make out. After all you are only in your rooms for a very short time.

Reviews.Title: “Happy stay at the Radisson Celebration”
Reviews.Author: spqr777
Reviews.Content: Just back from a very nice 2 weeks stay at the Radisson Resort Orlando Celebration, I was at first very worried about this hotel having read the reviews, but I found only 1 to be true. The room smelled mouldy, we found that the solution ws just to leave the A/C on. The room in building 5000 was a nice good size for 2 people and very clean, the bedings and all towels were changed on a daily basis. Also the location of the hotel is fantastic, right on the 192 with easy access to the parks, airport and Florida Turnpike.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LaurenPitterPat
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I just returned from a one-night stay at the Radisson Celebration in Orlando. I chose this hotel because of the recommendation and special pricing through mousesavers. However, I wish I'd paid more attention to the reviews on TripAdvisor! The hotel appears to be a nice place in a nice location, but we found the "nice" doesn't extend to the rooms themselves. The first thing we noticed was the smell. Closer inspection revealed a room that was in need of remodeling and updating. Oh, well! We are not picky people, and we told ourselves it was just for one night. We put our stuff in the room and headed out for an evening at Downtown Disney. After thinking of that smell all evening, I decided to ask for another room upon returning. The front desk staff were all very friendly and the change was made quickly - - to the room next door. I had hoped to be moved to another building, perhaps one that is newer and fresher, but that did not happen. We convinced ourselves that it was better, and just went to bed. We awoke early the next morning (not what we'd planned to do on the last day of vacation), and just wanted to leave. The whole experience - the smell, the running toilet, the question of cleanliness (I wore my sandals around the room) - did not lend itself to fond memories that we wanted to extend! My daughter woke up with a headache, which leaves me wondering just what exactly caused the smell. The one bright spot was the view out onto the pool area, which was very pretty from the fifth floor of the 6000 building. This, too, was tainted, though, when a small camera crew set up around the hot tub the next morning. As my daughter and I were preparing to leave, we saw as a beautiful young woman begin to pose on the rocks. Some may have found this to be an exciting bonus. I found it sad and shocking - especially when she took off her top! I am so thankful my teenage son was not with me! And, yes, this was in the public hot tub out in the pool area! The grounds are pretty, the staff helpful and nice, but I would not stay in the hotel again. There are too many choices in the Orlando/Kissimmee area - fresher, newer, nicer properties. I was just very surprised, as I thought Radisson was nicer than this.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelor14
Reviews.Content: I was at the Raddison for 3 nights and was pleased with my stay. When I got there, it took a long time to check in. I was there with a group of many people in several rooms, so that's understandable. The rooms are luxurious and spacious. The lobby has a Starbucks and a Pizza Hut, so that was nice. They have 2 pools and a hot tub which includes a waterfall and waterslide. The continental breakfast was very satisfying. The hotel is a very convenient distance from the Disney parks and includes a Disney gift shop. I did have a problem with the layout of the hotel, I had to walk a far distance and go outside to get to the main lobby. This hotel was nice and I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as people say, but not a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: Linemon
Reviews.Content: Many reviews found for this hotel knock it for moldy, smelly rooms, the assessment fee and security. To start with, I was the unfortunate winner of a stay at this resort via Priceline, bidding on a 3 star hotel, for four nights. 3 it isn't. I was paid in full thru Priceline, but yet the hotel still had the right to charge me the $10/day or $11.30/day with taxes Activity Fee. They even provided a index card with what it covers (daily activities for entire family{dive-in movies, arts & crafts, games, etc}, live entertainment {poolside lobby & Mandolins restaurant}, tableside magic, local phone calls, in room refrig, advance tee time @ Celebration golf and discount Thrifty car rental located on site). Traveling on leisure/business, I was't partaking in any of the activities, wasn't making local calls, wasn't using the refrig, wasn't golfing, and certainly with my Corvette rental from Hertz, I didn't need their piddly Thrifty car rental. The front desk girl said, but you have a refrig? I said I'd unplug it and leave it in the hallway! But to no avail, so off I go fighting with their corporate offices. The parking was abysmal, especially in the north lot behind building 3000? due to the poor lighting, which is where you were forced to park if you returned late. And security, the lot's hard iron gate was locked after say 11, but the automatic arm gate didn't lower after 11 as I was told by the front desk, as other people attested to. The only saving grace is that the exterior doors were locked and needed your room card to get into. The room was clean and neat in building 2000, but had 70's decor with orange and reds in the bed spreads and decorations. Free wired internet access in certain buildings (2000) but wireless in others? The pool and hottub was neat and clean. There were activities during the day for kids and families at the pool, as there was a poker night one night in the lobby. Overall, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: jonatel
Reviews.Content: We a party of 4 (2 adults and 2 kids) spent 3 nights at this hotel. We stayed at Radisson hotels before and always had a good experience. This one was awful. We booked the BB rate. The size of the room was OK .When we checked in there was a Q-tip laying next to the fridge; and it was still there when we moved out.!! We arrived late, the kids went to bed and my husband and myself decided to have a salad at the Restaurant. The salad was not great but it was OK, the service was OK too. When we came into the restaurant there were 3 tables occupied by people; but on many tables were plates with rests of food . A very bad odour was in the restaurant. We thought it came from the tables which were not yet cleaned and decided to return the following day for our breakfast. It was still stinking like the day before; impossible to eat anything We informed the reception and were told that the Catering Manager would take care of. We decided not to have our brekfast there anymore despite our BB rate . I will for sure not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it and left”
Reviews.Author: erinys
Reviews.Content: This was a bid through Priceine, but it was $100 for a room that was normally $129 - just over a 20% discount, not a big loss to the hotel, and to get a Priceline room the hotel has to be projecting that room would otherwise be empty. Was scheduled for 5 days. I arrived and wanted a smoking room. The clerk had to check with her manager, who never appeared in person, three times during the entry process. First she checked and said there weren't any, that part of the hotel was being renovated. And the hotel was "full." It was Priceine, they couldn't be full if I got a room. I said I'd take that area, she checked again and said the manager didn't want me there, it wouldn't be an "enjoyable" stay. Checked with her manager again, suggested they put me in a first floor room, near a door since there was a large penalty for people who smoke in non-smoking rooms. I wasn't pleased but content. IMPORTANT PART FOR NON-SMOKERS: The room reeked of smoke. Lamp shades had been replaced, but walls had tar and one burn, carpet had a couple burns. Immediately called the front desk and advised them it already smelled of smoke, had been smoked in, and I didn't want to be billed for what had already been done, offered to let them check to verify, but they chose not to. Parking lot view, but it was a cheap room and I had "special needs" like being near a door, so that wasn't unreasonable. It won't bother most, but for a smoker to be trapped in a smoky room with threat of fees if you smoke is torture. Returned and took a bath. Bath tub was incredibly shallow. While slid down in tub to get in the water, saw the inside of the sink under the rim was absolutely BLACK with mold. Checked a few more places, including AC unit, also moldy. Already knew I had to leave for one night that was already paid for, so did some priceline bidding for 4* this time, ended up at the Peabody, exactly what I was aiming for, near the convention center for $108/night (had to do valet parking which was $18/night) for two nights, while I continued to pay $100 nightly for the Radisson (this is the danger of Priceline and Hotwire, but I'll still use them, just do my research into previously won hotels and read the RECENT reviews, not just the overall rating). Packed up after one night at the Radisson for what was a two week vacation (I'm a woman, that's a lot of heavy clothes, shoes, and toileties), moved to the Peabody for two nights (absolutely fantastic). Gave the Radisson my complaints, told them it was so bad I was leaving for another hotel for three days, told them I wanted a smoking room in the under reservation section when I returned. The moved to the Peabody before spending a night at a Best Western elsewherefor swimming with manatees (highly recommend with a small group, if you don't harass them, and very educational). Returned for that last night at the Radisson (Peabody was booked with a convention). They'd gotten my complaints, put me in the section under "renovation." It was significantly better. A nicer room (same shallow tub) without mold and gave me a Sleep Number bed which is supposed to be $10 extra. Although there were plants and art missing from the halls, the elevator was a bit inconventient and I ran into workman who were walking once, it was a much nicer experience. So they did resolve my issue for one night's stay The Radisson has a $12.50/night resort fee, which I just tell myself was an internet fee, in addition to the potential Sleep Number fee. I'm ok with the fees, although I wasn't warned about them. I was billed for the fees for the nights I wasn't there, too. I just paid them and was just grateful to be out. Even at full price, this wouldn't have been a ridiculously expensive room, but it isn't a 3 star. At best it's a 2.5, if you don't have a moldy room. The ponds were lovely, but how much time do you spend looking at ponds when in Orlando? The ponds also made it a further walk from parking, inconvenient with a heavy load. Check in was in a separate building, which wasn't convenient, but must allow extra room for ponds. So it's a 2.5 star hotel at a 3 star price. If you think that is reasonable and don't expect requests to be met, stay here. If you have any requests, higher expectations, or looking for a good deal, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Take the rough with the smooth”
Reviews.Author: HarryOla
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 12 day stay at the Radisson. In some ways the hotel is great. The pool area is great, the location is very good for Disney and the grounds are very attractive. We liked the convenience of the Deli, with Pizza Hut and Starbucks available all day. We also got very quick and helpful service from the hotel staff. Our only complaint here was the frequency with which we needed it! We got a great rate from mousesavers ($79 per night plus service fee), so we were not expecting the best room in the place. Our room was OK. The standard beds are very firm, so if that is not your thing then you need to pay the extra $10 for the sleep number bed. But the safe did not work and the toilet got blocked 3 times. In the end they swapped us to another room, but when I went in that, it had a definite musty smell. Ironically, the safe worked in the second room, but they then upgraded us to a sleep number room. This was much fresher than either of the first two (but the safe did not work again). This was a nice room and certainly good value for the rate we were paying. Overall, we thought the good far outweighed the bad, especially given the price. It suited us fine for what we wanted. Both the good and bad reviews do capture something of the truth to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: MinnieBirminghamUK
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe the terrible reviews that are written about this hotel! We were so disappointed when we read them before we travelled but it just goes to show how everyone's opinion varies I suppose! My husband and I (both 27yrs) found this hotel to be wonderful - staff very friendly and helpful, room was large, clean with excellent daily maid service. Good location - we used the shuttle buses for most journeys to most of the parks - which were reliable and considering it was the main Easter holidays, only one bus was full. When this happened, the bus driver phoned for a (free) taxi for the family that were unable to get on the bus. The times of the shuttles are limited yes, but suited us okay as we had time to have a good look round the parks. We did hire a car for three days (through the hotel which were very helpful) but only because we were wanted to travel around a bit - I suppose it depends on your reason for travelling there - we wanted to go to all the disney parks, seaworld, busch gardens, universal etc, and we found it all fantastic!! Having a car obviously means you can be more flexible and i guess as we do not have children meant that we could stay out as long as we wished. We also went to have a dolphin swim at discovery cove which was truly a wonderful experience and a must if you are going to Orlando. Whilst there, we overheard an English man really moaning about the place, how overated it was and how you shouldn't have to queue for food there etc !!! We couldn't believe this - we had the time of our lives and just goes to prove that some people find fault in everything!!!!! As the discovery cove is an 'all inclusive' day, you do have to wait a little for food at lunch time but they do have a maximum number of people. We just thought it obvious that at at the main lunch time (between 12 and 2ish ) that it would be slightly busier!!!! But hey some people obviously are never satisfied!!!!! We ate in the Mandolins restaurant which was great and usually ate breakfast in the deli which has a selection of 'on the go' snacks.' We had an amazing time and would go back anytime - we usually stay in 3/4 star accomodation and this hotel was great. If you have booked please do not worry!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rocket235
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 8 nights and had a wonderful time. I had read all the negative reviews before getting there, I was travelling alone from Australia so it was a little disconcerting. I found the place to be great, the shuttle buses were excellent for Disney and the SeaWorld one was a little long so just take a cab home if you dont want to wait, only around $22 to get back to the hotel. All the staff were very friendly and make a visit to Charleys steak house across the road, the best steak i have ever had. The deli was really handy for quick snacks as well. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone and some of the reviews just show that there is no pleasing some people so get a life.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place- it is moldy!!!”
Reviews.Author: wallyZ
Reviews.Content: From the outside this place looks wonderful. The exterior of the property is well kept. It has meticulous landscaping – very typical of a higher end resort. The lobby was very luxurious looking as well. We first noticed a musty odor as we walked down the hallway to our room. It got worse the further from the elevator we walked. When I entered the room the smell became worse and my eyes begin to water and my lungs started to tighten from the mold/musty smell. Rather then unpack we sat in the room for awhile to see if I would get accustomed to the environment. After 10 minutes I noticed that the walls were covered with black spots of mold; I first thought it was part of the wall paper but realized after closer inspection the walls were covered from about 7 feet up to the ceiling. I walked down to the desk and asked for another room – this time I waited about 25 minutes while the clerk prioritized service to anyone who walked through the door. The routine was to wave a customer that walked through the door to the desk and check them in – work on my room – stop wave another customer who just walked through the door to the desk and check them in – go back to finding me a room etc… I would consider this poor service. The second room was finally assigned and we moved into it after I did a through check for visible signs of mold/mildew. At this point I really was beyond sensing whether or not mold was in the air as my sinuses were now stuffed and eyes were red from the previous room. After a night of fitful sleep – the beds were rock hard and also well worn… I would have hated to sleep on this be when it was new. We spent the day away from the hotel and I began to feel better in the afternoon. When we returned that night I again started to have issues with my sinuses and could now smell the mold/mildew in the hallways/room where they reassigned us. Bottom line – this is not the place to stay if you are averse to mold/mildew and have allergies. It was my understanding that the 2nd room I stayed at was a “newly renovated”. They’ve obviously not addressed the serious issues with mold/mildew in this facility.

Reviews.Title: “So-So at the Radisson Resort”
Reviews.Author: travel4fun64
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from 6 nights at the Radisson Resort in Celebration. Transporation to and from area attractions is limited, making it difficult if one doesn't have a rental car. For example, there is only 1 bus to SeaWorld each morning and 1 returning each evening, making for a long 12 hour day. The buses often do not accommodate all guests either. The pool areas are nice and kept clean. Hot tubs, however, are not large enough to accommodate all the guests. Seems this is a popular choice with school bands and church groups - lots of teenagers around (most of the time unchaperoned) during our stay. All restaurants on property automatically tack on 18% gratuity and $11 per day resort fee is a bit steep for families who are always in the Orlando area parks.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Was Adequate and Comfortable - No More, No Less”
Reviews.Author: Grimheart
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Radisson for the beginning portion of my honeymoon trip to Florida. Pros: - We checked in with dual full-size beds, and after mentioning our honeymoon the hotel staffer bumped us up to a king-size bed (getting double beds was the result of booking through travel website). - Hotel staffer gave us a nice little honeymoon bonus coupon too (unfortunately we didn't use it, but it offered us a few things like couple drinks at the bar or sparkling wine delivered to our room). - The heated pool is very comfortable. - The housekeeping is top notch - we left our room a mess each of the 4 days we stayed. Sheets and towels everywhere, luggage strewn about... and each day the housekeeping came in and made everything fully clean again. - Literally right next to the two main highways/freeways you need to take to get into the various Disney parks. They even have a free shuttle that takes you to Epcot - but once at Epcot you gotta figure out the Disney transportation system to get to the other parks. Cons: - Room was completely average. Worth about the cost of staying, I suppose. - Despite the great weather, the real pool was absolutely freezing and this sentiment must have been shared because we saw around 2 other people in this pool the 4 days we stayed. Everyone tended to stay in the heated pool, but the heated pool lacks the waterfall + water slide + depth and sheer size. - The hotel restaurant was below average, in food and service. We received the bill and it already had a 18% gratuity factored in, so service staff really didn't feel they had to do much to earn the tip. However, after being in Florida several more days I've found the factored-in gratuity very common here (I don't see it added in ahead of time in California where I live) and I believe it is optional and can be taken out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice with some exceptions”
Reviews.Author: HughesUpstateNY
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 5 night stay in the Radisson. The Good: Beautiful outside grounds, very nice staff we never had a problem with anyone being rude, especially the bartenders at the outside bar... very nice. Our needs were met on the first request. Our shuttle experience was good. Always on time, never had a problem. There is a lynx bus across the street which you can ride for $1,75 per person if you want different times than the shuttle runs. The heated pool was nice. The one with the slide was like ice water! The Bad: Of course the service charge: It would have been nice if the activities that were scheduled for kids and such actually happened... We noticed a lot of "activiity staff" that were quite lazy and really did not try to get the kids involved. The day that they scheduled the DJ by the pool it was raining so they cancelled him. They should have put him under cover and played anyway to get the crowd going on a rainy day. The drinks were outrageous! $9.47 for a margarita which includes the tip so don't double tip. The food... Most of the time we ate in the deli for breakfast and quick grab and go's which was good. Mandolin's was good for breakfast buffet. but dinner... yuck! Not real italian food so don't bother! The room was only average. Yes, it smelled musty. I needed to write the maid daily to give us toilet paper, water, etc. Should not have had to do that! The first room they put us in was smelly, old and a view of a tree. So we asked to be moved and with no problem we were moved to the 6000 building. Which I heard is the nicest. Tips: Take a walk next door to KOBE Japanese restaurant. The food is great, plentiful and it is a lot of fun. Our 2 kids really enjoyed it - they actually ate! All in all we had a pleasant experience because we were in "vacation mode" and tried not to let things bother us. Would I stay here again, probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Theft and Poor Service at the Radisson Celebration”
Reviews.Author: lbrwn04
Reviews.Content: I encourage you to book another hotel. Upon arrival, I was given a smoking room although I booked and confirmed a non-smoking room. It took 15 minutes of heated discussions with the front desk staff to get a non-smoking room. The room itself meets your basic needs. It's comparible to the Holiday Inn Express chains. Several items were taken from my room including a necklace (hidden) and sunglasses. The security staff responded immediately and instructed me that a loss prevention manager would contact me immediately. I'm still waiting on that call.... Note that the security gates were never down during our 4 night stay and old mattresses were stacked in the hallways. I attended a conference at the Gaylord Palms while I was there and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never Stay Here at the RATisson”
Reviews.Author: Kabear
Reviews.Content: This is a ratty old hotel. Please believe all the previous negative reviews on trip advisor. They are all true! We stayed here because we were part of a group with seminars at this hotel and it was just the convenience (we booked online and prepaid the four nights). There was one couple who checked out after the first night (they had only paid for the one night) and got a room at a Hilton ten minutes away and just commuted between the two hotels each day to attend the seminars. Another couple checked out after one night and went home. My husband arrived two days prior to me. He said the room smelled very moldy and the room was horrible. He went to the front desk to get a different room. He was told there was no other room. After he threatened to call the Board of Health, miraculously they had another room for him. He said it was better. However when I arrived, I could smell very strong flowery bathroom type deodorant that was covering up other bad smells. The hallways also smelled like this. The sleep number bed was not comfortable and it didn't work right. The room was tiny, the bathroom was tiny. The furniture was bargain basement. The shower was in the tub and it did not drain so we stood in inches of bath water when showering. The only positive thing I can say is that the food provided for the seminar was good. There are so many condos for rent (brand new) in the Orlando area for about $99/night - two bedrooms with full kitchen, washer/dryer, - there is no reason to stay at any hotel. We have done this before, but for the convenience of the seminar we stayed here. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here unless you have to”
Reviews.Author: gobuffs93
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights following an on-site Disney stay for 4 days. There is no comparison between on-site Disney and this hotel. We stayed at a moderate Disney resort for the same amount as this hotel. I have no problem paying resort fee if it is justified, but this is just another way to get an extra $11 a night. A ping pong table and a basketball do not equate to activities. In addition, our room had a terrible odor. We actually stayed out at the park 2 hours longer than we wanted to in the rain to avoid going back and smelling the room all night.. The concierge service was pathetic. I asked for directions to Sonny's bar-be-cue and was directed to a Sony store. Use this hotel as a last resort only.

Reviews.Title: “Hit or Miss”
Reviews.Author: stitchmouse
Reviews.Content: I try to go to Disney World every year. I usually stay here for all or most of my visits. I used to love this place. I used to think of it as my secret because the prices seemed so low for such high quality. You are paying motel rates for a really nice resort. But then something changed and I will probably never stay here again. I booked through the hotel with a discount for frequent visitors. The price was great, but obviously frequent visitors do not get any perks beyond that. The first room that I got smelled unbearably horrible and had a view of a vacant lot. When I went to the front desk for a new room, I wasn't too confident when I got a room in the same building directly above the first room. The new room smelled musty, but it was tolerable. It did, however, have the same view of the vacant lot. The entire building smelled musty and as we were checking out, staff members were shampooing the carpets. For the other reviewers who have complained about walking far to park, the problem is that the resort consists of several buildings. The buildings near the entrance have a very limited parking area, so unless you get back early, you have to park in the large parking lot in the rear of the property, which is fine if you are in the rear courtyard buildings. Be sure to get a courtyard view or pool view room to avoid the view of expansive vacant lot. When I first came to this resort about 12 years ago it was being renovated. Actually, it always seemed to be in some phase of renovation. This past visit all the renovations have already been worn, buildings smelled, and the room seemed tired and dingy. Something has also happened in the area in general. There used to be a Hilton nearby, but now it is gone. There is an abandoned bank next door, an abandoned apartment complex, and the aforementioned vacant lot. There is a security gate for the parking area that is used after dark. I am pretty sure that it has been the same code every time that I have been here, which is obvious from the 4 numbers on the keypad that are worn bare! The plusses: great price, close to Disney, nice pool, Pizza Hut in lobby is open late. Staying here is a gamble, it could be great or it could be bad, but I don't think that I will take the chance anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: travel_guru_atl
Reviews.Content: I use Hotwire all the time for booking hotels. Normally when I pick a hotel I stay in a 3.5 or 4 star hotel, which ever has the better deal for my budget. I picked the 3.5 in Disney Main Gate on Hotwire and got the Radisson Celebration. Normally Hotwire ranks Radissons 3 star, so I was a little shocked to get it at the 3.5 star level. Immediately I went and looked at the website for hotel pictures, they were not terrible and the complex looked nice. We were pleased to see they had free Wi-Fi in select rooms and Sleep Number beds. I called the hotel to speak to the guest relations rep. to see if they had Disney tickets at the hotel, but the rep. wouldn't tell me the gimmick over the phone, just said to ask at check-in, the prices constantly change. So, we get to the hotel...and as we pull in, you see the front is nice looking. The lobby was decent...but then you are given directions to the building you are staying in...we were in building 4.....so, we had to drive around to the back side of the complex....you turn the corner from the front of the parking lot and its a total different picture. There are two 8 story towers and two 2 story buildings. We were in the backside of one of the 8 story towers, luckily it overlooked the pool. As you pull into the parking lot, you see condos at the far back of the lot...a run down playground which is just a small toddler single slide set in a sand box. So..we parked....and the parking was dark and surrounded by trees that every morning we'd come to the car to find a branch had fallen. There was no close parking to any of the building and lighting was terrible...completely unsafe for traveling with children. Asthetically it looked on on the outside. Then you walk into the building and you are hit with a musty carpet smell. You walk through the labryinth and find your right elevator and get to your floor. Apparently our floor didnt have hallway a/c because it was always hotter than a sauna on the floor. We get in our room...and it's just a standard room. 3.5 star on Hotwire is usually much much nicer. The bathroom was nice...marble looking everything. But I again, we were travelling with an 18 month old...so not the safest kind of flooring for her getting in and out of the tub. And the tub....I nearly slipped and fell and busted my butt getting in that itself. There is not skid prevention what so ever and it's an angled tub. We didnt get the sleep number room, that was $10 more/night. The regular bed was the hardest hotel bed Ive ever slept on. Ive stayed at Motel 6's that were more comfortable than this. Housekeeping knocks on your door at 9am....we're on vacation..we dont want to be hearing knocking on the door at 9am. There was supposed to be a security gate that you put a code in to get to the parking lot, but it never worked the whole time and was always up. At dusk you were supposed to have to swipe your room key to gain access to the building...never had to. Security was the absolute LAST thing this property was concerned about. Now there is a picture of a slide on the hotels website. After looking at the view from our room...luckily it was too cold for us to swim that weekend, but it would have been such a let down. It basically was a handicapped ramp with water to make you slide down it.....not even enough to call it a waterslide.....it was a total joke. Don't be fooled by the appearance on their website...this location is totally not worth the money they charge much less what we had to pay with Hotwire. We called and complained to Hotwire and got a $75 credit, our other option would be to pay the difference on a beter quality room. If I wasnt with a baby, I would have done it...but its just a PITA to move all that stuff across town. Next time I'll just go with the 4star and pay the price. Hotwire totally overrated this hotel. Normally I get Hilton's, Hyatt's and Embassy Suites for 3.5 star's...not a freaking Radisson. Thankfully we only paid $69/night or I would have complained up a storm. I don't recommend this property at the price they charge per night on their website...I've had better deals with better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “OK option close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: Estells
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Celebration for 7 nights beginning January 19. We were using frequent flier miles to book the room and so did not expect the best room on property. Overall, the room was fine. It was clean and spacious enough for 3 of us - not like we spent much time in the room anyway. The bathroom was rather small and the water pressure in the shower was terrible. First night there, we had a major condensation leak from the A/C, but it was taken care of quickly. Food was fine in Mandolin's. We only ate breakfast there, but there were always plenty of choices and good options for us. The price for the breakfast - kid's eat free - was very reasonable for hotel buffets. They more than gouge you, however, at the lobby quick service restaurant. Regular coffee was $3.25! Not a latte - just coffee. The grounds were fine, but not as lush as they appear on the website. The pool with the water slide is not heated, so my son only made one trip down it before moving to the heated pool. Parking was supposed to be secure - they go to the point of giving you an entry code for the gate - but the gate was always up our entire stay. From what I see for other reviews, it has been that way for a while. When I mentioned it at the front desk, the girl said "Yes, we know and it is being fixed." 5 days later, it was still broken. Overall, the location was great - 5 minutes to Disney max - and there are plenty of the typical restaurants close by if you don't want to dine at Disney every night. However, next visit we will likely stay on Disney property at a moderate resort and take advantage of the amenities that go with the Disney resorts. We never took the shuttle - very limited runs and we heard it was often full - so ended up driving to Disney every day. That was fine for convenience of getting in and out, but the hotel does tout that shuttle service as an amenity - and it really is not much of one at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but uncomfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: bulldogPortsmouth_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 14 nights in Jan 08. First impression was of a tired and out of date hotel. Room was clean and tidy although could be better. Bathroom was the smallest I had ever seen - very surprising for the USA!! - can't fit more than one in at a time!!!. Beds and pillows were really uncomfortable forcing us to buy new pillows at the nearby wal mart. Room had a safe but was not working so had to use main hotel safe, also no iron in room but had an ironinig board?. Large fridge allowed us to store plenty of drinks/snacks in the room. There is also a daily $11 resort fee payable - don`t let it catch you out. Parking was supposed to be secure but is not - the barrier was always up!!. Location was great, Disney is 2.5 miles away and right by junction 64 of I4. Charleys steakhouse is walking distance away and is great, there are plenty of the usual restraunts within 5 miles. Pool and grounds were nice and well kept. Sports bar was fine but several chairs were broken, food there was good though. Main restraunt was adequate, serving good breakfasts. Overall, if you want a place to crash close to disney and I4 this is fine, but we will look for somewhere different next time.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Laly41
Reviews.Content: My husband runs, so every year about this time of the year we travel to Kissimmee to the Disney Marathon. We really need a good hotel to stay, relax and rest. We don't do parks so is important to have a nice place were to enjoy the stay. He found it here, the amenities it offers are great. Good swimming pool although it was a kind of chilli, but the Spa was awesome, the room clean and silent. The front desk people, very polite and we can say we will return with our kids next time when we visit Orlando. Another nice thing to add is the Pizza Hut express, very good idea...

Reviews.Title: “Overall-GOOD, but am compelled to warn others of hidden expenses”
Reviews.Author: Midwest_Mom_22
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a stay at the Radisson the week between Christmas (2007)and New Years (2008). We visited all the Disney parks, downtown Disney, Blizzard Beach and Seaworld. We have a 10, 9, and 6 year old. Overall, we were satisfied with the Radisson. We had gone to Orlando 3 years ago and paid a lot of money to stay on the Disney property as we wanted the entire Disney experience for a brief 4 day stay. As we had planned a week long vacation this year, I did a lot of research on various sites to find a hotel with the best value, but still having a good reputation and fun things to do on our days off from the parks. I chose the Radisson, even though I was scared about some very terrible reviews. I have never written a hotel review myself, but felt compelled to tell others about the (+) and (-)s of our recent stay. (+)s: beautiful landscaping, well-kept pools, friendly helpful staff (every one of them we came in contact with), Marceea (activities director) is a gem, the guy who does pool-side tattoos is very kind and generous (will re-do airbrushed tattos ($5) during your entire stay, for FREE), the magic show/magician is hilarious and very good (was my kids' favorite highlight of the trip (despite all the $$ shelled out at parks!!), sleep number beds and linen were very comfortable (-)s: hidden charges-Mandolins (restaurant at the hotel) markets kids under 10 eat free; a dinner buffet at $22 per adult bill came out to $79; when asked about this-it was broken down that all soft drinks, including the kids were charged and were high priced, we were charged tax on all the 3 'free' kid meals, and a manadatory 15% tip for all 5 buffet meals was added to bill; here's the kicker though~since we purchased the room option that included breakfast buffet for 2 adults, all of our breakfasts for all adults and the 3 kids were 'free' (including numerous juices, coffees, no extra tip added on) (?!?); the breakfast was good and I would recommend it; Other (-)s included the taxi service the Radisson uses was always $5-$7 more per trip than any taxi we used coming back from the parks for the same distance; Why taxis? The 'free shuttle' was often late due to the heavy holiday traffic (no one's fault), it was first come, first serve, so the line began early (so one often waited around 45 min or more for an unguaranteed seat as the shuttle also delivered people from 2 other hotels); this was one of the main factors in choosing the Radisson and we were willing to pay taxis vs. the hassle getting the shuttle; we were also concerned as everyone kept telling us the parks sometimes closed because of capacity around noon to non-Disney resort people, so this was an added stressor as a 5 min trip to a park sometimes took 1.5 hours start to finish on the shuttle My husband feels overall the Radisson was still a wise choice for a budgeted 1 week vacation, but I think if we do venture to Orlando again, I may lean towards a Disney value resort, to ease my mind of transportation issues, ensure park access and to take advantage of Extra Magic hours.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be updated”
Reviews.Author: CtheGlobe77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in November 2007 for a business trip. It was not my first choice, but the first choice hotel was fully booked already. The rooms at this hotel are in need of renovation. Everything seemed old and outdated. Their seems to be an issue with temperature control because the hotel lobbies and hallways were freezing, but the rooms themselves felt rather warm. I had to put my A/C on full blast to get the room to a comfortable temperature. The staff was friendly enough, but the overall look of the hotel was kind of dreary and worn.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your air freshener”
Reviews.Author: greenwhite7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson for a total of three nights for a business trip. The grounds are very pretty, well kept and clean. The rooms have an overwhelming musty smell !!!! When I checked in and opened the door to my room I could not believe the smell. I thought if I left the air conditioner on it would help, no luck. I switched to another room in another building the next day after my meetings....same thing overwhelming musty smell. The smell is also in the hallways and elevators. The maid never vaccummed my room and the hallways were always in need of cleaning. I was traveling with 10 other people from my business and we ALL had the same experience. The staff was not helpful and a few were actually rude....especially the front desk. I have stayed with Radisson hotels in the past and this is not what you expect. For the money they charge you can do better in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I expected....”
Reviews.Author: agleicher
Reviews.Content: We haven't stayed off Disney grounds in over 16 years. This is a trip I took with my in-laws who wanted to go to IOA and receive a free breakfast. I found this hotel and they seemed happy. Got a good nightly rate but the $11/day fee stinks! The lobby is beautiful. Nicely decorated and they keep the grounds very well maintained. The rooms were nice & clean, the A/C was a bit noisy and the beds were as hard as rocks! If you book this hotel make sure you book a room with the sleep number beds. I woke up several times during our stay, thinking I was sleeping on the floor. Breakfast at the Mandolin was very good. Service, quality and quanity was excellent. The pools and hot tubs were very nice. Overall this was an OK stay, except for the rock hard beds. The service and maintainence was good. It is nowhere close to being a Disney hotel if that is what you are looking for!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: adthro
Reviews.Content: I was referred to this hotel by the Omni when I tried to make a reservation there for a conference. This hotel is a HUGE step down from the Omni. The only reason I can think of that the Omni would refer me to the "Ratty Radisson" (as a colleague and I began calling it during our stay there) is that they are under the same ownership. The Radisson's rooms are outdated, the carpet old, security non-existent (anyone could get into each hotel building without using a keycard). This place is so bad, they don't even play real music by their pool. Instead, I was subjected to listening to bad karaoke-like remakes of popular songs. To add insult to injury, the "customer service"/concierge desk stopped me as I was walking through the lobby and I was subjected to a sales pitch for a timeshare. Are you kidding me?! As if the fact I had to stay at the Radisson wasn't bad enough (when I'm having to attend the conference at the Omni and can see what I'm missing), please bother me more by trying to sell stuff to me. Awful. Terrible. Horrible. Thanks a lot, Omni!

Reviews.Title: “erm, they need to fix laundry issues”
Reviews.Author: biztravelleragogo
Reviews.Content: This stay would have been acceptable enough if it weren't for consistently dirty towels, sheets and even shower curtain. My towels actually smelled (of cigarrettes and garlic) and there were filthy marks on the sheets which I didn't dare explore too much. I can put up with basic if its clean. But this should have been well above basic, given the price, and I can't forgive dirty. Even the bathroom was not properly cleaned - I arrived at 2am having travelled for nearly 24 hours and had to wipe down the sink, bath and toilet seat. On the plus side, the pool and outdoor area was nice and of a much higher standard than the inside. Staff were friendly, the gym was ok and the deli and pizza hut handy. The pool bar was nice too. There is nothing that can't be fixed by addressing some housekeeping issues and a lick of paint, but if I were to go back to the area, no way I'd stay here until I knew they had been addressed. (I should add, I was a business traveller so not really into the resort aspect of the place. It was one of the designated conference hotels - a mistake, I think).

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad, enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: loves2travel1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10/23-10/29 on trip to Disney. Got a deal thru AllEars. Paid $79/night. Thought hotel was fine. Was worried when read other reviews. Hotel was clean. I had no security issues. Our building required key card and the parking lot was gated though the gate was not down at the time they stated it would be. Room was clean and adequate. We were at parks all day and really only used room for sleep. Pizza Hut on site delivers to room which is nice and room service was excellent. Did not have an opportunity to use any of the pools though one in our group did and said was fine. Weather was rainy while we were there and our room started getting a musty smell by the last day. Not sure if this was due to our wet clothes and shoes about the room but we decided it probably was. Stayed in building 1000. Resort fee is normal at this type of place so did not see as a big deal. It included free internet in the room which surprised us. Did not bother to turn on our sleep # bed since others complained is like a bubble. Turn it off and the bed is fine. Nice surprise to have the small fridge. Was not expecting it and did not have to pay extra for it. Overall, I would stay here again. The most important thing to me in a hotel is clean, safe and close to attraction.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped off and disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jmetcalfe20
Reviews.Content: Be warned this hotel adds in 15% gratuity to all meals and drinks without telling the patron. I only realized I was double tipping when reviewing the receipts once I was at home. Pool is nice to look at but the water is freezing…far too cold to enjoy even on a very hot day.

Reviews.Title: “Staying one night for Disney”
Reviews.Author: kittyx3
Reviews.Content: The overnight visit there was overall good. There were no problems, more annoyances. We decided to try the sleep number bed to see what the hype was all about. Honestly, it felt like sleeping on a bed with a bubble. Our remote control for the TV did no have any batteries in it. A replacement was issued without any problems. The A/C unit was very loud.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected....but you can do better in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: dizzneegirl
Reviews.Content: This property turned out to be ok, but I think you can do better. This is an older area and really out of the way. Pros: 1. clean with great housekeeping service 2. very comfy sleep # bed with nice linen 3. room had fridge, bath small but very clean, very quiet in building 6000 4. nice pools and hot tub and relatively clean, plenty of pool towels 5. lobby staff very nice, helpful 6. Thrifty car rental onsite 7. Free internet and 2 pc's in lobby (hard to access in evening) 8. Pizza Hut pizza very good Cons: 1. room had musty smell day 1, but did not notice by day 3. 2. very out of the way if you don't have a car. Shuttle service was very limited. Taxi very pricy $22 one way to disney and $32 to universal. 3. limited selction for dining (nothing offsite within walking distance) 4. some of the area behind the property looked like it may be a "rough" area...so suspicious characters walking up and down the road ways. 5. resort fee.....don't think it was worth $11.40 6. horrible place for a convention, rooms very dated with poor lighting I paid close to $90 per night, rate was $69 but after taxes, and resort fees it was about 90...In my opinion not worth this. I prefer the downtown disney area, you can get hotels there with the same options for the same price or better and have a much better location.

Reviews.Title: “will never go back -has potential to be good”
Reviews.Author: hollydecarlo
Reviews.Content: hate that there is a smoking section in the hotel, we arrived in the evening and the entrance was hard to find, the place we could tell was beautiful but it was so poorly lit we could hardly see. We got to our room and it had not been cleaned - the people before us had clogged the toilet - it was sooo gross. We got another room which was ok but the front desk gal didnt know if it was near the smoking hall or not so we had to go down the hall ourselves to tell. The restaurant onsite had the poorest service so we left and went to the nearby places outside the hotel which are amazing thank goodness. We will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved This Property!”
Reviews.Author: ltisdall
Reviews.Content: I was reading some reviews on this property that were bad, so I went in with some concern..What I got was a Beautiful property!I got a Great rate on line on orbitz..$74 a night!!I could not believe when I got there how nice it was..Front Desk was a great help, Julie was Great!My room was overlooking the Beautiful Pool. Huge waterfall was amazing...The Sleep number beds are a must!!Clean room, Air Conditioning was nice and cold, quiet..There is an $11 dollar a day service charge which every property in orlando has, but you get Free Use of Internet, heated pools, and great hot tubs..Nice Restaraunts..Plenty of shuttle buses to Disney..I highly recommend this Property..

Reviews.Title: “It was just Okay”
Reviews.Author: keg3035
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Radisson Resort Orlando-Celebration 9/20-9/27. It was just okay. We stayed in building 6000. Pros: 1. The room was clean 2. The room was quiet (you couldn't hear the room next door) 3. The room was reasonably priced 4. The hotel is on 192, 2 minutes to 4, and only 10 minutes to all Disney Parks. 5. Lunch at the Patio Grill was reasonably priced and tasty. Cons: 1. The line to get into Mandolin's for the breakfast buffet was long at 8 am. The tables weren't clean. The food was average/below average and overpriced for what you got. We had a much better breakfast at the IHOP a minute down the road on 192. The waiter poured another table coffee from container we were given. 2. The bathroom was extremely small. If opened, the door would clip the knees of someone if they were on the toilet (we didn't open the door when someone was on the toilet, just trying to give you the perspective of the size). In addition to being small, the bathroom looked like it was half remodeled. The sink was tan granite, the floor a complimentary brown granite, and the shower a grey and white marble with rust spots. It looks like they forgot to redo the shower! Also the chain in the toilet fell off a few times- no wonder because when you opened the back tank of the toilet the insides were rusted. 3. We requested fresh towels etc. throughout our stay, but it seemed that the quantity of face clothes dwindled each day, until we just didn't receive any. Also, half way through they gave us a hand towel instead of a bath mat. Complimentary toiletries were also not replenished (at all). I recently stayd in Boston at the Radisson, and these thing were attended to properly. 4. The pool, although the water was clean, looked tired and like it needed a good scrubbing. The drains and walls were discolored with a green tint (algae?) 5. There was some trash in the bushes behind the lounge chair seating next to the pool. 6. Guest Services- This desk is not a concierge service, They will not help you book dinners. All they will do is try to get you to sit through a timeshare presentation or sell you tickets. It should be called the Helpless desk. 7. The bed linens were too small for the king size bed and the bottom sheet would come untucked in the middle of the night and the mattress pat would bunch up and make the bed hot. If I were returning to the Orlando area for 2 nights or less( for a convention or short busines trip), I would probably stay at the Radisson again because it was clean, convenient, and reasonably priced. I would not however recommend it for a week long vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a little over priced”
Reviews.Author: TurnersTips
Reviews.Content: A hotel large enough to get lost in and be anonymous. Nice grounds. Room had a musty smell though - maybe carpet had just been cleaned...? The rate we paid was $80 + tax for room only - no complimentary breakfast. Your best bet for that is either Denny's down the road, or better still the Market Street Cafe in Celebration. The hotel is just off the I4, 10/15 mins drive from the theme parks and 5 mins drive from Celebration. The hotel offers an entertainments program - mainly for kids and families, a free park shuttle, free internet and coffee maker in the room. One tip - if you have forgotten a power cable for your cell phone then ask reception as they have a box of cables they lend out. Next time around, I would probably stay elsewhere for a cheaper price considering we spent little more than sleeping hours in the hotel and didn't make proper use of the facilities provided.

Reviews.Title: “Underrated”
Reviews.Author: markhels
Reviews.Content: Just feel that we have to add our review of the radisson resort orlando celebration. Some of the reviews written here are so wide of the mark. So, to add some perspective to the review, I shall start with the price for a king or twin room. $70 dollars. Now, good points 4 pools, including hot spa and jacuzzi Slides for kids in the mail pool Pizza hut and starbucks on site (tho expensive) Business centre with 2 internet pc Free Wireless access all over (inc both rooms we have had, able to support skype too, cheap uk calls lol) Gym, never used it, but looks ok. Fridge in rooms. Bad Points 70s concrete style. Rooms are old, but clean and décor is ok. Air con, whilst effective, is individual to room and therefore noisy. Our opinion. The value cannot be beaten. For the price of some motels you are close to disney, on the 192, with all the benefits and features of a major hotel. For families, it would be possible to get all of you in a twin, but for the price, get 2 rooms if you have teenagers and enjoy some peace... This is a resort and hence usually has families here. We would recommend it for families and couples, provided that u can tolerate others children.

Reviews.Title: “Not That Bad..... Or Is It?”
Reviews.Author: slatkiishak
Reviews.Content: First let me tell you, I stayed at this hotel during the labor day weekend. The check in was very fast and easy, probably was my fastest check in ever. I was first sent to a room in the 1000 building. My room was facing the side of the pool, but only one problem, didnt see the the pool. Only saw trees. But anyway the room's safe wasnt working properly and they changed my room. The second room we went to was in the 6000 building. At first entrance to the room, we almost died of the smell, including the bellboy. I called the front desk to change to another room, and it seemed like they were annoyed with me for wanting to change to another room. But they did it anyway, and the third room was fine. The room itself was nice, it was cleaned very nice everyday. We had a mini refrigerator, so we bought some sodas and water and stored it there. The pools were very nice, especially the smaller pool, which was heated, and was very relaxing at night. The big pool was very nice too. It had a slide, but let me warn you adults, its good only for the kids to slide down on, because adults always got stuck. Now let me get to the bad parts. Remember, we were there labor day weekend. Parking at the hotel next to your room was almost impossible to find. I would have to park all the way on the other side of the hotel and then had to walk for 5-7 minutes to my room. The staff at the hotel is not great either. As I told you before, I had to change my room twice and was given a slight attitude after the second room change. Also, after check out we were in the airport when my wife noticed she left a bag with 3 sweaters inside in the hotel room. I called the hotel right away and was told they would check and call me back. That never happend. I left them 3 messages to call back and still no call back. I eventually just gave up, thinking even if they would find them, they wouldn't send them to me anyway. Overall this hotel isn't really that bad. Especially since you don't really spend much time in the hotel since you are in the parks all day. And the attitude of the staff, I guess you just have to deal with, since you dont talk to them all day anway. Personally I would recommend this hotel to someone, but because there are so many hotels in orlando, I would go somewhere else next time. THIS ISNT A HOTEL TO BE AFRAID OF. I'VE SEEN WORSE.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in the Orlando area”
Reviews.Author: Siroco
Reviews.Content: This is the best deal in the Orlando area. We got a rate of $69 plus a $10,50 as resort fee (they give you your money worth for this as they have bingos and contests for free, ping-pong, even sand volleyball). This one of the real 3.5 stars hotels in the Orlando area. It is perfectly located for a visit to Walt Disney World and Seaworld, somewhat far from Universal Studios (a 15 minutes drive). It has many affordable restaurants nearby. The pool area is very nice and large, it has a small waterslide and a waterfall. 2 jacuzzis and a heated pool. The prices at the various restaurants are quite affordable. It has a pizza and coffee shop parlor if you want something lighter. It also has roomservice. The room was rather small but adequate and very nicely furnished (they have some rooms with dial-a-beds), the bathroom is very nice and stocked with all the necessities. The personnel is very nice, they keep saluting you and opening doors for you. The only minus is that if you arrive late at night you have to park rather far from any entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: susymichelle
Reviews.Content: This place was magnifient. We had a king size adjustable bed, it was just great. Staff is extremely friendly, room was immaculate, breakfast buffet was out of this world. pools, bar and eveything else was just excellent. Oh, they have free shuttle to disney parks. I can't compliment this place enough! i loved every minute I spent there...and I got a great deal on it too...I will definitely come back here!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the reviews (Had a great time)”
Reviews.Author: Chill2007
Reviews.Content: My family and me stayed at this Resort for a week July 9 thru the 14. I must say after reading some of the reviews here I was leary about this hotel but decided to see for myself. When we arrived it was like 8:00pm at night we were checked right in no problems. Front desk was very friendly and courteous (I was waiting for them to be rude like the reviews stated but that didn't happen) I even complimented them on their service. My room was very clean it smelled a little stale but other then that no complaints my room was cleaned everyday and clean towels and washcloths were left each time. They had 3 swimming pools, Jacuzzi’s all three were great my grandbaby loved it. The pizza hut food was great. Breakfast at Mandolins was fabulous fresh cooked waffles and omelets. They had a game room, which we enjoyed. Didn't take the shuttle for we had rented a van right from the lobby, which was very convenient. Gift store was not overly priced just like any other gift store. They had something going on in the hotel lobby almost every night, which was really nice. I received a nice massage while I was there got my grandbaby portrait painted in the lobby by the artist who was there every night. We enjoyed tennis playing ping-pong. If you need drinks or snacks which is a little cheaper then the lobby store there is a store a short walk away. The only thing that I really didn’t like is there was no microwave in the room. I’m glad that I decided to stay at this resort. So overall I would definitely recommend my friends and family to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: meggy29
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from a 16 nights stay at the hotel and it was excellent. Our room was ready when we checked in at 4pm and the manager happily changed our room to the 1000 building with a pool view. The room was very clean and the air conditioning worked fined. We had clean towels every day and the cleaner always tidy our room for us and changed the bed linen regularly, and when we asked for more towels they were delivered immediately. I found all the staff very helpful and pleasant. We found the deli bar very cheap compared to English hotel prices. Would highly recommend this hotel and this is the second time in three years that we have stayed here. The kids entertainment was excellent. All the families we made friends with no-one had a bad word to say, so I am not sure why this hotel is getting negative reports.

Reviews.Title: “Okay...but some problems”
Reviews.Author: Lovey1217
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not horrible. When I called the woman wasnt that friendly when I asked for extra towels, but anyway....they did call back to make sure the towels were brought. When we got there, the sink was clogged....within a few minutes after calling, someone came to fix it, and we did get a call to make sure they had come to fix it. The front desk and guest services people were friendly and helpful. We were put in the 6,000 building...which is kind of confusing to find being that there is no sign on the outside of the building. We had sleep number beds that were very comfortable. As far as the other people who have commented about stains on chairs, and in the tub, its true. There are two pools....the main pool was often crowded and during the week the back pool wasnt....this is something I enjoyed, but thats just a personal preference. It was quiet, and it was nice to relax. On the weekends, and nights it picked up, but no reason not to enjoy it. The hot tub with waterfall was great. There was a movie shown by the pool for the kids on Saturday night. Oh and by the way, dont be mislead by thinking there is an actual starbucks in the hotel, theres not. The deli in the lobby serves starbucks coffee...which you fix yourself. Mandolin's breakfast buffet was really good, and so was dinner. We ordered room service, the man who brought it was funny and friendly. The shuttles were good, and the drivers are helpful and answer any questions you may have. This hotel was ok....but we decided that next time we are staying on Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: EMG51
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in August. Rooms were clean, beds and pillows very comfortable, bathrooms small, but clean with nice shower. Pools were great! After spending all day at a park, it was refreshing to jump into a nice pool. Plenty of towels and lounge chairs around the pool. Hot tubs were nice too. Fun activities for both children and adults during the day. Grounds were beautiful. We found everyone nice & friendly. Our only problem was at checkin. They did not have our reservation, even though we made it through Radisson reservations, but they quickly found us a room & at a cheaper rate that also included breakfast! Breakfast was good for free, but expensive if you have to pay for it. Parking at night was a bit tight, but always found a spot. Overall, for a family of 4 (2 kids ages 12 & 14) we had a great stay! Not sure why so many bad reviews.

Reviews.Title: “This Place Sucked”
Reviews.Author: Luvtotravel83
Reviews.Content: All I can say is what a dump. The prices are way overinflated and the food was lousy. The best meal we had was breakfast. The beds are too close together and hard. The bathroom was wayy too tiny and we saw mildew or mold on the wall in the bathroom. The airconditoner wasnt working right so when we needed to get some warm air in the room it started to overheat and sounded off the smoke alarm!! If you eat at the restaurant there is one female server who keeps telling you that nothing is free. We went down to the snack shop and again everything was overpriced. The rooms are too small and one of the hot tubs outside was broken the first night we got there, so we froze when we got in The nicest part of the hotel was the waterfall pool. However, some drunk guy came and sat down by us and was acting bizarre. We complained but they never kicked him out they just said he was on the other side of the pool and he wouldnt bother us anymore. I asked for a 10% discount when I checked out because I was so upset.

Reviews.Title: “All Around A Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Broadwaylvr
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying at this hotel for 5 days, and had a great experience. The hotel itself is very nice and clean. All of the hotel staff is very friendly, and also cooperative if you needed to make any calls to the front desk for reservations. The location is great if you have a car, if not there is not too much to do within walking distance. They have a free shuttle that will take you to some of the theme parks; such as Magic Kingdom, SeaWorld, and Universal Studios/Islands of Adventure. The shuttle leaves every morning at 9:05am and you don't return back to the hotel until around 7:30-7:45pm. I would HIGHLY recommend the magic show which is every Thursday night! It is fantastic with a man named Dan Stapleton. You can make reservations at Guest Services which is in the hotel lobby. The hotel restaurant called Mandolin's is very good, and has a wonderful dinner buffet every friday night! If you plan on staying at this hotel, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Roach Infested! Do Not Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: chef512
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so disgusting I would have rather been camping, and I am NOT a camper. It is old, smelly, dirty, the air conditioner was falling apart and so loud we could not put the tv loud enough to hear over it. I got up to turn it off at 1 am and cockroaches were scurrying around. On the 4th floor. Huge ones! The hotels response? They offered another room? What? were they going to tell the roaches to stay out of a particular room for one night? The whole thing needs to be refubished and fumigated. We left at 3 am after contacting hotwire and having them rebook us elsewhere. They moved us to Gaylord Palms which was absolutely immaculate, beautiful, awesome service, can't say enough about it. We have stayed there 3 other times and each time the hotel was consistently clean and friendly. DO NOT stay at this hotel, you will regret it. Unless you enjoy camping in the worse conditions, pick another. I don't know how anyone can rate this hotel anything but the worse. I think the people who refused to accept it's conditions were not sent review forms. I know I wasn't. Only to the hotel we got moved to afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Time!!”
Reviews.Author: Arielitoll
Reviews.Content: This was the 4th time we stayed at "Radisson Resort Celebration" and we really enjoyed it! We had originally reserved a standard-accessible room with our Radisson Gold Points, but the man at the front desk gave us a very nice upgrade to a room with a sleep number bed and a pool view! It was great! In the past, we have had rooms facing the parking lot or the garden areas... All of the rooms here at the Radisson are great! They are always clean! We have never had a problem with moldy, smelly or old rooms before thankfully.. We highly reccomend this hotel!!!! -God Bless

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: nckpgh
Reviews.Content: Pluses about this hotel: Beautfiul, nicely landscaped hotel with excellent location to Disney (10 minute ride to the parks via Rt. 4 which is right out of the main entrance to Radisson), hotel pool is huge, clean, warm with fun slide and smaller quiet pool for adults and baby pool nearby also. Downfalls to this resort: Rooms are smaller than most hotels & bathroom is tiny, prices at the gift shop, deli and restaurant are inflated by 100% so shop at the Publix just 2 minutes east on I-192. The hotel has only 3 internet stations for guests which are filled up 24/7. The hotel needs to add some other computers so guests don't wait half and hour to check emails and flight info. Front desk response slow to none r/t problems in room. Room not ready at 4pm check in.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: otttawaorlando
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in July 2007 for 3 days It was clean and comfortable, but during our stay my husband had an unopened carton of Canadian Cigarettes stolen from our room. This made for an unpleasant stay as we weren't sure if something else would go missing during our time there. The security staff did come and investigate and we had to file a report. It has been 2 weeks and we have not heard anything back from them. With this problem we would not recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Hated it, Stay far away!!”
Reviews.Author: michaeljulie717
Reviews.Content: First of all, they should not use the name "resort" in their title. I've been to alot of real resorts. This one was more like a Travel Lodge! On the internet they make it look very pretty and they write about the "newly remodeled" rooms. Thats a joke!! My husband and I always stay at Hilton hotels. I decided to change things around for our nice little 2-day trip from West Palm to Orlando. My husband was mad at me for booking this room and wanted to leave right away. The decor is embarassing. About 1 hour after we arrived, It started raining. Rain started pouring into the room. I took pictures and we immediately called to be moved. They "upgraded" us to a room with a larger bathroom but the same ugly, dirty decor. The breakfast buffet thay they Rave about on their website was ice cold. Cold eggs, bacon, waffles, sausage. Warm milk, hard donuts. me and my two boys didn't eat a thing either morning. What a waste of money. We are not wealthy people so Im not just being snotty and spoiled. This hotel is really not worth the 3 star rating they give it. I will fight for the resort fee back as well as one nights stay being credited. I will never stay at another Radisson hotel again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place For Families Visiting Disney Parks”
Reviews.Author: MERVYNMCC
Reviews.Content: Please ignore all the negative reviews as this hotel has everything you want when visiting the Disney parks etc. Plenty of activities for the kids also and some really good restaurants within walking distance - would recommend Charley's if you like steaks. We stayed here for 14 days and enjoyed it immensley. The rooms were kept clean and we found all the staff to be very courteous. We also used the shuttle service so we didn't bother hiring a car. Have a great holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: secret_traveller82
Reviews.Content: Great hotel!!! Had an amazing experience. Good points: - excellent room/bed/shower/view - excellent room service - excellent internet wireless connection in our bedroom - great pools - great bars/restaurants (wide array of foods) - good restaurants nearby - friendly staff Bad points: - The shuttle service to disneyworld!! The driver wasn´t friendly at all, picked up sometimes before the schedule and then would leave the pick-up point without waiting for others.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids and close to the action”
Reviews.Author: Robby4905
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Radisson Resort Orlando. The staff was very attentive and did follow up calls to make sure that our special requests were completed. The hotel is clean and there are a lot of activities for the kids. We drove to Cocoa Beach on Sunday and visited Sea World on Monday. The guest services desk was great with directions and drive times. On Wednesday we did Universal and the drive time was less than 15 minutes. We loved this hotel. the kids eat free breakfast was great, though not cheap. We ate at Dennys on our final morning which was 3 blocks away and about 10 dollars cheaper for two adults and two kids. Our family will be returning to Orlando next sunmer and will stay at the Radisson again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: pretagreg
Reviews.Content: Quite a large resort, with several buildings on the property. Definitely a family oriented hotel, with lots of kids running around, certainly as expected right outside the Disney World property. While we did not partake of the pools, they were definitely popular with many of the guests. The room was just fine. The bed was okay, the bathroom clean, and the hair dryer and iron and ironing board are always appreciated. We had Internet access, good for researching the local restaurants and attractions each evening in preparation for the next day. Parking was free, in a lot that required a pass code to enter at night (a bit of a pain if you forgot the code). Our package, obtained through Expedia, included a free buffet breakfast. The food was adequate, not bad for free, but I would have been less pleased if I had to pay for it. One extra fun touch - there are two ponds on the property, with large fish and turtles that you can feed with food from a vending machine. The surrounding neighborhood is interesting. Lots of cheap tourist junk shops, with not the highest quality customer base. In fact, the Radisson was easily the best hotel in the area, with a number of lesser lodgings bringing in a different tourist crowd. But if you sleep, eat, and swim at the Radisson, then leave the area for the Disney, Universal, etc. parks, you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “2nd great stay...”
Reviews.Author: TheHoffer
Reviews.Content: Alot of the reviews here are funny... are these people expecting the Four Seasons? For the $$$, this place is the best bet in the area for a family stay. With the AAA rate, you can't beat the deal, and they were upfront about all of the charges. Highly recommend the sleep # bed / breakfast package; the breakfast is fantastic and the service is excellent. The waiters and wiatresses really go out of their way to please.
