We had such a good time this last stay, we even skipped one of the parks for a day. The pool is great, with a really fun water slide that everyone had a blast with. There is also a pool waterfall to chill out under, and there are a ton of activities for the kids. It feels like you're staying at a resort for the same price of any of the area hotels that offer nothing of the sort. The rooms are more than adequete; we always get the same high floor overlooking the pool. Very picturesque, and the sleep # is adjustable to suit your liking. The pillows are a little too big and poofy for me, but they give you alot of them so you can arrange things they way you want. Maybe I'm just an easy going guy, but in two stays here, I have not had any of the problems these people are complaining about. We really enjoyed our time and I can't wait to go back...

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: 051610b
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here for a convention and it was horrible!!! We were suppossed to be getting a discount for a room, but in fact they charged us $30 over what the regular rate was, our bed was no lie as hard as the floor. It felt like bricks. The room smelled like really strong mens cologne, I chocked when I opened the door. We went to the desk to complain and all we got was sorry, we're booked. There is nothing we can do for you. At this point I was so mad! We finally said cancel my reservation and went to another hotel. The room was dirty, the staff was rude, the bed was hard, I would never in my right mind stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: smoochpop
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Radisson - Celebration was pleasant. During our family vacation to Disney World, we stayed at this hotel and were very satisfied. The comfort of the beds and pillows were exceptional. The rooms were very well cleaned and the staff were extremely courteous. The hotel was beautiful and located minutes away from the Disney Parks. For the price, cleanliness of the hotel, and the amiability of the staff, I would definitely recommend this hotel to others. Also, occasionally they offer military discounts, which was a plus for us! The only negative was finding the hotel. On the Interstate, the hotel is visible, but to actually get to the hotel was a hassle. When we were there, there was major construction taking place. Hopefully, it's easier to access. Overall, the hotel was worth my money!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Disney.”
Reviews.Author: Dianeyz
Reviews.Content: We really did enjoy this hotel; overall, it was very pretty with tropical landscaping and careful design elements. The room was clean and comfortable, and the bed linens crisp and white. But something was always just a little off...an ashtray by the pool that was too full, the smell of cigarette smoke in the hallway, elevators that worked right every other time. We chose this hotel because it was close to Disney but just a little less expensive than one of their mid-range hotels. If you are going to spend over $150 on a hotel room, you might as well stay at Disney, where you know that everything is always going to be perfect. Even if it's a lower-tier Disney resort, the attention to detail is always going to be above-par, and that means everything when you are on vacation. It's not included in your hotel rate, but the breakfasts were truly outstanding. There was a gentleman making omelets, and I'm not lying when I say my husband and I both had two each...every day we were there. The man making them was as kind as can be, and the view of the gleaming pool with its cascading waterfall made for very nice mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4inthesun
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with out 9 month old and it the facilities were good. The room was good, but could have been better if there was a balcony or open patio of some kind. Good facilities on each floor - washer/dryer and ice machines - convenient if you have kids. The shop which sold breakfast croissants etc was really convenient if you don't want a full breakfast but jsut a quick snack before you head out. Also, having the pizza hut outlet was really useful as well when you feel peckish in the day. We only ate in the restaurant a couple of times. The breakfast was good but I think you can get better deals outside. It gets extremely busy at breakfast times as well. The pool bar had great snacks too - which is always handy, especially with kids. There baby pool wasn't that warm as it was meant to be, but was much better than some of the other pools. The main pool has a slide - which was really good - even all the adults were going on there! There are secret little hot spa/tubs dotted around the resort. You just walk around near the pools, and you'll be surprised to find a little hot spa which you can jump into. The location of the hotel was ideal - close to Disney, and close to restaurants and shops as well without being in the midst of them all as the hotel is located just off the main road (near Arabian nights). I think the best thing about the hotel was the convenience of the hotels shop - where you can buy hot food and coffee to take to your room and the pools - there was a few to choose from which was good. The resort is quite big and its good to have different entrances to get into your own block. The only thing i would improve would be to have a balcony or some kind of outside seating area to relax - after the kids have gone to bed!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was pretty nice, I thought!”
Reviews.Author: skysmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just fine for us! Rooms: Decent rooms, sleep number beds nice, a/c just fine, bathroom was small and the towels rough. Not good for a sunburn!! There was a safe and a good fridge which was nice. A coffee maker in the room only brews 4 cups and we bought our own coffee and filters even though they supplied it daily. I just like my own!!! We also had a pool view which was beautiful! Hotel grounds are fabulous! The pools are their finest amenity!! One really big pool with a slide and a waterfall which is not heated, but it was nice in the ninety degree weather! A smaller pool is heated and that one was nice all the time! There is also kid's activities there daily. The waterslide was down for repair when we got there, so they had a movie at the heated pool every night for the kids! Plus, they put up a huge blown up slide for the kids to go down instead. There is 2 hot tubs which were fabulous! I found the grounds and pool areas clean and spacious! Lots of pool loungers for everyone! Service was fine. We only had one problem when I pushed a button on the safe and we couldn't get it to reset. Security was there quickly to remedy the problem. Plus, housekeeping was there every day with new towels and they cleaned the bathroom and made the beds. My only problem is that they did not vacuum. I would have liked that!! Did not eat at Mandolin's, but did get Starbucks coffee a lot and so good! Their onsite Pizza Hut Express was cool to have too!! A plaza right across the street had a little supermarket, but it was pricey. We bought a lot at Walmart or Publix. I do recommend a car here only because we like going to different places to eat and there is not much within walking distance. Did not use the shuttle service as we had our own car. Also, there is a service charge tacked on to everything you get by the pools. We ordered 2 cheeseburgers and it was $22, but they were huge and very good, but quite pricey. I sort of expected that, though. There is also a computer room in the lobby with free internet access. I checked my emails and that was convenient. Checkout was a breeze as we called in the night before and they slipped a charge sheet under our door in the morning and we never had to go to the front desk to check out unless we had a problem with our charges and we didn't. There is an $11.30 a day resort fee, but I think this is normal in Orlando for some reason. I just wish they would put it into the room rate. Very close to Disney Parks. It took us 10 minutes tops to get there and park! Overall, a pretty nice hotel. We had a good stay and enjoyed our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Skelly210
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awful. I could not believe it was a Radisson hotel. Radisson should be appalled to have their name on this hotel. The room I booked smelled and the bed wwas as hard as a rock. The bathroom tub fixtures were falling off the wall and the light switch had a problem and kept shocking me everytime I turned the light on. I requested a new room with a sleep number bed. The new room smelled as well and the sleep number bed wasnt much better. The bathroom was so small that I was afraid I would fall in to the toilet when i stepped out the shower. The air conditioning didnt work in the hallway, lobby or elevators and it was over 90 degrees outside!! Stay away from this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just O.K.”
Reviews.Author: m57torres
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms at this hotel for 3 nights because we got what we thought was great deal through a military website. I read some reviews online and was a little concerned, but went ahead with my trip. Most of the reviews were correct. The "heated pool" was okay, but not as warm as you would expect. The pool with the slide and the kiddie pool were ice cold. We had planned to spend most of our time at the pools but had to find alternative entertainment becaues of the pool temp. Our kids enjoyed some of the activities during the day and the staff did a good job of orgainizing the games. The rooms were also okay, but not what the website led us to believe. We were under the impression the hotel had recently been renovated, but the carpets were very worn, walls had paint/wall paper coming off, and the rooms smelled musty. We got sleep numbers, those were great, but had to spend about 30min at the front desk to get the rooms we had reserved. Dinning was very pricey and service at Madalions was very poor. Front desk staff was friendly, but we had to wait over an hour to get a crib brought up to our room. Once we got it, there were no sheets. We never got those. We ended up checking out a day early. For the price it was just okay. Probably won't plan another stay there. I felt the website was very misleading.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the $$; but not great”
Reviews.Author: minisann
Reviews.Content: We just visited Orlando to do the whole Disney/Universal theme parks trip with our son. This "resort" is very close to the parks, which is a definate plus. However, with a rental car (or even had it been our own car), we felt that the parking situation didn't feel "safe", as adequate lighting and security were not readily available. We abtained a rate of about $110 at their own website. However, we later found a cheaper rate on Travelocity. They honored their online price guarantee and we ended up with a price of $62 (plus tax & resort fees)-to around $75/night. Not bad considering the close proximity to the parks. Our rate also included 2 free adult breakfast buffets and free children under 10 meals. The regular price on the buffet was $13/pp. The online service desk assured me that they had updated their records to include the revised per night fee and included the freebies. However, I had to spend an additional 30 minutes at the front desk convincing them that this was what was promised by their online desk. The manager finally took care of it for us. The carpet and interior did look worn (past its prime) considering that they just remodeled. However, the lobby and restaurants were very nice. The pools were very nice too. Beware: They charge a 15% service charge on all meals, and beverages ordered at their restaurants, bar, take out and room delivery. Tip is of course, extra. They offer discount tickets to the parks, which is definately worth while (we spent appox. $210/for 7 days of Disney parks). We got a better deal online for the Universal parks ($70/pp for a 2-day pass). Additionally, if you use the promo code for their rental car partner (Thrifty), you get approx. a 50% discount on the regular fare. We did get sleep number beds in our room and that was nice. I woudn't try the onsite restaurants late in the evening though, because the service is not just poor; but horrible. However, the breakfast staff is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with extras and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: ResortSpaLady
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference at the Gaylord resort--The Gaylord was sold out and the radisson was listed as the other conference hotel. Some attendees were disappointed that the Radisson was 10 minutes from the gaylord but there was a shuttle service. I had a rental car so it did not matter. Parking is free at the Radisson as are many other amenities. I travel for business and everything was free at the business center and it was open 24/7. The staff was always very helpful to send faxes, mail letters--do anything that I asked so I was very pleased with this. This can add up at hotels so I would return to this hotel just for this reason. My room was nicely decorated but a bit worn and dated. The bedskirt was dirty and I kept my socks or shoes on for the duration of the stay. There was not enough lighting in the room, especially if you are working on the bed. The bath was fully stocked with towels and basic amenities. There was a coffee pot in the room with coffee and tea. The room was very quiet and peaceful--I did occasionally hear doors slamming but that was the only noise. There are grocery stores in the area so I used the refrigerator that was in the room for beverages and snacks. Don't order the chicken lettuce wraps and expect PF Changs--I set the tray in the hallway and did not eat but I did order some room service at lunch and sandwiches were ok. It was a 45 minute wait for room service both times. The work out room was above average with good lighting and newer, clean equipment. It is next to the pool so you can enjoy the view while you work out. The grounds and lobby are very nice and there was always securtity about. There is a coffee shop, gift shop, pizza hut, snacks in the lobby so you won't go hungry but the $$ adds up. It is not far from Disney and I saw large buses picking up and dropping off folks throughout the stay. There seemed to be a lot of families but also some couples and business folks. The staff was also pleasant and accomodating. I would stay at this hotel again--especially if I want to save some $$. For the money I was pleased with the accomodations and service. The nicest surprise was to be able to see the fireworks at disney from my window every night-- What a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ivy23kris
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location!! It was walking distance from a lot of restaurants and right off the interstate to all the disney attractions. Honestly, you don't even have to leave the resort. They have everything there, activies, bar, music, great restaurant and even starbucks coffee and pizza hut pizza. I loved the room, although my bed was not a sleep number and it was very hard, but we were on the 8th floor and over looked the Epcot ball and every night around 9:00pm we got to see the firework show. It was amazing and free!! The only problem I had was with the room service. They screwed up our order 2 times and when we finally went down stairs to talk to the manager it took him 15 mins. to come to the desk and talk to me. He then proceeded to tell me he would come back to my room and give me a refund, well he never came but the poor room service guy came up with our money and our food. (We had waited over 2 hrs. and we had lost our appetite) I think they might have some management problems with such a big property. All in all I can't fault them for a bad day of room service so I def. recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: miamimickey140
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 3 days in Orlando....and this resort was a big surprise. I read some of the review on Tripadvisor and really found nothing wrong with this resort at all. LOCATION: Perfct since its right next to I-4 which takes you to the Disney parks. So your no more then 10 min drive (if that) GROUNDS: Amazing! Has two clean pools with a slide and waterfall. Outdoor bar for drinks and even a Pizza Hut Window. Live music at the bar which you can hear at the pool. Lots of games and activities for the kids. Landscape was very nice and building was well maintained. Lobby was very welcoming. ROOM: We stayed in the 6000 building on the 7th floor with a view to City of Celebration. Room was a great size with very modern/contemporary furniture. bathroom was a bit small...but super clean. I loved the room. We had a king size bed with sleep number which was great. Sheets and pillows were soft. Over all this is an amazing little jewel in the middle of Orlando. Minutes from the park. Clean nice sized rooms. Staff is friendly. I will agree with the previous review about the $12.00 daily charge. But its not a priceline issue. Most orlando hotels do this now. I go to Orlando about 4 times a year and know they do this. But i will say this has been the most expensive charge I have had from all Orlando hotels. I have had from 3.00 to 9.00, Bottom line its worth it. You get alot for the 12.00. I will be booking my next stay here!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Quick Note About Priceline”
Reviews.Author: skakodker
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was not bad at all. The facilities were decent and the staff was polite and courteous. I booked my trip through Priceline and got a decent deal. However, I would like to caution people who do this that this Hotel charges a $12/day "service" fee that they tack on to your bill. Add that to any deal you get on Priceline to decide whether you're getting a decent deal or not. As a frequent traveller, I will say that in most hotels, things like wireless Internet access, use of the swimming pool, etc., are included in the room rate. I guess things are different in Orlando. I believe Priceline could do a better job of keeping its customers better informed.

Reviews.Title: “Was very happy/Give it a try”
Reviews.Author: keysformees
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a group of 75 and out of 75 74 had a wonderful experience/ the 75th was quickly taken care of. Clean rooms/great front desk service/wonderful pool area/ if you are looking for disney then stay at disney if not this is a geat alternative/I have stayed in over 20 different hotels in orlando including disney/universal and have travel ed alot around the world! This was a pleasant surprise! Great omlettes at the breakfast buffet! So give it a try...we will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Just what I was after”
Reviews.Author: scnickr
Reviews.Content: When I read the reviews, I couldn't believe people were being so negative so had to change it around. It's a brilliant place for kids, nice clean pool with free towels, pool bar etc. Nice restaurant. Really had a nice time staying here and would love to go back to this hotel again. The coach driver was very dedicated about his job, being on time etc and very friendly. No faults except on arrival the more expensive room I booked wasn't available so we had to have a room with two double beds which wans't a problem really. More space and manged to get a refund from Expedia once they had confirmed I had paid more than what I got. I does seem this hotel has a habit of changing people's rooms at the last minute, but don't let that put you off. The rooms were very clean with maid service daily. No problems with them at all and very polite. A nice pizza hut on site for any kids that are staying, if that like that sort of thing. Tad expensive but where isn't these days?! Nice selection of food on the menu too. Overall, a nice stay here and would stay here again. Good for all (Families, couples, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine_Floridian
Reviews.Content: -We did the hotwire, $84, great rate, great hotel for that rate. -Beds were a bit firm, but SleepNumber Beds are available for extra charge and are very comfortable. -The hotel seemed like it was recently renovated -We got the handicap room (extra space in bathroom) -Pool with waterslide seemed nice -Pizza Hut and Mandolins (full service restaurant) both located on property) Only negative complaint i have is about the directions the hotel staff gave us, they didnt know where we were when we gave them a specific location and we were put on hold for ten minutes to wait for someone competent to help. We only stayed for a night, and had a pleasent experience regardless of the rather incompetent staff. I think the on property Disney hotels are better even if you stay at the value resorts, or the hotels in Lake Buena Vista due to location. This hotel is a bit out of the way if you're planning a Walt Disney World Resort trip.

Reviews.Title: “terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: STLTravelUS
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through priceline and thought it would be a okay hotel although we read some negative reviews. But things were not as we expected. The first night we arrived late because of a delayed flight. They kicked us out and sent us to a hotel (American Best Value Inn) across the street. Apparently they overbooked the rooms and thought we wouldn't show up. Finally we moved in, The room was okay. But we found there were some black spots in the tub, which made us a little uncomfortable. However, the most terrible thing was, some one broke in our room in the midnight because the hotel gave them the key to our room! We were terrified and asked the hotel staffs to find what's wrong. But apprently they didn't want to solve the problem or even apologize to us sincerely. Please think twice before you book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe all the bad press. *******A super Hotel*******”
Reviews.Author: FourOnTour
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a stay at the Radisson Hotel Celebration with my family and I must say I was very pleased with the whole thing. Sometime after we booked (with Virgin) one of our party decided to read some of the reviews on Tripadvisor and to our horror the majority of them were very poor with lots of negative statements. After reading these were very tempted to change our booking to another hotel, well I am glad that we didn’t. From the check in to the check out I was very pleased with the whole experience. We were in Orlando for two weeks over what was probably the busiest time of the year being Easter and Spring break in the US and the Hotel was very busy. Even though it was busy the staff was very helpful and we never had any issues with using the facilities. The check in took a matter of minutes and when we opened the doors of the rooms we were presented with a clean comfortable room with everything you could expect, I do agree however with one of the Tripadvisor reviews that the bathroom is a touch on the small side but if that’s the worst thing in a holiday experience then life is good. We had a nice view onto one of the lakes and fountains and the room was very clean. We had only one problem in the entire stay when the toilet became blocked (I blame the large Florida meals), I phoned guest services and literally within minutes the maintenance lady was knocking on the door and solved the problem with the whole thing from call to completion taking less than ten minutes (honestly). The pools were excellent with a small heated pool and a large unheated pool that was superb for cooling down and relaxing in the hot sunshine, there was also a good sized children’s pool and two red hot spa pools. To further show the friendliness of the resort, the staff take a projector down to the heated pool at night and play movies on a large screen so you can swim and watch a film while enjoying a drink from the pool bar (called dive in movies). We used the Deli bar on several occasions and the pizzas, burgers and chicken were all good and fairly priced and the staff were very friendly with the manager (I assume) being very and chatty. The hotel has a wide variety of facilities including a decent shop, ticket and attraction agents, and business suite including use of the internet. We never went into Mandolins restaurant so I could not comment, however it looked quite nice. All things considered the hotel was excellent and combined with its superb location I have to say that the Radisson was an excellent experience for our family. I have been to Orlando several times and must say the Radisson is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for- Maybe”
Reviews.Author: CletusVanDam
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night during a convention where the main hotel was sold out for the night. Upon arrival I was told that I would have to wait for about 2 1/2 hours before my "assigned" room was ready. When I told the clerk that I really needed to get into a room and then back to the convention I got a shrug of the shoulders. When I told her that it woul dnot work, another shrug of the shoulders. After having to hustle this hotel up due to no openings at the main hotel I was not thrilled about going and trying to find another hotel ,even with the lousy attitude of the desk clerk. \\ I then chatted with a supervisor that said "no problem we can assign you another room". Then she gives me the old $11 resort fee scam. Why cannot a hotel simply raise their rate if they need to rather than play this slimy game. Knowing that most people (including myself at this point ) are to tired to go elsewhere they manage to extract a few more bucks from you. Multiply that times a few hundred rooms every night and they get a nice margin for giving you nothing that a "resort" should anyway. You get to use the pool, free internet access (in the lobby) .. whats is next $2 for a towel? Arriving at my room , the door have a nice collection of chips, dings, and small divots all over it. They were quite artfully covered up with a childlike smear of plastic wood in a lovely contrasting color to the the simulated walnut of the door. A strinking first impression if ever. Inside the room, worn furniture ,an AC unit that thumped like a studebaker, and a shower curtain with nicely scattered dark spots greeted me. All in all probably what you get for about a $100 per night in Orlando. My advice would be if you had to stay here you will survive but certainly not go home and tell all they must visit here. I fyou have the means, spend some more and upgrade to another place. I cash is tight, try the motel six down the road. Oh almost forgot about the beds. The heavily advertised sleep number beds are additional cost and not available always. The beds in my room should be called plankmatics. Enough said

Reviews.Title: “Major problems! You can do better!”
Reviews.Author: pabmo
Reviews.Content: I stupidly booked this hotel again, after staying there 3 years ago! While it's a good price for the location and amenities, there are major problems with reservations/billing! The first time we stayed there, they ran out of non-smoking rooms, and had to give us a smoking room. It smelled awful and my husband has allergies! At least back then, they comped us that one night, and put us into non-smoking the next night. This last stay, however, we were arriving late into Orlando, so I called ahead to confirm that they had our room and weren't going to give it away. We arrived around close to midnight, and guess what? They'd given our room away!! With a tired and grumpy 5 year old child wanting to just go to bed, the Radisson staff told us they had booked us at the Rosen Shingle Creek, 7 miles away! But that they would comp us that night. So we stayed at the Rosen, who said they needed our credit card just to have on file and that the Radisson would pay. Well, we checked our credit card statement and sure enough, we'd been charged $186 for staying at the Rosen. We went back to the Radisson the next night to continue our booked stay, and reminded them to pay for the Rosen. They acted like they knew nothing, and it took much aggravation to get the point across of their mistakes. They were very uncaring and unprofessional. They gave us a letter saying they were responsible for the charges at the Rosen, but we still have not gotten a credit to our account and I'm still working on getting our money back. We should not be responsible for having all this aggravation over their mistakes. But I feel like it will be like pulling teeth over the next few weeks trying to get this resolved. So I guess my point is, if you plan on arriving late to this hotel, just know that your room may be given away, and just say NO to any other hotel they want to send you to! I would have rather just gone to the Quality Inn which was advertising vacancy, instead of being sent to a 5 star, overpriced hotel, which the Rosen Shingle is, and then getting totally cheated out of money I could have spent somewhere else. The front desk staff at the Radisson are very unprofessional, so just be prepared to deal with that if any problems come up. We will NEVER stay there again. I would recommend staying at Lowes hotel near Universal, as they are professional and accomodating. If we ever return to Orlando, that's where we'll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “The pool is just what I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: sdmiller
Reviews.Content: I arrived in the morning on a red-eye flight from LA. The staff was very friendly and accomodating and made every attempt to get me into my room as soon as possible. The pool was great, just know that there is entertainment at the pool so it's not always a serene with Bingo numbers being called. The room was clean, nothing too exciting to report. Walking distance to restaurants and gift shops. No shuttle from the airport but I was able to book with Mears for a round trip total of $31 (less than one-way cab fare). Overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelor14
Reviews.Content: Very nice, big hotel. The pool was Huge! It had a nice waterfall and slide. The second pool is nice too. Along with the kids pool and 2 hot tubs! Very Nice lobby with an on site deli, Starbucks and Pizza Hut. Also a dine-in resturant with excellent service. Rooms were newly renovated. Room service and housekeeping were wonderful. The thing I was most amazed with, was the wonderful continental breakfast. Wide variety of great food, every morning! The only two negatives things I would say is the fact that is it difficult to navigate your way around the hotel. Also most of the staff didn't understand much English. Other than that, my stay was very pleasent and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Could have stayed somewhere nicer for less $$$”
Reviews.Author: mooch010
Reviews.Content: We arrived 03/23/07, there was no shuttle service to Hotel from airport. Spent $70 on cabfare + tip. Hotel power was out so we couldnt check in for hours. Finally checked in still with no power. They offered my 2 & 5 yr old glow sticks because it was dark!! OOOh, a .50 cent glow stick! Finally we dropped our luggage in our Dark Room and headed dowstairs to Moldinos Retsruant. Poor Poor Service & Very Limited Menu!!!! At least the restraunt had power! Well, after our long dinner we headed to bed for what we thought would be a comfortable nights rest. The headboard in our room was falling off the wall and every time you moved the pillow it would clank. Carpet in room was so so. The best part was the Heated POOL & our lovely cleaning lady that kindly arranged my childrens stuffed animals each day. The clown at breakfast was also good. Anyway, I wouldn't stay here again. I wouldn't reccomend you stay here either. Not really in walking distance to much except a convient mart in a less desireable strip mall.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been way better.”
Reviews.Author: diane381
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very close to Disney and the main highway along with a huge street of places to eat or shop so that was a real plus. I didn't care for the beds as they were so hard. One of the reasons I booked was because of the sleep number beds, only after requesting one did I find out that you do not get these if you book from an outside agency, that they are $10. extra per night and that there were not any available for the 5 nights I stayed. I wasn't too pleased with that. Also, what ever you pay add $11.30 on to it as they make you pay that much extra per night. They say it is for the pool and refriedgerator ect. Bull, that is their sneaky way of getting more money out of you, I would have seriously left right when I checked in if I could have gotten any of my money back. Really a total rip off if you pay more then $65. per night (I paid a lot more then that), so I really was unhappy with this place and would not recommend unless you can get it in the price range mentioned above. There are a ton of more fairly priced places in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pools...room smelled”
Reviews.Author: SpartyIndianapolis
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights here for a small convention. Checking went well. Opended the door to my room and was welcomed by a strong musty smell. I thought the smell would dissipate, so I unpacked. all my clothes. Plus it was a very long walk back to the desk seeing I was in the 6000 Building. The next morning, while getting dressed I noticed the smell had permeated my clothes. Now it was too late to ask for another room, cause the embedded funk was in my clothes. I was embarassaed to get near people during the convention thinking people would believe I hadn't showered or something, all due to the smell from the room. I could not wear a vest on the plane during my flight home because of the room's lingering effect. I now have to have all my clothes dry cleaned to get the smell out of them. Also, during my three nights I would walk in the room wearing white socks. By the end of my stay the bottoms of both socks were literally black from dirt and gunk in the carpet, which appartently had not been cleaned for some time. The staff was pleasant, and worked very hard because of the large groups that were staying here. Deli staff was friendly. Good business center. Warning...don't stay on the sixth floor of the 6000 Building

Reviews.Title: “Fairly Good, Nice Pool”
Reviews.Author: CanuckFamilyOfFour
Reviews.Content: The common facilities (Pool, Lobby, etc) were quite nice, but the rooms were a touch cramped, especially the bathrooms. In general the rooms were nice, but in need of some freshening up. Carpet in the room was a bit grungy with many spots. Missing some simple things like a trash bin in the bathroom. Beds were clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was nice, but a few too many greasy items and not enough healthy alternatives. Beware of the 1/2hr lineups for waffles, there's only 1 waffle iron and it seems every kid in the hotel wants a waffle! Court yard and pool area was beautiful, with two swimming pools, two hot tubs, waterfalls and a waterslide. Good music and entertainment in the pool area throughout the day. Not enough shuttle departure times to and from Disney World. They should add a few more scheduled departures during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Reveiw_gal
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel upon our first stay in Orlando. Not knowing what to expect we booked it and hopped for the best. We arrived at this hotel early int he afternoon. It was fairly basic but was in a good location. We had to change the room sevrel times because of a stale smell of somke lingerng. The staff were fairly friendly and this hotel is fairly close to disney but is somewhat iscolated and has quite a dead atmosphere. I guess if all you want is a room at an ok price its good, but if you are not planning on visiting any paks then I would think twice before staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Rotherhamlass
Reviews.Content: me and my husband and Young daughter and sister in law stayed in this hotel, we found it to be clean and very well presented....the hotel had its own sports bar which all staff where very warm and welcome towards us all...the pizza hut was lovely they made all pizza's in front of you they did burgers salads and all other things too, the gift shop was really very nice had all the little things you may need too, the pools where very clean....all towels provided and even a pool bar, it was all very nice and clean i would stay here again for sure x

Reviews.Title: “We had a good stay”
Reviews.Author: Momoftwo-23
Reviews.Content: This hotel could definitely use some improvements, but we had a great stay. Our room was very clean and the service was great. Yes, there was an old worn chair in the room; newer furniture would've been nice. The sleep number beds were comfortable. They did change our sheets during our stay. We could've really used a microwave in the room. The pools were clean and nice. However, we were disappointed that the heated pool was not the one with the slide (one of the reasons we chose this hotel). The staff held activities during the day at the pools. The hot tubs were clean; however, one was not hot enough and the other one was too hot. They closed them down on our last day for cleaning (and hopefully, temperature check). Really nice landscape, relaxing environment. The breakfast buffet was average; however, the cooked to order omelets were great. It was nice to have a Starbucks on site. We ate at the deli several times and everything was good, Pizza Hut pizza, burgers and great cuban sandwiches. We also ordered room service and had no problems. The pasta entree was good, but my daughter's chicken tenders were not that great. The ice machines were broke for a while, but were fixed the next day. I think it is a nice hotel with good service overall if you are not too picky.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: txphinfan
Reviews.Content: Our room was not as nice as the pictures make it appear. It was old, crampt and dirty. When we got there, the carpets had not appeared to have been vacuumed and the tub was dirty. There were small amounts of black mold in the sink and that remained there for our entire stay. There was a bottle cap on the bathroom floor that remained for our entire stay, meaning that the floor wasn't thoroughly swept. Durning our stay, the sheets were never changed and the tub was never cleaned. A ring around it for each day. We got ice the first night and every time we went to get some more, the ice bucket was full of water and had never had the bag replaced or the bucket cleaned. I emptied the coffee pot and rinsed it when I could get some coffee. Otherwise, it sat for days with the coffee in it. I was only left coffee twice. Went to use a glass and it had the previous occupant's dried milk or whatever. This place was average, usually dirty, but had a decent location. Close to dining, stores and Disney, etc. The pizza place and diner had extremely slow service and got our pizza wrong after waiting and waiting. When people asked questions, the staff had no idea. We got this room at a rate of $80.25, and felt somewhat cheated. I would have been furious had we paid the $139 rate as listed on their site.

Reviews.Title: “Service less than desirable”
Reviews.Author: Mr.Brandon'sMom
Reviews.Content: As a Radisson Gold Club Member, I expected a great room along with great service at the Radisson - Celebration. After waiting 25 minutes to check in (at 8:00 pm on a Tuesday night), I was given the wrong room. Then I had to wait in line again to get the room assignment corrected. The "Resort Fee" charged is ridiculous. I checked in at 8:00 pm and checked out at 6:30 am but I was still required to pay the fee. The pools were cold and dirty. The room itself was clean. The Sleep Number beds were comfortable. At checkout, my bill was incorrect. Another guest(s) charged dinner at the onsite restaurant to MY room account. When I disputed the charge, the front desk clerk acted like she didn't believe me. The staff members I encountered were not friendly either. Overall, I was very disappointed and will think twice about staying at a Radisson hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “NOT AS GREAT AS IT SOUNDS”
Reviews.Author: ~KK027~
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not originally a Radisson, but was a Ramada in for what must have been 100 years, before being refurbished. It *is* truly very very close to Disneyworld and to Universal, but because Orlando's every road is under construction all the time, you really have to know your way around and have a map handy so that you can drive easily. Getting home will be different than coming there, in fact, our instructions for how to get to the hotel involved making a U-turn in between the white concrete things that partition the road (which wasn't the freeway but some sort of 'parkway') in the dirt with zooming traffic coming at us head-on in the midst of a steep curve. The hotel did have swimming for the kids, but the pool was murky and all three kids got rashes on their body.They said the pool slide was at least 40 feet when it was more like 40 inches. They said the water smelled like urine. For sure, we did see babies in the pool with diapers on even though I think there was a smaller pool that they should have used. It was pretty bad. The parking was nearly impossible to get into. We had to drive around four or five buildings, or come through a secret back entrance, all of which had a keypad that we were required to know a special code for. One guy forgot his and stopped up the whole line while he tried to figure it out. I think someone just finally told him what it was. There was not room enough to park near your building, and other buildings' visitors would park near our building. At one point I had to park near the lobby and took one of the limo's places because there literally were zero spaces for me anywhere in the whole lot. The outdoor fun, including bar and big screen tv closes at 10 or 10:30, not what you'd expect for people on vacation trying to have a good time. We had no minibar in the room, which is fine, but we thought there was a mini-kitchen and there was not. Small fridge that froze everything, so we lost $50 of lobster pasta we brough back to the room from a nearby restaurant. There was 1 (one) microwave in the entire hotel, which consists of about five, 5-story buildings whose hallways meet in the middle, sort of like a star. That's a lot of people to have no microwave power. We never could get the safe to open. The buildings' exterior doors would lock you out, requiring key to get in, so if you ran to the car without it, you might sit there for a while before someone noticed you. There was no intercom to alleviate this situation. The outdoors had a long long walkway that you could bypass by going through a cigarette infested dirt path made by oh-so-many before you, and I personally did not like the concrete stairway where people would lurk while smoking where you had to slide your key. The deli there was incredibly expensive, and I spent $60 on a quick breakfast and lunch there one day. It has a Pizza Hut inside it, but then again that was expensive, charging $25 or more for a medium pizza. The "Kids eat free" program is a joke. If you want to go to a deserted restaurant on the premises that charges more than double what a normal place would charge, then you can see why a child might eat for free. If you won the lottery you still wouldn't go there... only 8 or 10 items on the menu, and it was NOT that nice of a place either. The one great thing about this place is that it is so close to the amusement/theme parks, and it's close to gas station and walgreens. There was an odd lack of take-out / normal restaurants there, as though you were stranded in some far-away city without a modern-day restaurant row. The room was redone with down pillows and comforters, too, which was heavenly, and the hallways were painted and carpeted very attractively. The staff was quite friendly and helpful, although they spoke no English (which doesn't bother me). Everything in the rooms seemed clean and they had good speed internet. The tv of course had 5 channels, all of which were aimed at getting you to buy something or to advertise Orlando. Their deals on tickets were the worst, asking considerably more money for one-day passes to one park only. With the rain coming and going, we needed better than that, and we got lucky by buying tickets from the parks themselves. The best ticket deal is from the Sea World site, which has links for tickets that allow you to come and go at your choice of many different parks for your choice of days (1-14, I believe). All in all I'd probably stay there again if I did not plan to swim, watch tv, enjoy any type of nightlife or eat close-by, but wanted to be close to the parks at a place I'm familiar with. In reality, I know if I go back to Orlando, I'll be looking forward to better accommodations elsewhere. ~KK~

Reviews.Title: “Bestest Foreverest”
Reviews.Author: trojanette07
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late in coming, but we want to give credit where it is due. My girlfriend and I traveled to Florida for a birthday rendezvous and a bit of Disneyworld and Universal. Reasons for recommendation: (1) Hotel room was very clean. The rooms are separated into various buildings, and I believe we were in complex 3. Lots of towels in the bathroom. TV worked great. (2) Shuttle Service was amazing. The driver was hilarious, knew everything about the area. He gave tips about what to do, where to eat. Shuttles went to all locations, so you don't need a car if you're on a budget, which we were. Definitely made our trip much more enjoyable. Shuttles started early and picked you up really late at the parks, so you can stay a bit later if you wanted to. (3) Breakfast buffet was awesome. Made-to-order omelettes, there was bacon, eggs, and even donuts. For, you know... people who want to eat donuts in the morning. (4) Front desk service was great, even at 4am when we were checking out to catch a flight. Checkin and checkout were painless. Not-so-good stuff: (1) Pool was closed at the time. It was winter and really damn cold and rainy part of the time. So not a big deal and I'd bet its open by now. (2) Room service didn't arrive for a long time, so that was a minor issue. But when we called to ask why what took so long, they gave us a discount. Coool. Finally, in conclusion, summarizing: Great hotel, would stay at again, would recommend to everyone. Great for couples, family and anyone who is on a budget. Perhaps not as a honeymoon location, but its Disneyworld. woo!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay....clarifications needed about "resort" title”
Reviews.Author: mimifg
Reviews.Content: First, let me say our stay at this Radisson was wonderful...reasonably priced, not overwrought with children, and though chilly, the oversize jacuzzi's and heated pool were a joy. This is not, however, a "resort", rather a very large hotel on beautifully landscaped grounds off of I-4. Resort to me means sauna, massages, salon, etc. and to be waiting on hand and foot. We got a room in the "6000" building and had sleep number beds. Very pleasant night's sleep. Quality of linens was lovely. Air conditioning and heat worked great. The bathroom was perfectly fine and the housekeeping were excellent. Water pressure and temperature were always consistent. Decor was nicely appointed. Bathrooms a bit small but not a big deal unless you are really obese and with an obese partner trying to brush your teeth at the same time. There is a free large bus that will take you to all the Walt Disney locations (at set schedules), Universal Studios and SeaWorld. You are within easy walking distance to a strip mall that has a Kobe Japanese steakhouse. Regarding front desk staff....very, very helpful, as was the bellman. Room service, though prompt, mixed up my order one night and then came back with the original plate of spaghetti I ordered. (I received someone else's fruit plate....maybe they were trying to tell me something.) When they came back with the spaghetti, it was cold. Not good. However, the next night, room service was perfect. Spot on. The bar was lively but not too raucous. The lobby area is very clean and spacious with lots of room to gather. There is a business center with free internet (two stations and a printer). No need to pay to use the "check your email" machine in the telephone room. Bypass that and go into the business center. Breakfast is a whole other story. It was included in our rate and I will say the omlette's made to order were the best I have had. The rest of the breakfast buffet was not so good but my husband had no complaint. The wait staff were obviously taxed and service was slow. I couldn't blame them....I would have flipped out. There is a clown that paints children's faces during breakfast. This was annoying to me because kids were running helter-skelter like the Second Coming had arrived when it was there turn to get their faces painted, knocking into things and people. We did not eat in the restaurant (Mandolin's) other than for breakfasts. There is also a Starbucks on site. The on-site Diner is not so good. Icky hamburgers ("where's the beef?) but good for families I suppose (Pizza, hamburgers, soup, salads, milk, etc etc etc.) All in all, a good stay off the Disneyworld campus. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the bad reviews scare you...”
Reviews.Author: Hawkshoe
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at a decent rate and then came here to find some not so positive reviews. I was a bit nervous but decided to keep my booking as there were few hotels available at a decent rate. I am glad I did. We really enjoyed this hotel. The staff was friendly and efficient. The room as nice, the pool was great and the grounds were very pretty. My only complaints were that the hallway smelled strongly of smoke. I must say, however, that our room did not have the same odor. We went to Mandolins for breakfast which was decent (I am not sure how much it cost as we ended up getting it for free due to some poor service). The deli prices for drinks were expensive also. The could improve on the restaurants, but otherwise a nice place to stay. It was very convenient to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: missy2k7
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to post a review on here because my husband and i booked this hotel for our honeymoon ages ago and then right befor we went we looked on this website to see the reviews. Reading what it said on here made me want to cancel but as we would lose money cancelling we decided to risk it. Well we were so delightfuly surprised when we arrived, the hotel was gorgeous! Our room was big, clean and quite. The bed was amazing, it was one of thier sleep number beds and i would highly recommend requesting one, great night sleep after a long day at the parks! The pools were excellent and the hot tubs even better (especially the one with the waterfall) Even thought the breakfast wasn't included we thought the prices were very resonable and the food itself was great! We were also concerned because we thought there could be extra costs added on at check in, but there wasn't any. This place is one of the best hotels i've ever stayed in, do not let the negative reviews put you off staying here or you will most definatly regret it (trust me i've stayed in a few orlando hotels and none compare for the price). cheers! jess and jim in Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Won't return”
Reviews.Author: ath17
Reviews.Content: Although paying for the stay in advance on Expedia, we were hit with an $11 per night service fee at checkout. This is the only hotel where I have ever seen that. Also, during our trip, the regularly scheduled bus service to Universal and SeaWorld ran once per day. The bus to Disneyworld ran 4 times a day. The last bus back ran around the same time the fireworks display at the Magic Kingdom was starting. There are better options in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.... just a little advice”
Reviews.Author: homesteadj
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! This is my 5th visit. I even brought my boss for a local convention and he had nothing but great reviews. I typically visit with my family and always find the property and rooms to be great! Get a room with breakfast included.. best hotel breakfast..yet! However.. here is my advice, The dinner ordered in from room service was terrible! I have eaten in the restaurant prior and had a good experience. The quality of the room service food is quite different from the actual restaurant. Other than that the stay was great. Also, if you are a guest who smokes, please do not smoke in the room, as it is unfair to the guests who are non smokers that visit after you... the hotel does have rules. I unfortunately stayed in one of these rooms... and suffered from allergies...

Reviews.Title: “Problems fixed!!! Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelRNFtLauderdale
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at the Radisson Celebration through Travelocity . It was the perfect location and the price was great!...Then I got worried, it was almost too good so I checked it out on Tripadvisor and was even more concerned. Since I had made the reservation last minute, only two days before I was going; I decided to keep the reservation and give it a try. What a pleasant surprise!!! Everything is just beautiful!! We had a lovely view of the generously landscaped pool area and waterfall. No construction. A secure gated parking lot. Several pools and spas, including a waterfall into the pool, water slide, heated pool, kiddie pool and separate private spa (jacuzzi) A fresh, generous, breakfast buffet was included and they even had an omelet and belgian waffle station. The hotel is across the street from the town of Celebration where we had planned to spend most of our time but we ended up spending most of the day at the pool drinking pina coladas from the pool side Tiki bar. No need to get out of our lounger they took our order and served us poolside. Don't let previous negative posts dissuade you. Everything was perfectly clean. Great beds and lovely high end bedding. Go now before the raise the rates!!! Cynthia from Ft Lauderdale.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Vacation Stay-Fine Hotel for Adults”
Reviews.Author: Tripfor2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Radisson Celebration last week and had no problems with this hotel. We had an early morning flight and I was skeptical that they would not let us check in early in the morning. The front desk reception was friendly and checked us in right away! I was nervous that our room might not be nice because of all the negative reviews. I was very surprised. We stayed in building 6000, which must have been recently renovated because our room was immaculate, new carpeting, marble bathroom (small, but clean) and a sleep number bed. We had a really nice view of the pool too. There is one thing to be aware of and that is that they have cards in the bathroom and near the bed that tell you if you want clean sheets every day, to put the card on the pillow/bed and throw the towels in the bathtub if you want clean towels. We abided by this request and had NO problem getting clean sheets and towels restocked every day. Since we were barely at the hotel and really wanted a quiet place to sleep, we found it to be very sufficient for our needs. The jacuzzi was great. We rented a car and found the hotel property to be very convenient and close to all the theme parks & entertainment. The deli area can be pricey, so you are better off going to the nearest Walgreens for juice and snacks. We ordered pizza from Pizza Hut that is in the hotel and it was delivered quickly to our room, hot and fresh. The information desk staff was very helpful and the business center provided internet service when we needed to use it. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to my family and friends & would go back myself!

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great time !!”
Reviews.Author: Curlee
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from our 10 day stay at this Resort Jan.12-21/07. We had great weather and a Great time. Because of our flight from Canada we ended up arriving at the hotel in the morning and were greeted by Jeff at the front desk, who went out of his way to get us an available room early. Our maid Carmen was excellent. Our room was ALWAYS clean (thank you Jeff and Carmen for great customer service) Now, yes the hotel is older. So what. There where two beautiful pools. The main one was cold, but it had such a wonderful waterfall and slide that lent to the relaxing atmostphere. Two hot tubs. One with a hotwater waterfall (beautiful) near building 6000. The heated pool much to our delight was Saline (salt). So much nicer on your skin and eyes when swimming. We found the pool BBQ cafe food was always good. BBQ chicken breast on a bun (nice). We didn't like the Lobby Buffet dinner. The chairs and tables where just awkward to eat at. We went to this hotel not with high expectations but with a positive attitude that our vacation was going to be great. And it was !! All in all, we would have loved to stay longer. We will be return customers. HINT* If looking for a beautiful site to dine casually, then make the extra effort to Vist the town of Celebration. Right across from the lake is the MarketPlace Cafe. Nice casual dinning out on the patio sidewalk. We loved the turkey dinner. Also Pacino's Steak House across from Olde Town..mmmm like butter.(a little pricey) We didn't get any tickets for theme parks from the lobby (timeshare..ugh)

Reviews.Title: “A very clean room”
Reviews.Author: beachbabymorristown
Reviews.Content: After reading all the bad reviews of this place I was terrified of what I was gonna find when we got there. But I must say our experience was great. Our room was very clean and we had no problems at all. The only thing I could possibly complain about is the maids didn't show up until late in the afternoon to clean our room. Drink prices are a little pricey in the bar and at the pool but I find that anywhere you are staying near a resort area. I am pretty picky about cleanliness and the hotels I stay at and this one passed my inspection. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Needs major refit not a touch-up!”
Reviews.Author: trailblazer_uk2000
Reviews.Content: Arrived on 22nd December, for our second stay at this hotel, first time was in August 2006, when I would say it was better than average. however, this time the first room we were given had no main curtains, just the plain nets, dispite being very busy with registrations, the reception gave another room just up the corridor. First impressions were it was a little grubby, and the carpet was more than just a little worn, with 2-3 patches where it was down to bare threads, on a couple of other places it was dirty too, and didn't get cleaned during the 10 days we were there. We had used the Deli, to get breakfast on our previous stay, and to get quick meals when we couldn't be bothered to go out in the evening (it's tiring walking around Disney parks all day!!). We used it again this time, but found that the breakfast stocks were often insufficient, on at least three morning the were no Croissants, and this was at 8am? If you are using the Pizza/fried Chicken section, please be aware that this facility is often so overrun with order that food can take a good while to come, and on one occasion, the forgot about our food order completely, and as a result my wife suffered with a dose of runs, because the food had not been properly cooked. So to sum up, this was not the best experience we have had and we've stayed in many hotels from Kuala Lumpur & Singapore to New York & Toronto. The hotel needs to have some serious money spent on the rooms to bring them up to the standard of hotel they claim to be.

Reviews.Title: “Rated 3.5 stars on Hotwire. A dump. Beware”
Reviews.Author: InVivoVeritas
Reviews.Content: Appallingly filthy and rundown. A 1970s vinatge resort that somehow manages to rate 3.5 on Hotwire (probably a 4 on Priceline). Has made us very wary of hotel ratings. We have never written a hotel review, but after complaining many months ago after a stay here to both Hotwire and management, we recently made the mistake of booking blindly again through Hotwire and discovered that the rating remains. Either they've rebuilt this dump from the ground up in the last 3 months or Hotwire is in collusion with Radisson. BTW my wife and I have travelled extensively and stayed in accommodations ranging from hostels to 5 star properties. This is genuine hole.

Reviews.Title: “Not a very merry Christmas”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinTACK
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the resort everything appeared O.K. The lobby was grand and the grounds were well kept. Then the busboy took us to our room,but to get there we had to walk through remodeling on two levels. The smell of chemical was un- bearable,and the dust and debris was everywhere. Yes, now I was concerned. Upon entering the room I was disappointed. The carpet was filthy,the room smelled musty and it would be impossible for us to sleep five in there. Being that this was completely unacceptable, I went to the front desk past all the unairconditioned smell and debris of remodeling , past the unattractive rolled up beds in the hall and the trays of dirty dishes left next to doors. The lady behind the desk apologized as if she had no idea of the condition my family and I were being asked to live in for the next eight days. She proceeded to set us up in newly remodeled building three buildings away. We moved all of our luggage ourselves and pleasantly the building was cleaner until we opened the door . The room smelled terribly musty, the carpets were filthy and the only chair was stained with something . I went back down to the desk and once again she apologized and gave me another key to another room. The third room smelled worse and since we didn't want to spend our first day on vacation playing musical rooms we settled on the second room with the stipulation that someone deodorize the room, remove the filthy chair and vacuum up the cheerios left on the floor after the chair was moved to make room for the fold out bed. Well after all the negotiation the chair wasn't removed, the cheerios never vacuumed,but we did recieve two squirts of an air freshener. The rest of the stay we deodorized with my perfume. Several of our nights were also cut short due to the shuttle bus early pickup. When I booked the room I was guaranteed a bus available after the parks closing, and that wasn't the case. When I notified the manager she acted completely unconcerned. I was very disappointed with my accomodations and the attitudes of most of the people working here. Our Christmas vacation was not what it could have been. So if you are anything like me and enjoy cleanliness and consideration this probably isn't the resort for you. Best Regards from my family to yours

Reviews.Title: “Expensive...”
Reviews.Author: Happy_travel1
Reviews.Content: I would say this hotel was a little overrated as their website is not exactly accurate. The hotel standard was ok, tho they were currently doing some refurbishment, rooms were cleaned every day, and we had a big tv and Air con, kettle and a fridge, and also a courtesy shuttle to the themeparks, well so we thought!! They charged us 10 $ a night for the services...On their website they state that the hotel is ADJACENT TO a gof course, which is not true. Took us over 30 mins to walk to the course. And also it says it is situated 1.5 miles from Disneyworld...Well yes, from the outer perimiter of Disneyworld..Not within walking distance!! My advice is, if you want to stay in this hotel, you will be better off renting a car! The hotel also have a pool bar, which is way overprised!!! A fairly nice restaurant, with not much atmosphere, but good food (called the Mandolin) The hotel itself could have been a buzzing place, if the staff had tried to give it more personality,,It was a very cold place and not somewhere we enjoyed spending a lot of time.. Best point: Charleys Steakhouse just a few minutes walk away. Nice steaks at a decent price..Really enjoyed a meal there!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay given short notice”
Reviews.Author: Zan_Kitty
Reviews.Content: We contacted this hotel directly and found out they had some great, unadvertised rates. We were staying at a hotel which we found very unsatisfactory and needly a new place to staty ASAP. The rooms were spotless, the lobby was pristine with a great grab and go store/Pizza Hut/Coffee shop and bar. It had 2 pools and a wading pool for children (one of the two pools was designated for youth) and 2 bars, towel check, and lovely landscaping. The complex itself was quite large and parking was sometimes a challenge, but that can't really be helped. The hotel had laundry facilities on each floor, free wireless, comfortable beds, large bathrooms, and was in a great location. It was also set back from the parkway, so it was quiet and felt safe. This is probably a hotel you would expect to stay in if you were visiting Orlando for a convention, but most of the guests were there for the amusement parks. We were very pleased with our stay here and the rates were very reasonable for peak season. We rented a car and did not use the shuttle service to and from the parks so I can't comment on that. However, if you visit during peak season and aren't an early riser, it may be worth your while to stay at a Disney Resort for guarenteed park entry. They DO close the gates when they reach maximum occupancy (thank goodness, the Magic Kingdom was so packed we couldn't move at one point). I would recommend this hotel but definitely call the hotel for special rates.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't do it again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mommy24x7
Reviews.Content: This was the WORST hotel I have stayed in since ???? The lobby is lovely and the grounds look nice but the room was just plain dirty. There was mold growing down the bathroom wall and around the toilet. The room (as you may have guessed) smelled musty. The one chair in the room had a layer of dust and holes in the corners of it. I can't say that the whole hotel is bad or even that all of the rooms are since I was only in this one (thank God for only a night) but if you do brave booking this place stay away from room 1026.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: canadian_shortee
Reviews.Content: My parents, their friend and I were going on a 2 week vacation starting in Florida and ending on a Caribbean cruise. Their friend made the hotel reservations on their website; 6 months ago; and requested 2 smoking rooms. Here's the story. What the hotel is really like: It's a beautiful hotel, inside and out. The landscaping is fantastic and it looks like a resort. The pool is beautiful, the hot tub is amazing and the rooms are really nice. First impressions are that this has got to be a 5 star hotel, not a 3.5 star. Our Experience: When we got to the hotel, we found out that they had no smoking rooms, but they would let us convert the 2 non-smoking rooms into smoking rooms for our stay. We thought, ok, that's a little ridiculous not to have 2 smoking rooms and they should have called to let us know, but oh well. Well turns out they put us right next to the area they're doing construction on and woke all 4 of us up at 7 am the next morning! We went to the desk in the morning to complain about the construction so they apologized and said they'd move us to ground floor rooms with patio doors so we could go outside to smoke. They told us to just have our bags packed and ready to go and someone will come by to take them to our rooms while we were out. We left the hotel at about 11am and didn't return until 6pm. We asked for our new room keys and they hadn't moved any of our stuff yet. We thought, oh great. So we went to get our stuff and move to our new rooms ready to see the sliding doors to the patios. Turns out, there are no sliding doors. None of the windows open and the entire hotel has no balconies. We went back to the desk to say we didn't get what you promised us, and all they could say was oh sorry, there's nothing else we can do for you. Not once ever did they offer to refund us a couple nights or anything, instead, they said they would refund us our service charges at $10/day. We said, what service charges? Well apparently this hotel charges you to use their internet, pool, hot tubs etc at $10/day. 6 months ago this wasn't mentioned online in the booking section, they just changed it but were still charging us the money. By this time the only thing we wanted to do was leave. To make things even better, the room got so damp and started to stink. You had to have the fan on with the heat all the time or else your bed would get wet. We think this is because the air circulation was the pits and the fact that none of the windows opened! My mom then needed to have some dry cleaning done, so she called down to have it picked up to be done to be ready to go the next day. The next day it hadn't been returned to the room and we found out that it was never even done! Apparently they had no idea that we needed it done even though it was sitting in the back waiting to be sent off. Never stay at this hotel if you want to go to Disneyworld or just hang out in Orlando. Don't waste your money!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Been_There3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night because we got a good rate at the last minute. However, the room was a bit cramped and had a weird musty smell. The bathroom was small and although it had been "remodeled" it was still not very nice. Also, the beds are very hard. Close to Disney attractions but I would not stay here again. I have a feeling that if you get a room from one of the discount sites they stick you in the rooms in the back of property where we were. Perhaps the rooms in the front part of the hotel are nicer??

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Radisson Resort - Celebration”
Reviews.Author: carolinagirl66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Resort - Celebration the week of Thanksgiving 2006. I was nervous after reading some of the bad reviews. Apparently they were all b/s. To start off, I had done the express check in online. We had another couple traveling with us so when we went to pick up the keys, our rooms were not joining. The hotel was booked solid but the person at the front desk rearranged rooms to get us joining rooms. He was extremely friendly and I appreciated him going out of his way for us. Yes, the hotel was in the process of replacing windows in one of the buildings. We did not experience any of the construction dust/problems that I read about. I hardly even noticed anything was going on. The hotel is decorated very nice. I loved the color schemes. Our room was very clean and well decorated. Beds very comfortable. We had sleep number beds. Bathrooms were clean and in great shape. The employees/staff at the hotel were all very friendly and helpful. This hotel is in an excellent location. Just 2 miles from Disney. Lots of restaurants, stores and entertainment very close by. I manage a travel dept for a large corporation and will highly recommend this hotel to our travelers. Do not believe the bad reviews!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: AngelD710
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned our stay here months in advance for our first anniversary. We had planned a trip to Walt Disney World, and we thought we had found a great deal in the Radisson. We booked a 6-night stay in a pool-view Sleep Number king-size bed. Upon our arrival on our anniversary at the hotel, we were told by the front desk manager that our room was not available, and instead, had been given to a member of a “group” that had checked in to the hotel. Understandably, my husband and I were shocked, being that we had booked this specific room two months in advance, and had multiple confirmations via email and telephone regarding our reservations. We were placed in a double room that smelled terrible, and we sat there calling other hotels (Orlando was booked!) trying to find somewhere else to stay. The front desk manager came to our door a while later to tell us he had gotten us another room with two queen-size Sleep Number beds, so we changed. We weren't charged for our last night or the daily service fee. Short of that one manager, we encountered the worst customer service skills from various employees at the Radisson. We attempted various times to reach the general manager, but his secretary tried to refer us to other people. Needless to say, we never got a hold of him, but I have since written him a letter. We received a bill that was totally wrong on the day of check out. When we went to check out, the front desk staff was very rude. The bill that was wrong was thrown in the trash by a man, who I assume was a manager, he blamed it on "routing" and tried to explain in hotel managment terms that I didn't quite understand and were irrelevant to me at the time anyway. My husband and I had a horrible experience with this hotel and will never stay at this or any Carlson hotel again. The customer service is way under par, and you shouldn't have to settle for what we did on our first anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “The Good,- The Bad and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: RedSpring
Reviews.Content: The Good: The rooms are nice and very good for the price. Cleaning was done well. The pool area is excellent - in the top three of anything I have ever stayed at. The jacuzzis were emptied and scrubbed while we were there, a good thing to see There is a good choice of pools, a large cool one, a smaller cold one and two jacuzzis. Our kids loved the waterslide Location is good, with easy access to the parks. The free shuttles dont run too often, so we used our own car. Some of the front desk (Constance) were very friendly. Price was good (65 USD - 85 USD in October) on hotwire. The Bad Before you unpack all of your luggage check your room. We had two rooms with moisture problems. The first room had wet a carpet next to the bed. The next room had a very moist and humid smell. Some of the walkways have that smell too. Our third room was perfect. No matter how you look at it, the extra 10 USD as a "resort fee" is just an attempt to have lower room rates. We knew about it before and did not make a big deal. Sometimes they will play the music too loud at the pool. The Ugly Around one of the Jacuzzi areas there were rats running around now and then. Yes,- rats. Unless you have tons of time, try not to get helped by Roberto at the front desk. He probably tries but he manages to make simple tasks take 15-20 minutes. Would we stay again? Yes,- I just hope they get rid of the rats. Note that one part of the hotel is under renovation in October 2006. It does not really disturb too much.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Excellent Experiences Especially for Single Parents!”
Reviews.Author: flakid
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Radisson Celebration since 1990. As a former resident of South Florida, I have stayed at this hotel several times and always recommended this hotel when friends and family would come to visit. The rooms can be a bit small, but perfect for two people. I had not stayed at the Radisson Celebration for several years after moving from FL, but when I planned a visit home this was my first and only choice. This hotel has it all...transportation to all of the major theme parks (all other hotels only offer one choice of complimentary transportation to either Disney, Universal or Sea World, but not all three) it takes a bit of creativity to master the shuttle schedule, but it's free! If you choose not to take the shuttle there is Town Car service for $25 each way to any of the major parks- very reasonable. The staff is great- helpful, and personable. Mandolin has an excellent breakfast buffet, but a little expensive for other meals and not much that kids like. Rooms are modern and clean, and kids can rent playstation games on the TV in the room. The pool and giant slide are great, and there is also a decent arcade. This is an outstanding value for families, especially for single parents. My only complaint would be that the hot tubs were hard to use because families with kids were monoplozing them and had the hot tubs full of water toys and screamning rude kids, and rude parents. The staff should be a bit more diligent when it comes to accomodating the adult guests, and ensuring the adults their right to relax, there is a large kiddie pool and the hotel should maintain that chlidren stay out of the hot tubs, and in their place. Other than that complaint, this is a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for Bog Standard Orlando”
Reviews.Author: sirronah
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not in Celebration: it is on Highway 192 next to what used to be the Hyatt - now a little haunted looking, unoccupied place Disney could do something with! The Radisson is OK if you have low or no expectations. If you have experienced any good US hotel you will be disappointed and you will pay for it. The rooms are standard fare in need of a boost. The decor is weird and unattractive: something to put up with rather than to enjoy. Our room was at ground floor looking onto the hot tub but with no veranda or French window. The net curtains were either produced in sepia, badly faded or just dirty. In daylight it was dark and depressing - something to escape from rather than a place to retire to for relaxation or enjoyment. It's sad to say that it looked better with the lights on. The pools are ok but there was not a lot happening when we were there. The pool bar and grill were ok but you don't buy a hotel room on the stength of that. We had one meal in the restaurant - breakfast. That was enough for us! We have been to the Orlando area several times and complacency seems to be setting in. Americans are masters at parting you from your money. Our experience, say ten years ago, was that they put a lot of real effort into it; now they want it for nothing and this hotel is a clear example of that unwarranted expectation. There is no way we would recommend this hotel or return to it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Radisson Resort-Celebration”
Reviews.Author: nninna77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I reserved and paid for a room in advance using hotels.com website. The dates we reserved for was from Oct. 13-14, 2006, King-sized sleep number bed with a pool view at the Radisson Resort-Celebration in Orlando, FL. My husband and I were running late so he phoned the front desk, at least twice, in order to avoid losing our room (being that it was already paid for). We checked in around 3 a.m. on Oct. 14 and there were 2 customers behind us. The gentleman at the front desk took our information and sent us on our way to the room. We realized that we were sent to a lower class room which had a terrible smell, along with cigarrette smoke, in the hallway and inside the room. The seat had some type of body fluid stains and the pillows were crummy. By the way, it was a double bed. We walked back to the main lobby to address our issue with the front desk personnel. The gentleman was directing the last customer to where they should go and the customer said "I know where it's at. I always reserve this room."
