We approached the gentleman at the front desk and he bacame agitated. He stuttered and said that the room we asked for were not available. He even mentioned that they do not 'blacklist" anyone. We did not imply on the company blacklisting anyone. He just mentioned it for some reason. The gentleman did not offer any remedy, so, we asked to speak with his manager. He went behind the door and called for his manager. The manager walked in behind us with a security guard and asked us what was the problem. We explained to him our issue and showed him a printed receipt from hotels.com which included the confirmation number and the dates, etc. The manager wrote down some information on a piece of paper and asked us a few questions. He apologized and told us to return to the room that was given to us by the gentleman and that at 7 a.m. we should return to the lobby so that we can be moved to the room that we have requested. We were not told of how he would remedy this situation. We told him that we had never had any problems in any hotels that we've checked in. We advised him that if this is how the system works that they need to change it. My husband got up that morning to find out what the remedy would be and the day shift manager had no clue on what happened nor what was going on. We decided to check out that morning and decided not to try Radisson Hotel brands anymore because of the poor customer service. We were not treated like human beings and the accomodation was terrible. I suggested to my husband to try the Sheraton before deciding on Radisson but since Radisson had more amenities and it has a 4 &1/2 star rating we decided to give it a try. I must say it was a terrible choice. From now on we will only use Sheraton, Hilton, Holiday Inn and Marriott brands. I wouldn't suggest Radisson brands to anyone I care about. Radisson did not live up to their 100% customer satisfaction standards.

Reviews.Title: “There's better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: gretaguk
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 4 hotels in Orlando at the end of Sept / start of Oct 06. This hotel appears to be undergoing some renovation right now, so if you are going to stay there soon expect workmen and lots of dustsheets in the main areas. The hotel reception and the main driveway to the hotel is nicely layed out, lots of water too. When checking in, I was actually given a room that was already occupied. When I noticed this, went back to reception who were oblivious. Comments about the lifts are spot on ... the doors close quickly and on you, so be careful. The swimming pool is not clean: lots of white debris in it, and mating flies everywhere, to the point you don't really want to sit by the pool. (Incidentally I did not get this problem at other places, perhaps the overzealous use of fertilizer?) Room smelt a bit, but it was not the worse hotel room I've stayed in. The hotel actually feels a bit remote in terms of attractions, if you are going to rely on public transport. There is a bus stop outside (which I found out on leaving) but not the ideal set up for a newly arrived tourist. I would not stay here again just based on this factor alone: pick somewhere on International Drive or along the iRide trolley route (there is a website, use it for planning).

Reviews.Title: “Yuck! Pick a different place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Karspills
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel from Sept.30 to Oct. 2. It was aweful!!! When we arrived, we thougth that it looked pretty nice from the outside, but when we got into our room, it was a different story. It reeked of cigarettes, which made my stomach turn, and our clothes smell. When I called down to the front desk I was told that the hotel was smoke free. Yeah right!!! For how long??? We stayed in building 4000, and the entire building was in shambles. Plastic, cardboard and dirt everywhere!!! Absolutely disgusting!!! Beware of the elevators, it closed on me while I walked in. The bathtub had a lot of mildew, and the toilet barely flushed! I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone and we will NEVER stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: disney743
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel from the 13th of September to the 27th of September 2006. After reading a few bad reviews we were a little bit concerned but on our arrival our concerns were swept away. The hotel is beautiful, the photos on the website do not do it justice. The staff on Reception were very friendly and efficient and we were checked in very quickly on our arrival. The room was clean and had been renovated recently so the decor and furniture was almost brand new. We had a bed and breakfast package and had breakfast in Mandolins restaurant every morning. Try the freshly made waffles - wonderful! Only two things let the hotel down in my opinion: 1. The shuttle bus. We could not understand why there was not a shuttle bus to Downtown Disney which is the nearest "park" to the hotel. We had to get the shuttle bus to Magic Kingdom and then get the monarail to a Disney resort and then catch a bus from the Disney resort to Downtown Disney. It would have been a lot easier to get a taxi but we didn't realise that at the time. Also, I think there should be more pick up shuttle buses from Sea World and Universal Studios. The bus picks you up from Sea World at 6.45pm but the park closes at 6.00pm. There is a later pick up at 9.20pm which we couldn't understand. What were people expected to do for nearly three hours if you missed the one at 6.45pm? 2. Guest Relations. The people at the guest relations desk were very rude and unhelpful unless you were buying tickets etc from them. I asked them a couple of questions on separate days and was answered in a very abrupt manner. One time they didn't even hang up the phone (they were on a personal phone call) to talk to me - just covered up the mouth piece and then started speaking in the phone again half way through answering me. Hints: I don't think it says on the hotel's website but there is a shuttle bus provided by Lake Buena Vista Shopping Outlet which picks you up at the hotel to take you shopping which is very good. The hotel is also near two great restaurants - Charley's Steakhouse and Ocean 11 seafood restaurant. Both are very good and are in walking distance of the hotel. There is also a Nike factory outlet just past these restaurants (also in walking distance) which is worth checking out. We would definitely stay at this hotel again without question. Can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Sort of Dissapointing.”
Reviews.Author: Ramtrucker
Reviews.Content: At first glance the front of the hotel and lobby are really nice. But at check-in, the clerk told me about the $10 a day extra fee, which i was already aware of. I cant for the life of me understand why they just dont raise their rates instead of charging this extra mandatory fee. I reserved a courtyard view but instead got a pool view, this was sort of bitter sweet because the noise level of the pool was enough to keep you awake, especially since the pool obviously doesnt have any hours and can be used 24/7. But, if I were to choose a courtyard view I would be subject to even louder construction noises from the total renovations going on in the next building. Because of these renovations there was styrofoam pellets everywhere....and I literally mean EVERYWHERE! Styrofoam in the ponds, the pool, the walkways, the bushes, at least they swept the styrofoam up in the lobby and hallways, but it looked like someone sprinkled Ice Melt everywhere outside. They had maintenace using vaccuums to clean them up but there was so much there would just be more the next day anyway. OK, so of course no ice machine worked except for the one in the lobby, and they made no attempt to fix any of them. Now the big problem, the elevator didnt work. It worked the first day we were there and then not again. They stuck a sign on the door that said use the elevator in a different building. They had a repair company out to fix it, but within hours it was broke again, and noone came back to fix it. Maybe I was lucky to have quiet guests on each side of my room, but the hallways were loud enough to keep you awake. Doors constantly opening and slamming shut, guests would have hoards of kids screaming at midnight in the hallways as they returned from their day. No, this isnt the hotels fault, but I think next time I will choose a hotel with no enclosed hallways because of this. The last rant I have is about checking out. They slid a bill in my door jamb and it read $150 more than my reservation. I was shocked. So at the desk they said that it is their computer system and it happens to nearly everyone. Basically instead of $59 a night rate, I was charged $90 a night, plus and extra $20 service fee on top of the $50 service fee. They fixed it and we were on our way. Im just wondering how many people that might have affected in the past. Now, I will say hotel staff was real friendly, the maids were good at their job, and the pool area has beautiful landscaping work. The kiddy pool gets dirty fast because of a tree hanging right over it, so I wish they took time to clean it more often. If your the type of person that enjoys sitting outside and having a few drinks, then this place has the atmosphere you want. We read previous reviews so the hotel resteraunts were out of the question, so i cant tell you anything about them. Lastly, they have internet and a printer in an office you can use to print boarding passes for your flight home. This is handy because the orlando intl. airport was busy. If you dont mind the noise, this hotel is decent. But next time I will try a different one.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service and Below Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunflower_765
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment. In August I booked a kids suite for $59.99 (+ $10 resort fee). A few days before we arrived they sent an email saying our rate was now $97. I called and they said they would honor the reserved rate, so we went. At check-in I tried to confirm that we were getting a suite and was told we were only booked for 2 beds. I told her what we booked and showed my email confirmation and was then told they no longer have kids suites. As they are renovating the hotel, they have converted all the rooms into single rooms. We were not told that before we arrived. We were offered no apology, but told we were given a pool view room. We stayed in room #1205 which faces the parking lot. The rooms were very small and our building was near the renovations and smelled. Nothing was as we expected and we will not return.

Reviews.Title: “lower your expectations”
Reviews.Author: Mukkani
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews - there are many common problems: 1. They charge you $10 as "service fee". Please add this to whatever quote you got. 2. Toilets breakdown. It happened to us 2 times in 4 days 3. There is not enough lighting for access from parking lot. Plus the card reader does not show green light even though it accepted our room card. 4. Coffee pot was not cleaned two days out of 4. 5. Mandolin has poor service as well. We went for dinner one night and had to wait almost 45 mins before food arrived. Think of a cheapo motel and you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Katy-Sue
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two week stay at the Radisson Resort Celebration, this hotel is great value for money for us UK residents who take our two week holiday in Orlando, but as we have three teenagers didn't want to stay in a Disney hotel. We had the flexibility we needed as we had a hire car and didn't actually spend that much time in the hotel during the day, the hotel situation is ideal for anyone wanting to go to both Universal, Disney and Busch Gardens. We only actually ate at the hotel a couple of times, the deli diner on the first night and from the pool bar one lunchtime both meals were fine and not too expensive (we mostly went out to 192 or Intenational Drive to eat). I had read previous reviews and was a little concerned but rooms were clean and housekeeping seemed very thorough (there is some work going on in one of the blocks with windows being replaced but we couldn't hear the work in progress). The pool and jacuzzi were very inviting in the evening after being in a theme park all day and there were always clean towels available. We walked to the restaurants over the road and would warn you that if you think Mandolins (the hotel restaurant) is expensive then don't try Charley's Steakhouse! We made the mistake of not reading the menu before being seated and had a bit of a shock (although the meal was very nice). Be warned though we travelled through Virgin Holidays and the hotel receptionist still tried to tell us when checking in that we had to pay the $10 service charge (and she could have at least cracked a smile, after travelling over 12 hours you don't want to be greeted by Mrs Grumpy!) The safe in our room was shut when we arrived but Security were quick to come and unlock it . Overall the hotel was great, the holiday was great, we would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: Mackspane
Reviews.Content: When comparing hotels *not* on Disney World property, there is only one thing to consider--Bang for your buck. This hotel provides it to a higher level than any other hotel near Disney. Two Pools, Two Hot Tubs, a waterslide and panoramic vistas from the room, can all be found in this hotel directly off the highway to the Disney area. There's even a shopping center across the street with a quaint grocery store, sufficient for supplying a wonderful, inexpensive breakfast. The rooms are nothing special, but are clean (at least to the eye) and the maids do a wonderful job. The only complaint I'd have are the food prices should you decide to eat there, so don't.. The food is not worth the money. If you are handicapped be sure to include your vehicle's tag number as security has missed my handicapped tag and I've twice had to fight a ticket (but won as the charges were dropped). Despirte the few negatives I mention, this is easily a 4 star hotel and is one of Kissimmee's best kept secrets. It's the place, I, a local--resident of Tampa, stay every time I'm taking family or friends to Disney (aka often). Truly a wonderful surprise is this Resort, so stay here if you're looking for great amenities, but plan to spend most of your time at the parks, then an hour or two in their "waterfall" hot tub (easily 10 feet tall), under which you can relax the foot and leg cramps away and look forward to tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Great get away”
Reviews.Author: brodie4
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews I was skeptical of what we might encounter, but I was so very very surprised. The hotel was outstanding, the service was great, the shuttle was awesome, the rooms were good. My family loved the pools and the convenience of the location to all the various stores and eateries. My only drawback was that housekeeping was great in making sure our room was tidy but the elevators and hallways were in dire need of being cleaned. The front desk was outstanding, even the deli. I can't say enough about this hotel. If you are on a budget and are in need of lodging in the Orlando/Walt Disney area this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: El-Yuca-Ingles
Reviews.Content: I was slightly resitant to stay here having read some of the reviews, however my company booked me here for 2 nights while I was meeting a customer close by. Turned out to be just fine, front desk staff were friendly, room was clean and comfortable. Coffee maker in the room was nice to have, bathroom was very small as someone else noted, but since I was alone in my room, was not a problem for me. Some room service trays remained on the floor in the hallway for 24 hours, this is the only negative comment I would make. In room high speed internet was very useful. Pools looked nice, I did not have time to try them! I ate breakfast one morning in Mandolin's, good buffet selection.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed A Pleasant Four Day Stay Here ...”
Reviews.Author: Skylark1265
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a pleasant four night stay at this hotel. ... The reception staff was friendly and most helpful. ... There was ample parking, and the public areas were all well kept. Our room, located in the 2000 building, was immaculate. It was spacious, attractively appointed and most pleasant. ... The bed linen was first quality and the bed was very comfortable. .. The marbled bathroom was also spacious and immaculate. Unlike other reviewers we were NOT charged a daily service fee. A refridgerator was provided free of charge. ... Daily maid service was efficient, and the room was always fresh and clean. The grounds were beautifully landscaped, and the main pool featured gracefull waterfalls. ... The pool areas provided a relaxing venue at the end of a busy day. ... The cafe off the main lobby provided snacks, sandwiches, salads, pizza and soft drinks for a reasonable price; and Mandolin's Restaurant featured a lovely buffet breakfast each morning. There is a plaza directly across (a short walk) from the hotel with several restaurants, a small market, and a camera and a souvenir shop. ... If you have access to an automobile, there are many restaurants as well as supermarkets along Hwy 192. ... The lovely Disney planned community of Celebration is just across Hwy 192., where you can enjoy a pleasant stroll along the lake, browse in the many shops, and enjoy a pleasant meal in one of the several restaurants or sidewalk cafes. ... And most tourist attractions are within a short drive from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Oot&Aboot
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute stay as part of a five day vacation. We needed a hotel close to Universal Studios without being on crowded International Drive. This hotel popped up in my on-line searches and it seemed reasonable $199 plus tax for two nights (Oh, and the $10 per day "resort fee" - right... a pool, two computers for internet access and a few weight machines does not a "resort" make...) Upon checking in to our room, I noticed ants all along the window (we were on the 1st floor). I called the front desk and asked to be switched to a room on an upper level, because we would be keeping food in the room and didn't want to have the ants get at it. They gave us another room within 15 minutes. After arriving at the 2nd room, we noticed that there were no washcloths, only 3 pillows for two beds, and the shower curtain was a moldy mess. I called housekeeping and they fixed the problems while we were out at dinner. Beds that night were fairly comfy, if small (only doubles - no queens). They had down-like coverlets and nice padding on the mattress. Sheets, however, were standard issue scratchy. I guess they don't use fabric softener. The next morning, we head out at 8:30 a.m. for a full day at Universal, returning to our room at 10:45 that night. After 12+ hours at the park with two kids, all we wanted was to clean up and get to bed. As soon as we open the door, we're hit with a musty wet smell, like a bunch of wet towels being left in the bathroom all day. That's because - they were! Housekeeping had not even touched our room! Lovely. It took them 30 minutes to show up to take the old and bring the new towels. The smell made it hard to sleep, and the old A/C unit didn't help much. After bringing it to the manager attention upon check-out, they did give us a $50 credit. Still, for the experience, I think one night should've been free. I might still check with the national customer service center for Radisson hotels to see what they say. If you're going to have a "resort", you'd better be prepared to keep it up, even in the busy season.

Reviews.Title: “terrible place to stay rooms smelled of stale smoke”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the minute i got there i didn't even unpack we called our travrl agent to get us out of there and find us a new hotel the lobby was really nice but looks caan be decieving i would never stay there again even if someone else paid

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from this hotel. We stayed here in June and it was Perfect. I went with my husband and 2 kids, 3 yr and 9 months. My parents also came and stayed in a seperate room. We booked our rooms online and forgot to request an adjoining room, so when we checked in, we were on 2 different floors, which wasn't going to work, because my parents were going to be watching my baby, while my husband and I took our oldest to Disney the first night of our visit. Fortunately for us, when we checked in, the front desk was EXTREMELY helpful and took the time to find us 2 rooms that weren't adjoining, but right next to eachother. We only stayed 2 days and spent them at Disney, so we didn't get a chance to use their pools, but they looked incredible. The grounds of the hotel were very clean and the pool area was fabulous. We stayed in the 6000 Block which was right next to the pool area and our window faced the parking lot and I never heard a car drive by. We requested a crib when we checked in and we weren't even in our room 5 minutes and the crib was delivered to us and was very clean (which was important). The security of the hotel was also a plus. You can always see a security guard walking the halls, no matter what time of day. I didn't eat in their main restaurant, Mandolin's, but the food looked pretty $$$. The diner located in the lobby was perfect on the go food which was what we were interested in. They do have a free shuttle bus to Disney, but we also didn't use that, because we rented a car. My parents dropped us off at Disney and we hopped on the monorail into the park and we took a taxi home the first night. The taxi did cost $18.00, but it was worth the $$ of not having the hassle of waiting in line with the hundreds of other people waiting for shuttle buses. We were back at the hotel within 10 minutes. Overall, I would definately recommend this hotel and would definately stay here again if I chose to stay at an offsite Disney Hotel. The hotel was very clean, the pools looked great and the price was perfect ($97.00 per night).

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience... Beware of $10/day room charge!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay wasn't terrible but it wasn't great, and I wouldn't stay there again. Upon arrival, the staff was not helpful and they were very rude. They told us we would have to pay a $10 PER DAY Service Charge! When we asked why, they were rude and cut us off and said to my husband, "SIR, we cannot change this. Every guest has to pay it!" They made it sound like everyone gets angry about this and that they are tired of dealing with it. Maybe they shouldn't use false advertising and then people wouldn't be so surprised! When we got to our room, there was still food left in the refridgerator and human feces in the toilet. On top of THAT, the toilet was BROKEN and I had to fix it 3 times. The elevator broke on my friends and husband when they were in there and it fell a story before coming back up again. I would not recommend anyone staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson was perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for our honeymoon. We were at the Hotel for a week, and didn't run into one problem. When we checked in, we told them it was our honeymoon and the front desk gave us a card for free complimentary items. The building are stretched out and finding our room was hard, but we only had to do that once. I would recommend staying in building 6 at poolside, ground floor. We were very close to the restaurant and the pool. Parking was never a problem. I wish I could have taken the bed home with me, they are sleep number beds and quite comfortable. Breakfast was good, shuttles were right on time (to the minute), and staff was so friendly it was overwhelming, and kinda strange, not used to that! We actully skipped going to the parks for a day to stay at the hotel and relax, plus you are at highway 192, and all the restaurants you could imagine are right down the street. They showed a Disney movie pool-side for all the kids one night, it was great. This is a great place to bring your kids, even though I don't have any. For example, one day at the pool, a parent lost her child. Within seconds of being notified there were 8 hotel security men all over the place, and the child was quickly found. When I have kids, that is the kind of response I want. The free breakfast was awesome, the guy will make an omlet to your liking write in front of you. Overall I loved the Radisson. Yes, the bathrooms are small, but I didn't smell any mold, the staff was friendly and it was quiet. Some people are just too picky and won't be happy anywhere they stay. We will be back next summer. Don't forget building six poolside first floor.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: ty4jen
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend, her daughter, and myself bought seasonal Disney passes and booked our first Disney weekend for the year at the Radisson Resort Orlando. Great deal, so we thought, and close to Disney. After checking in, we were not asked if we needed assistance with our bags so we did what the check-in person told us to do. Drive around the back of the hotel and walk to the third floor up the back stairs next to the tennis court to get to our third floor room. We were not able to get to the third floor from the staircase we were directed to use so we walked down the stairs to the second floor and catch the elevator to get up to the third floor. Once at the second floor elevators, couldn't get to the third floorbecause the elevator button on the second floor was broken. We ended up having to walk up another staircase to finally get to room. Once in the room, we noticed that there was left over food in the dresser drawer from the previous guests that stayed in the room. After a long day at the park, we returned appx 11:30pm and could not get into the back gate to park. I pushed the call button at least 3 times for assistance and did not get an answer. Three cars were now behind me since I pulled up so I had to get out of the car and ask if they would back up so I could drive back to check-in. The night check-in person gave me another paper key card which had the code stamped on it. Since our initial check-in person had not advised that we needed this code, I threw paper key holder away and put the card key in my wallet as I usually do when I travel. Last but not least, my invoice had a addition guest services charge of $7.00 for guest servives that was not explained to me when I checked in. When I checked out, I disputed the charge and was told it would not be removed since I initialed the check-in paperwork. Also, I didn't use any guest services because all we needed was room to spend the night for our short weekend trip. The check out person was unsympathetic and did not try to explain why the $7 was needed to be charged. All he did was slide a piece of paper in front of me and asked me to read it. In closing, even though the room was an excellent deal near the park, I'll gladly pay the extra money and stay in another hotel when we come back to visit Disney to use our seasonal passes this year. You pay for what you get at this Radisson hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better than this property I did”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We did stay off property this trip and unfortunately booked the trip with the Radisson Resort Orlando – Celebration for two adjoining rooms for 9 nights. I have stayed at several Radisson properties before, and I was very disappointed with this property (formally a Ramada Inn). This property was very dirty, elevators were not working properly and rooms are very old wicker furnishings, 2 pillows per bed, the rooms were musty, dirty and gold in color. The bathroom was so small the door almost hit the toilet when you shut it; forget two people being in the bathroom at the same time. We checked out the next morning (staff was not helpful at all and rude). As my 17 year old daughter put it “this is really grouse”. Not all was lost on our vacation we were able to book into the Sheraton Safari Hotel & Suites for $84.00 per night, per room poolside. What a great property, clean, large rooms, great bathrooms, 5 pillows per bed and the beds are wonderful! Next door was a Sizzler with buffet breakfast of $6.00 per person. With in walking distance was Olive Garden, Red lobster, Black Angus, Chili’s and several others. Shuttle service was ok, not as good as staying on property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson for 1 week in April. It is a very nice location with a gorgeous pool and garden. The rooms are okay, equipped with a refrigerator and a coffee machine, so you can make your own breakfast. Stay way from the overpriced restaurants. You are at the 192, there are more restaurants round the corner than you can imagine. Also keep in mind that the hotel will charge an extra 7.00 $ fee for service. The price politics leave the only bad taste when looking back at our stay. Last thing to complain is that they offer gated parking lots, but the gate was always open. Besides these negative aspects it is a perfect hotel for families with children.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at other Radissons and expected the same for this hotel but was sadly disappointed. I was looking for a nice inexpensive hotel for the weekend and that's exactly what I got. Checkg in was a breeze but finding my room turned out to be an adventure. Apparently they have five or six buildings and of course, my building was in the back. I had to park so far away from the door with a child and bags it was a bit much. Finally, I arrived at the door and found out that the slot for the key did not work. Luckily, a couple was coming out of the door when we were going in so we were able to get into the building. They informed us that they had notified the front desk about the door and it had not been repaired yet. Upon walking into the building, all I smelled was mildew and mold as if they had been hit by one of the hurricanes. I asked several of the workers and found out that they had not but still this constant mildew smell. The room was average with two beds and bathroom but I had not expected too much since I would be spending all of my time at Disney. When we went out to dinner we came back to the resort and realized that front desk had not given me a code to open the gate. Luckily again, one of the workers were nearby and lifted the gate for us...We walked a mile to reach the door again and found out that the door was still broken. Walked another mile to another door and it worked... I would definitely not stay at this resort again. Next time I will pay the extra bucks and stay at a resort were the doors worked and where the building doesn't reek of mildew.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nodweeb
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I figured this hotel would be wonderful since we stayed in another Radisson in Kissimmee last year and had a super experience. We were right! This place is big! There are 5 or 6 buildings, some 2-4 stories, some 6-8 stories, all surrounding a central pool/tiki bar area. The waterfall pool is HUGE, and has a waterslide. The first day we were there we swam in it and it was frigid! I guess it's not artificially heated, but after avoiding that pool for 2 days we got in it again and it was perfect and refreshing. We theorize that 2 days of temps in the upper 90's and abundant sunshine helped warm that water up a bit. The other pool is smaller, but heated. The only complaint we had was that in both pools, the water was very salty tasting (not that we drank the water but when it's on your lips you can't help but taste the saltiness). There were plenty of deck chairs, and towels were provided. THere were also two hot tubs. One had a waterfall and the temp in there was great. The other one was REALLY hot and we had to get out after a couple minutes it was so hot. There are lots of palm trees and plants, beautifully maintained. THe grounds in general were beautifully maintained. The parking lot was close to our building. It was a bit of a walk to the actual building but the walkway is covered from the edge of the parking lot all the way to the door, and you get to walk across a lovely pond with a fountain in it. You're in Florida for cripes sakes, so I don't know why other travelers found it necessary to complain about this short distance to the building. Yes, the parking lot is gated but only after dusk and even then all you have to do is punch in the code provided and drive around to your building. NOT a big deal! I believe that the hotel has just been renovated within the last year or so, so all the furnishings are brand new, new carpet, wallpaper, etc. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful too. We never did eat at the restaurant, so we can't say anything there. We were able to connect to free wireless internet with our Ipaq pocket PC, so I would imagine if you know how to work a laptop's wireless internet you'd have some luck connecting. If you don't have a laptop, there is a business center where you can access the internet for free and print for free. The one downside to the location of the property is that Kissimee/Celebration is dotted with abandonded properties like hotels or small amusment park type of places. There was an abandoned hotel right next to the Radisson but you could only see it as you drove down Parkway towards the Radisson and you couldn't see much of it at all. The upside to the location is it's proximity to restaurants, shopping, I-4, and DIsney. We were about 10 minutes from the Downtown Disney area and TYphoon Lagoon waterpark and once you figure out the screwy Disney/Florida road signage, you're good to go. This hotel also had a fitness center, brand spanking new! There were 2 recumbent bikes, a couple of different weight machines that you could adjust to do different exercises on, a couple of benches and a limited selection of dumbbells. It also had 2 treadmills and 2 elliptical machines. I only ended up using it a couple of times because I got so much exercise at Typhoon Lagoon and Disney but I was very happy with how nice it was and how much I was able to do in there. Fitness buffs will be happy with this gym. Or you can do what I did and walk 5 miles all around waterparks and upupup stairs on water rides and such, and come home 5 pounds lighter. All in all, we were extremely pleased with this hotel and would highly recommend it to other travelers. We can't wait to come back ourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing bad to say about this hotel - apart from the Diner staff!”
Reviews.Author: racitonleroy
Reviews.Content: If the "staff" at the Diner/Pizza place inside the hotel lobby were not rude and pretty much useless this hotel would have been rated as overall excellent. On the positive side - the other staff of the hotel were all very pleasant and helpful ( just watch if you want a taxi as they will call a "car service" that is more expensive than a taxi and just quotes fares out of the blue! ). At reception when we advised them that we were on our honeymoon they ensured that we had a king size bed as our travel agent had only booked us a double room with two double beds! The rooms were very nice - with quite cheerful colours and decor that appeared to be very new. The beds were comfortable and the small fridge in the room was great for drinks, small snacks and even breakfast supplies. The location was very close to Disney and also close to a lot of other restaurants. If you want a really nice meal and are not too concerned about the budget, I would recommend Charley's Steakhouse which is just across the way from the hotel for a delicious meal. The pool facilities were great and there were not too many kids running riot when we were there - although I would imagine in peak times it could be quite feral! The spa pool was really nice and warm for a late night spa! The hotel had laundry facilities in each building which is required when you are traveling for as long as we were! Whilst in the Orlando/Kissimmee area you MUST go to Cypress Lakes Airboat rides - this was the best thing we did whilst we were there (Yes - better than Disney! ) and was one of the highlights of our 10 week honeymoon. The staff there are lovely and very knowledgable of the area and the wildlife etc - THIS IS A MUST!

Reviews.Title: “Bravo, Bravo!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful and beautiful hotel. My mom and I spent a weekend in Orlando and our stay could not have been more perfect. The pool was magnificant and it was so easy to get to the parks. Thanks for making our stay memorable. We plan to make another trip and will stay there again. It was also not noisy and very clean..

Reviews.Title: “Great pool BUT!”
Reviews.Author: Kingsters
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 days at the Radisson Resort Celebration in Orlando. The room was very nice. The decor was new as well as the bed linens. There is a small fridge in the room which is great for sandwich stuff when you're not at the parks. The pool bar is great BUT I didn't find out until the last day that a 15% tip is already included on your check whether you have food or just drinks, no matter how many or few are in your party. The only reason I found out was a guy next to me needed help reading the receipt (the ink was very light and almost impossible to read) and then he asked the bartender if the tip was included, and he reluctanly said it was. Then at the sports bar inside the same thing happened when we charged it to the room. I was brought a receipt to sign and the itemized slip was kind of set off to the side. When I grabbed that to read it, there it was, 15% added on (very small). Maybe this is the norm in Orlando but I certainly hadn't seen it before. Also, although the rooms were great the staff didn't seem very happy. I can't say we were treated bad, but they sure didn't make us feel welcome, either. I probably will try someplace else next time. But overall it was a nice place for the money. They also add a 7.00 per night service fee so you need to remember that when you figure out your total $$ per night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Travel_noise
Reviews.Content: I just returned from three days at the Radisson Resort Orlando-Celebration. I was on a business trip with a conference at Disney. The hotel was located 5 minutes away from the Main Disney Gates, great location if you want to be close to Disney but not pay the high prices of their resorts. I paid $89 per night very reasonable for the area. The hotel is nice. Service was great from the front desk to the maids. The rooms are clean and well equipped. There are a number of restaurants within a 3 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place for the price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We made reservation on internet with guestselectors and we've been upgraded as promised on this site to a pool view room. For $69 a night, it was a real good value! We booked for 4 nights and when we decided to stay for an extra day, they charged us the exact same rate. Everything was nice, except the number of towels available at the pool... The shuttle driver to Disney, Universal Studios and Seaworld was funny and helpul. We enjoyed our stay better than in some other hotels and if we go back to Orlando one day, we won't hesitate to go at this hotel again. We recommend it to everyone (except if you want to relax, cause there's a lot of kids...)

Reviews.Title: “Did NOT live up to our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: onevatraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed there the end of April til 5 May. It was just "ok" but were expecting "Wow!". Even my husband who normally is not very picky felt the same way. The rooms were extremely small! Adequately clean, I suppose, but one day the cleaning staff took our one very small trash can we had and left a bottle of cleaner by mistake. The next day, I called for towels because the cleaning staff did not leave towels from the day before and I also asked for a trash can. It took an hour for someone to go all over the hotel to try and find us a trash can! Much of the staff spoke broken english. The breakfast in the restaurant was mediocore. We got tired of it by the third day and went elsewhere off site for breakfast. The cafe/diner was convenient but pricey. The pool was ok--lots of cigarette butts by the pool which extremely grossed me out. The temperature of the pool was frigid so my kids were less than enthusiastic about swimming. If you want a reasonably priced hotel with average comfort for sleeping after a long day at the parks, I guess this fits but we wil find another place to stay for our next visit to Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: rxlexie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson from April 22-29 arrived at 2:00 PM and they let us check in early as the room was ready (We even got one of those sleep number beds - BONUS!) We dined at Mandolin's one night but were not overly impressed but it still did the trick! No problem though because there is many restaurants close by. One night they even showed Shrek 2 by the pool area at sundown and the kids loved swimming and watching the movie. Just bring some OFF! The rooms were nice and clean - one day the maid cleaned the room but forgot about cleaning the bathroom and bringing new towels - one call to housekeeping had new towels in no time! Great proximity to Disney attractions with well equipped signs! The jacuzzi was amazing - many times no one in there BUT me! The kids loved the heated pool and the one with the slide but that one was chilly! I tried it once. Great place for a family as its easy to keep an eye on the kids. I would definately stay at the Radisson again! However, for now I am all Mickey Moused out! Happy travels and keep smiling!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price--Great Kids Activities”
Reviews.Author: LegoJoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from April 26-30. It is a great hotel for the price. Hotel rooms were new--pretty spacious. We had 2 Double Beds. What we found great was the pool and the pool bar. The pool has kids activities and a DJ during the day from 1-4PM, then a local band from 4PM-7PM. Great entertainment if you like relaxing, listening to some music and having fun. This hotel is very close to Disney and Universal is a short drive. Went to Mandolin's--great breakfast buffet. Expect to pay about $30 per couple. Sports Lounge was also nice--great decor. *Also try Pacino's Italian restaurant down the street. GREAT service, food and reasonably priced!

Reviews.Title: “RAVE REVIEWS FOR THE RADISSON”
Reviews.Author: MA99
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 9 nights. Great location to Disney and town of Celebration which has great dining and shops. Mandolin's restaurant has excellent food, but is pricey. Brand new Italien menu as of last week. We stayed in Bldg. 6000 which is closest to heated pool and restaurant and shuttle. Plenty of activities planned for kids all week. Shuttle to parks was great for teenagers. Many other dining options available on 192 - great place was Logan's Roadhouse - reasonable and good steaks. Within walking distance was Fioni's - an italian restaurant and Japanese steak house - both recommended. Also tried Oceans 11 because of reviews on this board - thought it was overpriced and all sides were alacarte. Heated pool was great but small. Waterfall pool was nice but too cool - I bet by June its perfect. Pizza hut and Diner were convenient for quick lunch. Poolside grill was good too. Try the ribs - awesome. For $ 80 a night, the rooms were clean and comfortable. I would opt for pool view when staying. You can also see Epcot fireworks from 7th floor (poolview rooms)

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: emtjohnson
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at nearly every Disney Deluxe resort, including the Grand Floridian, Polynesian and Beach Club. I recently spent three nights at the Radisson Resort-Celebration and can tell you that it is a nice place and a VERY good value. We paid $85/night!! This is approximately 1/4 of what I tend to pay for a room at a Disney World Deluxe resort and the room compared pretty favorably. Even better, the proximity to the Disney parks was superb. The grounds are attractive and the staff was always very helpful. Getting in and out of the resort is easy. The children loved the pool with the slide and had fun listening to live music in the hotel lobby one evening. We were in one of the bldgs at the back of the resort and, while not impressive from the outside, the rooms were brand new inside (furniture, carpeting, draperies). We did not, unfortunately, have a refrigerator in our room but refrigerators only just recently became standard in Disney's Deluxe rooms. This is not to bash WDW at all -I'm a huge fan - just put things in perspective. I must say the space in the bathroom was tight - but it had a nice marble countertop and was very clean. Housekeeping was good. Again, this place is a great value and definitely a nice place to stay - service was very friendly. It was also convenient to be near restaurants and drugstores, etc. on 192!! We even got to get real Starbucks cappuccinos at the Super Target down the road!

Reviews.Title: “convenient for disney”
Reviews.Author: katybStaffordshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 6 days while doing Disney. The rooms were quiet with very comfortable beds and a fridge to keep drinks cool. The bathroom was very small but this seems standard in Florida. It is a very large hotel so you can't let the kids have any freedom but it is worth staying here for the easy accessibility to Disney and for the hotel pool and slide for the kids to cool off in at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Walt Disney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Radisson Resort on 8 April and stayed until the 15th. The check-in staff was friendly and fast. We proceeded to our room, unpacked and ready to leave for dinner when we found out our room door didn't lock. We called maintenance, they showed up and said it would take at least 45 minutes to fix. So we decided to proceed to dinner and came back to the room an hour or so later and to our horror EVERYTHING was gone, even the items we had in the safe. We went to the lobby to tell the staff all of our stuff was gone and of course knew nothing about happened to it. My husband finally talked to the manager and he stated they could not fix the lock so they had to move our items into another room. My husband informed him a note should have been left in the room, so we wouldn't have went into shock seeing an empty room. So we proceeded to our "new" room on the 7th floor, better view, but now the safe didn't work. At first we were told it didn't work, but my husband said that was unacceptable and needed a safe. The manager came up to the room and fixed the safe. The manager promised my husband free breakfast coupons at the restaurant but we never received them. Then I hung my son's swim trunks on the back of the door under his swim towel and they took the towel along with his swim trunks. So we searched for them for 3 days. We finally found someone in house keeping who had seen his swim trunks on her chair but then couldn't find them. The manager gave us a credit for $15 at the cafe in the lobby. Not many employees speak English. We did go to the pool a few times but preferred not too because too many people and ALOT of unsupervised kids running around the area and jumping/diving into the hot tubs. FYI: You also have to pay $7 a day for newspaper, parking, internet, ect.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has seen better days”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Radisson Parkway. The rooms were very clean but the hotel is aging and needs to be upgraded. The air conditioner in the room only worked sporadically and the ice machine never had any ice available. The pool bar was fun and had live music and children seemed to be having a great time on the water slide. Very close to Disney but not Universal studios. Hint-for those of you who don't normally use cabs-get a metered cab- its half the price of the other flashy black "Cabs" parked outside the hotel with the "flat rate". We paid 15.00 to go 2 miles!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Best hotel & location in Orlando. Great service & a perfect place to get away from the crazy theme parks (close enough to get to them!). We loved this place and will definitely go back. Would love it more if the cranked up the heat to the pool - but everything else was super.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I generally am not a complainer - but our stay at the Radisson Celebration was the worst. I can overlook the incredibly small rooms and the extremely slow elevators - but I can not excuse the hotel for its pools supervision. We arrive late the first day (around 5:30) and wanted to go for a swim. The pool area was a disaster. Wet towels everywhere, including in the pool. Pool chairs all over the place along with empty pop and beer cans, plastic cups and empty pizza boxes stewn everywhere. No clean towels. After about an hour a staff member showed up (who did not speak engish) to clean up the pool and we explained we had no towels and he did get some. The next afternnon when we got to pool it was not much better. Just as messy - but was worse was the pool area was inundated with unsupervised younger and older kids who we were throwing things at each other (including wet towels) along with trying to throw each other in the pool. Using plastic water bottles to see shoot water on their friends not in the pool including thoese nearby. We had to move 3 times to avoid getting wet. I was also tired of yelling at the kids to behave themselves. There we no Radisson personnel around but the same nonenglish speaking person did show up after an hour to pick up a little. Final comment - the kids eat free program is a joke since the adults have to overpay at this fancy restuarant to save a little on the kids meals.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: Carsmom
Reviews.Content: After extensively researching a million hotels in the Disney area, I settled on Radisson. Thank goodness that I did! Being in town for my son's first ever Disney World trip was a big occassion, and the hotel more exceeded his expectations. We had a blast every evening in the pool and the outside bar was the perfect place to get an evening glass of wine. The room was very nice--very comfy select comfort bed and cushy bedding. I felt like I was at home! While we didn't eat at the hotel, we frequented the deli--a bit pricey, but hey...it served its purpose. There are several very nice restaurants within walking distance, so that was good. We opted to avoid the buses as we didn't know how long our son would last at the parks. The drive was a breeze and we were at the Magic Kingdom gate within ten minutes. We will certainly visit the Radisson again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rasisson at the start of our holiday for 5 nights - we arrived at around 2.30 and our room was ready - nice room with 2 doubles as requested. There was a 'mini-bar' in the room which was locked and unusable - I called front desk and they delivered a fridge to our room within 5 minutes. Each floor of the hotel has a washer and dryer and ice machine which was handy. It was quite cold for our first 3 days so we didn't use the pools then - when the weather improved we stayed round the pool area which was nice with live music in the afternoon. They have one pool (small) which is heated and a larger pool with slides which isn't heated which was a pity cause it was a much nicer pool but it was just too cold! The day we arrived we ate in the sports bar which was fine ( burgers, chicken strips, hotdogs etc). One night we ate at the main restaurant, Mandolins, which I wouldn't recommend, the food was limited and pricey. There are a couple of nicer restaurants just outside of the resort which we walked to, Charleys Steakhouse was excellent, also Oceans 11 which did steaks and seafood. There is also an Italian which did a nice pizza. There is also a small supermarket within walking distance but with limited choices. We didn't use the shuttle service as we would rather drive and leave when we wanted so I can't comment on that. This is a nice hotel if you get a good rate - we booked direct and then seen a cheaper rate elsewhere, we went through the 'best rate guarantee' claim and eventually they honoured their guarantee - although not without a lot of emails and faxes to back up our claim. This put a bit of a downer on the experience as I became increasingly frustrated by their lack of customer care here - although this is not done directly through the hotel as its a central department - the hotel customer service was excellent! I would stay here again as it has a good location to the themeparks.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: estebantxu
Reviews.Content: This is a horror story with a fairy tale ending, well that's how my wife described it. We booked into a hotel in the orlando area to find it was overbooked, they tried to upgrade us to another hotel, it was overbooked too, so they offered us a downgrade. Hot, tired and needing a shower we just wanted to go home. This was a nightmare. Then to our surprise the hotel downgraded us to a luxury townhome, and it was actually cheaper than the hotel. My thanks go to the hotel and to Classic Holiday Vacation homes for turning our holiday into a dream. ---. See the pics

Reviews.Title: “loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lucky-Honu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the radisson the end of march. I would highly recommed it to anyone going to orlando.We arrived at 1:30 pm and our room was ready so we were able to check in early at no extra cost.The pools were great. The heated pool is a big plus this time of year since the the water in the unheated pool was still very cold. There where activities for kids of all ages at the pool area everyday and live music in the afternoon. We got a sleep number bed room which was very clean and comfortable. The resort location is great. We could walk to the Arabian Knights dinner show, disney was 5 min from parking lot to parking lot, Seaworld and universal were only 10-15 min away. The shuttle to the parks has limited times so we chose to drive so we could come and go when we wanted to. Also be sure to get directions from the radisson web site because of all the I-4 consruction. If we had not done this we would have never found the place. We will stay here agin on our next orlando vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I added 2 days in the Orlando area after a businesss trip. We booked on line and were a bit hesitant after the reviews we read. We found this hotel to be an awesome deal. The room was not huge, nor the bathroom but it was clean, nicely furnished with a king sized bed with a select number matress. The morning buffet was outstanding with a person there to make omlets the way you like them. We wanted a big breakfast so we wouldn't have to spend so much money on food at the Disney parks. We were full all day on the outstanding breakfast. The pools were clean and a very comfortable temperature. There was a shuttle that took us to and from the parks at convenient times. There were lots of school bands etc there and they did a nice job of keeping them secluded from the rest of the guests. We would DEFINITELY stay at this hotel again! Thanks so much for the great time Radisson!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: To begin with, the shuttle to and from the Ticket and Transportation Service has service that is very inconvenient and runs that are few and far between. Don't plan on coming back to the hotel before 4:00 p.m. unless you take a taxi. We spent more time getting to and from the theme parks than we had ever imagined! I thought the fact that the hotel was "1-1/2 miles from the Main Gate" meant that we could possibly walk if we missed the shuttle. I don't know how they measure their miles in Florida, but it was at least a 15 - 20 minute bus ride on the interstate and through construction--that is, when the bus doesn't break down! Our bus broke down one morning going to the Ticket and Transportation Center and there were many Disney buses that passed us up--because we were not with a Disney resort! The "kids eat free" plan is a joke. The restaurant is so expensive that of course kids can eat free when ordering from a very small selection. Oh, and if you want the 10% discount on food and beverage that is advertised on the internet, you need to tell the front desk about it when you register. Otherwise, you will have to deal with unprofessional people at the front desk who are definitely in need of customer service training. If it weren't for the very nice man at the restaurant, I would probably still be waiting to get my discount. The one thing that was positive about this hotel is that the bed was very comfortable. I did not pay extra for a "number" bed, but the standard bed was great. I will never go back to DisneyWorld again and not stay at a Disney resort!

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: Moseley
Reviews.Content: I just returned to Washington from Orlando, where I stayed at the Radisson. I can't fully agree with the previous posting. For a tourist class hotel, I found the Radisson to offer much better service and value for money than other comparable establishments. I was in Orlando on business, so I can't evaluate the shuttle to the amusement parks. That said, the hotel staff were professional and courteous; the room was clean and looked as though it had been recently refurbished; and, judging from the shrieks of glee I heard, the pool area is a lot of fun. Two areas that need improvement: - The rooms should be "fe-breezed". Although I specifically requested a non-smoking room, there was a faint hint of stale of cigarettes in the room. (To be honest, the stench may have emanated from the room next to mine, which was occupied by a smoker.) - The main restaurant's food is really quite mediocre for the price you're charged. Perhaps simpler fare at a more reasonable price is in order. Other than that, I'd stay at the Radisson again if I were able to secure the same room night price ($63.00 per night).

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay when you are visiting Disney with kids. Bit overcrowded over the weekends. Security not that good. Free shuttel to Disney with Giovanni the driver as an expert commentator. Breakfast at the Madolin Cafe was just superb. Would come back, but not during springbreak.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, pretty atmostphere, good deal!”
Reviews.Author: xoannamariaox
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. My friend and I got a great rate (she used her college discount card), and the rooms were nice and clean as was the entire hotel. Service was great, and the grounds are very pretty. The pools are awesome! I believe they had 2? Very nice atmosphere. Close to Disney ,and other attractions/restaurants! Had such a plesant stay that I went back last year to the same hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon was nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed there on the 12th of feb till the 16th and I have to say I was very impressed. We had a little problem with checking in but after that the stay was great! The rooms are very nice and clean and the maids were all very nice. The pools were a very nice end to the long days at the parks and we were within walking distance of many different bars and restaurants. One in particular, Ocean's 11 was out of this world. Go there if you want good service and a good meal for a good price. I only wish that we could of stayed longer. We will never stay anywhere else when we are in Florida.

Reviews.Title: “second visit and will go again”
Reviews.Author: Joe_Hils
Reviews.Content: We first stayed in 2004 and went back again in 2005. There are two pools. One usually busy but the other much quieter, so you have a choice. Car park can be busy but always found a space no matter what time we returned in the evening. Great location. Good size, clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TampaLondonbound
Reviews.Content: We go to the Orlando area frequently, and this is the first hotel we have stayed at that I would not recommend. We were suppose to get a free upgrade to a sleep number bed. These beds are only available in Bldg 6000. Parking can be horrendous. This building is close to the ballroom/convention center so if there is an event going on, you will have to park very far from this building. Because we could not find any spot even remotely near, we moved to the 4000 building. The room was not clean and the bed was harder than a rock and extremely uncomfortable. The hotel staff only had two employees working Saturday night check-in so the wait was long. The staff was very condescending. They think they are doing you a favor with a gated/locked parking lot with limited spaces. We had to wait in line behind 7 cars every time we went in because people would forget the code. We only stayed one night (thank goodness) and that was too long. There are plenty of other hotels in the Disney area that are significantly more appealing with much better parking, cleaner rooms, more comfortable beds and a more pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: whalerfan77
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay. Clean pools are great. Food is $$$$ but overall good. Staff is good. Hotel is a 2 minute drive to Disney. Pool area and water falls and hot tubs open 24/7 as long as you dont make lots of noise. Clean rooms. We always stay here

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was glad to see a large overhang at the entrance to the hotel since my wife is handicapped. It kept us from getting wet. We got to sunny Florida in a downpoor. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. The room was nice with a wheelchair freendly bathroom. It was clean a fresh no lingering odors. For a handicapped access room I would have liked one large queen or king bed instead of 2 full beds. It would have made maneuvering a wheelchair a little better. Overall we had a good stay at the resort. We will probably go to Florida and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was nice. It was clean, and my non-smoking room did not smell like smoke which was nice. Beds were not all that comfortable and pillows made my neck hurt. Although I did have a standard room with no sleep number bed. Loved that my son ate free and loved the free transportation to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel,very convenient for Disney & other parks”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the radisson in Dec 2005 for two weeks. After reading some earlier reviews we were a bit worried but found it to be a very nice hotel with all mod cons. The decor is nice and bright, the rooms large and clean. Asking for extra pillows and towels brought an immediate responce,and the room was cleaned every day. The air con wasnt working when we arrived but a quick call to reception and it was fixed at once. Food and drink was a bit pricey but you expect that inhouse,there was a supermarket 5 mins walk away which satisfied all needs. The shuttle bus was excellent, on time every day and a very cheerful and friendly driver. It serves the magic kingdom, seaworld,and universal. It may get crowded in summer time but at this time of year, we were always able to pick our seats. All in all a very nice place to stay if visiting the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience; convenient; reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Awarely
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a few nights here and found it clean, comfortable, and convenient. We booked two nights on Quikbook(-) for $79 but when we arrived were told only one night had been booked and there would be an additional $10 charge for the extra night. It was late so we agreed, but then found our paperwork and went back to complain the next day. The problem was solved, but I still don't know whether it was an honest mistake or something else. We did not use the facilities (pool, restaurant, etc) but enjoyed our time there. The location is convenient to Disney (free shuttles) but not near the airport, so a rental car is required.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband and kida and grandkids stayed there during thanksgiving. We booked our rooms six months ago in a package for king beds and to get them together we get there and have full beds. which they said they couldnt switch because the rooms were full Our room we entered had a big machine running and hoses going to the tub a big dryer on the floor we go down to the desk and they change our room away from everyone, oh yea and then we were hit with a extra fee each night for 3.50 per room which our package was paid in advance. We go and talk the next day to the manager he moves us back down to where everyone was but he wanted to put us back in the same room with the machines. Oh yea and after a long day at the park we go to get in our room that night and the code was changed go back down and they had down we checked out. Along with that the sink was stoppped up, they left the cleaning products in the bathroom. One of the worst hotels I have stayed at. This is a bad hotel to be called a Radisson. Oh and by the way wait in long to get in the gate it was always lined up

Reviews.Title: “From 2003 to 2005-Much improved”
Reviews.Author: rabrassard
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after an initial stay in 2003. They are in the midst of a large-scale remodeling. I specifically requested a remodeled room and stayed in Building 600. I noted that since my last stay, there have been many improvements, from the new (quiet) a/c unit, shower head, furniture, carpeting, drapes, and bedding. The interior hallways to the rooms have been changed dramatically for the better with an italian contemporary feel. Granite and marble in the bathrooms were beautiful and the bathroom is much larger than those at the Disney resorts. Yes, there was a little bit of mold in the bath/shower caulk, but folks, this is Florida. Mildew, mold, bad hair days, storms and hurricanes are just part of the deal. Plenty of towels, and when we needed more, they were brought within minutes with a smile. I requested the sleep number bed for $10.00 extra a night, and it's my fault I could not get used to it. We avoided the mini-bar altogether. Check in was okay-not overly friendly, not rude, just okay and efficient at 4:00 which was the check in time. Staff on the grounds and in Mandolin's Restaurant were exceptional (great breakfast buffet and custom made omelets). The pool areas and jacuzzis are wonderful. The grounds were immaculate-cleaner than Disney. I was not provided with the four digit # for the gates at night, but a quick press of the call button took care of it. My bill was left for checkout as promised. You can book rooms here for as low at $60. a night through a Mousesavers discount. I would not pay more than $80.00 per night, but it is a great alternative to the Disney resorts, and is conveniently located right off I4. My kids loved it, and want to go back. If you have kids, or a large group and need 2 adjoining rooms, this would be the place. BTW, eat at Ocean's 11 in the plaza next door-lobster bisque and filet mignon to die for, and reasonably priced to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a one week stay at the Radisson. I will never stay here again. We had problems from check-in to check-out. The person checking us in refused to consider upgrading us to a room with a view of the pool even though they had many rooms available. We wouldn't have minded if this was said nicely but he stated that our reservation would have to be canceled and we would have to book a room with a view and pay the rack rate for it. I've never had anyone at a hotel give me that response. They claim the hotel is secure but the gates are not always down at night. We got in a few nights around midnight and they were up! When it was down, our pass code didn't work and we had to keep calling the front desk to open it for us. Plus, you can get on the hotel property by just walking on. The gates (when they are down) only prevent a vehicle from getting into their lots. I had to call three times one day in order to get more towels delivered to our room. Apparently they thought two towels were enough for three people. What really bothered me about this stay and why I will never go back is that my itemized bill was not placed under my door. Since I travel frequently for work, I always like to ensure that it's provided to me prior to leaving. When I checked in I was told that the itemized bill would be placed under my door the night prior to my departure. The morning of my departure it wasn't there. After I placed a call to the front desk, (after holding for 15 minutes) they said they probably placed it under the wrong door but that I could go to the front desk to pick it up bc they were to busy since there was a long line to check-in. I asked the woman I spoke to if I could just ask someone for the envelope with my bill in it rather than having to wait in the line since she stated she was printing it out for me and she said of course. When I got there, it was a different story. I was told I had to wait in line even though the envelope was within my line of vision. I asked the guest who was checking in if he minded me just picking up an envelope. He had no problem with it but then the man at the front desk told me I had to wait in line. When I explained my prior call, he said it didn't matter and that I had to wait. Mind you this was the hotels mistake and there were over a dozen people waiting to check in and I needed to catch my flight. I have never experienced such poor customer service. This is not to say that you will not have a good time here but just don't rely on the hotel to help you with anything including tickets as they try to get you to go on a timeshare presentation to get a free one day ticket to disney rather than just sell you the ticket. We still had a great time despite the poor service as we were only at the hotel to sleep. If you want to enjoy hotel amenities/service, this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Radisson Standards”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our reservation included King Size Bed. When we got there it was two doubles. We called and they said they had run out. They said there was a king available in a "deluxe" room for $10 extra a day. Yeah..no free upgrade for their mistake. Code for parking was not given at check-in. Fridge in room is vending type that is packed full of over-priced items and prices had mostly been rubbed off door. Air conditioner was noisy. Toilet ran for a long time after each flush. Walls thin. Air conditioner rattled. Vending machine falsely advertises 12 ounces bottles when they are really 300ml which is around 10 ounces. Yes...$1.75 for 10 ounces of Dasani.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible for a Radisson”
Reviews.Author: BrianThousandOaks_CA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel three nights, October 12th-14th. My room was on the 7th floor of building 4 (room was 4xxx). The pictures of this resort on the website are stunning. Let me tell you, that beautiful 'lake' with the huge fountain overlooking the 'resort' does exist in real life, but it doesn't look nearly that impressive. They Photoshopped the heck out of that shot to make it look that nice. That aside, the room was comfortable. Nothing special, but not bad. Beyond here are some warnings: 1) The property and buildings are NOT secure at all. You will be given a 'gate code' to the parking area if you return to the resort late, but the gate is actually open 24/7. Furthermore, although there are key scanners outside every entrance to the building, they are not active; all the doors are unlocked. 2) If you need to print your boarding pass in their Business Center, be prepared to wait - not becuase of crowds - but because their Internet connection is painfully slow. Printing my Southwest Boarding Pass is a 3 minute task at home; it took 30 minutes here. The good news was the whole operation was free. By the way, there is NO assistance for the Business center at all; you better come prepared. 3) Each building has a few coin-op washer-dryers. They are located on random floors (not every floor). You need to call the front desk to find out where they are. Two of the three units in my building didn't work at all. One ate my coins then jammed. They were still broken at the end of my stay. My building had 8 floors, and three units. Most of the other buildings are only a few floors, so they may have only one unit. Be prepared to lug around armfuls of dirty laundry if yours isn't working. Also, make sure you have change; the only dollar changer on the property is in the Arcade. 4) Air conditioning was the ground-unit-near-the-window type. It freezes anyone in a 6 foot radius, but doesn't condition the entire room. 5) They claim they are located 1 1/2 miles from WDW and MGM Studios. If you (like me) are not Orlando savvy, you need to understand that WDW is freaking HUGE. They are not referring to the park, but rather distance to the resort area (which apparently is about the size of a New England state). Assuming you take the shortest freeway route with no traffic, it will take you at least 10-15 minutes to get to ANY Disney park. This complaint really isn't the fault of Radisson; all of the resorts do that. Actual time to Universal Studios is about 25 minutes with no traffic. Sea World about 15 minutes. If I had to guess the hotel chain based on my stay, I would have guessed along the lines of Howard Johnson - not Radisson. I will definitely stay somewhere nice next time. Don't let the pictures fool you - the rooms are comfortable, but the ameneties are completely lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Value”
Reviews.Author: Nychuck
Reviews.Content: For a Raddison Resort Hotel, it was a disappointment. The biggest let down was the decor; 1980's Florida. Initially we wound up on the ground floor which reeked of smoke although this could have been mistaken for a must odor as it was very humid that evening. I snagged the room off of PriceLine, purportedly a three star out of four. I rate it closer to a two. The place was just a trifle tired. I wound up paying $134 for two nights after including the service charges, however, I'm now sitting in my comfy Sheraton Suite, at the airport, for $69 night but could only get it for four nights. Normally it's $129-175 per night. BEAUTIFUL! If decor doesn't bother you, try it; but be forewarned.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal!!”
Reviews.Author: nat7375
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Radisson was a great experience. My only complaint was that the beds, although brand new at the time, were a little harder than what I would normally like. But by the second night we were so tired we didn't even think twice about it. The shuttle service in and out of Disneyword was average. Some days the bus was quite crowded. Bathroom and bedroom were clean and plenty big. The bar off of the lobby had a nice relaxing atmosphere, with tasty appetizers and drinks. Hotel staff were friendly and accomidating. Grounds were well kept and the pool and surrounding areas were beautiful with a pool any kid would just love.(There's a slide!!) Overall a favorable experience. By the way, Charlies steakhouse on the corner a couple of blocks away has the best steak you will ever eat!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with Radisson Resort Parkway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Radisson for two nights in September 2005. I would compare this resort to a Disney Moderate as far as the rooms are concerned with the exception of the bathroom. The bathroom was much bigger and nicer than the Disney Moderate hotels. The pool was beautiful but we didn't have time to use it. I would highly recommend this hotel as far as cleanliness, room size, location and ease of getting to and from the Disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “Most appropiate....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reviewing all the comments for the past few weeks I was alittlle skeptical .......BUT I most say I am so happy to report that my family loved it .....and I was totally relieved !! We booked 3 rooms which were all next to each other....they were all clean with no disgusting stains or horrifying odors. The view from the rooms were tropical with a pond and fountain in the background. All in all we couldn't have asked for any better since we just needed a place to rest....Sea World was the purpose of our trip which was only a 10 min drive away. To sum it up....we would stay here again and hopefully would be very pleased !! Thanks and enjoy your trip LBM & Family

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and close to all attractions”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here from August 24 to August 27, 2005. Check-in was a breeze - no problems at all. Our room was easy to find with lots of parking close to the doors. Pools - they are amazing - there are 2 pools and 1 jacuzzi. The pools are clean and spacious. We went swimming from 9:00pm til 11:00pm and the water was nice. Attractions - Walt Disney World is very close to the resort but there is construction going on in the area - especially Hwy 192 and I-4, just take your time and you will get to where you are going. Food - we ate out at other restaurants. Staff - Awesome - always there to help. Resort - 4 star, no problems at all. Tips - go to Walmart and buy water, pop, juice etc....it is expensive from the machines and stores inside the Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Getting married in paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in April 2005. Myself and my partner had arranged to get married at the hotel (organised through Virgin Holidays) and 22 members of our family and friends were staying with us at the hotel with us. The wedding day was out of this world and with photographs taken from around the paradise type resort including by the waterfall pool and gardens they are the envy of everyone. I cannot imagine a better day!!! The hotel itself was very clean and tidy and the bedding and towels were changed most days.
