There was a disabled guest in my party so we had already requested ground floor accomodation. When we arrived our rooms were spread out over the fourth and fifth floors which I was not happy about. Also one of lifts was broken for the first few days of our stay. So with disabled and young guests in pushchairs this caused real problems. However once I explained this, ground floor rooms were provided all next to one other for all of us that wanted to change rooms within 24hrs of us being in the hotel. And the porters even helped us to move between the rooms. The deli restaurant was very reasonably priced and provided great snacks at night whilst drinking in the bar. The pools were fabulous and stayed open late enough so that we could go in them after we returned from a day at the theme parks. And the heated smaller pool was lovely to relax in at all times day and night, although it did attract lots of children until about 10pm. Towels were provided at the poolside for guests-HOWEVER BEWARE we took towels from home with us and these were taken from our room by the cleaners never to be seen again. I advise do not take any towels with you as they are all provided anyway. All the staff provided friendly service and I would return here again without any hesitation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore Those Bad Reviews! Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: intromaster
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely wonderful. It is very well kept. The grounds are beautiful and the lobby along with the entire resort is extremely clean. Check-in was a breeze since I had made reservations thru the Internet a week before. Within five minutes I was handed my room access card along with a small layout of the resort to navigare my way around. My room was located in building 4000 on the 6th floor. I had a very nice room which consisted of two queen sized beds that I specifically requested. The room was immaculate with no stains, carpet burns or other marks. The a/c worked great but seemed to get cold pretty fast so I had to keep turning it off and on at times. The Business Center was open 24 hours a day which was great if you needed to access the Internet. However, it only had two computers so that meant you would probably have to wait at times like I did in order to use it. I only had to wait about 15-18 minutes max. and this was mostly during the morning. This was not a problem for me though. The food at Mandolins was superb!! I had the bbq ribs and french fries both times and it seemed even better the second time around. The breakfast buffet was good as well but the menu was the same everyday which does get boring after awhile. Bacon, eggs, hash browns, omlettes, french toast, sausages, biscuits w/gravy, cereal, fruits, milk, coffeee, tea, orange juice, apple juice, soda. The pool at this resort was really something. It had a cascading waterfall that was spectacular at night. The lights in the pool made it light up very nicely. Off to the side was a very large heated jacuzzi. It could fit 10-12 people easily!! The water was very warm. However, after 20-30 minutes I had to get out because I was sweating like crazy. The game room/arcade was very small and only had about five games. MsPacman/Galaga, a two player driving type game, table hockey, missle submarine type game and the game where you use a joystick to lower the claw and move around to grab a prize in the glass cage. The game room also had a change machine. The fitness room was nice too. I think it had about 8-10 machines. It had two state of the art treadmills but I dont remember exactly what other type of equipment was there. A very large plasma television sits right above the treadmills which you can use w/o a problem. I think it's open 24 hours a day since I was using it very late (after 12am) There is a deli/food place right in the lobby opposite the hotel front desk. It's open until 11PM. It has a very nice selection of menu items. Pizza, cheeseburger, fries, donuts, ice cream, soda, milk and a host of other snacks too numerous to mention here. Prices are very reasonable too. It was only $6.95 + tax for a delicious cheeseburger and fries. Recommended! I didnt take the shuttle to the parks since I rented a car so I cannot comment on this. There is a Thrifty car rental desk also in the hotel lobby. Also, another desk sells attraction tickets to the Disney parks, Universal, Seaworld, etc. Overall, I had a wonderful time and wouldnt hesistate to visit here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, bad location, rooms need repair!”
Reviews.Author: PaymonVancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our one week honeymoon in Orlando and we stayed at Radisson Resort Parkway for only two days before we had to get out! The hotel was the worst place I've stayed at in a long time. It was far from most theme parks/good restaurants and that is why we were visiting Orlando. Upon arrival, no complimentary honeymoon upgrade was offered by hotel staff! The only complimentary gift was a voucher for two free drinks at the pool bar which was always closed. We were given a bottle of champagne which we had to throw out because it was cheap & horrible! Our room was facing a bare parking lot and bathroom sink leaked horribly. Walls were thin and had no sound proofing. The noise coming from the next room made sleeping impossible. My wife and I had to switch hotels after just two days of staying at Radisson Resort Parkway! We will certainly recommend against staying at Radisson Resort Parkway in Kissimee!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: monidel13
Reviews.Content: We stayed from June 17-June 23. We enjoyed this hotel very much. I did not see any evidence of smelly rooms, poor service etc which has been mentioned before. My son had a great time in their pools. Although they state that the pools close at 11pm, he was able to swim later than that without any problems. The service was excellent. We requested extra pillows and they were brought to the room within a half an hour. It was only a 10 minute drive to all the Walt Disney World parks. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: torontogal2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson Parkway with my fiance the week of July 19th. We got a really cheap deal on skyauction, so I honestly wasn't expecting much. Got to the hotel and it was really nice - nice lobby, beautiful pool area. Stayed in building 2000. The room was a good size, and I loved the duvet. No problems with housekeeping, it was usually done while we were out. We brought our laptop, and lucked out with a room with free high speed internet - it was great - i totally would have paid for it for the week, but the fact that the hotel offers it free was wonderful Of note, the safe was also free, and our building was pretty secure - it locked from the outside around 8pm and you had to swipe your card to get into the building. You also needed a code to get the parking lot gate-thing up. Pizza hut was good, and we went to the Mandolins restaurant one night. It was good, but not very busy. Took the shuttle to Disney one day, no problem with it. There was alot of people, so they had to call in another one, but it came promptly. Also picked us up on time at night, no complaints. The only negatives I really found with the hotel was that the dryer in the self serve laundry on my floor was really slow, but it wasn't a huge deal. The elavators by my room were a bit slow too, but the ones at the other end of the hall were fine. I'm a pretty picky hotel person, and I really liked it. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Happy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself would not stay at this hotel again. I am currently trying to find an email address to let the hotel know how difficult we found trying to get to Disneyland on their shuttle, if you can call it that. They only have a few trips per day and you would have to wait in the hot sun for the bus, no line control and if you were there first you always seemed to be last on the bus. Every one would push you out of the way. We had a non smoking room , but the hall was so thick with smoke your room also smelled bad. You are right they are quick with extra towels. The maid would turn our air conditioner up and when we returned our room was always freezing and would take time to warm up. We asked them not to do this. They did not put a top sheet on the bed and we had to ask several times for it. There was no bedspread and the comforter is way to hot in the summer. I don't know where they got those so called pillows from. Flat as a pancake. Due to the poor shuttle service we feel alot of our Disneyland time was wasted trying to get back to the hotel. Please do not stay there if you want to enjoy your trip to Disneyland. We are going to ask for a refund.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson........ was okey but not brilliant.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Back in April my family and I stayed at the Radisson in Florida. When we arrived the check in was speedy, and finding our room was easy. Good first impression, but when we went to the information desk, nobody ever seemed to be there, which was annoying as we didn't know much about the place, being our first time. Our room had a nice view of the pool but for a room that was supposed to sleep four people, the bathroom was small, and there wasn't alot of storage space. Though that, the pool area was lovely and the breakfast's were enjoyable but slightly over priced. The radisson was close to the theme parks and when the info desk was open it seemed to supply good information.

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Place to Stay Close to WDW Parks”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Resort Parkway for six nights in June. Overall the resort offers a fairly good value for the money. Just keep in mind that it is a three star resort. The resort and rooms were clean. The housekeeping staff did a great job every day. The rooms are definitely showing there age, but were still very nice. The pool complex was very nice. We enjoyed sitting underneath the waterfall after a long day at the parks. There is a nice waterslide, but it is a lot more fun for the kids than adults. The only major complaint that I have about the resort is about security. The outside door entrances to the resort did not lock. It appeared at one time there was some type of room key access devices that would open the doors. The access devices had been removed as well as the door locks. It would have been nice if the resort had been a little more secure. Also, the access gate to the parking lot was never closed. We were provided with an access code, but never found the gate close. Even with these problems, we would stay at the resort again.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: Ollie45
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from Orlando. We stayed at the Raddison Resort for 6 nights and loved every minute of it. The place is beautiful--very tropical looking. I thought the room was spacious enough and loved the white duvets. Bathroom was a little small but very nice. We stayed in building 6000 and were very happy. It would have been nice to have had a pool view, but I was not about to pay $10 extra a night because you are hardly in your room. Transportation to the parks was a plus. We will definitely stay there next time we go back to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here from June 13-18. This place is great. The rooms were very nice, clean, and everything there was beatiful. The pool area was great. There is a kiddie pool, a heated pool and a larger pool with a slide. There are two hot tubs also. I stayed here with a 5 yr old , a 12 yr old and 3 other adults and we all enjoyed our stay. We stayed in building 6 and everything was new and clean with a mild lemony scent, nothing strong. The maid service was excellent. Our rooms were cleaned and extra towels were left each day. The rooms were spacious enough even with the kids. The white duvets were nice but a top sheet would have been better, this is my only complaint. The beds were firm but very comfotable. The food from the pizza hut was great. The area the hotels is in has everything you could think of in short driving distance, from restaraunts to shopping and of course Wal-Mart. The place was beatiful and everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Florida. Stayed at Radison Resort Parkway for six nights. Liked everything about the place. A lot of people complained about the smell, carpets, and whatever else - I disagree. I was in the 1000 building, and had no problems with anything mentioned above. Yes, the bed is hard, but that is no reason to give a bad rating to the hotel! Overall it was a great experience. The pool area was awesome. The free shuttle to Disney is a great feature (although the bus is moldy). A note on dining: I suggest you eat outside. The Radisson's restaurant is unreasonably expensive. There are several places nearby that you can walk to. Kobe Japanese steakhouse was good. There is a grocery store in the same plaza, so if you have a fridge in a room - stock up.

Reviews.Title: “Successful Stay at the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: Angelina029
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Radisson for a three day stay. Our reservations were accurate, and we stayed in a beautiful King room that overlooked the pool. While there were a lot of families staying there for a convention, we felt that the hotel staff did a great job of managing the large number of people that stayed at the hotel. The resort is a quick 5 minute drive to Disney property! The rooms were comfortable- the bathrooms were a bit small. Housekeeping came through on a daily basis- and replaced linens and cleaned as would be expected. There is also free internet from the rooms if you've brought your own laptop! The facilities were outstanding- two pools, workout room, several restaurants. While I wouldn't eat at the restaurants constantly- as they are a bit pricey- they do provide a convenient place to grab a quick bite to eat. There is a strip mall within walking distance that has a small mini-mart, Subway, Wendy's, and two sit-down restaurants. Many people have commented on the refurbishment of the hotel- we did see the results of the construction- it's beautiful! I would highly recommend this hotel for couples, or for families! We travel quite a bit, and this hotel did a great job!

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel, perfect for the parks!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the beginning of May. The hotel is based on nice grounds with a lovely pool area with waterfall and slide. Rooms were spacious and clean. Great value for money Extremly handy for all the parks, basically just a five minute drive from the majority of them. Quite close to the premium outlets too which was a great plus! There is a great outdoor restaurant and bar beside the pool which serves good food. Suits all!

Reviews.Title: “Resort??”
Reviews.Author: arethashines
Reviews.Content: I have read some of the reviews which makes me wonder if I stayed at the right hotel. Are we talking about the Radisson Resort Parkway in Kissimmee? Well, I have been taken to a new low in disappointment. The room was stale smelling, old and way too dusty. You could see the coat of dust in the arm chair without proper lighting. The sheets were very worn, ultra thin and there was a brown stain on the comforter, uck. We wore our shoes on the carpet and in the bathroom as we really felt dirty in this room. The elevator is old and waay too slow. Based on the website, and reviews, I was a little hiped to spend a couple of days, especially with 'Resort' being in the name. However, I will not, did I say NOT ever, ever, ever, ever, stay at this hotel again or recommend it to anyone I know. It also seems to be a little away from the action. Boo hoo, now I know to do more intense research when booking a hotel. It seems some folks can't differentiate between the good, the bad and the just plain darn ugly.

Reviews.Title: “Kids loved the waterslide pool”
Reviews.Author: amd62
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days, May 14-17, 2005. We just came from St.Pete's beach where we had a great suite for a week. Our room at the Radisson was a bit of a let down. We are a family of five and the room was small. We were hoping there would have been a pull out sofa, no luck. The rooms have two double beds and a small chair. There is a mini bar, no fridge. We requested one ($5.35) and we never received one. The beds have a duvet on it. That's it, no extra sheet or blanket. We found the duvets didn't stay on the bed very well and they are white! We didn't find the staff very friendly. We were in building 5 and the parking is quite a piece from the rooms and the elevator. There was a set of stairs near our room but this was for emergency only. The maid service was not that great. On our last day our towels and toilet paper was not replaced. There are some good things about the Radisson. It is in a quiet area away from the I-92. But then it is close to the 92 and 4. We went to Seaworld one day and it is close by. It is also close to a Catholic Church (next to the outlet mall). There is a mass at 6:00 on Sat. (the front desk didn't know about this one, just the ones on Sunday). We enjoyed the unheated pool with the water slide. We all found the water warm once you got used to it. This was the busiest pool when we were there. The heated pool was just too hot. (the air temperature was 92!) There were lots of chairs and towels. The drinks are cheaper in the hotel store than the pool side bar where the tip was added on. We ate next door at Oceans 11 (near Charleys). We were a little worried because there was hardly any one there. We were pleasantly surprised. The service and food was great. The best place we ate at during our 10 days in Florida. When we left there were more people there. This was not our first choice when staying in Orlando. We had checked tripadvisor for hotels and then went to see my travel agent. The company which they deal with for packages on hotels only had the Radisson and a couple of other hotels available during the dates we wanted. When we were in Orlando, there were so many rooms available at other hotels at great prices!!!! If it was just my husband and me I wouldn't book before I left because there are so many great deals there.

Reviews.Title: “The Radisson Resort Parkway worked for our family...”
Reviews.Author: disneyvacationer2005
Reviews.Content: We just returned from this hotel. We stayed there for 8 nights. Would I recommend this hotel? Yes! It was clean, the rooms were fine. Honestly, we were only there to sleep and occasionally eat, but it was great! There were 5 of us in our room - myself, my husband, and our 3 daughters ages 2, 5, and 8. What can I tell you. For the value, I would definately choose this over a Disney hotel. The Disney hotels would have cost us double, and for what? You're barely there! The shuttle service people were GREAT! Very nice, always loaded our stroller, etc. One time we forgot our Disney passes, and the driver drove my husband back to the hotel!! With small children, the advantage of a Disney hotel would have been that we could have gone back for an afternoon nap with our 2 year old, but Disney is so big, you still would have been travelling. However, the option of returning to the hotel in the afternoon isn't an option, but we were fine. There was only one time the bus was crowded, and we were there during spring break. The restaurant was good for breakfast - which was included in our room rate. The pizza place made great pizza, and the fries portion was generous. Usually, we'd try to eat before we came home, but food was available. The pool was great. Yes, the unheated pool is cool for little ones, but my 8 year old loved it! Really, the pool area is beautiful. The housekeeping staff were great - always gave us extra towels, and made the beds with my girls stuffed animals on top. Our rooms were always clean. We got a fridge, and they never charged us for it. They didn't smell, and they all have new carpet and duvets. The bad things - our safe didn't work - so our passports had to be locked in the suitcase. They tried to fix it, but couldn't. I like when the sink area is separate from the toilet and shower, but it isn't. Still, with 5 of us, it was okay! Our room wasn't ready the first night - not a good thing at 1 AM. We couldn't get the room with 2 beds, so our girls shared a cot, and our 2 year old got a crib. It worked, and we weren't charged for that night. Overall, if we go again, we'd stay there for sure! Especially if your kids are older - you could leave on the 8:30 shuttle, and come back anytime after 4 pm, and as late as 1 am. The only advantage to staying at a Disney hotel I could see was the extra magic hours at disney. I wouldn't want the Disney ID - I would rather spend cash! Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for easy, cheap access to Disney”
Reviews.Author: Srchn4Sun
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my three children in Building 3 in mid-April. I found the registration staff less than welcoming, but that was balanced by the cleanliness of the room. Since I only paid $77/night (booking hotel and air together thru jetblue), I wasn't expecting much - just a clean place to stay with a free shuttle bus to Disney. I was pleasantly surprised by the good food at Mandolins restaurant (pricey for dinner, but kids eat free for breakfast), and by the fun pool and game room. When I say "fun pool" I mean the heated pool - in April, the large pool with the water slide (as youv'e read elsewhere on this site) was beyond cold. The shuttle bus was right on time, and extremely reliable, but DO get to the bus stop early, as seats fill up fast, and you'll be left standing (no fun at the end of a long day at the parks). We ate one night at Charley's across the street, which we later learned is one of the top ranked steakhouses in Florida. I would have enjoyed it more if I was just there with my husband (who couldn't make it on this trip) -- the kids' burgers were overdone, which at those prices was shameful. All in all, a great trip to take in April - remember coverups because it was cold at night, but the weather was perfect for the parks during the day. Would recommend this hotel highly for those looking to save on their accommodations portion of the travel budget.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in busy Orlando”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Radisson for one week in April. This was the first time we stayed outisde Disney and we were very pleased. For $107 this hotel can't be beat. It's conveniently located right off I-4 and Route 192 so it is a straight shot to the theme parks and only 15 minutes to Sea World. The grounds were well manicured and had a tropical feel. The main pool is impressive with the waterfall and slide. The second pool, which is not visible from the first (that was nice) was heated and is where we spent our time. There is a small arcade that kept our 13 year old son occupied. Inside the lobby is a small counter style restaurant to grab a quick snack or even Pizza Hut pizza. My first impression of the room is that we've been in larger rooms but it worked for us just fine. The beds were comfortable with fluffy down comforters. The bathroom was perfectly roomy with a marble floor and a nice clean bathtub/shower. Our iron didn't work and a simple call to housekeeping had our iron replaced with a courtesy call to make sure it was satisfactory. If at Disney, this hotel is close enough to take an afternoon break back at your room and then return to the parks. We'd definitely recommend this hotel if you are planning a stay in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are actually a reasonable size, but they are filled with boxy furniture and hence look smaller. The beds are very firm which was fine with me. The bathrooms are tiny though, and you have to do some maneuvering to close the door after you enter. The pools are very nice. Our baby had a wonderful time playing in the heated pool. There were lots of kids playing with the water slide in the unheated pool, but I was not brave enough to go in. Since this is a resort hotel, all of the food/drinks were expensive. A 15% tip is automatically added to the bills, and so if you are not careful, you might accidentally double tip them! Very annoying.... It is cheaper to walk across the street to the convenience store and buy your beer/wine there. There is a lot of road construction going on right now, and so you sometimes have to take the next exit from the highway and double back. I recommend printing out a local map before going. The renovation work at the hotel currently consists of repainting the exterior of building 6. This did not bother us at all since we were out at the parks during the days. The parking is quite limited near building 6 however, and we needed to park on the other side of the complex on a couple of days. The Mandolins restaurant at the hotel was quite good, but pricey. For cheaper fare, I recommend going to the Downtown Disney Marketplace, and eating at the Earl's Sandwich. In the evenings, there is a 30 minute line, but it is worth the wait! Otherwise go for lunch on the non-park days. The freshly-roasted beef just melts in your mouth, and the antipasto salad is quite upscale for a place like this.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for Disney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two weeks. Pool and public rooms are excellent, but the decor in our bedroom was slightly dated. Two standard double beds which were OK although smaller than expected. Bedroom is a good size, but bathroom is very small. Lift now has a new carpet! Main pool is unheated and freeeezing! Smaller pool is much warmer. Any criticisms are minor. For those moaning about the lack of tv channels, get a life! Why come to this hotel to watch tv when there is so much else to do? Shopping at the factory outlets is outstanding. Amazingly cheap prices for clothing and toys. Did not try the hotel restaurant - too expensive. Hotel also has a diner which sells Pizza Hut and burgers etc. All OK but again slightly pricey. For breakfast drive 5 mins East on the 192 and try Ponderosa. Adults pay $3.99 for "all you care to eat". Typically breakfast for two adults and two kids was $20. Most popular evening meal for our kids was from TGI Friday. Not as cheap as the buffet style diners, but better quality food and service. Change from $60 most nights - half UK prices. Cracker Barrel is also worth a visit. There is a Walmart supermarket about five miles East on the 192. Try to visit this for everyday supplies and presents. You name it they sell it including guns! To sum up the hotel is a slightly above average tourist class hotel in a good location. Ultimately if you are here for Disney etc your hotel is just a base and it is perfectly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 nights whilst doing the orlando sights !! The hotel was being refurbished (which needed doing in the coridors etc.) However our room was large, clean and had everthing you needed. Pizza was good, hotel resturant pricey. There are plenty of other resturants within walking distance. There are two pools one unheated but just about ok for me to swim in April !! Location was good for disney but there are road works which confused us British when we were trying to get of the high way and the junctions had gone !! All in all a decent hotel in a quiet location

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not more than a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: workhardplayharder5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson from March 16 - 30, 2005. First night we arrived they gave us a room that had a VERY strong disinfectant smell. I am usually not sensitive to this but the smell was actually so strong it was burning my nose. As well the door handle to the room was coming off. Called down and they did finally send someone to show us a new room. However, people obviously had been smoking in that room as it reeked of stale smoke. They assured us that it was a non-smoking room. The gentleman who showed us the room agreed with us. Finally got a room that was as odour free as possible (my son said it smelled like wine every time we came in - we don't drink wine!!). Took an hour plus to get the room - not a good start. Booked a deluxe courtyard view - had a view of parking lot. There were never enough towels. When there are 4 people in the room there should be 4 sets of towels - not rocket science! Always had to call down for extra towels (for 2 weeks!). Sometimes they never brought them. Came back from the parks 1 day and carpet in hall was all ripped out. When I book, I specifically asked if they were doing renovations and answer was no. Complained and did get $500 off entire 2 week stay. Beds are very, very hard - never experienced anything quite like it and have travelled extensively. Daughter dropped cherios on the carpet one morning, still there 3 days later! Complained again and they said that they had already given us a deduction in price and that was all they would do for us. Restaurant and deli are way overpriced (especially dinner at restaurant - no one ever there you think they'd get the hint!). We are accustomed to paying more at hotel restaurants and this usually does not bother us but this was ridiculous. Only ate dinner there twice - much cheaper to eat at Disney and better food! Hotel is verey close to Disneyworld but I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL hotel”
Reviews.Author: TGBTG
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband and son in December 2004 for four nights. The rooms, bathrooms, breakfast and hotel grounds were all wonderful! They have a heated pool and jacuzzi that guest were enjoying even in cold rainy weather. The hotel also has a great eating area were you can get Pizza Hut, sandwiches and other snacks. The lobby is beautiful especially at Christmas time. This is a wonderful hotel to stay at if you plan to go to the Disney theme parks and shop at some of the area shopping centers. Everything is very close and convenient. We are planning to stay there again. Please feel free to email me if you have more questions about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “definetely not what i thought”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went the week of march 5-12. When we arrived the first night at around 1am, we were told that due to renovations they did not have a room for us. nothing is worse than getting off a flight, dealing with rental car people then having your already paid for hotel send you to a crappy Ramada Inn. I made reservations for a king size bed and needless to say when we did get to stay there, there were no king size beds. what a way to spend your honeymoon!! and all registration had to say was "the price is the same " the deli is way overpriced and the pay movies were out of service the entire week.

Reviews.Title: “While not a resort, this Radisson is more than adequate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Radisson Resort Parkway during the week of March 14th. I read some negative comments prior to my trip and was worried. I can confirm several comments by prior reviewers: the beds are indeed firm, the elevator was a bit dirty, the unheated pool was very cold and there is currently refurbishment work (new carpeting) that may inconvenience you as a guest. With that said, this hotel is above average, especially considering the close proximity to all major theme parks in the Orlando area. There are easily 15-20 good restaurants within a 10 minute drive from the hotel. While not a "resort", this is a good hotel that is clean and well-maintained. The service staff is helpful and the front desk is professional. I was not bothered by any strange odors from the new carpeting. The room was nice and the bathroom was more than adequate (however I wish the in-room refrigerator was more than an overpriced drink dispenser). The two pools are very nice, in fact we spent more time enjoying the facilities than we had planned. It seems you can definitely get a good price for your room (especially compared to some lower-end hotels nearby... the extra $20 per night is worth it). Don't let a few minor complaints stop you from considering this hotel, especially at a good price. All in all, it turned out to be a good choice to stay at the Radisson Resort Parkway and I would consider a future stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place but expensive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at RRP in early January. The place was wonderful. Very nice room, nice restaurants, grounds very well kept. Very much worth the money. The area is surrounded by restaurants shops, and grocery store. Definately 4 stars or above. Not many tv channels though so for down times I paid 30$ to watch shows and movies. I think that was the whole point of the limited channel offering. most people dont spend much time in the room so you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Filled the bill”
Reviews.Author: Caney80
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at the Radisson Parkway 3/12/05 to 3/20/05. We had read all the reviews for the hotel and was not sure what we were in store for? Only had a couple of problems during our stay. 1. At check in they had a hard time finding our reservation, but this was probably not the hotels fault, had more to do with the company we booked our vacation through. 2. On three different days we did not get any towels when they cleaned the room, but on every occasion they supplied us with new towels after we made a call to guest services and they called us back to make sure we had been taken care of. Most of the negative reviews had something about a bad smell in the hotel. We did not notice any bad smell at all. The hotel was laying new carpet while we were there and there was a smell of glue and new carpet smell, but nothing that was detracted from our stay. I will say that our section of the hotel already had the new carpet layed so that was good for us. We did not use the pools due to the fact that it was too cold to swim and we had passes for other water parks. The deli was not bad and had good variety to pick from. The sports bar was great and on our stay had great people staffing it. The hotel does have washer/dryers in the buildings, but only on the second and fourth floors, so it would be a long haul if your not on one of those floors. We were on the fourth floor and right next to the washer/dryers, but our dryer did not work and had to go to the second floor to use the dryer. Location of the hotel is great anywhere from 1/2 mile to a mile away from all the Disney theme parks. If you go east from the hotel on Hwy 192 for the next 5-8 miles there are almost all the eating establishments that one could want. We did not get a chance to eat at the hotel's restraurant, so I can not comment on that. If you are planning on using the hotel's free shuttle service to the Walt Disney World, Universal or Sea World be warned that the schedule is somewhat limited and if your using it to go to Universal or Sea World there are only two shuttles in the morning and one or two in the evening. There is Thriffty Car at guest services, but if you are renting for more than one day you have to call into the 800 number to make your reservation. The exercise room is nice, it always had plenty of towels, has two treadmills, to bikes, a multi-position station machine and a abdominal cruch machine, everyone should find something that they like. Another thing you need to know is that the beds are only two double beds, not queens. All the other hotels that we stay at all have two queen beds, so expect small beds. This was a little nicer hotel so I expected larger beds. The rooms are on the smaller side, but probably about average. The bathroom was not bad, but the shower/toilet is not seperated from the vanity. This is a nice touch when one person wants to be taking a shower and another can be using the vanity, minor details I know. All in all it is a nicer hotel and it does have a lot to offer. I would recommend this hotel for anyone going to Disney World area, it should fill the bill for you also.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were in for the Daytona 500 and although it was a bit far away the drive was nice and no road congestion as we took alternate routes. The room was clean and well taken care of each day. Morning room service was a relative deal compared to some of the local restaurants and their lack of service. Great deal also since the room was part of a package. Close to the attractions yet far enough away that it was not crazy with people. Only issue was the lack of airflow on each floor. Felt like the heat was still on when it should have been the a/c. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned February 28”
Reviews.Author: jillles
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at this hotel. It was a good value for what we paid - AAA rates of $107.56 for the first night and $98.56 for each night after. The rate included a buffet breakfast for two adults, and children under 10 eat free. We got the rates after being quoted higher rates, continuing the research, finding lower rates, and then urging them to give us the lower rates. The hotel was pleasant and staff were responsive. Although we enjoyed our stay there, I'm pointing out both the good and the bad below so that you'll be aware of them. The buffet each morning had the following: sausage, bacon, biscuits with some kind of gravy on the side, scrambled eggs, omelet station, a small selection of pastries, fresh fruit, Fruit Loops or Frosted Flakes and either pancakes or french toast. You could request toast, bagels or bread, and were served coffee, juice and other beverages. A la carte breakfasts (even the continental) started at about $8. So for our friends who had two teens, they felt the breakfast for two of the four cost too much and they bought bagels and muffins nearby for those not eating the buffet. The rooms were pleasant enough. The beds had a duvet and a white sheet-like duvet cover rather than bedspreads and blankets. I found this comfortable. One of our friends was moved to a different floor after leaving for a few days and noticed that new carpeting was being installed. There were other renovations going on around the hotel - the game room was having a new floor put in, and I believe was being painted. As a result, game room machines were moved to what had been the fitness center. The fitness center was closed. It might be that it's being moved to where the game room was - I'm not sure - but it wasn't that large a room originally. The plastic lounge chairs were replaced with more comfortable lounge chairs, as were the tables and chairs around the pool. There is a large lobby, with a fountain, and numerous waterfall landscaping features around the hotel. The pool area is surrounded by the buildings but nicely landscaped. Although the photos from the website give the impression you are surrounded by acres of grass, it's not an accurate impression. There are ponds with fountains in front of the hotel and in the rear, and several neat wading birds would frequent these areas, but the rear of the hotel backs up to the parking lot. The teenagers with us played tennis on the lighted tennis courts behind the parking lot. There was also a playground area and I believe volleyball net off the parking lot (not especially inviting). I didn't see anyone using these facilities while we were there, perhaps because they were behind the parking lot and not especially attractive. The Deli is expensive, but a convenient place to grab a light meal. It has choices of Pizza Hut, pre-packaged sandwiches and salads, hot dogs, and I think burgers. Food is also served at the bar near the pool. There is no poolside waiter service. Bottled non-alcoholic drinks are about $2.75 each in the deli, and wine or mixed drinks are $8 or more each in the bar. Go to the nearby shopping plaza, a short walk across the hotel's grounds for better prices. One of the members of our party noted that she would have liked a room with a balcony, or in which you can open the windows. These windows don't open, but you have full control over the air conditioning and fan. We noticed that although the rooms, outside grounds and lobby seemed clean, the first impression on our arrival was not great because the elevator was dirty (debris on the floor) and in fact, the elevator area remained dirty throughout our stay. The comments about the firm beds are accurate - I like a firm bed, so they suited me fine. And there were more beds being delivered as we stayed in the hotel. For some reason the ice machines don't offer ice cubes - just chipped ice. We had a cooler and had to keep replacing the ice fairly often. Also, there is not a lot of room for luggage storage. The closet doesn't really have the space to store suitcases, and we wound up piling some behind the chair in the room. There is a dresser in the room with three drawers, and a smallish closet. The bathroom isn't that large either. The room also had the beds (we had a room with two doubles), a comfortable chair, a night table on the outside of each bed, and a table with two chairs. There were many lamps, including one over each bed. The hotel offers a choice of rooms, charging more for those facing the pool. Those rooms appeared to be exactly the same as the ones we had, and I don't believe the view of the pool (or the view of those at the pool of you) makes it worth the extra money. Many people made use of the shuttles, although we had rental cars. The shuttles were full size buses and I never observed them too full to take riders. There is a guest services desk downstairs at which you can buy tickets to certain attractions at discount prices. But go to the Disney desk next to it at your own risk - that's some type of timeshare sales desk (excuse me - they'll tell you it's not a timeshare) and if you want information about Disney without hearing the spiel (is that how you spell it?) the woman can be quite rude. Also, we found the folks working at guest services did not always have accurate information about local attractions. So do your homework on the attractions and then compare prices you've found with what the hotel can offer. The hotel was minutes away from Disney, Seaworld and Universal. All in all, we found the hotel a very reasonable, pleasant place to stay. The pools were great and the rooms were fine. The fitness club was closed, and although they didn't initially volunteer it, with perseverence we learned that we had the use of the fitness center at the Celebration Hospital across 192, and that if we paid the $10 fee the hotel would reimburse with a receipt. We did, and used the indoor pool there with the kids on a rainy day. Thanks to all who helped us select this hotel for our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: cold_in_kitchener
Reviews.Content: I recently got back from a 5 night stay at this hotel and was very pleased. Although the rooms aren't overly fancy and could use a renovation, they were clean and comfortable. The hotel staff is extremely friendly and helpful. We did not rent a car so we used the free shuttle to and from all of the theme parks. They were excellent - always on time, and always plenty of space for everyone. The resort itself was quite nice. The pools were great, and the larger pool, although not heated, had a water slide. It was an extremely relaxing place to be and for the price, you would not be disappointed. People complain about the room and the tv not offering enough channels. Come on, you're on vacation. Who cares about the number of tv channels you get??? Overall, it was a great place to stay and we took MANY pictures of it to show off to our friends. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “been twice, just booking again”
Reviews.Author: maxi_p
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in this hotel twice and have only ever had a problem once ( with a room safe ), check in was always quick and the room was always clean and housekeeping did a great job. The small pizza hut/diner was great and i ate there on a number of evenings with the free juke box making my meal even nicer. The rooms i've stayin in were in the 5000 block and had a pool view, they were spacious and the beds were comfortable. The bus to the theme parks was very handy as i didn't get car hire and the local stores had all the little things i needed. i could go on and on and on bout my time there but all i can say is that i've been there 2 years in a row and am on hold at the moment booking my third visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but I thought it would be nicer.”
Reviews.Author: RamBrian
Reviews.Content: The room was OK; no problems, nothing to brag about. This is the 21st century, they should have more TV channels to offer, and they shouldn't charge for local phone calls. Parking is a long walk. Ice machine didn't work on Sunday night, but worked Monday evening, so it was probably just tapped out Sunday. Bed and pillows were OK, I slept well. $87 on their website, I think that's a pretty good value. If I had my family with me, I think it would be a good place to stay if we only needed it for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Not really impressed, overall disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at this hotel for 6 nights, 7 days. The whole time we were there, there was construction going on and they were ripping out carpets in alot of the rooms. The first room we were given the lights didn't work. When asked for another room, it was better but smelt funny. I guess it had just had new carpet put in it. The windows leaked in the room also. The exhaust fan in the bathroom didn't work well either. The bathroom was very small and the room wasn't that big either. A pain to park and far to walk to your car. The pictures on the website make it look so much better than it is. The whole place could use a makeover. The hallways and elevators and ice machines were very dfirty. Alot of the ice machines didin't work. The kids eat free at the restaurant is a rip off. They charge you 12.00 for the breakfast buffet plus gratuity. Not worth it at all. My husband and I paid 38.00 for breakfast and that was the kids eating for free. The only thing good I can say is when you need something like extra washcloths or towels, they are fast about it. Also the location of the hotel to Disney and Seaworld is close and convienient. We didn't use the shuttles at all so I do not know how they work. We rented a car. The pool with the waterslide is neat but it was too cold to use while we were there. The heated pool is small and shallow, and not much fun. I would not recommend or stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A welcome improvement on previous accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Groomsport6
Reviews.Content: We initially booked into another "hotel" that turned out to be a very tired motel. We negotiated a transfer next day to the Radisson Resort Parkway and spent a wonderful week here. Friendly reception staff, spotless bedroom and bathroom all with good quality linen. Great availability of snacks, fresh salads and pizza in the lobby. On the one occasion we had to contact reception for additional coffee supplies, not only was it delivered promptly but reception called us to check that our needs had been fully satisfied - what a great close-out of the issue. Excellent location for local facilities and access to road network. Secure parking. Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location, No Problems”
Reviews.Author: safety86
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice on different occasions. Both times, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The room was very clean and colorful. The main pool is huge with a nice slide. The location makes it easy to get to Disney and to other places such as Kissimee. I highly recommend it and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we just got back from staying at this hotel for three days, and i have to admit that i was disappointed when first arriving at the hotel. Just like many people have mentioned, the staff is friendly and helpful, but the room decor definitly needs upgrading. I found it rather dull and depressing. The bathroom was really small, and the room had a weird smell to it...kind of like wet carpet. Before leaving the hotel, we did get to try out their restaurant (The Mandolin)...don't even bother with it...the waittress was sweet, but the service was sooooo slow, it was ridiculous. Not only that but the food was not good at all, and definitly not worth the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value,Excellent Service but tired decor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights from 3rd January 05. Bearing in mind the price we paid ,just $92 a night, we received excellent service from the staff. The room was clean, the pool good & onsite facilities generally good. On the negative side the rooms and decor were tired and dated and the beds are very hard. My 6 year daughter was ill and was sick over one of the beds, we called the main desk and they sent fresh bedding within 10 minutes. This was followed up by a call an hour later asking how our daughter was now feeling. The toliet flush stopped working, an indication of how in need of refurbishment the place is, but they came and fixed in within 30 mins. Close by are 3 restaurants, we tried 2 of them. Oceans 11 & the Italian , both were excellent, good food, service and atmosphere. All in all you wont get better value for money or a better location, but the hotel is in need of refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some not so...”
Reviews.Author: lakedog
Reviews.Content: Bought 3 rooms for one night from a cheap online service, probably got what I paid for. Rooms were actually comfortable but in an outdated, quite colorful section of the hotel. Looks like there is a newer section that is closer to the lobby, restaurant, and pools. Free parking, nice pools, friendly and efficient desk staff. Free transportation to the parks in the morning and late afternoon/evening or catch a taxi for $20. Close to the parks either way. Eat at Charlie's restaurant across the street, WOW!

Reviews.Title: “great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during primetime. After Christmas 2004. Booked it through priceline at $100. The snack diner in the lobby is nice for grab and go food or a pizza. We highly recommend Charlie's Steak house that is located within walking distance. It is a high end steak and seafood resturant. Excellent service. Best crab legs I've ever had. Their rate #2 steak house in US! We did the Disney thing and some mornings caught the free shuttle. The last one runs at 10:30am and there's a couple at night. It would take around an hour to get to where we were going due to having to go to Disney's bus terminal and switch buses. So sometimes we just took a town car that ran $17 to any Disney Park. We never used the pools since we were on the go but they were very pretty. Lobby was average. Room was fine for the price. Didn't think they cleaned much a couple of the days. But we were never in the room. Last day bell man was supposed to come up and bring us a cart and help with the luggage but never showed. He said it was a misunderstanding. For the price we would stay there again. We met people paying 200-400 a night this time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Not that impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently and we were a little dissapointed. The whole place seems in need of updating...in our room the first night, the minibar had leaked all over the corner. It was very wet and it smelled badly. In addition, we were right next to the laundry room and someone was drying clothes with loose change late at night (not only that, but they put it in for two cycles!). Two calls to the front desk did nothing to change the situation, and the loud noise kept us up. We also noticed many many fire doors propped open with hand-towels, which seemed kind of sketchy. When we told the front desk this, they assured us they had fire inspectors, but it still seemed weird. A 3.5 star hotel can't afford cheap door-stoppers?! We requested that our room be changed for the following night, and the staff was accomodating. Our new room had a large leaking mini-bar stain too, but it wasn't wet, at least. The grounds were very nice...we wished we could have tried the pool and waterslide. It seems like a good place for families, and fine for a Disney vacation, but some things about it could definitely be better.

Reviews.Title: “Service, Location and Clean!! Radisson Resort Parkway has it all!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Radisson Resort Parkway Nov. 27 - Dec. 02 2004. After reading many reviews of many different properties posted on TripAdvisor I decided to give the Radisson a try. I was quite pleased with the property and and the service was excellent. All of my requests were met immediately upon check-in. There was only one minor hic-up and that was resolved with both professionalism and immediate attention. I had requested connecting and or adjoining rooms. At check-in I was provided adjoining rooms each connecting to a different room. I returned to the front desk where Mirna and the front desk manager said they would investigate the possibility of my party switching to one of the other connecting rooms. The front desk manager said we could go and freshen up in one of the rooms already assigned and he would be up to advise us of the situation in about 30 minutes. In less than 30 minutes he was there and showed us the other connecting room. It met all our requirements. The carpet in the new room had just been cleaned so they were still a bit damp. The manager had a floor blower brought to the room and by the time we returned from dinner the carpet was dry. Service such as this always makes the stay pleasant! The pools and hot tubs were great, but the large pool with slide was a bit cool for the time of year we were there. The hotel was clean and the staff always met our additional requests pleasantly and expeditiously. I was a bit concerned of the beds after reading so many reviews. However, my party did not have a problem with the beds, but after a long day at the parks anything would have felt good. The location was superb! Very easy to the parks and an abundance of dining choices on US192. I will most definitely recommend this property to everyone. I originally had planned on staying in a Disney property but the value of this hotel changed my mind and glad I did. Great time, great place, great stay! My family is ready to go back!

Reviews.Title: “We'll stay here again - - for the price, value and location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Ashburn_Pats
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week from Dec 17-Dec 20th. This was our second stay here (we were here in May of 2004). We weren't disappointed with our stay. The check-in was very easy. The sports lounge is open all the time and was fun to hang out in. The lobby cafe has Starbucks coffee and Pizza Hut pizzas available, even though we didn't partake in either during this trip. The best feature is location, location. It is literally right off of Interstate 4, which is the main road which goes through Orlando and passes all of the theme parks. It is also a quick trip from the Orlando airport (via Rt 417). Everyone was really nice overall. A minor issue was that my husband has a bad back and the beds were a bit hard for him. We will most likely stay here again when in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet place for families”
Reviews.Author: zodaisy
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel November 24-29. Like all others on this site, we loved the hotel, location, and the many things that were offered. The price was right, and we found a free upgrade to poolside room. The hotel did a wonderful job with a request that we made to have an adjoining room with my sister, who did not arrive until the 25th. We will definately stay here again and recommend this place to others. The only thing that I did not see on this site that you may want to be aware of is the special attraction tickets that you can purchase through the hotel in the lobby. My husband and I were each told separately that we could get discounted tickets to Universal or Disneyworld if we attended a breakfast at the Wyndham. I specifically asked the man if this was a sales presentation for a time share, and he said "no, that they just want you to see their hotel and go tell your friends that it was nice. " Needless to say, it was a timeshare presentation, worth 2 hours of our time. If it seems to good to be true........ But I won't hold that against the hotel--we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “So...So”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My name is Skylar. I am an 8-year old boy. I've stayed in Radission hotel last month (November 2004) and this is what I think about Radisson: Pluses: 1.Radisson has a very nice heated pool. 2.If you can walk for 20 minutes Ponderosa is a great resturant to walk to. 3.At Radisson the bus is very quick to get to places. Minuses: 1.At Radisson they have another more beautiful pool but it is SO cold that hardly anyone swims. 2.There are no windows you can open so you have to turn on the fan but when we turned on the fan my little sister almost got sick because of the cool air. 3.The lights and service is very poor at Radisson. Summary We are probably never going to stay there AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What we expected, WONDERFUL HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: jadapespa
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived from Orlando: wife, 5 year kid and me. We spent 4 nights at this excellent moderate resort. $69,95 per night in an upgrade room, building #6000, room 6405. Superb staff, looks like brand new, location, pools, whirpools (wow! how relaxing), everything have been said here, but we don't agree about the hard matresses; they are like ours at home:orthopedics!; we could sleep as kings. The bathroom is not big but is fancy. The food very expensive, but you can go walking to the supermarket deli. We didn't use the mini bar and it was not necesary to rent a fridge for $5 and something per night. We didn't use the shuttle to parks but we saw a big bus on time at schedule hours. The hotel deli was helpful: Pizza Hut, Starbucks, salads, sandwiches,etc. We had a rental car and we were happy to be next to parks: Disney 7 minutes and Sea World 11 minutes. Outlets: Nike, walking distance from Radisson and Premium 10 minutes by car. Internet, movies, nintendo, calls (locals,etc) are charged if you use the service. we only needed de local callings $0.75 half hour. You always see people, with kids, but you don't hear a fly; it's a quiet place. We found what we wanted,and for shure this is a great place. If you want a place better than a INN you don't be dissapointed. The photos shows you the real thing.

Reviews.Title: “We've got a new Orlando home!”
Reviews.Author: Johnnyerb
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to the Theme Park district for almost 20 years now, and we have tried a new place every year for the last ten or so. The last place we loved was a Radisson (it is now a Radisson again, about 2 miles west), and we were excited that our Travel Agent recommended the Radisson Parkway - and for good reason! This is a wonderful place; beautiful and spacious. By now, you know about the pool. I was down there every morning at 8 AM and started every morning with 2 hours in and out of the pool. You are never too old for the pool slide. As we are in our 40's, we were on it as much as any kids were. I've read comments about the mattresses being firm, and they are, but not at all uncomfortable. The rooms are fine - not fancy, but clean and comfortable. The on-site amenities are great! The Sports Bar is contemporary and friendly; the bartenders eager to accommodate. The Deli and Gift Shop are better than average. I was in both every day. Nice to find an on-premises Deli that sells Champagne and Wine by the bottle! All the reports about the staff and their eagerness to help is right-on. This is what really makes this place special. They do whatever they can to accomodate you. We had hoped for a late checkout. As the hotel was completely booked, the Manager was not able to extend us as late as we may have wished, but he worked hard to let us stay in our rooms until 1 PM, and was apologetic he couldn't do more. Things will always go a little awry in a hotel - it has to! Its a building being used and abused by two thousand people. The hallmark of a good hotel is how they deal with it, and the staff here always looks to accommodate your needs immediately. No put-offs, no procrastinating - just action! If we had any complaints, they are minor. And I include them here only so maybe they might take note, or perhaps others have noted them as well. The staff at the Pool Bar and the Breakfast Host at Mandolins were way below the hotel's own standards. I would doubt either will be there on my next visit. And beware if your air conditioner blows over the bed. Some rooms are set up that way, and that led to one of our party catching a cold. Again, I do not blame the Radisson for that; had we said something, I have every confidence they would have remedied that somehow. So this is our new home! We look forward to our next visit. To find a hotel with the lush grounds (and oh, that Hot Tub!), accomodating staff, clean rooms and all for a great price - I just hope they accept reservations in time for my nexet visit!

Reviews.Title: “This place is great!!”
Reviews.Author: gmadiane
Reviews.Content: We stayed here October 14-19th and couldn't have been more pleased! We had reservations at another resort but changed to the Radisson after reading all the helpful reviews on this site. We had deluxe pool view rooms which were very nice. Everyone we encountered was very friendly and helpful. The grounds are beautiful - ponds, waterfalls, palm trees and fountains everywhere! The heated pool was really nice for the cool evenings and the large (and it IS large) pool with the slide and waterfall was great during the day. The free shuttle service was very nice although there were not many runs to SeaWorld or Universal (more frequent to Disney)- however cabs were always available and there is a Thrifty car rental desk right in the lobby. We asked for a late check out and opted to pay ($40) for a "lounge room" which had a couch, chair, TV, full bathroom with all the amenities, ironing board and iron near the pool so we could swim right up until shortly before our departure and shower and change there. (We could not bear to leave this wonderful resort any earlier than we absolutely had to!) Would love to return here again.

Reviews.Title: “A rave review for the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: promosinc
Reviews.Content: I checked into the Radisson Parkway -- about a mile from Disneyworld Orlando -- unexpectedly during a recent trip. I had reserved a room at the Hampton Maingate East just down the street (read my review of that nightmare) and moved over to the Radisson after one night at the Hampton. It was night and day difference! I can't remember if I've ever stayed at a Radisson before -- if so, many years ago, too many to remember -- but for sure, I will be staying there again. The level of service of the front desk hotel staff and others was so incredibly warm and helpful, that it's easy to overlook any of the small inconveniences that popped up. Service is everything -- and that Radisson has it down to a science! Having just come from a horrid night at the Hampton, I was very, very cautious about inspecting the Radisson's rooms -- I chose to look at several before deciding. The front desk staff member, Kathy, was wonderful -- always a smile on her face, knowledgeable, friendly and when I had trouble entering one room which appeared to be locked from the inside, she came over herself to make sure the problem was resolved. The mattresses at the Radisson Parkway are very, very, very firm -- the hotel staff forewarned me. Much too firm for my taste -- and I do wonder why they didn't choose a more middle-of-the-road compromise between firm and soft, especially since current mattress research indicates a too-firm mattress is not, in fact, good for our backs. But even with that issue, the Radisson had a way out -- they offered a "pillowtop" topper, as my bellman explained. I ordered one for my room, and when I returned at night, my bed had been re-made with the pillowtop! A word or two more about the Radisson's pillowtops -- a good plan, but it fell a little short. The pillowtop had a downlike fill, which was so soft, that it compressed all the way down -- and the result was almost as hard as without it. A better choice would have been a latex topper. I did hear another staff member mention a convoluted foam topper which would have been a better solution for me. I also reported the A/C a bit noisy -- the engineer was up to my room immediately, although when I returned there was no noticeable improvement. However there were messages on my room's voice mail system both from the engineer and from Kathy at the front desk wanting to know if there was anything more they could do to make my stay a pleasant one. To my mind, that level of consideration makes up for a little noise from the A/C. It's also worth mentioning that some of the beds offer duvets rather than comforters. I opted for one of these rooms -- very European looking -- a downlike comforter is inserted into a duvet made of sheet fabric, which appears to be freshly laundered for each new guest. How wonderful -- no more worry about how many others before you had their faces in the blankets or comforters, which are definitely not laundered for each new guest in most hotels. When checking out, the front desk staff member told me all Radissons will be featuring Select Comfort Sleep Number beds, starting in 2005. Although these air beds are not my personal favorite, I commend the Radisson for such a forward-thinking upgrade, allowing everyone to adjust the mattress to his or her personal level of comfort. All in all, one of the most exceptional stays I've had in a long time. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better then what I Expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice, well lit, good design, and big nice windows. My fiance and I ended up with a room facing the massive pool, and two double beds, we put them together to make a massive king. lol.....The bathrooms, were surprisingly very nice, the tub is larger then ur average tub, and the exfoliating soap is a nice extra touch! I normally stay at luxury high end resorts, like the Grand Floridian, Ritz, or Gaylord Palms. But this hotel is very nice for a good price! :)

Reviews.Title: “The most Fantastic Wedding Ever!”
Reviews.Author: REDMEN97
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband got married in this hotel 2nd September 2004 and it was the most fantastic wedding we could of wished for, Jane and Yvonne the virgin wedding co-ordinators were amazing and took the pressure off us for the big day. The hotel and gazebo area was beautiful, we had some fantastic photographs taken by the pools and by the lovely waterfalls. Our room was comfortable and clean with a good size bathroom. We had a small problem with the window when Hurricane francis hit as it leaked a little but when we reported it, they fixed it within minutes. Reception was helpful and the bar and delhi was nice too. We had our reception meal in Mandolins restaurant in the hotel, the food was wonderful and service was excellent. The pools were lovely and clean and the hot tubes were extremely relaxing. The hotel was very accessible to all the attractions and offered a courtesy bus to some of the parks which was quite good. Would definately recommend a stay here and will probably visit again. The only bad thing about this hotel is that reception floor is quite slippy, so watch your step!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!! Will go back”
Reviews.Author: bulatada
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Radisson. Rooms were very clean, and the grounds were extremeley nice. The free shuttle to the parks was very convenient. The only complaint I have is that the beds were hard, but after a day on your feet it didn't matter one bit. I would stay here again. I am a very picky person and this place satisfied me completely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pools & Excellent Services!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the 21st - 24th of September and couldn't have been happier with our choice!!! The pools were exceptionally clean and all the facilities were up and running even with the 3 hurricanes that hit in the weeks previously. Management fulfilled our request of having our room deep cleaned as the reviews we read stated most of the rooms reeked of stale smoke...also they were able to make sure we had a fridge already running for snacks and medicines we had to bring along. The mini bar was way overpriced so we were glad we brought snacks. Our bed was a little firm, but didn't stop any of us from sleeping comfortably. We stayed in the 1000 building on the 3rd floor and had a FANTASTIC view of one of the pools and the hot tub with the cascading waterfall. The pool with the waterslide was great for smaller children (ours were 4 and 5), and both of the kids had a blast....hours were 6am until 11pm which was nice to swim later after we returned from the disney parks. They also had a kiddie pool with about 1 1/2 feet of water and a heated pool, and one additional hot tub. Also, we were very surprised to see the pool snack and BAR served perfect refreshments, and were open later in the day also. One of the SMALL complaints we had was that there was not a phonebook provided and local phone calls were charged a dollar a minute. Also the pillows were a little flat so we requested more free of charge. The game room had an air hockey table and about 15 other games in it, it was a lot bigger than expected. Also, the exercise room was nice and had a few of the newer machines in it. The shop in the lobby was VERY overpriced as most lobby shops are, but the GREAT perk was the activities desk outside the shop. Everyone behind it knew more about the disney park hours and prices then you'd find in a brochure. Also, they were offering HUGE discount rates (on the parks) for couples over 30 if they signed up for a tour on a time share or if they were married. Also the shuttle busses were always on time so that was nice. The Mandolins restaurant had a great breakfast buffet open from 7am till 11am offering more than we expected. Fresh fruit and french toast, eggs anyway you want, yogert and lots more. If you dine here make it a breakfast instead of lunch or dinner. The breakfast buffet was under $15.00 and a child under 10 ate free with the paying adult. The dinner portions were smaller, and overpriced, but if you have to dine here for dinner make it the bbq ribs. Across the street was a steak house (Charley's), a grocery store, salon (offering discounts on hour massages), a japanese restaurant, italian restaurant (nice dining outside tables set up and everything), and to top it off a great shop with reasonable prices for gifts to take home and a ton of stuff just in case you forgot to pack a suit or sandles or sun screen. The next shopping mall over included a Nike Outlet store, a Payless shoe store, a Subway, Wendys, and another disney type store selling tickets to local parks, then a surf shop and a discount outlet store with clothes from dkny and levis and they had great prices. Also within walking distance was the WATERMANIA water park (open 11am till 5 pm, discount prices from 3 till close), and a block past was a go cart park that looked like lots of fun. I believe they were open from 12 until 5 pm and closed on Wednesdays. Overall we had lots of fun and would go back in a heartbeat. Next time we would actually go without going to the disney parks because the kids were happy enough to swim in the pool! If I left out anything you might have questions about don't be afraid to email me... Nichole

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: piergear
Reviews.Content: Very nice. Great staff. Good price. Nice clean rooms and grounds. Nice pools. Breakfast buffet overpriced. Better and cheaper in the area. Try Capt. Nemo's for all the Maine lobster you can eat, I'm still full. We were there Sept. 10, 11 and 12, 2004. We will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shellyaz
Reviews.Content: As I book a lot of guests into this property, and wanted to get out of town for my fiance's birthday, I decided to stay here. I checked in, which took no more than a couple of minutes. The guest clerk was very pleasant. I requested a refridgerator, which was an additional $5.00. Upon entering the room, I was a little disappointed at the size. It was very small and a little worn. As in another review that I read, I did find the bed was overly hard. The bathroom was gorgeous, and oversized. I was shocked at how clean the room was. I was very impressed with that. After about 20 minutes upon entering the room, the phone rang. The Front Desk Clerk called to check and see that everything was okay with the room! I have NEVER had a hotel do that!! Later that evening, upon returning from the amazing pool, the fridge was still not in the room. I immediately called, and within 10 minutes they delivered the fridge. EXCELLENT response!! I was surprised! All employees were very friendly. They all greeted us, even in passing. They made us feel very welcome. The next evening, I was taking my fiance out to dinner. While he was in the shower, I called Room Service and requested 2 desserts be brought up to the room while we were out. I explained that I would not be there to sign the bill. I explained what this was for. He said it was no problem. When we returned, the desserts were on the desk, and each one had a strawberry with a birthday candle in it. I couldn't believe it! Again... EXCELLENT! My daughter fell at the pool and ended up with a bloody nose and fat lip. My poor peanut!! I carried her into the Deli, and asked for ice. The manager immediately fashioned a bag of ice for us. Breakfast at Mandolin's was very good. They have a decent variety. A Chef will prepare your eggs or omlettes as requested. A little pricy, but worth it. We are definitely going to stay there again! I was thoroughly impressed by the responsiveness of the staff, the cleanliness of the property, and amenities that the property offers. I will definitely continue to confirm my traveler's there, and I will definitely stay there again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 2 years ago. Fisrt I reserve pool view to queen beds. They give me the key, go to my room, it's a king bed (I'm with my two girls and wife) with view of the parking. Then I got the good room (where was it when I check-in the fisrt time?). But it was a smoking room with smoke still hagging around in the room. Told the wife that I will not go back to complain again so stayed there. But we couldn't sleep all night because of the noise of people in the pool unitl 2AM. Was supposed to stay there 3 nights and the morning after I left this awfull hotel and paid for the 3 nights. Never staid at a Radisson after that trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel between 17-26 July. Found a great deal on the internet. The hotel is just excellent! The rooms are nice, so are the 3 pools and the spa. The staff were very helpful. Don't bother paying for the breakfast as there is a supermarket, a Wendy's and a Subway just a few minutes walk from the hotel. Make sure you ask for a room located on the upper floors. We would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In Flordia”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Radison was one of the best hotels that I've been to in a long time. Me and my famliy stayed there for 1 week and I was very glad that we did. I had a great time at the hotels Pizza Hut it is to die for. My son really enjoyed the tours that we went on there. We got to go to Disney and Universal Studios that was alot of walking but we manage. The room service was great the pools was great too. After all that walking We got in the hot tub the water was great for my aching body from all that walking. So I subjust that if you do go to the Radisonn eat at the BostonLobster home they have all you can eat lobsters and go to the Nike Warehouse they have great deals there.

Reviews.Title: “Quality for a great price.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We came second week of July with our daughter to do a week at both Disney and Universal parks. This hotel was the perfect location. The grounds are beautiful, the staff is courteous and professional, the rooms were clean. The main pool is quite large. We booked our room with the breakfast buffet included, and the buffet exceeded my expectations. This hotel was great for a family vacation and the price was unbeatable for the quality. The only negative comments I have is that, while the pool does have a waterslide, it is kind of short. And if you're interested in using the fitness room, it is very small.

Reviews.Title: “OK but with Flaws”
Reviews.Author: Stephen455
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel when my 14 year old daughter was playing in a softball tournament in Orlando in July. The hotel gets mixed reviews. The rooms are normal sized with normal amenities. The swimming pool is above average with a nice slide and a waterfall area, but there were not enough chairs by the pool. Several issues kept me from giving this hotel a better rating. 1) The coffee shop did not open as scheduled. There were a number of sports teams staying at the hotel with early games and although the coffee shop was scheduled to open at 6:30AM and there was a crowd of patrons waiting at the door, the shop only opened after 7:15. According to management sombody got their signals crossed. 2) One night we wanted to go to a TGI Friday's restaurant and the concierge did not have the phone number and was not allowed to call information to get it. I couldn't believe my ears. Not allowed to call information?

Reviews.Title: “Must be the best kept secret? Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Skyhigh2
Reviews.Content: Like most people who visit "tripadvisor" we checked, after booking, to see the good or usual bad reviews.But this time there were none? Any way we were happy with our price, about $90 a night.........When we booked in after finding the place...Very easy, turn off I.4 onto 192East. Which is Junction 64A.
