Its the very first left, turn onto Parkway, you then go pass their immaculate gardens into reception.They were friendly and fast,we were in our spacious,clean and well kept room in minutes. Outside the pools ( 2 with 3 spas and kiddy pool, tropical gardens,waterfalls and a very popular water slide) and well equiped free Gym with nearby outside bar are perfect for familys and all ages till late at night. We found many people just stayed on the property , with the odd trips into the very,very busy theme parks. Some nighs it was standing room only in the pools till well past 10. We were on the 3rd floor but did not hear any noise from any of the people having fun.If you are waiting for a bad word on the place........ No.....We went to reception to order a fridge for the room (we needed space for some medication) and explained we could not get it in the MINI-BAR a fridge arrived in our room within 10mins, free gratis. If you want a great place to stay, clean and friendly with all the trappings of a large resort hotel. Great restaurants with its own PizzaHut and StarBucks coffee shop at normal, not inflated prices, you have found the place. But lets keep this one a secret, we want to stay again on our next Florida vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was a little concerned when we arrived. Our rooms were on the 6th floor. This floor has a bit of a musty smell. However, the room seem to be fine. The one problem with the room, was the pillows. They were very flat. The very next morning I called the front desk and requested better pillows or extra ones because the ones we had were extremely uncomfortable. We went to Disney all day, when we arrived at the hotel at 11:30 at night I was so grateful because they had filled both requests. This staff was very nice and pleasant. Everyone had a smile. The pool deck area has a bit of a drainage problem. The kids stilled enjoyed the pool. Overall this is a nice and clean hotel. I would stay at this hotel again and I also recommend it to anyone visiting the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic base for your holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very dubious after reading some of the reviews for this hotel, but what a pleasant suprise. When we arrived the room we were given was quite dark and dingy as it was at ground level and looked into a courtyard area, so we asked to move to a lighter room. The front desk gave us another room straight away without question. This room was great, even though there were 4 of us along with all of our cases and an ever expanding collection of shopping it was an adequate size. We really only used the hotel as a base, so I can't comment on the shop, resteraunts, etc. We did use the larger pool, which is great fun but was taken over at one point by a large group of obnoxious and overbearing adults and adolescents that seemed to be together, but if they were there on our trip I'm sure they wont be on yours!! The parking was never a problem but we were to one side of the building so there was more choice available anyway. I think our only moan was that sometimes you had to wait quite a while for a lift but they were never not working. We had car hire included which was fantastic and probably why we spent so little time at the hotel. We spoke to another english couple who hadn't bothered with car hire so were eating at the steak house just across the road every night and paying far more than we ever paid for 4 of us by travelling a mile down the 192. For any british holiday makers looking for a good base point for there holiday then I would definately recommend this hotel. It is just down the road from Disney, very close to Old Town and less than half a mile from I92. We will definately go back

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Used the Mousesaver rate for a free pool view upgrade. The room was a little small, but very clean. The beds were very comfortable, firm just the way I like it (bad back). We were in building 600, which was the best. Right in front of the pool (never too crowded-just right amount of people). Right in front were the shuttle stops, very convienient. Avoid the restaurant-way too overpriced! Cross the street to the restaurants down 192. I highly recomend Charley's, great service, great food, some things are pricey, but my daughter and I shared and the bill was resonable. Also Ocean's 11 was great also. For breakfast there's a deli right there on 192. We would have juice and bagels for $5.00, beats the $15.00 Mandolin's charges or you can eat at Disney for less. Arrive aerly for the shuttles, they fill up fast. With careful planning you can have the awesome vacation, just like we did. I would stay there again and ask for a room in building 6000.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Pools/Spas”
Reviews.Author: bboydbarger
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights at this Radisson and especially enjoyed the pools. The main pool is huge with a beautiful waterfall. The smaller pool is also nice, warm, and sits adjacent to a smaller waterfall. There are two outdoor spas, one with its own waterfall! They also play nice music in the pool area. We really enjoyed our stay. We did not eat in the restaurants other than to purchase some small items in the 50's style diner that's on property, but there are numerous dining options within a few minutes of the hotel. The 50's diner prices were similar to the food court prices at Disney properties. Our room was very clean and for this price, the decor was fine. I will have to admit that the room had a "musty" odor, something that often happens in Florida. This would be my only complaint. The bathroom we had was small...only one sink, but you don't get the Taj Mahal for $100 a night in high season! We wanted a good "sit by the pool" resort, and that's what we got! Nice soft towels provided poolside, friendly service, and wonderful atmosphere. We would definitely stay here again. Next time, I'll bring my own air freshener, but do realize that I'm extremely sensitive to smells. My husband didn't notice any funny smell at all. (I think they should pipe in good odors like they do at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge!) This resort is in a quiet, safe area, yet unlike Disney resorts, there are reasonably priced restaurants and grocery stores within a few minutes' drive, and you can be on Disney getting ready to park hop in the time you would spend waiting for the Disney bus! I know, I've done that, too. Try this hotel...if you like a beautiful pool, nice room for a good price, this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded mine and my boyfriend's expectations by far! The hotel is gorgeous and the shuttle provided to disney is completely great! Our room was spotless, a little small and plain, but clean! The hotel grounds, the pool and the spas are absolutely fabulous! If you're looking for the resort feel when visiting Orlando but don't want to fork out the hundreds of dollars, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: satriani7
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Radisson Resort Parkway on May 3, 2004. We bookedour wedding and honeymoon through Virgin. We were told that the hotel would upgrade us to the Deluxe Pool VIew Room and a contragulations basket would in our room on arrival. When we arrived and checked into our room we were surprised to find a room with seperate beds and a view of the car park! No welcome present either. When we told the front desk that we were getting married there they told us that they did not know!!!! They moved us to a different room the following day - needless to say it was not any better than the first one. The wedding location which was to be "within the hotel's tropical ground with fountains and waterfalls as your backdrop" Not so much as it was in a concrete courtyard with hotel rooms literally surrounding the gazebo! We had to pay $1000 to move to the Wyndham Palace Resort and Spa and have our wedding and honeymoon there. If you are looking for somewhere to use as your base on a holiday then it would have been fine but it was definately not wedding or honeymoon material.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel experience I have ever had. Once my family and I arrived at the hotel around 1pm, we asked if we could have an earlier check in, since we were traveling since 5am with 3 young children. The clerk at the check in told us to come back at 2:30 pm. when we returned at 2:30pm, another clerk rudely informed us that check in was at 4pm. Of course, we already acknowledged that, but we were told that we could come back at 2:30 to receive the keys to our rooms. In a totally unprofessional manner, she proceeded to call what i assume was the cleaning staff, and carried a conversation in front of me about how” they were here from 1pm,etc." and hung up the phone and said that the rooms are not ready yet, and to come back in another 20 mins. She did not seem to care at all about this being a major inconvenience to us. The staff continually asked us to come back in 20 mins until at least 1 hour+ had passed. My children were in the car tired, hot, and uncomfortable since 1pm and now for over 3+ hrs, the staff was completely uninterested and did not offer, not even a single room temporarily for us to use to freshen up etc, until our rooms would be ready. We had booked 2 adjoining rooms to accommodate my family of five, and we received no services for the inconvenience of being kept waiting without our rooms, not even a cold drink for my family, or even a complimentary snack for having to wait. After waiting past the policy check in time of 4pm, we still did not have our rooms. The staff continually claimed how the carpet was wet from being cleaned in the afternoon. I was very upset since this is now 3+ hours and still no rooms to check in to. I insisted on speaking to a manager. He really did not provide any immediate satisfaction to rectify the situation at that point. He said they were understaffed, and there wasn’t anything he could do but apologize, which was no help to me. After I demanded something to offer us for this major inconvenience of our 1st day in Orlando, he reluctantly offered 1/2 price for the 1 room for the 1st night’s stay, and a free breakfast voucher. This really wasn’t enough after ruining our afternoon. When we finally got our rooms, there were no bellhops readily available to assist us with our baggage. all my children including a 6 and 8 year old had to help carry the bags to the rooms. there was only one bellhop that we seen on duty. try to find him is the name of the game there. The kids eat free program is a farce since they overcharge for breakfast at $9.99 for each adult when one could easily go down u.s. 192 west or east and eat breakfast for $3.99 and it wont matter if the kids are free or not. The dinners were overpriced as well, and we never ate at the hotel for this reason. Even if the kids were to eat free, there menu did not offer many dining choices for a family. On to the rooms, they were clean, but the towels are as hard as sandpaper, not even full bath size towels, and the beds really give the feeling of sleeping on concrete blocks, not mattresses. The main pool is nice looking on there website, and is another reason why we chose this hotel. However, it simply cannot handle the volume of guests the week we stayed. There seemed like there were a few groups of guests staying together, and they dominated much of the pool, using it to play football, or to just throw each other in and out of the water even though there are no diving signs. The groups consisted of adults and teenage children; perhaps a school sports team or something of the like. This situation, combined with the undesirable fact that your hotel does not have a lifeguard on duty, made it very uneasy for as family with children to feel comfortable having the children play in the water with all the ruckus going on. Many were using the pool slide standing up as they went into the water. I have stayed at many hotels with slides, etc and there is usually a lifeguard on duty to prevent any dangerous conditions or situations from occurring. Also, the 2nd smaller pool was not of much help since it was outdated and too small, plus it appeared to still be heated water in it in the middle of June’s hot 90+ days, which seems a bit odd. The playground really should not even be mentioned as an amenity. It is far off in he distance with only one piece of equipment that had a slide. The parking lot is not designed to accommodate the guests who would like to be closer to the building that they are staying in. Many nights we would have to park very far and it is not desirable when traveling with children and having to walk a far distance to get back to the room. We clearly were not very satisfied with our stay at this hotel. This hotel really put a damper on our entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great off-property value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If I were to stay off Disney property, this is the place. It's as close as Disney's secondary resorts and it's a good value. It has a decent pool complex. Note that Disney pools are all heated, but only the smaller pool at the RRP is heated so winter swimming is dodgy. The on-site Pizza Hut is great for feeding kids, and there's ton's of places to eat just down the road. The breakfast buffet is OK, but don't plan on using it everyday as soggy waffles and long omelette lines get tiring really fast. Rooms are a little on the small side, but adequate and clean. The public areas are nice and well maintained. Summary: nice place, eat nearby

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel May 26 - 28, 2004. We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The rooms were comfortable. The location is great. The service was great. The hotel has a shuttle service that goes to the Parks. The Pool is great. I wish I could have stayed longer. Whenever I go back to Orlando I will definitely stay at this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a very reasonalbe place to stay, and it is very nice. Close to all of the parks. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took a trip a few months back to this hotel and it was very much to my dissatisfaction. I contacted the corporate office of customer relations and told them of the disappointment and issues I had. They proceeded to contact the hotel directly and I corresponded with a Ken Smith, the front desk manager. I just took another trip for 4 days and was given a complimentary suite. (Last trip we had the presidential suite and things stopped working and there was no housekeeping done the entire trip.) This suite was gorgeous and we were treated like kings and queens. I have to say all of my doubts were washed away with this trip. The people were wonderful and our every need was met. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Place Overall”
Reviews.Author: belangem
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week at the Radisson Parkway in Kisssimme from may 9th to may 16th. The rooms were very clean and the staff was good overall. The pool is great if you like staying at the hotel, but the real good thing about this hotel is the shuttle. The hotel has it's own shuttle, there's always enough room and they are almost always on time. It's about 10 minutes away from Disney and 15 minutes from Universal. The downside: food is WAY overpriced at the hotel. You can eat at Disney Downtown for the same price and a it's lot better! If you really need to eat, the Pizza Hut counter is not so bad ans the price is okay. I would definetly suggest this hotel but if you go in high season, you might want to rent a car since I guess the shuttle can get full quickly in this time of year.
